Technologies have been developed since long ago; however , not all of them are planned .
There are many pathways that lead to a technology being created , mainly through serendipitous discovery or through research .
In our everyday life , we stumble across things that are out of the norm .
While most of the events appear to be non-significant , there are some where people actually get ideas from them .
This is what we call serendipitous discovery , when people make discoveries that they did not seek .
One of the examples of technology being discovered from research is the development in automobile safety and a better design of roads in the United States(U .S .) while an example of the technology resulted from serendipitous discovery is the Post-it pads .
The technology created via research has significant differences from technology resulted from serendipitous discovery in several aspects .
One of the major differences is whether there is a need for the technology .
Technologies developed through research are ussually to address a problem that have been identified .
In this case , the development in automobile safety and a better design of roads in U .S . is to reduce the massive casualties from road accidents where the annual vehicle death rate reached 50 ,000 in the early 1960s(statistics taken from Rogers , E . M . (2003) .
The generation of innovations .
In Diffusion of innovations (pp .136-
158) .
New York: Free Press) .
On the contrary , technologies developed through serendipitous discovery are not born from a need for them .
For instance , Post-it pads were developed out of mere coincidence .
Decades ago , the 3M researchers found a new bonding agent during their research but it was not what they had wanted to achieve as the bonding agent did not stick paper very tightly to the surface .
Therefore , it can be said that technologies created from research are due to a need for them while technologies created from serendipitous discovery do not originate from a need .
Another difference is the final usage of the technologies .
Technologies developed through research are used for their intended purpose .
For example , in U .S , the development in automobile safety includes safer cars that come with padded dashboards and stronger bumpers while safer roads are achieved by placing impact attenuators in front of viaduct pillars .
These technologies were developed for their intended purpose , which is to reduce casualties from road accidents .
However , technologies developed from serendipitous discovery are not used for their intended purpose .
For instance , the researchers of 3M found a new bonding agent during their research .
The bonding agent was initially thought as a failure as it did not meet the expectation of the researchers ,which was to stick tightly to the surface of paper .
However , it is later converted into a successful product when it is used to create "Post-its ," the little stick- on squares of colored paper that can be used to attach a note to a letter or other documents  , which is not the intended purpose of this technology .
In a nutshell , technologies created from research will be used for their intended aim while technologies developed from serendipitous discovery might not serve its intended purpose .
Lastly , one final difference between the 2 lies in the background research .
Technologies created from research undeniably have lots of background research .
This is proven just by looking at the amount of research needed before measures are to developed a safer automobile as well as better design of highways .
The research span can be years ,decades or even longer before the technology can be successfully developed .
However , this is different for technologies originated from serendipitous discovery .
There is no background research needed for these technologies , as they are created out of pure coincidence .
With reference to Post-it pads , they were created without any background research .
The researchers simply found a way to utilize the bonding agent years later which led to the product Post- it pads .
Hence ,  it can be said that there is background research for technologies originated from research while there might not be any background research for technologies created from serendipitous discovery .
Despite the differences between the ways by which the technologies are created , they help to improve the life of mankind be it through convenience or through any other means .
In conclusion , there are significant differences between technologies developed from research and serendipitous discovery; however , these differences does not change the fact that both technologies are key to the future for mankind .
The development and advancement in science and technology has brought much convenience to thehuman society today .
With a click of the mouse , one can communicate with another person half a globe away , strike a business deal with foreign entrepreneurs and catch up with the latest happenings all around the world .
Technology is something which is created to help solving the problems we face in our daily life and at the same time , improve the quality of our life .
Generally , most of the technological innovations are created through basic research , followed by applied research , leading finally to development .
(Rogers , E . M . (2003) .
The generation of innovations , para .
7) .
However , there are also some technological inventions which are designed from a serendipitous discovery .
According to Roger , serendipity is the accidental discovery of a new idea .
The differences between these two types of technological inventions can be perceived in terms of their research backgrounds , cost of the invention of the technology , and time consumption .
Technology developed via research and technology  resulted from a serendipitous discovery have different research backgrounds .
Technology based on scientific research requires a wide range of knowledge to conduct the research .
Special skills are also needed to carry out certain experiments and to record the results and data of the experiments .
Many researches also have to be carried out to identify and rectify the problems encountered throughout the experiments .
For example , to create a miniaturized medical submarine which can be injected into human bodies to destroy the blood clot that threatens a human life , there are many technical problems to overcome , such as how to make , power and steer the medical submarine .
(Metin Sitti , (2009) Voyage of the micro robots , para 2) .On the other hand , technology created by serendipitous discovery does not require any knowledge and special skills .
It is an invention by chance while a very different invention is undergoing research and analysis .
For example , DDT is created out of a substance used for protecting wool clothes against moth .
(Rogers , E . M . (2003) .
The generation of innovations , para .
11)Obviously , more research and analysis are needed for technology based on research as compared to technology created by serendipitous discovery .
The technology based on research and the technology created by serendipitous discovery require different amounts of cost to be carried out .
For technology based on research , a large amount of money is needed to purchase materials that are essential for the research and investigations to be conducted .
Moreover , specific apparatus , for instance , machines and robots , which are usually expensive , are also needed in order to carry out certain experiments .
However , for technology created from serendipitous discovery , it actually requires a few cents or even not a single cent as it is a useful "side product" from a different research .
Less cost is required for this technology because it is an unplanned technology discovery .
Apart from that , time consumption for the technology based on research is much different from that for the technology created by serendipitous discovery .
In order to carry out extensive research and analysis , much time has to be spent for the technology to be successfully invented .
For instance , Thomas Edison had spent his whole life to invent a light bulb with almost tens of thousands of failures before he succeeded .
For technology created from serendipitous discovery , less time is as it comes out unexpectedly .
One popular example is penicillin , which turned out to be the first antibiotic because of its property of killing biological materials when it was left in Petri dishes containing biological organisms .
(Rogers , E . M . (2003) .
The generation of innovations , para .11)
To sum up the salient points , technology  via research requires more researches and investigations than technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery .
Besides , cost of creating a technology created via research is much higher as compared to that of technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery .
Technology based on scientific research consumes more time than technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery as  many researches and experiments need to be carried out .
Although all technology serves a common purpose , there are many differences between inventions  resulted from research and those resulted from serendipitous discoveries .
Looking at an example of invention that resulted from research - the laptop and an example of serendipitous discovery - the implantable pacemaker , a few distinct differences such as the cause leading to the research , final usage of the technology and the research procedures can be spotted between them .
Firstly , the most distinct difference between an implantable pacemaker and a laptop is the intentions which led to their discovery .
In the case of the laptop , the inventors of the laptop started with the intention of creating a "DynaBook ," which is a concept conceived in 1968 .
The "DynaBook" concept is to make a "personal computer for children of all ages" .
The implantable pacemaker , on the other hand , was initially an attempt to build an oscillator to record the sound of heartbeats .
However , when Wilson Greatbatch , inventor of the implantable pacemaker , inserted a wrong resistor and discovered a different reaction , it led to the invention of the first implantable pacemaker .
Therefore , it is obvious that the cause which led to the invention is very different in that in the case of the laptop , , it was already intended  before its creation whereas in the case of the implantable pacemaker , its creation was never intended .
Another difference is the final usage of the inventions .
In the case of the laptop , the final usages are what the laptop was intended for  during its conceptualisation stage .
However , in the case of the pacemaker , the final usage is not what it was intended to be .
It was intended to be a machine to record the sound of the heartbeats  but ended up as a device to stimulate the heart and to serve as a cure for certain heart problems .
As shown above , in the case of most serendipity discoveries , they will normally not be used for the initial purpose of the experiment that led to its discovery whereas in the case of an invention through research , it will be the used for its intended purposes .
Lastly , the pace of advancement that led to the invention of the laptop and that of the pacemaker is different too .
Normally in the case of a serendipitous discovery , there is a sudden advancement in the progress of the research as it is an accidental discovery during the experimental process .
The experiment that led to the discovery of the implantable pace maker was done in 1958 and within months of its discovery the first implantable pacemaker was being used on a human being .
However , for the laptop , its concept was developed in 1968 and the first "laptop" only came into existence in 1975 .
Despite all the differences , there are undeniably some similarities between serendipitous discoveries and discoveries made through conventional research methods .
In both examples , regardless of their methods of discoveries , both are beneficial to mankind and help to improve the quality of life .
The laptop has simplified human work whereas the pacemaker has helped prolong life of some stricken with life threatening diseases .
In conclusion , though there are many differences between the discovery of the laptop and that of the pacemaker shown above , they both help to propel the human race forward into the future .
Today , the change in climate is being labeled as one of the main threats that are affecting the existence of humankind .
For example , global warming has caused the temperature throughout the world to rise , which results in the melting of the icebergs in the North Pole .
Concurrently , the sea level would rise and cause serious floods that would dangerously threaten the survival of our human race .
Thus , we should rank preserving our environment as the main priority among our other needs .
By applying the engineering design process , we could design a product that is environmental friendly .
The first step in the engineering design process is to identify the problems that our product will face .
Firstly , during the manufacturing of the product , we should be environmentally friendly by reducing the amount of wastes produced and ensure that the wastes produced are properly disposed too .
Secondly , we should also use used materials as the main material for our product and ensure our product is recyclable .
The next step is to gather relevant information that would help make our product a success .
The most convenient way to collect the appropriate information is through the use of internet , as there are always search engines available to help get our sources more accurately and quickly .
There are also traditional ways such as using the library and looking through bookstores to gather more detailed information .
The third step is to generate multiple solutions to solve the problems that are stated in the second paragraph .
For example , we could use filters in gas pipes to reduce air pollution from the factories manufacturing the product .
We could also come out with a standard procedure on how to dispose the waste products so that there would be no chemical leakages that are harmful to the environment .
Through more brainstorming within our group , we would arrive at more solutions .
The fourth step is to analyze and to select the best solution .
The best solution would be chosen from the few ideas that we have thought of during the" generating multiple problems" process .
There will be many criteria that we need to fulfill in order to choose the best solution .
The most important criteria are which solution proves to be the most environmental friendly and whether the product will be able to function properly by using mathematical calculation and scientific theory .
The subsequent criteria will be whether it is safe to implement and if it is cost effective to produce .
The last stage in the engineering design process is to test and implement the solution .
We should come out with a series of tests to prove whether the products work in real life environments .
We should also develop a suitable design for our product that would be warmly welcomed by the public .
Even if one of the tests fails , we could apply the engineering design process to solve the problems that have emerged in the process of the testing .
In conclusion , the engineering design process would be able to help us develop an environmentally friendly product to help preserve the environment .
Therefore , it proves to be a good method to solve most of our needs .
Technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery
Human beings have gone through 21 centuries .
In this long time period , technology has developed together with the human society .
Technology has been developed in different ways .
Two main ways are research and serendipitous discovery .
Both research and serendipitous discovery are very important in technology development .
Technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery differ in some aspects but are similar in some other aspects .
In terms of development process , technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery are different .
For technology via research , scientists have a clear plan before they start their research .
They know what they want to get or to achieve at the very beginning .
Then they just do what they should do step by step according to their plan .
Finally , they achieve their goal .
The process for the development of technology developed via research is very systematic with a very clear target .
Technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery is different .
Scientists discover a very useful technology unexpectedly .
That means they themselves even do not know they will discover it until they really do .
They do not have the target but they finally stumble upon some new technology .
These two kinds of technology also differ from each other in development inputs .
As an old saying goes , one cannot make bricks without straw .
Technology research is also the same .
From the moment that scientists decide to work on a new technology , scientists have to put in a lot in order to discover a new technology .
These inputs include time , effort , fund , and so on .
Unlike technologies developed via research , technologies resulted from serendipity need almost zero input .
This kind of technology is just like a gift from God .
It is for free .
What is needed is just luck .
Scientists need such luck to get this God's gift .
So , these two kinds of technology need different input .
Consumer domain is another difference between technology resulted from research and technology resulted from serendipitous discovery .
In most circumstances , scientists are clearly aware of consumers of their technology before they start their research .
They develop certain technology which satisfies certain consumer domains; in comparison , scientists usually do not know the use and the specific consumer domains when they  accidentally discover a technology .
In spite of these differences , these two kinds of technology share several important similarities .
Both of them are very useful to the development of our society .
They help make our life easier and more comfortable , thus improving our living standard .
If adapted into industry production , both kinds of technology can bring economic benefit .
To conclude , technology developed via research and technology resulted from serendipitous discovery not only have differences but also share similarities .
Even though these two kinds of technology are developed in different ways , they both can benefit the society and our daily life .
Over the past century , the technological boom has brought about much comfort and convenience through different inventions .
These luxury items , although they bring about a lot of convenience to our lives , are major culprits of destroying our environment .
As such , one of the main human needs would be to restore balance and lengthen the lifetime of our environment .
The process of creating new inventions , also labelled as engineering design process , is able to address this issue .
This can be done by considering the environmental friendliness of inventions as one of its major factors in the five steps of engineering design process , which are as follows: Defining the problem , gathering information , generating solutions , analysing and selecting a solution and implementing the solution .
(Khandani , 2005)
The step of defining the problem is very important .
It sets out the whole purpose of the process in the right direction .
Thus , for new problems defined , the factor of it being environmentally friendly can be factored in .
For example , eco-friendly gym equipment today are able to harness the energy generated during its use to power the machine itself .
This innovation eliminates the need for external power for the gym equipment .
Moreover , new inventions should not be the only products with a "green" factor as old inventions can be re-designed in order to achieve the "green" status .
One such example would be the invention of hybrid cars which are recognised as environmentally friendly automobiles .
The next step is to gather information and generate solutions .
Information gathering is a step which allows the designer to be equipped with background information of the problem before tackling it .
At this step , researching on the various methods in order for the product to be more environmentally friendly should be one of the main concerns .
It also allows them to consider existing solutions , if any , and consider various factors which will determine the success of the product such as its economic viability and its effectiveness .
Thus , solutions generated from these ideas should be able to resolve the problems identified as well as conform to the requirements of the society .
The solutions should be environmentally friendly such as being able to bypass or convert the by-products which are harmful to the environment , such as greenhouse gases or toxic waste .
Moreover , not only should the product solve the initial problem , it should also meet the society's demand in terms of usability , ergonomics and economical concerns .
Thereafter , the next step would be the process of selecting the solution for implementation .
This process selects a solution generated in the previous step that best meets the requirements of the problem .
Each problem is different and unique; thus , they would have different factors to consider for analysis .
Every design is rated based on the consideration of various factors such as functionality , ergonomics , mechanics , manufacturability , safety , cost-effectiveness and compliance with regulations .
(Khandani , 2005) The solutions would then be rated according to different criteria corresponding to the analysis and the best would then be selected .
Since the need for an environmentally friendly product is the emphasis for the invention , its functionality would naturally be a priority for consideration .
After functionality , safety is another area of concern .
Finally , the solution will only be implemented after going through a series of rigorous tests and improvements .
In conclusion , engineering design process is a general process through which ideas can be generated to resolve current issues .
One of the main human needs of the current millennium would be to have a sustainable environment in view of the rapid progression of our technology .
Engineering design process is able to address this issue by encompassing and focusing on the element of environmental friendliness for every invention .
Technological developments are divided into two different categories: the conventional method of developing technology through research or the unusual method of developing technology through serendipitous discovery .
The two technological innovations discussed would be the Laptop Computer and Sildenafil (Viagra) .
Though they are on the opposite spectrum in terms of the field of technology , both have similarities in their own way .
One difference , aside from their uses , is the manner in which they were developed .
The development of the laptop in Toshiba took on a systematic and direct approach towards an apparent goal: to reduce the size of a personal computer so it would be compact enough and portable .
On the other hand , Sildenafil , the compound in Viagra , was synthesised and studied initially for usage in treating hypertension (high blood pressure) and angina pectoris (a heart disease) .
However , clinical trials showed that it did not treat angina but instead , stimulate significant penile erection .
The company , Pfizer , thus decided to manufacture the compound into pills and market it as a drug to treat erectile dysfunction .
Another difference between the two technological developments was approvals from the inventor's company leaders .
In the case of Viagra , the inventors Peter Dunn and Albert Wood had the blessings of their company to carry out their research and were given research facilities and funding .
Tetsuya Mizoguchi , on the contrary , had to go "underground" with the laptop research project in the company's other factory , diverting funds and shifting engineers from military projects to design the laptop , despite being denied development funds and an experienced team of engineers (Rogers 2003) .
Ironically , after the success , Tetsuya was promoted to Toshiba's board of directors while the inventors of Viagra were denied recognitions for their invention .
Yet , aside from being products of different fields , both technologies were able to be commercialized into products successfully .
Pfizer managed to patent the newly synthesised Sildenafil , incorporate it into pill form before marketing it as an oral treatment for erectile dysfunction .
In 2000 , Viagra sales accounted for 92 percent of the global market for prescribed erectile dysfunction pills .
(Keith A 2000) The laptop was a radically different innovation then; nevertheless , it was marketed furiously and soon had majority market shares in Europe , United States and Japan (Rogers 2003) .
Another similarity between the two technologies was that they had competitors .
Global shares of Viagra dropped to 50 percent due to other erectile dysfunction pill manufacturers like Cialis , Levitra and several counterfeits and clones .
( Berenson , 2005) .
Toshiba , similarly , has seen its fair share of competition with leading names like Dell , Apple and Fujitsu .
Finally , both innovations have helped enrich the lives of people by addressing a need or a problem .
Offices in Japan are crowded and homes are small with no space to install a desktop , giving rise to a need for smaller personal computers .
The problem of male erectile dysfunction was solved by the innovative development of Viagra , though it was a 'coincidence' that the compound Sildenafil causes penile erection .
In conclusion , though the development of Viagra was serendipitous and would seem unfair to the arduous task of development via research in the case of Tetsuya's laptop project , both worked towards a common goal of enriching lives , which I feel is first and foremost the basis of technological advancement .
Also , let us not forget that chemists , Peter Dunn and Albert Wood , were also working systematically towards creating a compound to treat hypertension and angina .
Transportation is a necessity that humans cannot live without .
The number of cars on the road keep on increasing year by year and so does the pollution that arises from it .
Therefore engineers need to come up with better design of environmentally friendly hybrid cars that run on green energy fuel to replace the current diesel engine cars .
The first step in engineering better hybrid cars is to define the problems of current hybrid cars and to gather information about them .
Current hybrid cars available in the market are not practical and do not appeal to the mass market .
Some of the factors include the lack of recharging stations and the high cost of producing it .
This deters consumers from switching their old diesel powered cars to the more environmentally friendly hybrid cars .
We also need to make a complete market survey on the reasons why hybrid cars are not getting the attention of consumers .
As stated by Khandani in "Engineering Design Process , 2005" , consumers are the one that ultimately establishes the need for a product .
Thus , understanding this need of environmentally friendly hybrid cars is of importance before proceeding to the next step of the design solution .
Next , engineers need to generate multiple solutions for the hybrid cars .
This includes brainstorming sessions to find new alternative fuels and designing a new engine that can run on such fuels .
Engineers also need to make comparison between the latest hybrid cars such as electric cars , hydrogen fuel cell cars and solar powered cars to see which one is more efficient and suitable .
Willingness to take risks and experiment with new alternative fuels is also important so that more creative ideas can be generated .
Then , we proceed to the next stage of analyzing the various solutions and selecting the best one .
As highlighted by Khandani , there are some factors that may need to be considered in the analysis such as the product safety , functional analysis , market analysis and mechanical analysis .
The hybrid cars should be tested for its safety and functionality .
For instance , solar powered hybrid cars need to be ensured that it has enough energy to function well in the night .
Hydrogen fuel cell cars must have a practical way of emitting water as its waste .
We also need to analyze the safety of the designs .
If it is below par , we can add adequate safety features or a thorough instruction manual to it .
Lastly , after going through rigorously analyzing and selecting the final design , we need to make a prototype of the hybrid car and test its overall function in real world situations .
This will reveal the weaknesses in the design; hence the engineers can improve on it .
We also need to test and check various criteria so that the hybrid car meets the needs of the consumers .
Documentation and patent on the overall design should be done at this stage .
Then , we need to execute extensive marketing and awareness campaign to get consumers to buy the hybrid car .
To conclude , engineering a new design of environmentally friendly hybrid car helps to reduce pollution by using green fuels such as electric and solar power .
Creative engineering design can produce a paradigm shift for people to start using environmentally friendly cars due to all their positive advantages .
What is the best alternative of fossil fuel ?
The answer is widely believed to be one of the renewable energies , which include solar energy , wind power and so on .
However , in the process of looking for new energy source to take place of coals and oils , a more urgent problem of the energy system has been neglected -- the storage of the energy .
If the coal , oil and sunshine can be regarded as the primary energy carriers , the battery , whose energy can be consumed effectively and cleanly , is the secondary energy carrier , which relates to our daily life more closely .
Ironically , comparing with the primary energy carriers , the battery is far less popular and only used in some specific fields .
How can the engineering design make it widely used by innovating ?
The process can be divided into three parts , defining the problems of battery , finding the solutions and selling the new products .
Although battery is not widelbe traced backtoday , it is possible to change the situation by innovating .
To enhance the capacitybecause ofhe battery , keep weaknessesew materials is important .
Since the new battery is designed to use in the big machines to replace engines , the capacity will have the priority .
The engineers can try some heavy materials without worrying about the weight and volume .
Additionally , the engineers can also playersgn the energy system of the big machines to cooperatecompared battery to get a best efficiency .
To shorten the charge time , the technicians can get some ideas from the design of small batteries , which can be fully chthe batteryn fifteen minutes .
The last part of the process is to sell the products .
The popularization of battery is not isolated; as an energy carrier , it should be tkeepingher with the innovation of the electrical cars and other engineering prodbe useds to form an industry chain .
The chain will also include the battery charge station , which will replace the refueling station as the popularization of battery .
withTo sum up , the engineering design process can be a good way to innovate new generation of battery .
A process that includes defining , golving and selling will build a wh industry chain of new battery , and finally meet the energy carrier need of the society .
Nowadays , there will always be an engineer designed product wherever we go to or whatever we do .
They are the results of engineer designs to meet our needs .
In order for us to progress faster , more money needs to be pumped to the research sector so that discoveries like cures for illnesses , could be discovered faster .
Therefore , engineers should design products or systems that could improve the economy .
Engineer designs that save energy , cut costs and save manpower are the key to improving the economy so that more money can be used for more research .
New form of or improved transportation could help to reduce costs and save time .
Teleportation is the ideal form of transportation in most of our dreams .
Although it is indeed unrealistic and impossible , we can never know if it can be realised .
No one thought that mobile phones were possible hundreds years ago too .
However , realistically , we could improve our transportation through better public transport design systems .
One example would be replacing drivers with automated computerized transports .
By replacing drivers with automated computerizations , manpower could be saved and public transports would be less costly .
With cheaper transports , people would have more money to spend , improving the economy .
In cities around the world , a large amount of energy is consumed by electrical appliances every day .
By designing better electrical appliances that could perform the same function with less energy used , we could save a large amount of energy .
One example would be designing a fridge that uses less power to run .
With less energy used , costs of living are reduced and the economy would improve with more people having more money to spend .
Another way to improve the economy would be through the designing of new forms of energy sources .
As the natural resources are depleting , the price of using it as source of energy is becoming increasingly high .
One such example would be the price of petrol .
Therefore , through the discovery of new forms of convenient and renewable energy , the price of energy could be more stable .
A more stable price reduces the chance of a big change that could lead to economy problems .
Given the current shaky economy , another big upset would have an adverse effect on our lives .
Therefore , a stable economy is essential for us to progress in technology and having a more reliable source of energy is the key to it .
With a population of 1 .15 billion , a total area of 3 .2 million square kilometers , twenty eight states  , seven union territories , diversity in culture and around a hundred different languages  , India , has certain significant problems in the hampering of engineering design processes for innovations .
Though engineering design is considerably well established in the country , some practical problems , play spoil sport .
Despite having the manpower , she is still not technologically advanced in comparison to the other developing countries like China , Brazil and Egypt .
The two main causes for this problem are population outburst and corruption .
The population of India is rapidly multiplying , increasing from 1 .147 billion in 2008 to 1 .15 billion in 2009 , in a course of just one year .
This makes it difficult to implement innovations , esIndialy in relation to engineering design .
Having a literacy rate of 61 percent , it is quite difficult to introduce new technological innovations , as not all the people in the country would underproblems unclear meaningize the product well .
Another problem is 'Brain Drain' or "human capital flight" (Ramones , n .d .) which began taking away India's brain power at a rapid rate .
This is because the job opportunities are better in foreign countries in comparison with the state of unemployment in India .
"This concept of taking education in a country but earning for another is known as brain drain .
"(Bhargava Tarang , n .d .) The western countries open up more job opportunities as they acquire cheap and hardworking labour .
Problems such as second highest population , vast size , low literacy rate and 'Brain Drain' have made it difficult for India to take a step towards technological innovations in the field of engineering design .
Currently , corruption is wide-spread in India .

(CNN-IBN , 2007) .
The revenue involved in this waspread mishap is very high , thereby affecting all the facets of the country .
Even the poverty stricken section of the society is forced to bribe the officials for their living .

These individuals are indifferent to the fact that majority of India's population is below the poverty line .
While the rich get richer , the poor keep gettithe secondrer .
The 'black' money does not get released into the economy for the fear of law and hence hampers the economy , widening the bridge between the 'haves and have nots' , pulling more people under the poverty line .
This multi faceted economic problem poses as the main hindrance to India's technological development and is the mother of all other social and political problems that India faces .

How do we invent products or systems ?
Do we simply just think of an idea and create a product to try and solve a problem ?
As engineers , most of us will use a process identified as the engineering design process .
The design process is a 5 stage process which includes defining the problem , gathering useful information , finding multiple solutions , narrowing down the solution and testing and implementing the solution(Khandani ,2005) .
The 5 stages are sequential , which means that an interruption in any of the 5 steps can hamper the engineering design process .
In Malaysia , engineering design processes for innovation have not been evolving as much as the government would them to .
The problems that contribute to this are that there are not many quality engineers left in Malaysia and because of the local society's mindset .
The first problem is the lack of quality engineers left in Malaysia .
Most engineers leave for financial reasons .
The value of the ringgit is rather low so engineers tend to favor working overseas as there , the salary is higher and the working environment is much better .
For example , Malaysians who study in Singapore are required to sign a bond which ties them to work in Singapore for a few years .
After working in Singapore , most of them will not return to work in Malaysia as the pay in Singapore is almost double compared to the pay in Malaysia .
In addition , the engineers produced in local universities are not able to fill the gap left by the engineers who leave the country .
The second problem is the society's mindset .
Malaysians have a very conservative way of thinking .
Furthermore , they are not willing to take new risks in terms of design innovation .
Malaysians are easily contented and refuse to improve on existing innovations and technologies .
Malaysians are also uncooperative in their work .
They are not willing to seek help from foreign countries and contract most of the work to unqualified local companies .
Apart from that , it is well known how corrupted the country is .
Corruption can lead to unmotivated work ethics .
The problems listed above can have an impact on all or one of the 5 stages of the engineering design process .
First and foremost , the conventional thinking of Malaysians can affect the first stage of the process of defining the problem .
Their traditional thinking will not be able to identify what the needs of the country are .
The uncooperative nature of the country can influence the design process in terms of generating multiple solutions .
We need to work together with other nations to tackle a problem because other countries may have different views of a problem  .
Most significantly , because of the insufficient number of engineers in the country , we are just not able to get enough manpower to accomplish the design process .
In conclusion , the progress of engineering design is being disrupted by the mindset of the local society and the lack of engineers .
As the rest of the world continues to improve technologically , we can only advance at a slower pace .
There is a need for an attitude change in both the government and the society .
Engineers should remain in the country and not just leave for personal benefits .
They should consider helping to improve the level of design innovation in the country so that we can compete globally .
Incredible as it seems in such a resource-rich earth , the energy crisis has become one makeable problem .
But the fact is that the shortage of energy has affected the whole human society and our further development .
As Tennessee Valley Authority disclosed that the normal 60-day store of coal now can only supply ten to twelve days (Business: The Energy shortage worsens , 1997) .
This means that our resources cannot fulfill our increasing demand .
The most pressing issue is finding a replacement for fossil resources .
One of the most suitable replacements is nuclear power .
However , there are some concerns about it , such as security , costs and performance , which have limited the popularization of this promising substitute approach .
In order to resolve these problems , a new generation of nuclear energy system which is called the Fourth Generation reactors is under test .
One of the six approaches that named as supercritical-water-cooled reactor can give us a way for our future energy with further researches .
Supercritical-water-cooled reactors share the benefits of Generation IV and some further benefits compared with other kinds of reactors , SCWR may also resolve some concerns about safety and cost with some further development .
SCWR as one of the six reactor concepts for Generation IV nuclear fuel , share the same e with all other reactors and some further predominance compared with other reactors .
Generating electricity in a sustainable , economically viable , sadisclosed ,e manner is the basic goals of Generation IV .
Sustainable means that the system should generate power by some natural fuel , at the same time , minimize the emeetental impact .
Economically viable means that the generating cost should be competitive with other energy resources , meanwhile the capital investment should also be low enough to allow access to a large number of countries .
Safe and reliable mainly emphasize that the future reactors should perform bett least as well in terms of the safety and reliability as current ones .
The focus is to decrease the emission of radiation and insuundergoingetestsety of civilians once accide ,appen .

(reactors (SCWRs)Power Energy , 2002) The SCWR is effective because only one cycle is involved .
Furthermore , the SCWR  .oSCWRsot require steam separator plates , heat exchangers nor turbines compared with BWR .
(Tilkki V . Supercritical Water Reactors: A Survey on International State of Research in 2006 , 2006) All the simple design reduced the construction cost of nuclear electrical station .
Also the coolant of SCWR is water which is cheaper compared with other kinds of reactors .
Not only does design entail a magnificent facade or the strange opinion of a maverick , but it also involves pragmatism , cost and efficiency .
All these requirements are fully met  by those who are well educated .
However , while there is a highly increasing demand for engineers with acuity of design , even in the education system of my own country , there are two major setbacks for engineering students getting adequate design skills: the lack of practice in school and the insufficiency of co-curricular activities .
Firstly , students in high schools do not have enough useful practice time in their schedule .
Although the curriculum has  been continually improved to gradually reduce the use of conventional teaching methods ,  .
The reason is that the acquisition of new equipment needed for experiments is not in tandem with the changing of textbooks .
Only in the urban areas can students have opportunities to get access to the required equipment .
For students in other places , they can only see the teacher do a sample experiment in the lecture but cannot try the experiments  themselves .
Even worse in some remote areas , students can only listen to the description of the experiment by the teacher .
According to the Labor Newspaper , in Hung Yen , a southern province of Viet Nam , there are thousands of students  studying without sufficient lab equipment due to the delay in  purchasing new equipment and due to corruption .
In these regions , another factor that breaks the camel's back is the exodus of young lab teachers to cities where they can have a conducive environment to develop their own career and earn a better living .
The residue of this migration is an old generation of teachers who are not very familiar with modern devices in labs .
Consequently , students do not have the chance to gain the priceless pragmatic experience of how to design  .
Secondly , students do not attend enough efficient co-curricular activities in school .
This can be accounted for by the fact that there are few organizations in almost all schools .
There was , in fact , only one organization , namely the Youth Union , in my secondary school .
When I went to high school , luckily we had three organizations: the Youth Union , Harmonica club and PTNK Soccer league .
Though activities held by the above organizations ranged from learning history to acquiring leadership , not many students benefited from them .
That is due to the fact that the number of participants for one activity just covered a small portion of all the students in school .
Moreover , since co-curricular activities are not compulsory in our country , and the studying in other learning centers takes up almost all the time of students , studentstend to drop co-curricular activities in school .
The Youth Newspaper recorded a New Zealand professor saying that Vietnamese students spend so much time on gaining academic knowledge that co-curricular activities have become a luxury .
The two aforementioned issues leave engineering students  .
For one thing , students who are not used to doing lab research usually have just a vague idea of what should be done .
For them , the first step of the design process seems to be far away as they cannot define the problems completely since "people have a natural tendency to attack the current solution to a problem rather than the problem itself" (Khandani , S . , Engineering design process , page 8) .
As a result ,  the rest of the process can be ruined because of the first steps; for example , if the problem statement is not broad enough , the statement will preclude  new thoughts on the issue .
it is arduous to undo the whole process ,  these novice engineers have to accept low-quality products and , consistently , low profit .
Another thing is that without experiments in co-curricular activities , fledgling engineers cannot fulfill the second and the third steps: collecting pertinent information and generating multiple solutions .
This is because they lack confidence in communicating with other colleagues to gather information as well as learning experience , so they can hardly find out the most  information .
Co-curricular activities also help engineering students develop creativity and imagination to come up with many answers to a single question .
If students do not actively join various activities , they will be prone to solely apply rules and theory in school to work .
However , "creativity is much more than just a systematic application of rules and theory to solve a technical problem" .
(Khandani , S . , Engineering design process , page 11) .
Losing creativity and imagination means that they are losing their advantage in  .
As a result , the difficulty in dealing with the first three steps is a veritable hindrance for the whole project .
In brief , what impedes engineering process design for innovation in my country's education system is the lack of practice and co-curricular skills .
However , with efforts to reform the education , I optimistically believe that we can overcome these obstacles to be competitive engineers in the global market .
First , there is a lack of creativity .
Every individual has a different mindset; some are born lazy , while some are not .
In Singapore , a number of us are of the lazy type , which means we are lazy to design .
Moreover , there are some that are shy to speak up about their ideas .
Another problem would be individuals with fixed mindsets , thinking that designing is not a good path to take .
For example , in Marcelo Ang's (2009) talk , he mentioned that it is always the mental block of an individual that makes everyone think of not going for designing .
Hence there is a need to remove that mental block , so that  individuals will have the opportunity to design and invent what they desire  .
This mindset may cause the market to lose  good designers , who could potentially help boost the design industry .
This will impact the market because there will be an unavailability of new products .
Without people designing new products  , there will be no new products in the market .
This in turn will cause the market to suffer .
In the article "Designing engineers to change the world" , Chan (2009) mentioned that market users always demand  new products which they are fascinated with .
Moreover , when there are no new products , these potential customers are lost , hence causing causing the market to suffer .
Second ,  is due to the time taken to create a full design product .
A design process is not the outcome of one night's work .
It might take days and months to perfect the design so as to ensure that the end product is good .
Thereafter , more problems may arise such as finding and building of the parts and materials that are not readily available in Singapore .
For example , a lot of stress tests had to be done during the process of making NEWater (2008) .
These included tests on humans to confirm that Newater was fit for drinking before it was produced for public consumption .
Those tests were not done in a day or month .
They took more than a year to complete .
leads to other effects and impacts the market .
People tend to go for simpler designs , because of the long time required to create a proper full design .
The reason is that a simple design is much easier to design and time required to produce such a design would be much less .
This results in poor designs being produced in the market .
Hence market users will not be tempted to buy the product , which would cause  sales and the market to be low .
Additionally , this also leads to lost income for designers as they might not earn their production cost back .
Eventually potential designers would have second thoughts and step out of designing .
In conclusion , the lack of creativity and the time to create a design could cause impacts on the market in Singapore .
These problems that may hamper  engineering design would impact the market causing the unavailability of new products , designers taking shortcuts in design and designers' mindsets about design .
In addition , this would lead to a market downturn .
I personally feel that the most common problem originates from every individual's mindset , when they have already made up their mind .
It's hard to change it once it's fixed .
I believe that if an individual takes up the courage to change , and design a proper design , it would resolve the problems that are hampering the design process for innovation .

We humans always dream .
We have never been satisfied with what we want .
We are always out there looking for something better .
It might seem that we are greedy  , but the fact that I am writing this essay sitting comfortably in an air conditioned room is fact enough to validate our greed and curiosity .
If we weren't always greedy for more , just imagine how different the world would have been .
Just an hour without  electricity would make life intolerable for everyone .
The boom of innovation and technology in the past few decades has  been tremendous .
Every country wants to be technologically forward and pumps in enormous amounts of money and resources into leading innovations and research developments .
However , the standard of research and innovation in every country varies to a great deal .
This is influenced by the different prevailing social and economic atmospheres .
Now I am going to talk about the various issues that hamper engineering design and innovations in my own country , India .
The first thing that comes to one's mind when one reads about India is its vast size and a whopping population of over 1 .1 billion (Population Council , 2009) .With such a vast population , the onus on the government to ensure the welfare of the people is tremendous .
With a large part of the population depending on the government for subsidies and food  , most of the annual budget is spent in ensuring that the people are well fed .
With India being a democratic country , the major revenue for the government is taxes paid by the people .
With the standard of living not being quite high , the revenue earned by the government is also quite limited .
Therefore , the amount of money the government can afford to spend on  research projects is quite little compared to other countries .
India spends only 450 million USD per year on research (The Acorn n .d .) .
One of the major responsibilities of the government of any country is providing quality education to the nation's children .
This has always been quite a problem for India .
With its vast size and population a lot of the rural areas still lack proper schools .
Fifty percent of the children living in these rural areas leave school before completing their fifth grade ( The English Argument  , Prashant Mekala  ,December 8  ,1995) .
These children then end up in manual labour .
This is quality human resource lost .
These children may one day have turned into great thinkers and scientists  ,but due to the lack of proper facilities , they drop out of school .
It is no wonder that India lags behind in technological innovations and research .
However , in the cities , the quality of education is world class .
The people educated in the cities are now exposed to the entire world .
They are quite well learned .
Some of them  leave the country in search of better prospects in the developed countries .
The chance of earning huge sums of money and of obtaining a quality lifestyle  makes them leave their country as though they are leaving their house to take a leisurely stroll .
With the government spending huge sums of money on them and these people not even repaying the government by working here and paying taxes here  , their departure is a huge blow for the government .
More than 300 ,000 Indians migrate to the United States and over 75 percent of these people have had tertiary education (Finance and development  , June 1999) .
With such highly educated individuals leaving the country , the scope for leading research becomes quite limited .
Another factor is that a lot of the developed countries attract foreign talent  .
India is not able to do that .
With the standard of living and environment not meeting that of the developed countries we are unable to attract brilliant individuals from different parts of the world .
With all these factors playing a role  , the engineering design and innovation in India is significantly hampered .
Steps have been taken to minimise the effects of these factors  , but there is still a long way to go to see all these factors vanishing altogether .
Several private organisations have started helping the people in what little way they can .
Innovation engineering has been a commonly recurrent phrase in the industries in the recent years .
However , exactly how many engineers fully understand the full meaning and implications behind the simple phrase ?
Furthermore , how many understand the long and exhausting process required for innovative engineering operations to be executed and optimized ?
The process of concept generation , product testing and product implementation requires a lot of resources .
These resources come in the form of time , which translates to financial terms , and experience in the process .
In the Singapore society which is relatively result orientated , people tend to be afraid to try out new ideas as they are afraid they will lose out to the intense competition they face from  others .
Hence , engineers would rather stick to tried and proven methods that are seen to be effective , instead of exploring  alternative methods .
However , these engineers fail to realise that failures are the key to innovation .
Without having gone through failures , new and better processes would not be properly developed , and thus optimisation would not be achieved .
The environment makes it hard for companies to allocate resources for innovation , and at the same time , keep the company's competitive edge in the market .
Due to this problem , fresh ideas would not even have a chance to be developed , not to say move towards the implementation of the idea .
has gradually developed into an inflexible culture , where our workers choose to stick to current beliefs rather than try out new ideas .
Generating new concepts does not just require a single day of effort , as  people believe , but instead requires a longer thought process which may take days or even months .
The culture in Singapore does not even allow our workers to make time for this crucial concept generation process .
Another problem we face in Singapore is the lack of experience our country has in the innovative engineering field .
Compared to developed countries , which have years of experience in the field , our nation has just begun to prosper .
Previously , public policies have guided our nation towards the manufacturing arena .
This has given rise to various government bodies efficient in international operating and manufacturing standards .
However , it has only been in recent years that our government has moved towards research and development .
Therefore , it would take quite some time to gear local engineers towards an innovative mindset .
Engineering processes not only rely on theories , but a lot on the engineer's experience .
Chief engineers who have been in the field for a period of time would be valuable resources .
However , it would take years for a new generation of engineers to be trained in innovative engineering .
Innovative engineering requires the engineer to venture into areas which have yet to be explored , which makes  experience even more vital , as it would allow problems to be identified even before they occur .
Such problems would most probably not have been explored by current engineers .
In conclusion , Singapore should open up to accept more challenges and failures especially for the younger generations of engineers .
The younger engineers should be more daring and dare to venture into the innovative world to discover new ideas .

Two major problems among these are: the low acceptance of engineering design and the complex verification before licensing procedures for engineering projects .

In today's world , the significance of nuclear energy cannot be ignored .
In some countries , nuclear energy plays an important role  in power production .
Currently , "nuclear energy supplies about 80% and 30% of the electricity in France and Japan respectively"() .
More prominently , countries are using nuclear energy to make powerful weapons for military purposes .
We know how Iran and North Korea have been using their nuclear 'power' to negotiate with the US .
However , these powerful weapons  were not within scientists' imagination of how nuclear energy would be utilised .
Scientists probably had intended to use nuclear energy for peaceful purposes like using it as an alternative source of energy  .
Hence , we shall examine how nuclear energy  and how it is important to the world now and in the near future .
Nuclear energy was discovered in the early 1990s () .
Scientists discovered that a huge amount of energy could be produced from the nuclear fission of the element uranium .
We shall not go down to the details of that process but it was a major scientific discovery as it led to another form of energy production .
Unfortunately , nuclear energy's first real useful application was on Japan's cities where two nuclear bombs landed and caused massive destruction .
While this historical event marked the end of WWII , it presented nuclear energy to the rest of the world .
Soon , countries like Russia and China became nuclear 'powers' as well .
Their governments funded nuclear research and the setting up of more nuclear reactors .
Naturally , nuclear weapons became increasingly sophisticated as nuclear countries reinvented these weapons and vied to be the most powerful nuclear state in the world .
Now , nuclear weapons , from what we know , can be flown to a faraway place to cause massive destruction .
However , the use of nuclear weapons on another country has been non-existent since WWII as countries realize the chaos they could cause .
Moreover , the primary purpose of nuclear energy is to generate electricity .
Unlike energy produced by burning carbon , nuclear energy is clean as no greenhouse gases is produced from nuclear plants , where nuclear energy is made .
Using more nuclear energy and less carbon-generated energy to produce electrical energy could mean a significant decrease in greenhouse gases and a cleaner earth to live on .
Countries like France rely on nuclear power as much as other countries  rely on carbon to generate electricity .
Hence , nuclear energy might become essential in the near future as the world seeks to solve the energy-related problems such as global warming .
At the same time , just like any other forms that could be used to generate electricity , nuclear power is not a perfect source of energy  .
The danger of radioactivity is always imminent as critics often refer to the nuclear accident in Chernobyl that resulted in many deaths and serious repercussions such as unnatural births many years after the accident .
In addition , even if nuclear accidents do not occur , spent nuclear fuel would remain radioactive for decades .
As a result , land space has to be sacrificed to accommodate waste storage .
In conclusion , nuclear energy would probably play an important as the Earth's carbon resources are gradually being depleted .
However , nuclear countries should only encourage research on nuclear energy production for peaceful purposes .
They should not use it as a weopon in war as this could spell the end of the world .
The creation of NEWater , a technology where used water is treated to become potable , is one of the few examples of success in the research of technology in Singapore .
Prior to this achievement , the PUB (Public Utilities Board) faced many obstacles and that included the lack of engineering technology which made the cost of implementation unrealistic .
As a result , this plan was shelved in the 1980s .
Similarly , Singapore is currently facing problems that hamper its ambition of coming up with great innovations .
One of these problems is the rigid education system that is restricting the growth of the minds of young Singaporeans , mainly the teenagers .
At the same time , the comfortable state of living in Singapore poses a challenge to provoking the minds of its people to improve their current state of living .
All these may then lead to the slowdown of  technological advancement in Singapore .
The Ministry of Education (MOE) in Singapore adopts an academic based education system , where excellent examination results are prioritized over the creativity of one's mind .
Parents and teachers emphasize a lot on obtaining 'A' grades and hence students have a misconception towards education .
They have the impression that doing well in examinations equates to success in their future endeavours .
Moreover , achievingacademic promotion mainly requires students to reproduce their knowledge conservatively without much consideration .
As such , less time is made for attending brain teasing courses which  , in almost all cases ,  are made optional to students and whose importance is not highlighted .
Hence , 'students from Singapore top results in Mathematics and Science among their peers from 41 other countries but when it comes to designing , Singaporeans are way behind their foreign peers' (Boston College , n .d .) .
It is thus evident that Singaporean students are proficient in examination questions yet fail in creativity .
In view of the limited development in creativity of the people here , there is no doubt why the ability to design novel engineering processes is beginning to be seen as an outstanding talent in our society .
The other problem Singapore faces is , ironically , its high standard of living .
More importantly , the efficient system of governance in Singapore lives up to most of the promises made to its people during general elections .
Given the comfortable lifestyle they are enjoying , the idea of bringing about a change is not  the people's priority .
For instance , the government has upgraded the facilities in housing estates through  the implementation of schemes such as the Lift Upgrading Scheme , and this has brought about the 'tardiness' in Singaporeans in thinking about further improvements to their life .
Their focus , instead , is directed at their routine occupational job and their own family matters and therefore , the element of creativity is not part of their daily life .
Consequently , these problems result in the failure to generate creative ideas as a solution or improvement to the people's surroundings .
The scope of their thoughts is relatively narrow and hence they usually fail to come up with innovations that are beyond their imagination .
Surprisingly , what Singaporeans have in mind as the ideal solution may not be in tandem with that of foreigners .
Eventually , without a niche in designing , they will  lose out to the 'brains' from other countries when it comes to employment for 'a designer is a planner with an aesthetic sense' (Bruno Munari , n .d .) .
Not only is knowledge important , but originality too plays an important role when it comes to being a great innovator .

"Think outside the box .
"This is the sentence that we have all heard many times before when it comes to innovation .
Singapore , as a young nation with no natural resources , depends heavily on its human resources to survive .
To be able to capture the consumers in the market , we have to be innovative in product design .
However , I think problems like the fixed mindset of the person and the lack of resources may hamper  engineering design processes for innovations .
Firstly , many people have a fixed mindset .
They tend to worry about what others might think and are afraid of criticism by others .
Self-criticism is also another issue that hinders creativity .
Most people believe themselves to be lacking in creativity and think that others will not like their ideas .
Hence , during a presentation , they present their ideas with little or no confidence because they are afraid of making fools of themselves .
Therefore , others will take it that there is a lack of enthusiasm in the idea .
Moreover , if someone receives a negative response , there is a high chance that he will not pursue any innovative attempts anymore .
Sometimes , people have the tendency to make products too complex or are too focused on factors like usability that it results in a design barrier .
Not everyone encourages new ideas .
Often their reaction to new things is negative .
This will also further hinder creativity .
Secondly , since Singapore is small , it is limited in resources .
We often have to import materials from other countries .
As a result , the cost of production will be expensive and people would rather choose to design a simple product instead of investing in  product innovation and research .
In addition , we have a small talent pool of people with innovative ideas .
Hence , most people do not possess the skills that are able to design any innovative products .
As a result of the problems that hamper  the engineering design process for innovation , many fail to identify  unmet needs of the market , causing the market to suffer .
Instead of having new  products in the market to capture the attention of the consumers , the market ends up with many different products having similar features and functions .
Furthermore , as mentioned by Chan in his lecture , many people are willing to pay more for design as well as for new products that they think are simple , practical and useful .
For instance , Apple iPhones were in high demand in the market during its launch because of their design , simplicity and reliability although the features of the iPhones are generally the same as many other smartphones in the market .
In conclusion , it is possible to avoid all aspects which will hamper  engineering design processes for innovations by changing the mindset of the people as well as finding alternative ways to solve the problem of the lack of resources .
We should attempt to make changes to our way of life in order to begin a larger change in our lives .
The engineering design process plays an important role in innovation and creativity .
Since the resources in the world are limited and decreasing , many countries are making efforts to develop the designing process to use the resources more efficiently toimprove the standard of life .
However , in my country there are still some problems that hamper  creativity and design , especially the lack of resources and the behavior of customers .
In this essay , I will discuss  these obstacles and how they affect the design process .
First of all , one of the biggest obstacles that hamper the engineering design process in my country is the lack of resources , which includes both  human resources and natural resources .
Human resources , in this case , refers to the labor force needed to design products with skill and knowledge .
Without knowledge , an engineer cannot start his designing process because he does not know where to begin and what to create .
As a result , the lack of human resource affects the design process at the very first stage .
Another factor that also hampers  creativity is the lack of natural resourcessuch as space , time and materials  for designing .
For example , in my country , many projects have to be postponed because there are not enough materials to make the products .
When waiting for the resources to be imported from other countries , these projects were still on the paper .
Therefore , natural resources are important at the stages of implement the ideas to create the products .
Secondly , the behaviors of the users also cause many problems when putting the products on the market .
Customers are usually afraid of changing the products they are currently usingt to new ones when they think the old ones are satisfactory .
Once they are used to  a current product , it is hard to persuade them to switch to a new one because they have to learn how to use the new device .
This may not be a big matter for the young but with the old people , the problem is much  greater .
For example , my mother will only use the traditional line-phone and not the cell-phone because making a call with the hand-phone is more complex than just picking up the line-phone handset and dialing the number .
Consequently , a new product , although functionally well designed , could be easily refused if it was not friendly to users .
In this situation , the behaviors of the customers are the key factors which directly determine the success of the product in the last stages of the engineering design process: making the product and bringing it to the market .
In conclusion , the two factors of lack of resources and behaviors of the customers cause great problems to the engineering design process in my country .
They affect most stages of the design process as they can postpone the process or even  stop it .
Unfortunately , these problems cannot be solved in the short term; it will require much effort to bring back the knowledge and materials into my country .
Have you ever wondered how many vending machines  the National University of Singapore has ?
Believe it or not , it is reported that there are over 100 vending machines in this university alone (National University of Singapore , 2009) .
Vending machines are available almost everywhere .
We can see them in hospitals , parks and even jungles !
There is no doubt that this invention has influenced our modern life to a great extent .
However , this technology only came on the market in the early 1880s , although the first vending machine was invented by a Greek engineer named Hero of Alexandria many centuries ago around 10 A .D . to 70 A .D . CITATION Eri06 \l 1033 (Jaffe , 2006) .
Various factors have contributed to allow such an invention to be widely adopted in today's world .
Ever since the first vending machine appeared , many companies have adopted this idea as the public has welcomed such an invention .
The convenience it has brought has definitely played a big part in its success .
From the consumer's perspective , cumbersome long queues can be avoided when he only needs to have a can of drink .
Furthermore , the simple manipulation of the vending machine and the hygienic storage is widely accepted by the masses .
From the vendor's perspective , the vending machine is favourable because it allows the selling of stocks that have a very long shelf life .
and the reliability of these vending machines is guaranteed .
Practically , they can be placed at any place , including rural locations .
This introduction of vending machines has improved and revolutionized the conventional way of merchandising .
In countries like Japan and Singapore , where there is a lack of space , the need for a condensed merchandiser which improves space efficiency is furthermore amplified .
As time gradually goes by , the population density of many countries increases .
Devices that free up more available spaces are gaining popularity .
In Japan , the available vending items range from instant noodles to cars !
