For the next 10 years or more , Singapore  have a high percentage of population consisting of the elderly .
There are a few factors leading to an ageing populationlike low birth rates and increase in the cost of standard of living .
With the increase in the number of elderly , there would be a need for safety areas , thus products or services should be designed to meet this need .
For example , one of the current market products is called "MEMSwear" which is produced by National University of Singapore engineers .
This product is a smart suit that is equipped with an array of microsensors which are able to detect falls suffered by the wearers and to send alerts to their caregivers .
Besides these functions , the engineers have also included an "impact-reduction" system to reduce the damage done on the wearer when he or she falls .
For the product , we have seen that the engineers have made use of  engineering design processes to meet the need .
Firstly , they have defined the problem , which is  ageing population , and they have seen the need to invent a product which could give extra safety protection to the elderly .
Secondly , they have brainstormed on the preliminary criteria for a better design for the product (Khandani , 2005)) .
For example , for the first version of the product , they have not included the "impact-induction" system .
Without this feature , the wearer might suffer a serious accident if he or she falls .
Thus , through the use of engineering design processes , they have come out with a better design of the product .
Next , this is another product which works alike as the previous product .
But other than the features that the "MEMSwear" has , this product has additional functions (Khandani , S . (2005)) .
One of the functions is that upon receiving an alert when the user has a serious fall , it would dial for ambulance immediately .
This would greatly reduce the consequences of the fall if actions are taken within a shorter time .
Another additional function is the implementation of a temperature sensor .
For instance , in the case of a fire , the temperature sensor would be alerted and will send warning alerts to their caregivers or call for Civil Defense Force immediately .
Furthermore , when considering the design of the product , there is a need to make special considerations that are suitable for  elderly use .
Those factors that might need to be taken into consideration when designing the product are inflexible movements and slow response time .
Engineers would have to use the engineering design processes to list out multiple solutions the designing of product (Khandani , S . (2005)) .
For each solution , they would have to analyze and select one of the best solutions that suits most of the criteria listed .
In order to make sure the product works well , engineers have to test it before they launch the product .
In conclusion , we have seen that the problems of ageing population could get more serious in the next few years , thus there is a need to design a product that could help to reduce the risks and impacts faced by the ageing population .
Through examples of these two products , we could see that both of them have made use of  engineering design processes to meet the need .
And thus , they proved that it is really important to go through  engineering design processes when inventing a new product .
Human activities on Earth have depleted Earth's valuable yet limited  natural resources , thus damaging the its environment .
This causes Earth's natural resources to be depleted and modify Earth's environment so much that it is no longer suitable for human life .
Therefore , humans have to give priorities to conserving Earth's natural resources and protecting its environment .
This can be achieved by completely setting aside already available engineering processes , modifying and improving these old processes , or correctly identifying the reasons for the rise of that need .
Secondly , instead of removing available engineering processes , they can also be modified so that their original functions are still available but at the same time satisfies the need to preserve natural resources and protect the environment .
For example , transportation systems like cars require fuels like fossil fuels which are processed from a depleting natural resource , fossil fuels .
Furthermore , greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide are produced from these cars which  contribute to the notorious greenhouse effect .
To solve this problem , engineering processes like the designing of the car's engine can be changed .
For instance ,  electric cars by General Motors use electricity to power the car's engine instead of fossil fuels .
This satisfy the need as electricity can be generated from renewable sources of energy like solar and wind energy .
Furthermore , greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide will also not be emitted  .
Thus , we can observe how modifying available engineering processes can satisfy the need .
Thirdly , the need can be fulfilled by correctly identifying and analyzing the reason for the rise of that need , so that  correct decisions can be made through engineering processes  .
For example , CFC gases in the past are a by-product of many of our industries .
These gases caused the destruction of the Earth's ozone layer in the atmosphere which caused more harmful ultraviolet , UV rays to penetrate the atmosphere , and consequently health problems like skin cancer to humans due to these UV rays .
Therefore , a worldwide policy was implemented to ban the emission of CFC gases into the atmosphere by industries .
Thus , we can see how making  correct decisions to prevent pollution to the environment can fulfill the need .
In conclusion , to ensure a sufficient supply of natural resources and a healthy environment for us and our future generations to live in , these processes can meet our needs by removing and introducing or modifying available engineering processes and making  correct decisions through engineering processes  .
According to Khandani (2005) , engineers design products or systems that meet human needs .
Out of all the human needs in the world ,  clean water should be given priority compared with others .
Despite the fact that the amount of water on earth is quite large , nevertheless , we can only drink a very small part of it .
It is because most of the water in the world is sea water , which is not potable at all .
In addition , due to  global warming , the sea level rises .
Therefore , some precious sources of drinking water , like underground water ,  are polluted and not drinkable any more , which makes the situation even worse .
In some regions in the world , such as the Middle East and Africa , the shortage of clean drinking water is very serious , which sometimes causes wars .
To solve this problem , there are two ways in which engineers can contribute .
The first way is to design a system to recycle used water .
Water we daily use can be divided into two categories ,  for drinking and not for drinking .
For example , water we use to flush toilets , to irrigate farmland and to wash cars is not necessary to reach the same hygienic level as the drinking water .
Hence , we may use recycled water to do these jobs so that we can save more clean drinking water for people  .
Actually , this idea has already been adopted by many countries to relieve the pressure caused by the shortage of water .
Moreover , some developed countries , such as Singapore , have mastered this technology so well that recycled water can be drunk directly , which really helps a lot to solve the problem of shortage of water .
However , this method may not be suitable for  developing and undeveloped countries because it costs a lot of money , and the technology required is also very high .
The other way to get drinking water is through desalination of sea water .
As mentioned before , the amount of sea water is truly vast; therefore , humans can certainly take sea water as another source of drinking water .
However , the process of desalination of sea water is very difficult .
It requires highly advanced science and technology , and of course , it is very costly .
Another limitation of this method is that it can only be applied in seaside countries , like Singapore , which means that it is not the first choice of many inland countries .
But since it also has its advantage , like the huge and widespread source , it is still worth trying .
According to Khandani (2005) , the net result or purpose of most engineering designs is to produce a product that generates a profit for the company .
Therefore , since the two methods mentioned above are both costly and difficult to apply , they can be restricted by the economic and the market and thus , they may be not able to solve the shortage of water in a short period .
But what is important is that , at least , these two methods give us hope .
It is this kind of hope that motivates humans to develop , to improve , to pursue our dreams , and finally to have such a beautiful world today .
Hope is the most significant contribution which engineers have contributed to the world .
The environment-friendly car is a current human need which should be given priority .
Humans need to travel from one place to another easily .
The current car's technology , the fuel injection , has satisfied that need , but has not satisfied the environment's needs .
Humans need a car which is not only able to transport them easily but also is friendly to the environment .
It is the doctors' job to apply their creative energies in designing a solution which meets humans' need .
First of all , the current car's technology , the fuel injection , has satisfied humans' need to travel .
For example , the time taken to travel from one place to another with a distance of a few hundred kilometres has been reduced from 2-3 days to 2-3 hours; as a result , humans are able to travel instantly .
This  indeed makes humans' means of transportation rising to another level .
Second , in contrast with the benefit  fuel injection has contributed to human life , it has , in fact , polluted the environment .
This is due to  fuel processing in the car .
For example ,  fuel injection is exhausting Carbon Dioxide (CO2) as a result of incomplete burning of fuels .
Carbon dioxide is a greenhouse gas that traps the earth's heat and contributes to global warming .
Third , humans not only need to travel but also need a pollution -free environment to live in .
In  view of this issue , engineers are needed on designing a solution .
According to Khandani (2005) , products or systems are designed by engineers to meet human needs .
For years , engineers have experimented to design a solution to this issue .
For example , Japan's engineers have experimented for about 10 years before they successfully designed an eco-car which makes use of electric energy .
This eco-car has no fuel tank  , therefore , it produces no emissions at all .
On top of that , Japan's eco-car is as fast as the fuel injection car .
Lastly , Japan's engineers had followed engineering design processes Khandani (2005) to design their first eco-car .
They started by defining the problem of the fuel injection system .
They argued that the fuel injection system's problem lies in the fuel it uses .
Therefore , Japan's engineers started to look for alternate fuel for their eco-car .
They gathered information in order to arrive successfully at the right fuel source; subsequently , they decided to use electricity as the fuel .
The road to success is not smooth; likewise , Japan's engineers had gone through a lot of challenges and tests before they arrived at the final prototype of Japan's first eco-car .
Humans need to care about the environment's condition in order to preserve it for the new generation .
The new generation deserves to live in the same environment as we do .
To conclude , by using engineering design processes , engineers can design products that meet human needs .
Healthcare is a basic essential in every country .
It compromises of the people's living condition , availability of medical treatment and prevention of disease .
Emphasis on healthcare services differs from country to country .
For instance in Singapore and Japan , healthcare is emphasized on the elderly due to their aging populations but both execute their policies in different ways .
Hence , we will look at the principle of healthcare of the elderly in respective countries and the solution to the healthcare needs of an aging population .
The aging community has become an eminent issue in Singapore .
With a replacement rate of 1 .5 children to 2 adults and an estimation that by 2030 , 18 .4% of the population will be made up by the elderly , it is no wonder why Singapore government is promoting reproduction in young couples .
As the population ages , the main users of hospital services will be the  elderly .
Therefore , improvement in healthcare services for the elderly is essential .
Mobility of the elderly is a factor as well , as they have problems walking and moving around .
According to a survey in 2004 , Singapore is  one of the unfriendliest countries towards the wheel chair bounded .
Hence , there is a need for us to impove the healthcare services of our older citizens .
In Japan , nearly one quarter of the population is made up of the  elderly .
This is mainly due to the speed of industrialization in Japan .
Being one of the economic giants , Japan industrializes very fast at an early stage .
This causes an imbalance between work and family .
The fast paced society forces citizens to place work as priority over family resulting in a declining population .
In addition , in Japan , pay increases with the age of the workers .
Hence , companies tend to seek younger employees causing the older workers to lose their jobs and their health pension benefits .
Since the number of  elderly is increasing , it is important to cater to their needs in terms of healthcare .
The first concern is the living condition of the  elderly .
Home care facilities such as hospices , day care centres and nursing homes are built to look after the elderly especially when their family members are unable to do so .
For example , in Singapore , one room apartment with specially installed emergency buttons and lifts is catered to the elderly .
These apartments are created in such a way that they minimize the risk of the elderly injuring themselves .
The second concern is the mobility of the elderly .
Shopping malls and other common places should be equipped with more ramps and handicapped -friendly escalators .
Furthermore , on trains in Singapore , certain seats are allocated for the elderly .
Last but not least , health benefits for elderly should be protected .
They should be offered free medical check-ups and treatment if necessary .
In conclusion , healthcare services should not be neglected especially in countries which face an aging population .
More need to be done to improve our healthcare sector so as to achieve a healthier and wealthier society .
Over the past century , numerous research breakthroughs and creative innovations have allowed engineering design processes to meet various human needs .
According to Khandani (2005) , engineering designs are systems that are introduced by humans through combining different technologies and innovations to satisfy a particular human need creating ability for humans to complete a task faster or more efficiently .
To produce these systems , design processes are carried out over a period of time , ranging from months to years , and they are conducted based on a series of steps .
For example , water supply has been a main concern for the Singapore government as Singapore has no natural sources of water .
Consequently , after years of research and design  to alleviate this problem , the NEWater technology was invented .
This technology allows used water to be reusable after undergoing treatment through microfiltration and reverse osmosis .
This is an example of a particular human need which has been satisfied by an engineering design system .
Even though engineering design processes have been aiding humans in meeting many of their needs in the past , many others have yet to be satisfied; and the need to tackle pollution is one of them .
Pollution has been an ongoing problem for the past few decades or so and thus far , little has been done to alleviate this problem .
Global warming , as a result , is becoming more and more an issue of rising concern as little has been done to eliminate or substantially reduce pollution .
Temperature has been increasing due to the excessive release of greenhouse gases; and sea levels have been rising due to the melting of ice caps in the North and South poles .
Time is running out and to protect the sustainability of life on Earth , necessary actions have to be taken immediately , and if not , as soon as possible , and the help of engineering design processes should not be left out .
First and foremost , vehicles have been a main source of pollution and a large contributor to  emission of greenhouse gases .
In the past , vehicles used to emit harmful gases such as carbon monoxide .
Subsequently , engineering design processes have made possible the invention of catalytic converters which convert the harmful gases emitted by vehicles into non-harmful gases .
On the flip side , although the problem of the emission of harmful gases has been  , vehicles today are releasing carbon dioxide , which is a greenhouse gas , instead .
Consequently , a new engineering design process has to be carried out to rectify this problem .
After years of research , then comes the idea of inventing an environmentally-friendly car , also known as an ecocar .
For example , a group of Engineering and Design students from Singapore has invented its first environmentally-friendly car which does not emit any amount of carbon .
This is an example of a great breakthrough of an engineering design process which will be able to tackle the problem of pollution .
Another area of concern that is contributing much to the pollution of the environment is energy generation .
Power stations , also known as power plants , are common sources of energy in most countries and they make use of the combustion of fuels to produce energy in powering up the whole city .
Due to the combustion of fuels , pollution occurs; and taking into consideration that many countries have adopted the use of power stations , the effects of polluting the environment occur on a large scale .
Therefore , cleaner sources of energy generation have to be discovered and engineering design processes can do just that .
An example of a clean method of energy generation would be the invention of solar technology .
Solar technology makes use of heat and radiation from the Sun to produce useful forms of energy; and this is made possible by engineering design processes .
To conclude , pollution is an ongoing , serious problem in which swift actions need to be taken .
It is a human need to neutralize this situation because Earth's and human's sustainability is at stake .
With engineering design processes , the benefits of gaining control over pollution are tremendous .
However , engineering design processes take a certain period of time as factors such as safety and other side effects have to be put into consideration too .
Moreover , we humans cannot be totally dependent on engineering design systems only .
We have to be socially-responsible as every living person has a part to play in tackling pollution .
Throughout the years , there has always been a debate on whether technology shapes society , a technologically determinist perspective , or  society shapes technology , a socially determinist view .
One such technology that is closely related to this debate is the invention of the automobile .
Without this invention , we would probably still be riding the bicycle to work or school .
Looking back at history , we can see how this important technology has been shaped by societal factors as well as technological factors .
Due to the influence of these factors ,  gasoline-powered cars have won over  electric cars for years .
Firstly , societal factors like the expansion of cities favor  gasoline cars over electric cars .
As cities grow bigger , it becomes impractical to have an electric car for travelling .
For example ,  gasoline-powered cars can travel an average of about 300km on a full tank of petrol as compared to a maximum distance of 150km for a full charge on an electric battery .
In big cities like the United States , travelling to and fro from work can easily surpass 100km .
Also with the expansion of society , time becomes money .
No one is willing to spend 8 hours a day waiting for their car to be charged fully before they can make use of it .
Next , technological factors likecurrently available technology and limitation of resources have also helped shaped  automobiles .
With current technology , more hybrid cars are showing up on the market .
Hybrid cars involve either part gasoline and part electric or part gasoline and part compressed natural gas (CNG) .
This is made possible only with the advancement of technology as compared to the past .
For instance , the regenerative brake system has been invented whereby you charge your battery just by braking .
Car manufacturers like Chevrolet are cashing in on this possible new market , and coming up with new models like the Optra Magnum CNG in 2008 .
With a cleaner and efficient hybrid car , more people are opting for the switch .
The gasoline-powered car has finally seen a worthy competitor .
However , technological restraints like limited resources have been a set back for hybrid users .
Looking at Singapore for example , there are only 5 CNG refueling points around the country .
To get your vehicle refueled would be troublesome if the nearest CNG petrol station is far away .
This constraint makes consumers think twice before purchasing a hybrid vehicle .
Also , the fact that hybrid cars are a relatively new technology , car repair shops might not have the knowledge to repair hybrid cars yet , and any repairs must be sent back to the car manufacturer .
This makes it inconvenient if the shop is located far away from the consumer .
In short , these few factors have played an important role in shaping the automobiles that we know today .
Imagine if there are no technological restraints and that we could create a self replenishing battery .
The possibilities are endless , but it proves one point .
Technology and society co-exist and affect one another .
Even until now , we are shaping many other technological inventions .
Only the future can foretell the impact of these factors on technological advancement such as in the automobile industry .
Who knows , hybrid cars might actually manage to successfully dethrone  gasoline-powered  cars in the near future .
Electronics such as lights and cars have become essential to  human beings over the past years .
However , these electronics though wonderful ,  consume a huge amount of energy .
Given that the global price of fuel is on the rise , users of these electronics are incurring higher cost .
One current human need that should be given priority for engineering design is to have cos-saving electronics .
Firstly , the problems with lights is that , in order to save electricity , the user will have to manually turn off the lights upon leaving the area , which is rather impractical in places such as offices , toilets and classrooms which require the lights to be constantly turned on .
The idea of electricity conservation on usage of lights was to have the lights automatically turned off when the area is empty .
As a result , the idea sparked off the concept of integrating motion sensors to lights .
The challenge in having a motion sensor light to automatically turn on and off the lights with the presence of a human being was how to accurately identify the presence of a human being in the area monitored by the sensor .
To overcome the challenge , the motion sensors use infrared energy to detect human beings .
In addition , these sensors are also highly sensitive to human body temperature , therefore resulting in a highly accurate detection .
Today these motion sensor lights are used almost everywhere , in offices , toilets , classrooms and even homes .
Secondly , the recent price hikes in petrol fuel have caused human beings to pay a higher amount of money for their car petrol as compared to previously .
To overcome the price hikes , an alternative to petrol fuel is needed .
The outcome of intensive engineering design was to replace petrol fuel with (CNG) Compressed Natural Gas .
These natural gases are widely available on earth as compared to petrol fuel which is getting limited as  oil reserves get depleted .
In order for a car to be powered using CNG , there are certain modifications that needed to be done .
For example , new fuel storage was introduced , and took the name of Integrated Storage System .
Another example is the modification of the engine .
The natural gas from the storage cylinders flows into a fuel line when the engine is started .
The gas is then ignited by a spark plug , thus powering the car .
In Singapore , public transports such as taxisand buses have converted to CNG .
In addition , according to Channel NewsAsia , there is an increasing number of private cars owners converting their conventional petrol fuel-powered cars to CNG cars .
Engineering designs have improved the designs of lights and cars , which used to consume a huge amount of energy in the past .
To sum up , with the depletion of natural resources and high electricity and fuel cost , engineering designing should be given priority  cost saving electronics .
Engineering design is the process of creating a system or products to meet the desired needs of people .
Usually , engineers face difficulty in designing a product or coming out with ideas  demanded by the public .
An engineer needs to define the problem , gather pertinent information , generate and analyse multiple solutions and finally , test and implement  the solution  .
However , the two most disturbing problems that may hamper engineering design processes for innovations are the inability of engineers to generate multiple solutions to convince their superior to implement their products or ideas and the failure of constantly creating a product that is in demand .
Firstly , in the aspect of generating multiple solutions , engineers often face the problems of lack of funds and inability to convince their superior that their idea is feasible .
In most cases , their design will be rejected because the product or idea is not conventional .
Their idea or product is a totally new concept which people may find  hard to accept because of a traditional idea or product that may have been etched in their mind .
For example , in the Singapore National Service ,  military officers , using their portion of dominant influence , typically make most of the important decisions about innovation .
In addition ,  low ranking cadets usually fail to convince  high ranking officers that their innovative products or ideas may improve the military .
One example is the introduction of unmanned combat air vehicles by the engineers in the military .
This unmanned combat air vehicle might have been potent enough to replace the ubiquitous manned fighter in the near future .
However , due to the higher officer not having enough trust over the air vehicle being piloted by a human , this unmanned combat vehicle project did not succeed in being implemented .
Instances such as the above example will significantly affect the morale of the engineers .
Hence , it is imperative to address the issue of engineers unable to convince their superior to implement their products or ideas .
As engineers , if their ideas or products face constant rejection by their superior , they will stop coming up with new ideas or products as they see no purpose in coming up with new ideas or products and constantly opposing their superiors .
Thus ,  superiority in companies will significantly hamper engineers' morale and their design .
Secondly , the other problem that restricts engineering design is the lack of confidence to implement ideas or products that are in demand .
Although in the initial stage response to their products may be good , when it comes to implementing their ideas or products , the response may be different .
Engineers spend a lot of effort in developing these products , but the final products that they design may not be of popular demand .
Society always strives for useful and economic products .
Products that are not practical and expensive will face rejection .
For instance , in the 1960s , Singapore developed a phone that was able to see the other caller .
This type of phone faced rejection because it was expensive and users found it infringing on their privacy .
As a result ,  sales of these phones were low , affecting the morale of the engineer who designed it .
Facing multiple failures may cause engineers to be disheartened and put them on high alert as they will be more careful when they want to design a product .
They will tend to feel disappointed because they need to solicit a lot of funds , putting in their utmost efforts when developing the products , but only to find out that their products face rejection by the public .
This will seriously restrict their innovation because they may be afraid to face constant failure .
The "best" design solution is always hard to develop because it is one that most completely fulfils a client's requirement .
Therefore , engineers may just stop at gathering pertinent information , and not go into generating multiple solutions as they  worry that their products may not be in demand as expected , which again may hamper their design processes for innovations .
In conclusion , it is usually the lack of ability to convince their superiors and the constant rejection by the public that significantly hamper engineering design for innovations .
Traditional mindsets should be changed and let engineers have a chance to develop their ideas .
Furthermore , engineers should do their research and marketing of their products effectively , such that products that they develop will be of market value .
Scientific technology has been developing rapidly since the first industrial revolution .
Meanwhile , many new kinds of innovative inventions come out almost  every day , thus changing the way people live .
It is a remarkable fact  that  technical innovation is viewed differently by different groups of people .
A wonderful invention to a group of people may be disliked  others  .
In general , the justification of the utility of a specific technology or invention depends on the specific opinionsof different group of people .
Space technology is a good example to explain the existence of different views  .
Space technology is a kind of highly innovative , highly composite and also highly costly technology .
Its aim is to find out  unknown scientific questions and for military use .
The beginning of space technology was in America and Russia .
Then it quickly spread out  all over the world .
Nowadays European countries , China , Japan and India  all have advanced development in space technology .
Toward this new technique ,  two opposite opinions exist nowadays .
Governments  and scientists think it is worth to spend money and people working on thisbecause it will benefit the whole country .
However , many people think that it is a waste of resources which can be used to improve people's living conditions .
If we look a little deeper into the causes that lead to the opposite solution , we will find that the focus that specific groups of people pay attention to is , obviously , quite different from each other .
From the governments' and scientists' point-of-view , space technology is essential because it is the fundamental thing we need to do to protect our countries and fulfill future needs .
They pay much attention to keep technological developdevelopment moving and concentrate more on  huge issues , like military demand , and the future .
That is also the reason why every country tries its best to improve  space technology .
Former President of America Reagan even announced the star wars program , although it was given up at the end .
In conclusion , judgments of technical innovation or development always  differ because they are made by different groups of people .
All in all , the differences do really derive from  different thinking perspectives .
Because people tend to think about things associated with their own experience and life , different opinions emerge .
Why is  petroleum very important ?
Petroleum can be extracted and refined to produce fuels including petrol , paraffin , and diesel oil .
Without these extracted products from petroleum , cars cannot run , planes cannot fly , and ships cannot be launched  .
The world may not run any more .
WhatWhat is more , petroleum is a liquid mixture of hydrocarbons which is present in suitable rock strata and is not reproducible for now .
It is said that after 60 years , the world will run out of petroleum .
How are we going to solve this problem ?
There are two ways to solve this problem .
One way is to conserve and save  petroleum .
Engineers have come up with some solutions to saving  petroleum .
The greatest consumption of petroleum is in the transportation operation .
One of the engineer's solutions is to mix  alcohol and petrol together to provide  energy .
This solution is now being tested and implemented  .
In Wuhan , one of the biggest cities in China , all  taxies are operating using this mixed fuel .
Another solution , which is almost the same concept , is the Hybrid-Electric Vehicle .
This kind of vehicles uses both electric power and fuel and is different from the previous version .
It combines  electric power system and fuel system together .
When the vehicle starts , it consumes the electric power .
After the speed of the car reaches a certain range , it will switch to fuel power system .
When using fuel power to start the car , the fuel is not fully burned .
That is why we can smell strong petrol when the car starts .
The concept of power system is to let  fuel fully used in order to save it .
However , conservation alone cannot solve the problem .
The other way is to develop new energy resources to replace petroleum .
Hydrogen fuel cell , solar power and nuclear power are the three hottest topics that have interested engineers most .
Research  on fuel cell on vehicles was started in early 1960s and it has continuously  developed until now .
Most  car makers have come out with their own hydrogen fuel cell-powered vehicles .
But hydrogen fuel cell vehicles are still in the testing and implementation phase .
There are some prototypes running on the road .
But for the finalized product , the cost should be reduced and the efficiency of the cell should be increased .
Solar and nuclear power are the more advanced technology .
Solar power is in the experimental phase .
The key point in increasing the efficiency of solar power is how to isolate the sunshine .
If this challenge can be solved , the potential of solar power is prodigious .
For nuclear power ,  it is using the power generated by  nuclear fusion .
Nuclear fusion is the same way as the sun in generating its power .
Research on nuclear fusion has been going on for decades , but the progress is not very obvious .
In brief , the energy problem is one of our most serious problems  now .
So we need to work on it step by stepand  follow the right rules to arrive at the best solution to this urgent problem .
We live in an era of great change , an increasingly global society as a result of rapid growth in information and communication technologies .
However , the above only holds through for those who are not stricken with poverty .
The needs of poor  people , most of whom are based in developing countries , are endless .
The need for basic infrastructure ranks high on their priorities .
This is because basic infrastructure is the basis for any country to develop essential facilities like transport , housing and education to help the poor .
The engineering design process is an effective way through which the needs of these people could be met comprehensively .
According to Kandani (2005) , the very first step in any engineering design is to identify the need and to define the problem .
The word 'need' refers to a man's desire for a certain product or system .
This need is usually identified by the society and may vary from society to society .
Thus , needs which are considered a necessity to some might actually be a luxury to others .
For example , infrastructure is a real need for those living in the rural villages in Asia but not for the nomads in Africa , although both groups are affected by poverty .
The nomads would prefer to conserve the forests and wildlife so as to be able to carry on with their nomadic lifestyle .
This example clearly illustrates the importance of establishing the need accurately so that engineers would be able to work effectively towards solving the problem .
The second step of this engineering design process is to gather essential information .
In this step , engineers analyze the existing solutions and pick out the pros and cons .
Economic , environmental and safety factors are also analyzed .
Many developing countries have made big plans on establishing infrastructure in the rural areas in an attempt to bridge the gap in the standard of living between the urban towns and suburban villages .
However , these plans tend to get hit by delays after delays because of various reasons .
So it is vital for engineers to collect as much information as possible so as to not repeat the mistakes and go down the same slippery slope of their predecessors .
Once this is done , engineers can start to formulate multiple solutions .
This step urges engineers to temporarily throw the rulebook out of the window , open up their minds and explore many different ideas and possibilities .
Dr . Kandani suggests that a team with professionals from different fields be formed .
This team can work together and share their knowledge and expertise to come up with a few solutions .
The most logical step after coming up with a few solutions is to pick the best one .
This is actually the decision-making process , after studying the various solutions .
For instance , if a school is being built , based on the land available , few designs would have already been thought off .
Certain schools might be able to hold more students while not proving to be as stable as others that hold fewer students but are very much stronger .
So it is in this step that engineers make the decision of which design to adopt while weighing in all the factors to come up with a viable solution .
In conclusion , I would like to recommend the engineering design process because it is very complete in its steps to provide a solution to those in need .
The establishment of basic infrastructure in developing countries through engineering design will give the poor an avenue to successfully escape from the vicious cycle of poverty .
The world today is experiencing global warming which is caused by the burning of fossil fuels and deforestation .
The solution to this problem is the harnessing of an alternative form of energy called kinetic energy in wind .
An example of a product created for this purpose is the wind turbine and it is created using the three main steps in design process to address the problem which are problem definition , information gathering and testing and implementing of solutions .
The first step in the design process is  problem definition .
Following this procedure helps to generate more solutions to the problem addressed .
Tapping  kinetic energy in wind is a good solution as wind is abundant due to the frequent changes in the atmospheric pressure .
This step announces to  engineers that the Earth is in grave danger , thus giving them more motivation to think of a solution .
For example , by defining the problem as the fast decreasing quantity of fossil fuels ,  engineers gain insight into creating a product which can be used to tap kinetic energy in wind .
Referring to the earlier models of windmills like those built in Sistan , Iran , from the seventh century , which were used to grind rice grains , engineers used the same concept to create wind turbine which converts kinetic energy in wind into electrical energy .
The second step in the design process is the gathering of information .
The credibility of the problem needs to be addressed after it has been defined .
The important factor which determines the efficiency of the wind turbine is the general wind flow in the area where the wind turbine is built .
Since the wind turbine heavily depends on the wind to generate electricity , it is important to study the wind flow pattern before the wind turbine is built .
For this study , past weather forecasts and also the internet play vital roles in providing information needed to improve the efficiency of the wind turbine .
The overall gain in electrical energy needs to be calculated to decide whether the building of wind turbine is worth its value .
The last step in the design process is the testing and implementation of solutions .
The testing and implementation of solutions is closely related to the analysis of the design solution .
The main factor which contributes to the analysis is marketability .
For example , the Matilda built at Goland , Sweden produced a surprisingly high sixty-one gigawatts per hour of electricity in fifteen years which produced more energy than the other typical wind turbines .
However , the Matilda was demolished on June 6 , 2008 .
In conclusion , the main three steps in the design process help to create a guideline for the engineers to follow .
Problem definition requires knowledge of wind and thus making full use of it .
In terms of information gathering , the efficiency of the wind turbine is of paramount importance in determining whether it really solves the problem .
Lastly , the testing and implementation of solutions consists of marketability , ergonomics and safety which serve as a check on whether the product is deemed suitable to solve the problem .
Nowadays , engineering design products are everywhere .
Engineering systems play important roles in all  fields , for example , entertainment , healthcare as well as education .
Although they are essential for all  fields , engineering products and systems in healthcare and medical fields should be given the highest priority since health is the most important thing for all human beings .
Designing of medical products which can make all human beings  healthier  is obviously important .
Moreover , some medical products like "Fall Detection System" and "Posture monitoring system" can even help people save life in some ways .
On the other hand , people normally spend much more time for entertainment than healthcare .
As a result , there are mass products for entertainment because of high demand .
Instead , healthcare products should be widely available and used .
There are many healthcare products which are available in research organizations but not widely available in the current market .
For example , "Fall Detection System"  can detect the fall of persons , especially elder people , and can send instant messages via sms to relatives so that they can get immediate help in critical situations .
As mentioned in the "Global action on aging" website  , the number of senior citizens is rising  taking care of them imperative .
It is also mentioned that since the number of elderly people is increasing , the burden of caring is also increasing for young people .
Hence , engineering should consider this situation  and come out with solutions which will  help the elderly and make youth work without worry .
Although there are R&Ds for healthcare products for monitoring and taking care of the elderly , these devices are not widely used in the market .
So , in order to address this situation , engineers should think about  ways that can make the design process meet the needs of the market  .
In order to make engineering design products meet  needs , first of all , a clear and unambiguous definition of the problem should be defined .
Problems should be widely and clearly defined by engineers , the elderly as well as adults so that more innovative products and ideas come out .
Moreover , it is also necessary to make sure that there is enough information to generate clear problem definitions that addresses the real need .
Once alternative solutions come out , engineers need to analyze and decide on the best suited solution to implement  .Governments and organizations are also responsible in supporting the R&D process in order to gather information needed , generate multiple solutions , analyze solutions and test as well as implement solutions which are the necessary steps for the design process .
In conclusion , engineers should try to identify ideal situation in the market for their products , for example , the "Fall Detection System" which can take care of the elderly and the "Posture monitoring system" which can help people of all ages to maintain best posture with the help of government and organizations as well as consumers .
And the goal can also be achieved by developing  suitable design engineering process for healthcare systems and products .
A human need is a necessity that humans need in order to survive .
One main necessity is food .
According to the World Food Program's 2008 report , 25000 people are dying every day due to famine and related issues .
A large portion of the deaths comes from  Third World Countries like Africa and India .
By using the Engineering Design Process introduced by Seyyed Khandani , a professor at Diablo Valley College , we can reduce  famine .
Some factors that contribute to famine famine include political , technological and environmental issues .
The World Food Program (WFP) has been providing food and aid to areas affected by famine  .
By using the engineering design process , the first step is to define the problem .
The definition of the problem is straightforward in the beginning: the people are starving , so they must be provided food .
However , for Malawi , the WFP and the World Bank figured out a solution  , they found out that it is better to donate cash to them; based on their  research and found out that the country has food resources , but the poor cannot afford them .
In the 1990s , the WFP introduced  donation of cash and vouchers  , and one of the pioneer countries that received this  is Malawi .
Thus , providing cash did not only help to solve the famine , it also improved the financial situation of the farmers .
Furthermore , the WFP saved time and cost  collecting  food and delivering it to the affected areas .
In 1970s , the WFP provided food to India to temporarily solve  famine .
During this period , they analyzed the situation to generate other solutions to permanently solve the famine .
According to the design process , the second step is to gather related information , then generate possible solutions .
The first possible solution was to provide genetically modified seeds and fertilizers to  farmers , so that they would obtain higher yield .
Before this solution was implemented , they did a further study , and realized that the solution would not work as the farmers were using traditional farming methods which are not yield efficient .
Hence , the WFP provided machines and farming education to the farmers in the 1980s .
These aids  improved the famine situation as it dropped by about 20% in a WFP 1990s report; On the other hand , these solutions  not applicable to all  lands in India as different areas have different types of lands .
For the dry lands , the WFP had to do further researchresearch on water irrigation methods .
One of the solutions was to construct a drainage system from the Indira Ghandi canal to irrigate the dry lands in the region .
Some events like drought , flood and earthquakes cause famine .
These types of events are unavoidable .
Nevertheless , events like deforestation and overgrazing have also affected fertile lands and caused yields to go down .
Governments spend millions and billions of dollars on entertainment and military expenditure yearly , but ththis large amount of money could have been put to good use in helping their own people .
India has increased  military spending by 50% in 2008 , bringing the amount to 40 billion dollars , although 35% of its people are still affected by famine .
The famine caused by these situations is preventable .
The large amount of money could be invested in the agriculture sector , like using  technology to plant seeds that will grow on dry land which will greatly solve the famine .
In conclusion , the WFP can do more research and analysis , like creating genetic modified seeds that can survive in dry or wet land , or an indoor farming center that will shelter the crops from natural disasters , to resolve the famine issue .
In addition ,  governments can try to allocate more budget to  agriculture and research centers than to the entertainment sector , which is not right when people in their own country are suffering  .
The last step in the design process is to test and implement the solution .
Taking a small step forward will reduce  famine .
Poverty is unavoidable , but famine is preventable .
Thus , we should do more to help the people  are suffering from famine .
Another value of radio was its ability to perform mass communication .
As the average cost of production declined steadily , the radio set was mass produced leading to the birth of radio broadcasting .
Broadcasting allows single directional flow of communication where important information can be disseminated to the mass quickly and effectively .
Warnings and announcements regarding weather or disaster evacuation  made via broadcasting will greatly help in minimising the casualty rate in a disaster as the masses can receive vital and timely information and instruction even when the cable lines are damaged .
The other factors that have influenced the development of radio will be military demands .
The need for communication between joined military operations across forces and formations lead to the development of powerful signal set .
To prevent enemies from tapping on their communications or disrupting their signals , technology such as "anti-jamming" was developed by the military .
Besides improving on communication , military demands had also led to the invention of radar which uses radio wave in detecting distant objects and getting information such as their location and movement .
The technology of radar was soon transferred to civil usage such as by the commercial planes and ships due to its usefulness in navigation .
Another development of radio by military is guided weapon which arises from the need to raise accuracy of weapon in decreasing the chances of damaging and injuring civilian or allied forces .
In conclusion , radio is an important technology that is still being developed and improved continuously .
From its communication values to other discovered usages , economic  and military factors have played a positive role in its overall development .
The invention and development of radio have bettered the society in numerous ways .
A need refers to what is required in order to do something or achieve some state of being .
'Human needs' , for example , have been taken to describe requirements which must be satisfied if harm to an agent is to be avoided .
Overpopulation is one of the current human needs or challenges that should be given priority .
Size or density of the population affects  overpopulation .
In the world where  human populations are growing , we should focus on solving the problem of insufficient land to maintain  life on earth .
Houses today are stronger , and some of them can withstand natural disaster .
For example in Japan , a country where earthquakes happen often , their engineers try to solve the problem of constructing buildings that can withstand earthquakes .
By using the Khandani Principle ,  engineers gather pertinent information about earthquakes and manage to implement a solution after several tests have been conducted , called Seismic retrofitting method , where Seismic retrofitting is the changing of an existing building to a structure that is more resistant to ground motion and soil failure due to earthquakes or seismic activity .
Engineers try to solve overpopulation by combining many houses into one building , thus building multi-unit housing , or also known as attached dwellings , has been initiated .
Apartments , barracks , tenements and terrace houses are good examples of multi-unit housing .
Engineers applied the Khandani principle that time; they defined the problem and gathered enough information to make sure the buildings would not collapse .
For example , in Singapore , where  land is very small , engineers built a lot of condominiums and apartments to solve the problem of insufficient houses and managed to save some of the land for other purposes .
However , in the future , the population will further increase , and  building more multi-unit housing cannot solve the problem effectively .
In my opinion , engineeengineers should focus on upgrading the buildings .
They should build multiple level basements for multi-unit housing and building since we do not really use a lot of the underground space .
Building multiple level basements may cause some other potential problems and engineers should try to solve these .
Engineers have to analyze every possible problem that may occur like water seepage , internal condensation , underground virus and bad acoustics when in building more underground levels .
That is why building more underground level , we need to use the Khandani principle (2005)that requires engineers to gather a lot of pertinent information from any sources available before implementing it .
In addition , engineers can also improve the stability of buildings so that more levels can be built above them .
The stability  depends on the wideness of the base level , the material of the structure and the method of building the structure .
Engineers can increase the width of the base of the structure to support an extra level of building built on it .
Engineers can improve the structures by using stronger material like diamonds , gold ,  etc .
and finding more suitable methods for building a structure .
Nobody can create a perfect solution with just one try .
Engineers need to test the solution before they start to use it .
Hidden problems can be found out by testing them under real conditions (Khandani , 2005) .
In conclusion , with Khandani's the such process , engineers can generate a perfect solution to solve overpopulation .
If we compare the house 10000 BC to the modern house today , engineering design process is apparent .
If in the world we do not have engineering design process , engineers may generate solutions that are ineffective or  may cause harm to other life forms .
There are many human needs in the world and the engineering design process can help to meet those needs in a better way .
The issue of the depletion of earth's natural resources has been raised repeatedly throughout recent times .
The earth's natural resources are not well distributed across the globe , and hence some countries faces the problem of the lack of certain natural resources .
Singapore , due to its small land size area , also face the problem of the lack of natural resources .
In particular , the issue of the lack of water has been the headlines for many times .
In order for Singapore to be self-reliant on water , there is a need for Singapore to create portable water resources for its people .
Singapore had tried a number of ways in its bid to shift towards self-reliance on water .
This includes desalination and damping up of rivers to form water catchment areas .
However , these methods are still short of providing for the growing need of water by its people .
In recent years , the nation's engineers have come up with a purification process which can purify waste water into portable water for use .
The product  is called New water .
New water is treated waste water that has undergone stringent purification processes using advanced dual membrane and ultraviolet technology .
The product can be bottled for consumption , or be mixed with reservoir water and will then go through the usual water treatment to produce drinkable water .
Currently , New water is supplying Singapore with 15% of its water demands .
There are plans to scale up the project to contribute 30% of the water supply by 2010 .
The quality of the product is even assured by many international experts .
This is indeed a product of a system which is engineered to meet the human need for natural resources .
The design process of the system has undergone 5 design process stages as illustrated by Khandani in his Engineering Design process paper .
Firstly , the team of engineers working on the New water project identified the problem which is the lack of water resources for Singapore .
Singapore has been buying water from Malaysia , its neighbouring country , in order to supplement its own water supply .
However , the water agreements with Malaysia are expiring soon in 2011 & 2061 .
The agreements have been providing for 40% of the country needs .
Therefore , the engineers identified the need for Singapore to shift towards self-sustainability in terms of water resources .
Secondly , they gathered pertinent information on the technologies and usage of water that is purified from waste water .
However , the first masterplan was shelved because of the great cost and unreliability of the process .
The cost incurred will offset the benefit that it may bring .
Hence , the team decided to wait for further technological advancement before building its first plant .
They eventually built its first plant after the technology of dual membrane purification  matured and the production cost came down .
Thirdly , prior to the implementation of the New Water technology , there were also multiple solutions to the problem of lack of water resources in Singapore .
Solutions included desalination of sea water and damping up more rivers to increase the water catchment area .
The desalination of seawater would require large amount of fossil fuel to run which is another natural resource that Singapore does not have .
Furthermore , the desalination plants would also leave a larger carbon footprint .
Despite these , a desalination plant was still built because of the growing demand .
The damping up of rivers to form water catchment areas was in fact being implemented .
Marina barrage , the newest kid on the block , was formed by damping the marina channel to form a large water catchment area capable of meeting 10% of Singapore's need .
However , as Singapore has limited land , we could not go on forever creating water catchment areas from our land .
Therefore , New Water was decided as a solution needed to meet the need for water of the nation .
Finally , in May 2000 , the first New Water plant was completed .
Currently there are 4 New Water plant in Singapore with a fifth on its way .
Together , they will be able to meet 30% of Singapore's need .
Bottled New Water was also given out during National events , promoting its use  in our daily life .
In conclusion , New Water has been an engineering design which was designed to meet the human need for water  particularly in Singapore .
Throughout  human history , there are a lot of successful products which have great effect on human life ,  like television , the cell and so on .
It is not only their high level technology that makes them so successful , but also the fact that they meet the needs of the people .
The electric car , which was first invented by General Motors Company (GM) , is such an interesting case .
The invention of electric cars is both a success and failure .
We can analyse it in both social and technological aspects .
The electric car is the product of social reasons .
As we know , an ordinary car's fuel is gas which has been used since the first car was been produced .
While there exists a problem that the burning of gas gives off poisonous gases and a large amount of carbon dioxide which causes serious air pollution .
Furthermore , as it is mineral resource , the supply of gas is becoming less and less which directly leads to the rise of the price .
Because of the reasons stated above , people want to invent a kind of vehicle which can use cleaner and cheaper energy instead of gas .
That is why the electric cars came into being .
Another direct  social reason is that in the early 1990s , the California and Arizona state governments had raised a policy which said at least 10 percent of the cars produced in the automobile companies should be environmental friendly , in other words , nonpolluting .
This promoted the research into electric cars .
In the mean time , GM also wanted to use this opportunity to restore their position in the automobile world .
These are the social reasons that did favor to electric car .
While , there are also some negative social sides .
Thanks to nearly a hundred years developing , the foundation of the gas industry was quite strong .
There were a lot of big gas companies tried a lot of methods to promote their products in order to push electric cars out of the market .
For example a gas company even asked for the President of America , Bush , to appear in their advertisement .
So you can imagine the difficult situation electric car's companies met at that time .
The technological aspect is also very important .
At that time , the electric car was mainly made of aluminum which gave the car lighter weight and the shape was aerodynamically styled which could reduce the air resistance .
Both of the two features provided the electric car faster speed .
As it was powered by electricity , there was less noise .
Driving such a car could be quite an enjoyable experience .
While , technology was not fully developed at that time and the battery could only support the electric car to run at most 100 miles .
Furthermore , most of the gas stations did not offer the service to charge the electric car , so it is very inconvenient for people to travel long distance .
So , the electric cars couldn't be widely used .
While recently the companies of electric cars have realized the importance of social and technological factors and they start to fight back .
In social aspect , the environment situation becomes more serious than twenty years ago .
The crude oil production rate reduces .
The price of gas goes higher and higher .
Again people become interested in electric cars and the companies also take these advantages to promote their products .
They also invited some superstars , like Tom Hanks , to help advertise the car .
In technological aspect , new kind of battery has be developed .
The travelling range has been expanded to 500 miles , nearly five times farther than before .
Many functions , like GPS and ABS , are also applied to the electric car .
The performance of electric car can be as better as normal car .
Through the case of electric cars , we can see that whether a product can be successful or not is decided by both the social and technological factors .
The change of these conditions directly influences the position of the product in the market .
So when engineer produce a new product , taking these two aspects of factors into consideration is important .
With the development of the technology , people have more comfortable and beautiful clothes to wear , more enjoyable entertainment to participate , more delicious food to eat and more convenient transportation tools to use .
However , one of the most important factors seems to be forgotten by human beings: the place we live - the earth .

As an engineer , we must also take this responsibility to protect our Earth Mother .

As our society progresses human beings get stuck in a dilemma of energy .
On one hand , the energy resources we use now , which are mainly fossil fuels , will be exhausted soon if we continue to consume at the current rate while the use of fossil fuels triggers  a series of environmental problems .
On the other hand , the development of society calls for larger and larger amounts of energy , which makes us in desperate need of energy .
In order to develop our society without exhausting all the fossil fuels or sacrificing our environment , we have to find new energy resources to take the place of traditional fossil fuels .
In this case , solar energy stands out as our first choice .
Engineering design plays a significant role in the use of solar energy , especially in  solar heating .
In the first stage , engineering design mainly contributes by clearly defining the problem and gathering pertinent information .

However , the efficiency of solar energy was very slow .
The question of how to make an efficient and effective solar heating system is addressed by engineers .
In order to find the solution , engineers spend large amount of time to collect the relevant information , from which they can generate iinspiration , while drawing lessons from the previous work .
Though this preliminary stage appears simple , actually it not only takes a lot of time and calls for patience , but also is the crucial fundamental stage of  the solution .
That is not the end of engineering design .
What engineers will do next is  test the system and make possible improvements .
Although solar energy has certain advantages compared to other kinds of energy , it has an inevitable disadvantage .
The solar energy is limited by various natural conditions , such as day and night , seasons , and places .
It is not stable enough , so  people may not be able to use solar energy to heat water whenever they need .
To improve the solar heating system , engineers have added accessorial energy equipment to it such as an  heater .
This improvement makes it possible for people to get hot water fast and conveniently even when there is not enough sunlight .

The problems brought by the unbalanced energy source distribution are solved .
Although making use of nuclear power , water power and solar power seems feasible , there are some reasons that make solar power  the most appropriate .

What a tragedy it was !
We cannot guarantee there will be no such kind of explosion any longer if we rely on nuclear power .

we already have built some solar powerhouses but we have never heard anything unfortunate happen .
Last but most importantly , solar power seems endless .
Only if the sun disappears will the soalr power be used up .
However , as we know , the life of the sun is more than billions of years .
Therefore , for the three advantages above , we can find it really meaningful to develop the solar power technology
