From a luxurious entertaining appliance in the early stage of development , television has become an indispensable and ubiquitous thing within every household nowadays .
With millions of viewers around the world , it is used for various purposes not only by broadcasters and institutions but also businesses .
Television had to go through a very long way of development with reciprocal influences on society .
Advertising has become the most effective way of promoting sales of products .
The use of them is the most influential factor contributing to the development of television .
The cost of a television commercial depends upon the popularity of the channel and the time when it is broadcast .
These costs are the financial backing of broadcasters' programming .
Another way is to weave advertisements into shows .
This practice has begun in film .
For instance , a character may be driving a particular type of automobile , wearing a certain kind of clothes , or eating at a particular restaurant chain .
A brand or trademark is sometimes used .
I strongly believe that the benefits television brings to our society are undeniable .
Meyrowitz , a professor of communications at the department of Communication at the University of New Hampshire in Durham , deduced that television is the "secret-exposing machine" , and it opens up the "biggest secret of all , 'the secret of secrecy'" to children .
It is even claimed that television has replaced printing to become the main way to access information .
Researchers suggest that children who were exposed to educational programs , positive models preferred reading books , were more artistic and got higher grades .
Nowadays virtually all the broadcasters have at least an educational program of  their own .
That's because of the high demand from parents , institutions and educationists .
However , television also has more negative influences on our society than  positive ones .
A lot of findings showed that people tend to imitate the language and behavior which are inappropriate in society .
Children addicted to television are associated with obesity , passiveness , health problems and sometimes bad grades .
Inappropriate contents are deemed as another type of danger to the youth .
Violence , sex , drugs abuse , nonsense comics , etc .
cause a lot of controversies over the right age of watching them; and the youth are subject to parental television control , especially when it influences their self-esteem and body image .
With concerned parents , a child can greatly benefit from television programsprograms , whereas the child may encounter inappropriate contents if the parents let him or her freely use television .
Adults who spend too much time on TV viewing seem to be  dissatisfied people because they try to look for happiness in those programs after a hard struggling day .
However it is usually short lived happiness .
In addition to this , broadcasters often have some shows and programs addressing women in the new century .
Television played a vital role in the feminist movement .
It is disputable whether television has been changing the norms of society .
In conclusion , television has obviously contributed a lot to determine and shape our society , owing to the strong links between its development history and the human's  .
That is the reason why we always have to improve it , to nurture it .
We have to balance the pros and cons as well as the relationship of television to our present and future generations .
In the 21st century when people around the world get more opportunities to interact with each other , the ability to speak and understand other languages has become more and more important .
Most people choose to hire a translator .
However ,  well-trained ones are hard to find and they are not always available at times when you need them immediately .
Moreover , some people feel that their privacy is not safeguarded with a translator involved .
Thus , we have initiated this product called "N-in-1 Auto- translator" which can help solve all those problems mentioned above .
In the following paragraphs , the design process of our product will be illustrated to show how we fulfill people's need to communicate with others speaking different languages .
Having talked about the modifications , we have made efforts to minimize the cost , change the charging method and improve the portability .
As a brand new product which people do not have much faith in , it has been made reasonably affordable .
As batteries are not environmental friendly , we have made use of the DC chargers instead .
This is very convenient for the customers and they do not have to change batteries all the time as the lifetime of the chargeable battery is purposely made longer .
In addition , we have made the device more portable by minimizing the size and weight .
For example , our device has many components consisting of a scanner ,  speaker ,  printer and  recorder .
This allows our product to be multi-functional in contrast with an electronic dictionary which has many limitations .
Customers do not have to bring them all .
Instead , they can just selectively plug-in any component they need in order to make it much more portable .
From this example , we can see that we engineers always think from the customer's  point of view and try our best to fulfill their needs .
Moreover , we should also take care of the interests of small groups of people .
Our target customers are businessman , travelers , international school teachers and students and other people who have needs to understand other languages .
However , after reviewing all the feedback feedback on our official website , we found that the blind also need it .
After numerous research , we found that they recognize things by touching , smelling and hearing .
Thus we made modifications on our device such as the Braille-mini- printer .
This mini-printer can print in Braille so that they can understand by touching the paper after they scan the documents in other languages .
We can see that just a little change can benefit a large number of people .
To sum-up all the points mentioned above , we would conclude that engineering design processes can meet people's needs by qualified products and services , continuous modifications and the attitude to think for customers .
There is an old saying which goes "The customerr is  god ."
We totally agree with it .
We engineers must always keep ourselves upgraded and think for the customers all the time so that we can make upgrades and modifications to meet their needs .
While one is looking for A , he may discover B accidentally along the way , and this process is called the serendipitous discovery .
It is very different from the normal technologies we have , which  resulted from developments aiming to solve specific questions .
They are also different from each other in terms of level of success and how well they  solve a problem .
Nonetheless , despite so many differences , they are also similar in  that they are both important and can only be discovered by prepared minds .
One obvious difference is how each technology is discovered .
normal technology is found and developed by following certain procedures .
For example , a problem or need is always first identified , and then people start to brainstorm and think of solutions to the problem .
They always have a clear purpose or goal in mind which leads them in a certain direction to resolve the puzzle .
However , for technologies found through serendipitous discovery , they show complete randomness .
They are absolutely unexpected .
While one is solving some physics question , he may derive a solution for a biological problem in an approach which no one has thought of before .
There is nothing like a plan or preparation for this .
Hence , the two technologies differ from each other greatly in the ways  they are discovered .
Another difference between them may be the desirability .
Most of the time , serendipitously discovered technologies gain more recognition and greater success in terms of economic or scientific aspects , compared to the average normally developed technologies .
This is just like what Lawren Block said , the thing one found while looking for something else , usually suited his needs more .
The reason behind this is that serendipitous discoveries cater to solve the problems in more ingenious ways , as they may be the result of some unknown happenings , and they are produced by following some rules of  nature we have yet to gain an understanding of  , which are mysterious but also powerful .
A simple example would be the success of Dichloro- diphenyl-trichloroethane(DDT) , compared to other insecticides .
Nonetheless , apart from the differences , there are also similarities between these two kinds of technologies .
One major similarity they share is that both can only be discovered by prepared personnel .
As  Louis Pasteur  said , in the arena of observation , opportunities favor only the prepared minds .
This is indeed very true .
When people see some new products or discoveries , especially those close to our daily lives , sometimes they cannot help but ask themselves why , when they  experienced some similar things , they failed to turn them into innovations or products .
In our daily lives , it is true that we may experience this or that kind of things , but it is only those careful ones , prepared ones , those who always pay more attention to tiny things happening around them and treat these things seriously , come up with ingenious discoveries .
One needs to be prepared to identify a potential serendipitous discovery , as well as to develop a normal technology , so that one does not miss out any important details and gains success in the end .
In conclusion , these two main problems basically hamper the research and development areas of engineering design process , Singapore engineers can only at the moment upgrade or modifies existing innovations .
Thus they are the reasons why local Singaporean engineers have failed to come out with a stunning innovation yet .
A serendipity find is defined as accidently and unexpectedly discovering something fortunate .
One technology that was discovered by serendipity is the sound-powered telephone .
Unlike  a serendipity invention , a product or system that is created or developed , not coming from accidents , but through a series of engineering design processes is a research invention , and a technology developed via research is the mobile phone .
For these two technologies , there are several similarities and differences in the aspects of their usages , the power supplies they need , the communication efficiencies and health concerns .
Firstly , compare the usages for both the sound-powered telephone and the mobile phone .They are similar in  that both are used for communication .
However , the ways they are  used are different .
The sound-powered telephone is now widely used in naval vessels , and also in emergency communication systems for high-rise buildings , airports and ski lifts etc , whereas a mobile phone is designed for calling contacts .
Unlike  a sound-powered telephone , extra functions are included in a mobile phone , such as games , music and a camera for use .
Secondly , the sound-powered telephone differs from the mobile phone in power supplies  needed The speaker's voice , through its microphone unit , supplies necessary power for operating the sound-powered telephone .
Batteries or power connections are not required .The circuit is always live , thus a user simply begins speaking rather than dialing another station .
On the contrary , the mobile phone cannot operate without the use of an external power .
Normally a battery must be included and charged , so that the mobile phone can be switched on .
Lastly , for engineers , designing a safe product is a big concern .
The mobile phone emits electromagnetic radiation , which may harm one's health if used  for long period of time .
However , the sound-powered telephone does not pose any health risks to human beings due to its relatively simpler circuits compared to the mobile phone .
For the past few centuries , engineers and scientists have been working together , resulting in numerous great discoveries and inventions benefiting mankind in various aspects .
However , as science and technology evolved , they  also brought  numerous problems .
In this essay , I will be focusing on the environmental issues that were brought about by the improvement of science and technology and how engineering design processes can meet the need
From the late 19th to early 20th century , there was an outburst of great discoveries and inventions , coupled with worldwide expansion of industrialisation , creating many machines to aid human needs , and wants .
The sudden out-break of these events  caused several negative impacts on Earth .
One of the most prominent examples is global warming , a result of the existence of greenhouse gases .
Global warming causes an increase in the average temperature of Earth , which results in major problems such as melting ice caps at both poles , rising sea levels , heat waves and depleting ozone layer .
During the golden period of invention of machinery and industrialisation , machines running primarily on fossil fuels emitted large quantity of greenhouse gases during incomplete combustion of fuels .
These harmful gases have resulted in the vast pollution of the globe .
And , the situation continues to worsen .
It was not until the late 20th century that the environmentalists discovered that the greenhouse gases were harmful and had resulted in adverse conditions on Earth and started countering the pollution .
The Kyoto Protocol , a treaty signed among the countries to lower the emission of greenhouse gases to the environment which started in the 1990's , was quite a success .
However , even though there was a decrease in the percentage of the greenhouse gases emitted worldwide , the greenhouse gases still exist in our atmosphere , depleting our ozone layer .
Engineers , on the other hand , invented a product called the catalytic converter that helps to convert the harmful gases to gases that are less harmful to our environment before releasing them out to the environment .
This was a better solution to the problem .
Currently , as engineers , we should work on an advanced model of the catalytic converter , with a higher efficiency and better compatibility with different models of engines which may emit harmful gases .
Even though the process might be time-consuming and expensive , the improved version of the converter will be very useful to us .
Alternatively , we can look into the possible problems that might arise before the release of the product .
During the brainstorming stage , engineers should look at the product from various angles; the possibilities of doing harm to the environment while creating and testing the productproduct; the ways to dispose of any toxic or radioactive wastes , and the possibility of exploitation 
In conclusion , engineering design processes can meet the need of solving global warming by the improvement of catalytic converters and execution of cautious planning before any other procedures .
Prevention is always better than cure .
Safety is a primary need for all inventions even to this date .
However , safety has been overlooked or neglected on many occasions and this has  harm to its users .
One example would be the injuries caused by can openers .
In order to overcome such injuries and keep users out of harm's way , we need a logical design process to design a can opener of high safety standards .
According to Khandani (2005) 'Engineering design process' is a sequence of steps to design a product in a systematic order .
The five main steps are to define the problem , gather information , generate multiple solutions and analyze and select a solution and finally it .
To help achieve the objective of designing a safe can opener , engineering design process can be used to analyse the problems of existing can openers , and discover areas of improvement .
Existing can openers include lever type can opener , rotating wheel can opener and butterfly opener .
After analysing alternative solutions , the most suitable product has to be chosen .
Design process uses the decision process to select the best solution .
Firstly , the desirable attributes such as safety , function ability , marketability and ergonomics are ranked in order of importance .
Followed by this , a value factor is assigned to each attribute .
For instance , in this case , the success of safety is twice as important as the success of market analysis , a value factor of 20 will be given to safety and 10 to market analysis .
Value factors are assigned on a of 0 to 100 relative to the importance of other criteria for success .
Next , a rating factor is assigned to each new solution .
This will indicate how well the proposed product satisfies the particular criteria .
For example , if a product satisfies the criteria of safety to the maximum it will be given a rating factor of ten and if it satisfies the criteria of marketing by only half , it is given a rating of 5 .
Substantial knowledge of the product and its users will allow engineers to make an accurate evaluation which involves rating safety factors and value factors .
The value factors are multiplied to the rating factors and summed up for each product .
The proposed solution with the highest score will be chosen as the best design .
The final stage in design process is to implement the solution .
This would include prototyping , concurrent engineering , documenting and applying for patents .
These procedures would have already been done by existing products .
The new product for opening cans will have these four processes before it is introduced to the market .
One such product currently in the market which is safe for opening cans , handy , environmentally friendly and ergonomically stable is the one touch can opener .
It leaves the lid of opened cans without any sharp edges .
It is battery operated and uses a magnet to attach on to the lid  while cutting the edges away using an ultra fine blade .
Unfortunately , it is not very affordable and hence not marketable enough .
Future inventions would have to give more importance to the marketing aspect of it .
It can be seen that the design process is tedious , time consuming and sometimes even never ending .
No effort will be futile if executed in the right direction .
Design process suggests a safe path for engineers to take to achieve success .
The never ending need for safety to humans is an obligation for engineers of tomorrow to fulfill .
Increased confidence in consumers is seen whenever safety is enhanced for products .
In the case of can openers , making opening of cans hazard free will be able to draw a large consumer audience .
Constantly placing an emphasis on safety will serve as a reminder for all other manufacturers to meet and will in turn benefit mankind as whole .
The first stage of designing a product would be to define the problem using three key points .
They are to identify and establish a need , develop a problem statement and establish criteria for success .
The first two points have already been looked into by previous manufacturers .
However , the criteria of success has to be relooked at for a safer product .
A new can opener has to be safe , light , environmentally friendly and cheap .
After defining the problem , the data relevant to the need , safety in this case , has to be gathered .
statistical research to find out how many are affected , on which part of the user the injuries occur , when do injuries normally occur and who are the affected has to be done to get a better idea of the situation .
Besides that , material research has to be done to understand to what extent can the material harm the user and what alternative materials are .
For example ,  the lever type can opener is made of cast iron , which makes it bulky for users who end up injuring themselves in an effort to use it .
In addition , interviews on affected users can be done to understand how the injuries occur .
Manufacturers should also be interviewed to explain their reasons for overlooking the safety aspect if they had done it knowingly .
Once all the information has been collated , the third stage of design process would be to generate multiple solutions .
Multiple solutions can be from the users as well as manufacturers .
In design process , existing ideas are torn apart to find the fault in them .
For instance , in the lever type , its unprotected knife-like sickle is too dangerous for domestic use .
As for the rotating wheel , the necessity to pierce the can first is a nuisance for users and the butterfly opener produces sharp edges on the lid .
Thereafter , new ideas , tools and methods are combined to propose a new solution .
Such synthesis will seek to improve the weakness of previous solutions .
After  brainstorming and gathering ideas , the fourth and most crucial step of design process would be to analyse and select a solution .
The evaluation of proposed designs would be an overlap of the suggestion given by users and manufacturers and the information gathered .
Four main analyses are used for  designing  a safer product .
They are functional analysis , ergonomics , safety analysis and market analysis .
Being safe is the primary need of the product .
However , the functionality will determine the ultimate success of the product .
The three existing products have satisfactory function ability .
The first electric can opener was able to remove lids from more than twenty cans per minute without any risk of injury but was not put into practice because it was not handy .
Klassen Enterprises of Centreville introduced a wall-mounted electric model which was safe .
Unfortunately , this complex design was unpopular among users .
In functional analysis , the practicality of the product is put to test .
Next would be the ergonomic analysis of the product .
A safety device has to be able to fit the hands of the people utilising it to provide comfort and confidence in handling it .
Design process looks at the geometric properties of the human body to determine the dimensions of the safety product .
A good design will be able to fit ninety percent of its users .
Currently the lever type is mainly suitable for adults due to its large handle and considerably high mass .
As for the wheel type , the pliers-type handle allows a firm grip of the can edge and suits most users .
The butterfly opener is easy to grip but its metal frame makes it uncomfortable for the user .
The third analysis , safety analysis , would determine which product has a leading edge over the other products .
The human need of safety is still not addressed in many can openers .
The lever type opener has a sharp edge which exposes the user to potential hazard and the other two openers leave sharp edges on the lids of cans which are threat to safety .
The new product has be devoid of sharp parts as well as be able to not leave any sharp edges on the lid .
In design process , engineers have to keep records of calculations and methods used and foresee other ways people could use the product .
As a result , safety considerations must be included in the manual of the new product .
Description of inherent dangers should also be displayed on warning labels .
To make profits , market analysis has to be done .
Just like the existing openers , future products have to be evaluated against criteria such as sales features , cost of manufacturing and advertising .
Failure to do this will results in unpopular products like the wall-mounted electric model mentioned earlier .
When you go shopping , do you usually see the same kind of products which almost have the same functions or even same appearances ?
According to the research done by U .S . Customs and Border Protection , in 2004 the total amount of illegally copied products is 1 .39 million and 63% of products come from China .
In China now , a huge amount of products do not contain any innovative elements and the manufacturing companies just copy the existing patterns .
As these companies manufacture products which  copy the basic design from others , the product design process is no longer present for innovations .
There must be some reason .
Obviously , copying ideas and reducing manufacturing cost should hamper the innovative design process .
Secondly , reducing manufacturing cost hampers the innovative design process as well .
In order to reduce input and gain more benefits , some companies pay very little attention to design process because that design process always costs lots of money .
Therefore , they have to simplify their products or just copy them from others .
Even though there is an innovation idea , designers will not consider it .
As a result , design process just follows the previous pattern and no innovation is created during the design process stage .
In today's global competitive market , a product's functionality is not the only thing customers are looking out for .
Products must not only serve their functions but must look good on the surface .
No doubt there are products with solely excellent functions out on the market .
These products are appreciated by few .
It does not take long for one to realize that products must have their own unique design in order to be relevant in the market .
Engineering Design Process , written by Professor Seyyed Khandani from Diablo Valley College in Pleasant Hill , California , aims to guide engineers and aspiring designers to design their product through a sequential thinking process .
Engineering Process Design brings the reader across different aspects of engineering design , such as the marketability of the product and the testing of products .
Designing itself is a creative process and in some cases , readers may find certain aspects of Engineering Design Process are not applicable at all .
In Singapore , the small elastic market and the lack of facilities and flexibility for product testing may hamper the design process .
According to Khandani (2005) , the purpose of designing is to generate profits .
Afterall , who will want to waste their efforts on something that does not reap benefits ?
This is one of the reasons why engineering design process is not all that easy in Singapore .
With only a population of 4 million , Singapore has a relatively small market .
The remuneration is simply not enough to lure players into the market to produce and design their products .
Engineers will often find themselves limited by the consumers' needs .
In addition , engineering design process in Singapore is often faced with Singaporeans' preferences for foreign goods .
Firstly , foreign goods are often established brands which appeal to the local market .
Secondly , certain goods , especially technological products , are much cheaper when imported from overseas .
In recent years , with the explosive number of online shops emerging and the increasing popularity of B2C (business-to-consumer) websites such as Amazon .com , it is not difficult to purchase foreign goods .
This has resulted in the low demand for locally designed products and often discourages engineers to continue in their innovations .
Before the product is implemented , it is important that the product is  tested first .
Singapore , a small country has only 650 square kilometers of land area .
Much of the landscape is covered by skyscrapers and public housings .
The lacks of land area to build suitable facilities to test products is an obstruction to engineers .
Since 2004 , the National University of Singapore's (NUS) , School of Engineering's Formula Society of Automotive Engineers (FSAE) has been building racing cars and representing Singapore in competitions against other universities from other countries .
Associate Professor Seah Kar Heng commented that one of the difficulties faced by the team is the lack of a suitable venue to test drive the cars .
Beside the lack of facilities , engineers are constrained by the strict regulations imposed by the Governement .
The team from FSAE could only test- drive their cars within NUS' compounds and in the United States where competitions were held .
Currently , there are only laws governing the use of conventional cars on public roads .
The team from FASE will have to seek approval from different agencies which is often very time-consuming .
In conclusion , Engineering Process Design is a comprehensive guide for engineers who have no idea about how to go about designing a new product .
However , in Singapore , engineers will find that they will meet  some problems that may hamper the design process .
Due to the small market in Singapore and Singaporeans' preference for foreign goods , many may give up their innovations eventually .
For those who successfully designed their products , they are met with another problem-- the lack of facilities to test their products and the inflexibility of the Government's regulations .
Engineering design process is a tedious one and by analysing the problems that hamper it , one may be able to make the process a smoother one .
Our world is experiencing amazing changes every day .
It cannot be denied that some people in certain areas are still struggling around the poverty line , however , most of the citizens of the world believe that our living conditions are becoming better and better .
But behind the prosperity , we are facing some great challenges , or , in another way , some urgent problems which may affect the rise and fall of mankind .
Among those problems , the limitation of resources has raised a lot of concern from our society .
Engineers are playing an important role in finding and using renewable resources such as wind power and solar power to satisfy the increasing demand of resources .
Firstly , scientists and engineers have been focusing using wind and solar power for decades of years .
Many solutions have been tested and implementline .
However ,well known examples may be the solar water heater and wind power electrical generator .
These two inventions can not only meet our daily needs , but also protect the environput anotherave the existing resources like coal and petroleum .
To put it more specifically , solar water heater can take place of other is a sourceeaters basedfor coal gas .
So besides the reasons above , it is also very cheap to use these renewable resources so users can get a lot of economical benefits from that .

Engineers are trying to generatee solutions to some problems .
And these problems are mainly caused by restriction and immature technology of wind and spoweredpower .

For instance , car is one of the most important transportations in the world; however , new research has proved that the existing extra petroleum can only be used for another eighty to ninety years .
Engineers are trying to solve the problem that what we shall use after the petroleum run out .
Thus a new kind of solar-powered car has been invented .
But even engineers have reached certain success; the solar-powered car they can produce is still far from the standard of civil transports .

"The world is coming to an end in the 2100s (22th century) !"
Is this statement a false prophesy or a reality that has yet to come true ?
Natural resources around the world are being depleted at an alarming rate which has led to numerous debates and interventions by environmentalists , in a bid to reduce the amount of resources extracted and employed by mankind .
However , not all readily available natural resources can be used directly from their raw form .
One such example is the purification of water to make it potable .
Water is an essential part of human life .
Everyone needs it for survival and also for many other applications such as industrial usage .
Even though water is readily available , however , the process of purification to make it portable is tedious , technologically intensive and most importantly , expensive .
According to statistical figures from a United Nations Organisation (UNO) publication , the global population consumes approximately 3000 cubic metres of water daily .
As a result , there is an increasing need for newer , greener and more cost-effective purification methods so as to provide massive amounts of clean and affordable drinking water for all parts of the world , especially in less-developed countries .
Hence , the ever-increasing need for cheap portable water should be given high priority in global research and development initiatives .
The following case study illustrates the importance of modern technology and engineering design in water purification process , especially in countries that do not have self-sustainable water supplies .
Engineering design and modern technology assists these countries by first identifying the specific problem and in the process of doing so , possible solutions will be generated .
The final stage of the design process involves the testing and implementation of a particular chosen solution .
For example in Singapore , the government recognised that she has to be more self-reliant and self-dependent on her water supplies so as to mitigate any difficulties faced in times of contingency and emergency .
In addition , being a small 'island' country surrounded by close neighbours , the idea of desalination of sea-water to meet her water demands is not a viable long-term option .
As a result , NEWater , a sewage treatment plant , was set up a few years back to look into the possibility of converting 'used' or sewage water into clean drinking water via reverse osmosis technology .
As such , large emphasis and investments have been invested into this initiative since then .
Through the application of the engineering design framework and modern technology , purifying sewage water seems to be highly viable and successful .
According to statistics from the Public Utilities Board (PUB) , NEWater will meet 30% of Singapore's current water needs by 2010 .
This example shows that through the proper implementation of engineering design framework and application of modern technology , the current human need for securing clean and cheap drinking water can be achieved with a high degree of success .
In conclusion , engineering design process and modern technology will no doubt aid in solving and realising various human needs such as that of water purification .
However , prudent and appropriate usage of the world's natural resources still has to be practised religiously and conscientiously as engineering solutions do not guarantee complete success in any application .
As a result , both human and technology have an important role to play in the quest of satisfying human needs .
According to E .M . Rogers , writer of "Diffusion of innovations" , in general , there are six stages of innovation-development process .
They are awareness of the needs or problems , basic and applied research , development , commercialization , diffusion and adoption and finally consequences (Rogers 2003) .
During the process , there are many factors that would affect the outcome of the development project .
Some of them are determined by the technology perspective or social factors , whereas some include government involvement .
One important technology that Rogers mentioned is the innovation of the refrigerator in 1930 for electric and gas refrigerators .
When people did a comparison on both types , the latter has a better advantage over the first .and they were expecting  the gas refrigerator .
But it did not capture  the consumer market .
The main reason for this was because of the investment , consideration and decision made by the corporations involved in this project .
They believed that they would make more profits from electric refrigerators and thus marketed it to the public .
As a result , it turned out that technology in electric refrigerator was available to the consumer instead of the consumer's choice .
Another example of a social problem leading to government and scientist involvement is the safety issue with automobiles in the United States .
In 1960 , the annual fatality due to vehicles reached 50 ,000 and drew the government's attention to the safety ie on the transport system .
A survey was conducted between the specialized researchers' and public's view of the traffic safety problem .
It was found  that the research team didn't agree with the public view and claimed that it was an individual-blame perspective .
As a conclusion from conducting researchers , professors , government officials and insurance company executives , the research on safety measure became due to system-blame perspective and thus engineers redesigned auto vehicles and restructured highways .
As a consequence ofboth the above cases , , the technology did not become the way the consumers expected and the solution for solving social problems was redirected .
It did not follow the stages mentioned above for the successful completion of the process .
Most of them  varied along the process due to several factors and thus led to a different type of innovation .
From my point of view , no matter what the sequence of innovation-development process , as long as there is a new invention , it was invented to benefit all  mankind .
If the world is not growing enough food to support its population , the process can be speeded up through the development of Food Science and Bio- Engineering .
Certain types of food such as rice and fruits can be genetically modified to grow faster and increase food yield .
Animals such as cows and chickens can also be genetically altered to grow faster and produce more milk or eggs respectively .
By designing and engineering certain genes of these plants and animals , food production can be increased to meet the increasing needs of poor countries .
There are strict regulations and quality control for genetically modified food before it can be used for human consumption .
Engineering design processes are tedious , complex and require much creativity for the generation of new ideas .
Therefore , genetically modified food created from such processes would be able to pass the strict requirements and thus able to meet the needs of reducing food shortage in Third World countries .
In spite of the increase of research and development in recent years ,  a significant amount of discoveries and innovation are still being made by people outside of laboratories .
These kind of unconventional environments are commonly referred to as skunkworks environment .
However , we would define it more broadly to include all research done without  external aid .
Though the environments are very different , there are also many similarities between them .
In contrast , conventionally generated technology such as NEWATER progressed much slowly .
The research on NEWATER started in 1998 as a joint initiative between the Public Utilities Board (PUB) and the Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources (MEWR) .
(http://www .pub .gov .sg/NEWater) Its aim was to find a way to provide a sustainable means of providing water for industrial use and consumption for places where water is scarce .
This research took very long to carry out and commercialise as it has to go through a long corporate structure for approval .
Also , care was taken to ensure all the  water treatment procedures were widely acceptable .
Although it has resulted in a resounding success , the technology has not been widely implemented due to patents of the technology being filed by the parent companies .
On the other hand , neither conventionally generated technologies nor discoveries made in skunkworks have an absolute success rate .
For example , the engineers of General Motor's (GM) R&D unit in Detroit were able to create aesthetically pleasing and highly efficient automobiles that ran entirely on battery power (Rogers 2003) .
However , limitations of the technology and failures of publicity resulted in a weak adoption of the new technology .
Similarly , bio fuel studies made  independently by many researchers found that it could be used to replace fossil fuels .
One of the techniques involved in developing fast-growing trees that can grow to full size in just 10 years to generate the bio fuel .
({http://biofuelguide .net/}[HYPERLINK: http://biofuelguide .net/]) Similarly , lack of publicity and technological constrains prevented it from becoming a popular technology .
In conclusion , in spite of the various inherent differences of conventionally generated technologies and innovations from skunkworks ,  revolutionary or conservative , both share various similarities such as providing possible but not definite solutions to our problems .
It is by complementing each research's advantages that we may be able to discover ways to solve future problems .
AT&T picture phone in the late 1960s was invented and marketed as an additional function on top of voice call capabilities of a telephone .
It allowed user to 'see' each other as they talked .
This innovation was not one that had been thoroughly surveyed before the Research began , and users' feedback was that it was bulky , controls too unfriendly and picture too small ({http://www .corp .att .com/attlabs/reputation/timeline/70picture .html}[HYPERLINK: http://www .corp .att .com/attlabs/reputation/timeline/70picture .html]) .
The society could not accept the new product of the market due to several socio-economical and governmental factors .
Firstly , the picture phone aimed to allow both users on the phone to feel closer to one another , as they could now see each other over the phone .
However , it was this very concept which backfired , as users of the phone felt privacy intrusion to their way of life .
The concept was not easily accepted by the more conservative society back in 1960s and hence it failed its primary purpose .
Secondly , it was not economical to own such a phone , as data transmission was not as developed as it is today .
It was far more expensive to own and upkeep such a phone , and even with the monetary ability to own such a machine , technology at that time did not allow for a smooth transmission of data to the phone , as pictures were transmitted once every 2 seconds .
This generally played a part in the decline in product demand in the market and hence less consumers were willing to fork out the money for the phone .
In conclusion , the world today is better equipped with the relevant infrastructure and network to facilitate the use of such a device , a 'picture phone' .
This spin off effect from such development has proved to us that social determinants have definitely been playing a huge role in moulding the development of our technology .
In modern society , what we can see and hear surrounding us is always about technology and science .
Humankind has been inventing more effective and useful equipment by applying advanced techniques .
For example , since the first airplane successfully flew in the sky , people have been master of the theory of flight which makes the dream that people can fly come true .
Then , in the following years , many better planes were produced to satisfy peoples' requirements .
According to Rogers(2003) , technology is defined as a design for an instrumental action that reduces uncertainty in the cause-effect relationships with achieving an advantage or useful result .
In fact , the majority of these technological innovations cannot be reliable without human creativity and research .
However , some technologies were invented serendipitously .
Generally speaking , intended research to pursue development is similar to serendipitous discovery in terms of the aim and contribution to  human society .
The main difference between the two kinds of invention is the process and the effort .
First of all , the aim  technology which was developed with research is to explore some useful things and attempt to reach the unknown scientific area in order to solve the problems in the real world .
For example , people have spent a great amount of money to reach Mars to explore the mysterious outer space even though the probability of  helping make improvements for the Earth is low .
However , this is doing research for improving human's standard of living and making life more convenient and comfortable .
Similarly ,  serendipity is the effect by which one accidentally discovers something fortunate , especially while looking for something entirely different .
Hence , the result of serendipitous discovery also helps explore  unknown things and places .
In addition , both of technology that was discovered by research and serendipitous discovery contribute to the human society .
However , in terms of process and effort , the research to develop new technology is different from the serendipitous discovery .
Specifically , the majority of technological innovations are developed by scientific research  based on knowledge , research and application in practice .
Achievement requires a lot of work and thus  would take a long time .
Even so the result is still unpredictable .
In contrast , serendipitous discovery seems very fortunate because people receive unexpected things which are always beneficial for human society .
For example , Sir Alexander Fleming discovered the first antibiotic penicillin when he was doing research on  biological materials  .
Similarly , DDT was  discovered by accident in the 1930s , when a Swiss chemist , Paul Muller , was trying to find a way to protect woollen clothes against moths .
Hence , serendipitous discovery is more convenient and fortunate but it is much more difficult than doing research to develop innovations .
In conclusion , people always try their best to make inventions to solve problems encountered in real world .
Continually doing research on different scientific areas is one main aspect to discover what humankind desires .
However , it is true that people sometimes find new things or make inventions unexpectedly , which is considered as serendipitous discovery .
Both fulfill useful functions in human society .
For instance , DDT was widely used as a mosquito killer during World War II .
Truly speaking , people may prefer  serendipitous discovery for its convenience  , though it is more difficult to achieve .
Innovations are made every single day and we keep progressing .
But the most interesting part of innovation of technologies often turns out to be the set of events/situations which leads to the innovation .
Innovations may be planned to meet a purpose or to complete an objective .
These are the conventionally planned research based innovations .
Few technologies get innovated serendipitously .
They happen through work of wisdom combined with blind luck .
Comparison and contrast of two technologies innovated in these two different ways gives us many interesting features of innovations to ponder over .
When we look at these two technologies which were innovated differently we find that research based innovations are according to the famous proverb "Necessity is the mother of invention" .
The driving force becomes the desperate need for solving a problem .
However in the case of the serendipitous innovations , there is no exact driving force .
Sets of experiments accidentally yield results which prove to be significant .
Who would have thought that an apple would be enough for a man to develop the concept of mechanics and gravitation ?
The technologies innovated in this fashion were never meant to be innovated .
But today , without them , our survival seems questionable .
It is hard to conclude which type of innovation outshines the other .Infact it makes no sense as both are special in their own ways .
But it is important for us to acknowledge these innovations , respect them and strive to do many more things to make life better ! .
Engineers have been designing products or systems to improve our daily lives life .
The process that they used is called the engineering design process .
The process has constantly  developed new technology that helped to solve problems of human like making travel to countries faster and comfortable by planes .
Engineers have been trying to solve a human problem for many years .
That problem is to make drinkable fresh water available to everyone in the third world countries .
The engineering process involves defining the problem , gathering pertinent information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting solutions and testing and implementing the solution , as quoted from Kandani (2005) .
First , we will look at how the problem should be defined in the engineering process .
Water covers 71% of the earth's surface and water from the oceans take up 97% of  the total percentage of surface water ( Wikipedia) .
Even though water seems to be everywhere , only a very small percentage of water is drinkable  .
There are also many places in the third world countries where drinkable water is not available due to lack of rainfall and pollution in the water sources .
These places which face water shortage for a long time will face dehydration , diseases due to lack of fresh water and infertile soil for plantation .
Second , in the design process is to gather pertinent information on why the problem still exists as stated by Khandani .
Third world countries' governments know that there is a need to solve the water shortage problem .
However , developing new and clean water technology needs large amounts of money .
This money can be put to better use like getting medication for their people .
Another possible reason for the problem  could be pollution from industries .
Inland water sources are being polluted by factories which dump chemical waste products into the water sources , which make the water source unfit for drinking .
Third , is to generate and select possible solutions in the engineering design process .
Since inland water sources are being polluted and not fit for drinking , oceans , which cover a large area on earth are another possible option .
However , seawater is not drinkable as it contains a very high level of sea salt and impurities .
Therefore , to make seawater into drinkable water , engineers decided to use desalination .
Desalination is a process that collects extracted water from sea salt and impurities through boiling .
The extracted will be furthered purified for usage .
In order to make the extracted water  fit for drinking water standards set by World Health organization (WHO) , engineers will include a process that add nutrients into it .
Another possible solution can be creating more water catchment areas by planting more trees and building reservoirs .
However , this solution can only help to solve the problem in the long run if only the water catchment areas are free from pollution .
The result might not be an immediate effect , as it takes time for natural rainfall to fill up the reservoirs .
As a result , building desalination plants near the sea can help to solve the shortage of water immediately .
Lastly , Engineers can do some testing on desalinating seawater into drinkable water after they have drafted  a cheap and affordable desalination process for the third world countries to purchase .
The results from the testing will be sent to WHO for approval for desalination plant to be built for producing drinkable water in the area .
If the technology is newer than the previous old desalination process , the engineers might be able to get it patented so the price for this new technology will be affordable to everyone .
In conclusion , the engineering design process aids engineers in developing newer technology to help meet the needs or solve the problem of the global population .
This process is applicable to  producing clean water from seawater , which helps solve water shortage problems in certain countries .
The process is able to identify the problem , understand why it is still not solved , produce solutions to it and get it work in an engineering way .
In the context of the innovation development process , the development of technologies may be viewed from either a technologically determinist perspective or a socially determinist view , also referred to as the social construction of technology (Rogers , 2003) .
The construction of technology believes that the innovation of technologies is limited and controlled by social factors .
One technology that was socially shaped was the invention of automobile cars .
Automobile vehicles played an important role in this modern world as humans rely heavily on them as a main type of transport for travelling .
This technology is shaped by various groups of engineers according to social constraints .
Firstly , the rise of the automobile industry started as early as the nineteenth century and the First World War acted as a catalyst to speed up the research and development processes of automobile vehicles .
This was so as during the war , there was a rise in demand for automobile vehicles to transport soldiers and supplies to the front line .
It was also used for combat purposes .
Funding and incentives were given to companies to improve automobile technology as whichever countries with the more advanced technologies had a higher chance of winning the war .
As a result , faster , more durable and improved energy efficient vehicles were developed during the war period due to the demands from the military .
Finally , all the research and developments of technology depend on economic factors .
This is so that no investor would be willing to fund a project that does not make money .
Hence , when engineers make improvements to enhance the technological aspect of automobile vehicles , they have to consider the interests of the company .
The technical aspects of cars depend heavily on production costs .
If the production cost increases , carmakers would either see a reduction in profit or potential buyers of the product would see an increase in the price .
These two scenarios are not desired and this is the reason that cars are still running on petrol rather than powered by electricity or natural gases despite the fact that they are cleaner energies .
In conclusion , the research and developments of technology depends on social constraints such as economic factors , military demands or government policies .
Hence , technology is actually a product of society and is influenced by the norms and values of the social system .
The greatest priority of companies is to ensure that projects that they are involved in have great profit potential .
Toshiba is the first brand to have laptop known by many people .
But did you ever know that the invention of laptop is not support by the top executives of Toshiba at that time .
Indeed , there are always some innovations were created in a skunk works environment .
However , many other innovations are created in a conventionally generated environment .
This essay will focus on two examples of these two environments respectively and analyze the differences and similarities of these two different environments .
The first example is the engineer olaptopsiba who wanted to create a laptop (pp .144- 146 Rogers , (2003)) .

However , at that time , Toshiba'which wererketing situatskunkworks good and the company did not want to risk forwerenew concept of product .
Fortunately , our hero Mizoguchi did not give up .
Otherwise , our laptop may not be as good as now .
Moreover , he diverted funds and found engineers himself to fulfill his idea of creating laptop .
After two years of hard work , they finally worked out their laptop .
However , Toshiba still did not accept the laptop because they did not think it could have good market share .
The good thing is that after all his hard work , he finally proven to Toshiba that his invention very useful and sells very good .

On the other hand , for a conventionally generated technology , like the development of electric cars in California and Arizona , it is regulated by government (Rogers , (2003) pp .
87-89) .
Company had to do research on how to manufacture it and make it be loved by consumers .
