The second difference the source of the idea .
The similaes are those innovations all promoted the development of society and they do their best for the creation of their product and dream .
With the spirit of innovation and passion for innovation , our life will become better and better .
In Singapore , innovations in engineering design have been in the cold when compared to leading countries like Germany or Japan .
In my opinion , there are two problems that have led to this situation: Our education structure as well as the shallow engineering heritage that we have .
Firstly , the education structure in Singapore is too rigid and does not promote the creativity of students .
The majority of our Singaporean kids will go through primary school and graduate with a PSLE certificatecertificate , follow that up with a secondary school education in either the express , normal academic or normal technical stream .
This streaming systemhowever , however , was largely based on the students' abilities to cope with the standard subjects on language , math , science and humanities instead of the interest of the students in terms of arts , science or other humanities like literature .
As a result , there was an unhealthy emphasis on the children's results in the standard subjects which they learned .
Parents wanted their children to score well in order to advance to university and have a bright future .
In their eyes , creative students who want to make it into the arts stream were just rotten apples who couldn't do well in their standard subjects .
Indeed , this was very discouraging for the young minds .
As a result , creativity , which is the key to innovation , isn't developed since young for many Singaporeans .
Singapore's emphasis on commercial gains rather than innovations was largely influenced by the fact that we were a trading hub since British rule .
Chinese merchants , Indian spice traders and Malay rubber traders involved in the trading market were the backbone of our country's growth .
On the other hand , the Europeans had the Romans who created the wheel while the Japanese made the Katana for their Samurai .
Therefore , we cannot blame our forefathers for not being innovative when it comes to engineering .
Our innovations came in the way that they tense business instead .
In conclusion , even if  we are able to solve the education structure problem , it will still take a few more generations of Singaporeans before we can start to see results for our engineering innovations .
We are after all , a very young nation when compared to the rest of the world .
Perhaps in future , there will be Singaporeans who can create engineering wonders to revolutionize the world .
We will then be able to catch up with countries like Germany or Japan and be labeled as a country with innovative engineering .
In the past few centuries , humankind has taken giant leaps in technology .
The creativity and need for ever improving lifestyle have led to new inventions to ease our lives .
These new inventions are discovered when there is a need or a problem; and when an invention would help solve the problem .
However not all innovations are popular , even though the product would have a technological use , it may not be socially approved .
Therefore an innovation cannot simply be put into the market and expected to be sold , even though it would have a use .
Instead , the product should be accepted socially .
Even some of the products we use everyday are socially determined , for example , the electric refrigerator .
During the 1930's two types of refrigerators were at the prototype stage , one the electric refrigerator and the other the gas refrigerator .
The gas refrigerator was superior to the electricrefrigeratorin several ways .
The gas refrigerator uses an ammonia refrigerant which is vaporized by heating with a gas flame .
Then therefrigerantdissolves in water , hence cooling the refrigerator .
On the other hand , an electric refrigerator has a compressor that condenses the liquidrefrigerant and releases the heat , which wasabsorbedby therefrigerantwhen itvaporized , into the outside surrounding .
(Rogers 2003)
The gas refrigerator , though using the same principle as the electric refrigerator , has a few advantages over the electric refrigerator .
The electric refrigerator has acondenserand motor to drive it , in contrast a gas refrigerator does not contain any mobile mechanical components that could breakdown , and hence would require less maintenance .
This would mean it would be less expensive to maintain agasrefrigerator compared to an electric one .
In addition to this advantage the gas refrigerator makes lessnoisethan the electric refrigerator as well .
(Rogers 2003)
Typically , one would expect the gas refrigerator to capture the consumer market .
However it did not , the main reason being that powerful companies such as General Electric , General Motors , Westinghouse and Kelvinator spent huge sums of money on research and development .
These companies realized that larger profits can be made by selling electric refrigerators and they aggressively marketed the product .
Even though smaller companies tried to compete in the market with the gas refrigerator , they could not stand the might of companies such as General Electric .
Hence the use of gas refrigerators never popularized and instead today we continue to use the electric refrigerator despite it having several flaws .
(Rogers 2003)
In conclusion it can be noted that this technology was determined by companies such as General electric rather than it being the consumer's choice .
Also it goes to show that for a product to be approved and accepted by society , it should be socially determined rather than technologically determined .
As we all know , engineers build this beautiful world .
They apply the complicated theories and knowledge into practice to benefit our life .
It is the engineers who have done the greatest job and made the biggest contribution to human beings .
Although my home country , China , has been developing very fast and achieved tremendous success since theto practice open and reform policy , especially in the field of engineering design processes of innovations , there are still a lot of problems or obstacles lying on the way to further success .
Among all the problems , corruption and education rank as first and second .
According to the Oxford Dictionary , corruption means that dishonest or immoral behavior of activities .
Inimplementationcountry , a large number of great ideas or inventions are made almost every day , but few of them are made into practice and benefit us .
What is the reason ?
Corruption .
In some cases , when a research group comes up with a new plan or idea , he has to report to his boss to ask for fund to develop the idea .
Then the boss has to report further to a boss on a higher level , then all the way up .
Finally , the report reaches the "super boss" , but if corruption exists , the standard for the "super boss" to judge whether this idea should or should not be developed further is whether it can benefit himself , instead of the majority of people .
If the research group is lucky enough to get the fund , the money has to be passed all the way down to the group through a lot of institutions in between .
As the money is passed from one to another , it will become less and less , the other goes to the bosses' own pockets .
Finally , the research group gets the money , but no use anymore , because the remaining money is not enough or the arrival time of money is too late .
When such things happen again and again , people will have no desire to innovate because they know they will not succeed .
Just in this way , corruption hampers the execution stage of engineering design processes for Innovation , killing numerous of engineering design processes for innovation .
The other problem which hampers the engineering design processes for Innovation is the education system .
As we all know , China has the largest population in the world , so students suffer a lot in order to get into put into practice totitution .
They are forced to focus on how to get high marks , but not care about the creation .
PRC students are said to be "full marks , less ability" .
They just repeat what other has done before , and have little idea what innovation is about .
Of course , repetition cannot lead us to innovation .
This is the big problem that hampers the thinking stage of engineering design processes for Innovation .
Although the government is try to improve it , so far the result is not satisfied .
satisfactoryIn a nutshell , the two main problems what hamper the engineering desigotherschavees for Innovation in my home country are corruption , which will probably kill the innovation on the process of execution , and education , which makes the youth less creative that their peers in other countries .
These two problems are very difficult to solve in a short time , but we can improve a lot and make the engineering design processes for Innovation better and better .
Human need is something that is necessary for humans to live a healthy , convenient and comfortable life .
Are the needs that meet/fulfilled human need come from no way ?
The answer is No !
Have you ever observed your surroundings , for examples telephones , computers , fans , iPods etc .
Those  all came into being through the creative application of technology , and do not appear from nowhere .
The majority of the engineering designs are categorized as inventions-devices or systems .they didn't  exist before or are the improvements over existing devices or systems .
Those inventions or designs are processing under a term called: Design activity .
The solution to the design problem requires step-by step methodology , and normally the activity is  an iterative process .
Next I will illustrate more in detail how engineering design processes can meet that need by using one of a current human need that should be given priority - Eco Car .
Collecting information is the next thing we are focusing on .
We need to collect all the information that relevant to the problem .
In this stage , developing a problem statement is necessary .
A broad definition will help in the sense of allowing you to look at alternative solutions .
We should keep asking ourselves  questions , in order to discover mistakes and  also to help in redefining of the problem , such as: is the hydrogen is only the material we need to consider ?
What are the existing solutions to the problem ?
etc .
Searching for information resources for examples , using internet , electronic catalog or indexes will also broaden your view on your design problem .
Thirdly , generate multiple solutions .
In this stage , creativity plays an extremely important rule here because in generating new ideas that may solve the problem .
We could start with an existing solution to the problem , and from there can find out more weaknesses about our design/product and focus on improving the weaknesses .
For examples , the top speed of the Eco car can only reach 40km/h , which is consider "slow" for a normal driver .
So how can we improve from this issue ?
Thus , combine new ideas , methods , finding more weaknesses could help in producing a totally unique solution to the problem .
When it comesanalyzing and selecting solution , here we need to decide which solution is  best suited for implementation to the problem .
Analyzing the best solution is essential before deciding which design solution to implement .
For examples , functional analysis .
We need to ensure the given solution will function the way it should .
Even even though it meets all the criteria but fails at one of them , it is still considered a failure .
Product safety and liability , we also need to consider the Eco car that we design doesn't cause injury to humans , property damage and environmental damage from the use of your design .
Besides that , economic and market analysis , to analyze how people feel in this Eco car , are they willing to pay for a car the top speed of which is only 40km/h ?Lastly is the decision making and give rating to each design alternative against the stated criteria .
For examples , safety: 30 percent , efficiency: 30 percent etc .
Now we've reached the final stage - test and implement the solution .
There are several considerations  to be considered , such as prototyping , concurrent engineering and the distinct activities that might happen during implementation like , documentation , applying for patents .
Finally testing and verification , you have to test all steps in the process work .
Because without having a proper testing at all stages in the process , you may find yourself in trouble later on .
As a conclusion , follow the engineering design process is an important guidance as it can guides your design into more details of implementing ideas , more effective way of problem solving .
Design activity is cyclic and iterative , it will continually repeat to the five step processes , until the best design has appeared .
Basically engineering design process includes of five-step process .
It is usually used in a problem-solving works for design problems .
As the example given by Khandani's article , Wright brothers are actually gone through this five-step process , to show that design problem may require backtracking and iteration .
The five steps used for the solving design problems are:
* Define the problem
* Gather pertinent information
* Generate multiple solutions
* Analyze and select a solution
* Test and implement the solution
10 students from our school , NUS also involving in the Eco car design .
On 17 Aug 2009 , they successfully launched the first Singapore-designed urban concept car with zero carbon emission .
Let's talk about how they use the five-step process to work out such an impressing job !
Firstly , definition of the problem .
Before we can develop a problem , we need to recognize the need for a new product , system , or machine .
We all know that the vehicles are running by the petroleum fuel , because of the rapidly increasing of the petroleum prices due to lacking of the material , and it is predicted will running out in few decades , this issue leads us to look for a new material to replace petroleum has become enthusiastic among the engineering fields .
Besides , establish criteria for success is important as well .
We should consider the preliminary criteria before move into next stage .
For examples , the design must be low cost; the design must be user friendly etc .
There are several issues that may affect negatively an engineering design process .
Two main problems faced by Singapore engineers are financial issues and social factors .
Singapore is a modern globalized city utilizing cutting edge technology for its growth and development .
Thus , much emphasis is placed on the designing engineers to develop innovations to further improve the well-being of our society .
Even with strong government support in nurturing designer engineers , the problems are still very much prevalent .
For large scale engineering design processes , a huge amount of resources is required .
A large amount of money is required to purchase these resources .
Financial problems may start to arise at the start of the design processes .
An aspiring innovator will usually face financial problems and find it hard to kick start their research .
Thus , he or she has to find companies or organization to finance their work in return for partial ownership rights over their research .
Without proper funding , designer engineers will find it hard to complete their innovations given the iterative nature of their work .
Furthermore , funding is required to apply for patents .
pursuing patents is  not easy as they take  a long time period of time to process , requiring large amount of money .
The engineers have to be confident about their innovations and understand the improvements their work will have on society .
(Khandani 22) .
Even if the financial problem is resolved , the innovations have to be socially acceptable .
This applies to the design processes as well .
That is , the design processes must not goes against proper ethnics and morals , nor result in any negative third party effects .
For example , some processes of bio-engineering are involved with life human cells research and the use of living test specimens .
These may offend the general public as these actions are seen as 'playing god' , going against common religious beliefs .
Engineering processes that result in environmental issues will also face pressure from environmental groups or the government .
Another social reason would be the government factor .
In Singapore , there are several policies governing the ongoing design research processes .
Engineers are required to seek approvals before carrying out their work processes to meet safety regulations .
These may result in crucial time loss .
Time is a pressuring factor for designer engineers with date lines to meet .
Tedious 'red tape' in all the government processes would slow down the progress of research , resulting in lower working quality and efficiency .
In conclusion , the social and financial factors are main issues hampering the design processes of engineers .
The problems are even more so in the Singapore context .
However , realizing the importance of designer engineers in today's society , Singapore government has implemented measures to encourage innovative engineering .
Development funds are set up and the many guidelines for designer processes are clarified .
It helps to alleviate the situation , but the problems will still continue to persist .
Technology and inventions are not strangers in this fast developing world .
Things that people had never imagined 2 centuries ago have become a normality nowadays .
In 1876 , Alexander Graham Bell invented a telephone .
Today , we cannot live without a hand phone whereas people from 1900s did not have one for their own .
Furthermore , sharing of information has never been easier with the invention of Internet after another century , in 2000s .
All these inventions have been contributed by a lot of people of different expertises .
Most of the time , new technology and innovations are being developed based on existing technology while some individual or group may discover technology serendipitously .
There are certain similarities and differences between those two methods of discovery .
We will discuss computer technology compared to the discovery of penicillin which is a serendipitous discovery .
For every discovery or technology to be accepted by consumers , it has to meet the demands of users .
This is the same for both technology via research or a serendipitous discovery .
An example of this is the discovery of penicillin in 1928 which was one of the earliest antibiotics available in the market .
The use of penicillin extended from killing disease-causing bacteria to saving lives in the battlefield during the World War II .
Therefore , this discovery was a success and used by people all around the world .
This fact illustrates that not only the discovery has to be successful but also it has to be accepted by society .
Technology developed through researches has often been influenced by economical and profitability factors .
Most of the products created in computer technology are based on this factor .
For example , the companies have been developing different models of electronic devices every month to boost their sales .
According to Rogers(2003) , although gas refrigerators has overwhelming advantages (no moving parts , no noise) the extensive investment in R&D by big companies had made electric refrigerators better products .
On the other hand , a serendipitous discovery does not depend on those factors .
An individual or a group of researchers can make discoveries which may be useful to society without following the influence of companies and investors .
Other major differences between the two technologies are the availability of funds for research and the facilities used by researchers .
Technology developed through researched usually has ample funds allocated to them whereas the individual researchers will have to find the fund for their own .
Nowadays , Computer Technology has become so popular that every potential research will be funded sufficiently and thus researchers can produce more innovative ideas and products .
In conclusion , technology , whether it is discovered accidentally or purposely , is the main ingredient of new innovations and products .
We have to make the technology useful to society because they are the main users of the end-products .
In the end , a serendipitous discovery will be just as good as echnology discovered by research as long as it serves the purpose of contributing to the society and making lives better .
Energy source is the key factor that will affect the development of any country .
It is required especially for industries , agriculture , and even domestic uses .
However , due to the large consumption of energy , most countries are facing serious energy crisis .
One of the reasons may be also due to the increasing population and resulting in people consuming energy more than the amount of energy produced .
This serious shortage of energy is affecting industries as well as the daily lives of people .
According to an article written by Khalid Chandio (2009) , he says that "Pakistan is presently facing a serious energy crisis" and "the demand exceeds supply" .
Therefore , it is crucial to find possible solutions to solve the problem before it gets fully depleted .
Many countries now are trying to increase the cost of energy to prevent people from misusing them .
Although some countries are still keeping up with the rapid increasing of energy demands , there is still a need for other alternatives to prepare for the future .
Some possible solutions will be utilizing sun energy , wind , coal , geothermic and bio energy , which in principle are renewable .
However , among all this possible solutions , most of them are not suitable to be implemented due to high cost and the availability in large scale .
For example , coal is cheap but it causes pollution .
Extra work has to be done in order to reduce the amount of pollution produced to the minimum (Khalid Chandio  ,2009) .
Several design considerations have to be well-planned such that low design cost , design safety and preventing harm to the environment .
Analysis is the key to process design .
Among all the suggested solutions , it is crucial to analyse all the solutions before making a decision .
After brainstorming all the possible solutions , solar energy stands out as the best solution .
According to an article by Musse Mohamud Ahmed (2003) , he says that solar energy is world-wide recognised renewable energy sources , cost free and clean energy .
Environment impacts are also negligible .
However , one problem that may hinder this invention is the use of costly equipment and the selection of the wrong peak sunshine data .
Therefore , exact calculations for the solar power production are very important before any actual implementation of solar energy scheme to ensure proper performance and reduce cost .
Cost depends heavily on the size of solar power system .
Weather conditions are important for high performance as solar energy depends largely on the sun .
Cloudy weathers will produce lesser power as compared to sunny weathers .
Engineers need to calculate the required solar panels needed for certain hours use of energy .
Selection of solar energy components is another issue that engineers need to take into consideration when using solar energy .
To conclude , solar energy proves the best solution to solve energy crisis in term of cost and high performance , except for the cost of the solar power system .
Proper choosing of solar power system is therefore very important .
Solar energy also stands out in terms of commercial purposes due to environment impacts .
This will result in negligible pollution produced .
Hence , solar energy provides a remarkable invention to the earth .
"Education is not the answer to the question .
Education is the means to the answer to all questions" , William Allin did define the final purpose of studying , which becomes more and more essential in this 21st century .
Education is such an indispensable part of our lives that need improving to catch up with others; overall , it should be given priority and development .
Although our common education system is generally sufficient , it still contains some shortcomings that spread out all over the world .
In developing countries , education is even a far-away concept though a lot of governments' and outside donors' have been made .
As a glance: "In sub-Saharan Africa , for example , the average student-teacher ratio in primary school is 47 to 1 , compared with 17 to 1 in developed countries .
And that masks even worse conditions in the early grades , where this ratio can be as high as 100 to 1 .
As a result , too few of these new students are mastering the basic skills necessary to begin lifting themselves out of poverty" (Hewlett Foundation) .
The education issue also involves the cost of schooling , "Even when schooling is ostensibly 'free' studies have shown that parents incur other direct costs such as activity fees , uniforms , paper and pens (including texts and excise books) , transport , lunches , expenses for boarding and others which often result in the exclusion of poor children from school" (Chimombo , 2005) .
Other problems are equity and gender issue , cultural and religious attitudes , efficiency and quality .
In developed countries , the cost of study and also the efficiency of education are the main points which considerably need observing .
"Another observation in the report that we find is those with college degrees are facing the highest unemployment in two decades since records started being kept .
With college costs going through the roof and in many cases , costing nearly $50 ,000 a year at private schools many are asking whether some college degrees are even worth pursuing" (Mybudget360 , 2009) .
In short , the education shortcomings mainly focus on the equipment and management issues .
The problem seems to need help from social workers , but indeed , it also relies on engineers .
Processes to solve the above design problem include several steps .
According to Khandani , they are defining the problem , gathering pertinent information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution , testing and implementing the solution .
Specifically , when focusing upon the education problem , it can be inferred that the key words are "cost" and "efficiency" .
Then perhaps a multi-purpose tool is the good starting-point .
The tool should be sufficient to reduce the cost and enhance the efficiency .
For example , it could be an interactive learning device , an all-in-one electronic book , a real-time network or even a virtual intelligent teacher .
Whatever it is , the tool must be affordable by either governments or best individuals , helpful to students' studying progress and feasible for popularization .
Also and importantly , it should be a new and creative invention .
To achieve this aim , a large group of engineers are recommended to establish and work together .
People coming from different places all over the world will bring along their own view for the issue , understand what their country's need and contribute both their academic and social knowledge .
Co-operation among engineers will make an innovation in the end when the abstract idea is turned into physical equipment .
Education today should be given more priority and improvements .
That could be carried out by engineers who hold the key to solve design problems .
"Design activity occurs over a period of time and requires a step- by-step methodology" , said Khandani .

Standing in the Third World , China has taken the challenge to improve the development step by step in the past few decades .
Yet there is a long way to go , especially for those designing engineers , because creative design and integrated innovation really play vital roles in one country's development .
However , lots of realistic problems which are like obstacles hampering China from enhancing the economy in design process , lie in the way .
Specifically , two problems from social and technological aspect are emphatic .
The Examination-styled education limits the creativity of potential persons .
And furthermore , China is losing those talent people who are good at designing because of the unbalanced policy .
Firstly , Examination-styled education cuts down children's creativity .
Due to the huge population in China , Chinese education system has to select talented people by setting one universal examination which is called GaoKao for candidates all over China each year .
According to the ministry of Education of PRC , all together more than 10 million candidates will have to attend Gaokao for the entry to universities every year .
However , China has only 720 higher education institutes offering degree aspectsm (MOEPRC , 2006) , which means that those 10 million candidates have to fiercely compete for the deficient universities in terms of their marks in exam .
Under such an stressful circumstance , students learn knowledge only for examinations .
In order to gain a best result in GaoKao , they have to do thousands of tutorial questions for practicing .
Their goals are getting more marks in each test rather than trying to learning and applying knowledge to solve problems .
Therefore , most students neglect practicing their capacity of learning , communication skills , using logical method to get information , and so forth .
Moreover , the most horrible thing is that they can not thinking creatively especially for design process .
Engineers as they will be , their job is to be skillful at applying knowledge to solving problems they meet effectively , which is irrelevant to getting full marks in examinations .
Secondly , mae and more talented designing engineers leave China behind .
The policy of reformation and opening pushes China into a new global position she has never met before .
The designing engineering can get touch with foreign developed companies which may provide attractive remuneration .
Chinese government also does not take measure to keep resources of human talents .
As a result , approaching 600 thousand studentsmethodsone out overseas for further study since 1980s .
But only a quarter of them come back to serve China in economic development (Pan , 2006) .
In the same way , China lost lots of design engineers which may contribute innovative ideas about construction either on specific field like civil engineering , or on the entire development of Chinese economy .
However , only minority of the experts can make efforts on design process in China .
Thus , the acceleration of enhancement of engineering will be reduced at a large scale .
Additionally , every country nowadays is trying its best to protect human resources as well as technology and design ideas .
Less highly educated people staying in China will be a disadvantage on this protection .
Good designing ideas may be lost from China , or even not created in this country .
a minorityIn conclusion , my home country China now faces two challenging troubles .
Examination-styled education kills children's creativity .
And , Chinese government does not manage well on resources of human talents .
Both problems will sharply hamper the design process of innovation of China .
Obviously , it will be an extremely heavy load on our generation and hopefully , we can handle this issue and change the situation .

Problems Hampering Engineering Design Process in China
Nowadays , technology and science in China is growing rapidly .
As the economics develops and China is more connected to the global environment , the government has placed much emphasis on science and technology to make it an integral part of the development of the country .
Engineering design is an crucial part of technology .
However , since China is a developing country , the systems and regulations are not sufficiently advanced .
Lots of problems existing in different areas hamper the engineering design processes for innovation .
Among them , the most serious two are from education system and financial investment .
In order to solve these problems , we must first know how these problems come from and the negative effects they have caused .
In this essay , I will discuss these clearly .
First and foremost , the  in China is not conducive enough to cultivate students' ability of innovation .
Especially for engineerings , hands-on , practical ability and independent thinking are the most important capabilities .
However , the education evaluation system in China is based on examination .
Using examinations to recruit the most outstanding students results in that a large proportion of engineering students are only good at rote memorization but not innovative thinking .
This has caused the shortage of talents in both quantity and quality .
Based on statistics on 2004 , the number of researchers per million is 708 in China , while it is 3750 in developed countries (Education Economic Indicators of Countries in the World , 2009) .
Engineering creation and innovation can not go without talents .
Moreover , to create a new product needs the cooperation of many people .
If there is not enough talents , the design process can even hardly be started .
So the problems in education system is the main obstacle to the engineering design process .
In addition , funding remained a major problem of technology development because science and technology study and every steps in an engineering design process are expensive .
Compared with the world average education and technology input of 5% , the spending of China is only 3% (Zhang , 2006) .
The funding for technology is far from enough .
To develop a new technology needs advanced equipment , instruments , venues and special materials .
Besides , for talents , subsidies and welfare are necessary .
The design process of every invention needs large amount of expenses .
For some of the complex scientific research projects , it need a long time to go .
When it comes to some design for specific purpose , it may not receive any economic profits in a short-term .
If the government cut off the financial support halfway , the task can't be continued and everything come to naught .
It is precisely because there is not enough money input , a lot of good ideas can not be implemented .
And because of no good treatment , many talents go abroad to carry on their study and work .
Without strong funding support , the engineering innovation can not develop well .
This has seriously affected the engineering and technology innovation in China .
In conclusion , the problems from education system and technology funding have hampered the development of engineering design process of innovation for a long time .
To be a powerful country , China should develop in a comprehensive way .
Technology and innovation is the soul of a nation's development .
So the government should reform the education system and provide more funding on technology to develop engineering design processes for innovation .
In this new era of globalization , design and innovation plays an important role in changing the world into a better place to live .
From the  until this modern world of technology , many inventions and innovations have been made so as to suit our lifestyle .
For example , mobile phones have become smaller and lighter with the miniaturization of digital components and the development of more sophisticated batteries .
Inventors realized the risk of not taking a risk and dare to challenge an outdated product .
However , in my home country- Malaysia , there are some obstacles that hold back engineering design processes for innovation .
The first problem is the current economic model for one off development .
In our country , we are unable to achieve commercially significant levels of reuse beyond platform .
This is because the engineers design and develop most products as individuals in isolation from other products .
Eventually , all the products such as computer software  more or less have the same functions , it is just that return on investment in product development would be far higher if multiple versions or multiple products were taken into account .
Hence , organizations rarely make commercially significant investments in identifying and harvesting the reusable assets , unless it is explicitly planned in advance .
This problem causes us to fail to recognize the opportunity to convert resources optimally so as to meet our objective , which is to meet desired needs of the public .
And of course , this need can sometimes be considered a necessity to some people but a luxury for others .
But the most important reason is , when engineers do not investigate a reusable product , they will eventually create the same structural product without improving its properties .
Thus , these products do not fulfill different needs of the public .
The second matter that significantly hampers engineering design processes for innovations in my home country is the limitation of human resources for designing new products .
Human resources are an important factor for a country to come up with lots of creative innovation .
For instance , the younger generation dares to challenge themselves and think out of the box to generate new ideas .
They have the initiative and determination to turn their dreams and imaginations into reality .
Unfortunately , this expertise tends to work in other countries instead of staying back after graduation .
This is because foreign companies are willing to offer them higher position and satisfying salary compared to local companies .
Consequently , there is no new blood in research and development prospects .
The lack of human resources brings great impact on our country's economic growth .
This is because outdated products will be eliminated from the market and when there is no invention of new products , sooner or later other countries will stop importing products from us and head towards those with higher technologies .
As a result , our country will fall into inflation and recession will occur .
In conclusion , engineering design process for innovations plays a crucial role in our society .
It is very important for a country to sustain its products' marketability by enhancing its design and functions .
Hence , the  economic model for one off development and limitation of human resources should not be obstacles for our country's progress .
Don't multitask , multithink instead .
Think out of the box and be creative so as we can keep on path with the fast paces of life .
With the constant rise of sea level , many countries face the danger of being submerged underwater .
If this happens , we may not even have sufficient rice for survival .
More than a third of the Mekong Delta in Vietnam , where nearly half of the country's rice is grown will be submerged underwater if sea level rises by one more metre (IOL , 2009) .
Vietnam is the second largest rice exporter after Thailand and this will put the rice on our table at stake .
Global Warming has been a persistent problem that engineers should step in and help .
Engineers should adjust their designs creatively; like constructing more green buildings and including more greeneries in any future plans for redeveloping Singapore .
Firstly , engineers should design all buildings in accordance with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) green mark scheme .
The scheme would provide advice on how a green building should be built and what additional features should be included .
All these guidelines will save electricity  and reduce environmental impact as well .
For example , although the air conditioning system in a library cannot be switched off at night due to the moisture content in the atmosphere , they can be set to a higher temperature or part of the units can be switched off automatically at night .
Hence , it will help in decreasing the Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) gases emitted which harms the ozone layer .
In short , engineers should adopt the green mark scheme for all the buildings they design in the future to reduce the environmental impacts that are harmful to the earth .
Secondly , engineers can dedicate more green areas to future plans on redeveloping Singapore .
Some of the emission of negative gases that affect the ozone layer are beyond our control , certain plans to recycle the harmful gases should be considered .
For example , trees and plants can be planted at strategic locations of Singapore as they will reduce pollution by photosynthesising and producing oxygen in return .
This is an ideal method which can be adopted especially in congested cities like Singapore .
Other than dedicating land area for greens , gardens can also be built on the balconies , facades and even the roofs of buildings !
The multi-tier idea will definitely increase the intensity of green areas , thus reducing pollution and help to recycle cleaner air for our atmosphere .
To sum up , there should be gardens in every town and parks in every estate to allow a good ratio of renewing air supply in the atmosphere .
In summary , all buildings in Singapore in the future should be built in accordance with the green mark scheme by BCA and include a certain minimum percentage of green areas for all future town plans .
All engineers should design creatively and innovatively not only for decorative reasons , but to tackle the global warming problem as well .
So do you know why Singapore's Minister Mentor , Mr Lee Kuan Yew wanted Singapore to be a garden city since she gained independence ?
Nowadays , the living standards of human beings has been improved due to the changes in time .
Everything has changed drastically from the past untill now .
Therefore , the requirements of people in terms of technology has increased .
For example , in the past mobile phone has been designed to the size of a brick , and now mobile phone has been designed into a small and stylish design with high technology function , such as touch screen function .
However , the engineering design process for innovation has been hampered in my home country , Malaysia .
According to the The 6th International Malaysian Studies Conference 2008 , "it is true that Malaysian SMEs do not see innovation as part of their business" .
In my home country , I feel that the 2 main problems that hamper the engineering design processes for innovation  are the lack of government support in engineering innovative design area and social problem .
In my home country , I feel that social problem could be one of the main problems that lead the engineering design process for innovation hampered .
For the people who live in the urban area , it is quite obvious that most of the houses are designed in the same design by the developer , as the society doesn't have high expectation in unique houses design , as long as it meets their basic requirement , low price and large housing area .
Same to other engineering sector , as money remain the main concern in everybody's mind .
Many people feel that engineering design is not very important in their daily life , as it cannot help them to earn big money .
With this , the older generation feels that a functional product is more important compared to a well designed innovative product .
Old generation also do not encourage young generation step in designing area because they feel that designing cannot bring a good future for them .
Hence with this , the young generation will follow the pathway of their parents , for example , work as businessman .
Next , the other main problem is the lack of government support in this area , as the resources in the engineering design process for innovation and the expertise in this area are very limited in my home country .
People who are interested in engineering design area do not have any opportunity to explore in this area .
For example , the PETRONAS Twin Tower , the iconic building of Malaysia , government has bought the design from a Japanese architect and built it , as we can see that opportunities are given out to foreigners instead to local people .
These 2 problems may lead to some of the future local talented people give up on pursuing their interest in engineering design processes for innovation .
Some may seek  other solutions such as for those who can afford the  fees will go overseas for better education , and work there , as theywill have more exposure and opportunity to  in design .
According to the Australian Education International , "There were almost 21 ,000 Malaysian student enrolments in Australia as at the end of October 2008 .
This is 1 ,000 more enrolments than the same period last year , and represents almost 7% growth" .
Whereas for those who could not afford to study  overseas for higher education , may end up in give up their ambition .
Besides that , the export rate of Malaysia's products would also be heavily affected , such as the automobile sector , as it would slowly be outclassed by other innovative products from other countries .
In conclusion , innovative designing doesn't come into consideration in designing a product for most engineers in my home country and their main target is to meet their client requirement .
With this , if nothing has been done to solve it , in future the engineering sector in Malaysia would be seriously affected , compared  to other more advance country .
Technology is the power to make one country strong .
Since China has developed a lot in the last decade , its economic strength has increased significantly .
However , as President Hu (2007) says in the Seventeenth National People's Congress , China is still weak in independent innovation .
Since then , it became a big task to implementing the strategy of putting a lot of efforts in technological advancement .
China has learnt a lot from other countries , but is lack of its own inventions .
The reason why my country does not make a big progress in innovation area is because of the weakness in education system and limitation in economic support .
In this paper , I will discuss on two basic causes: education problem and economy problems , and explain the effects these two problems cause .
First , education is a big issue a countryt government should improve to make citizens more talented and creative .
Exam-oriented education is the main education system in China .
It inherits traditional education from thousands years ago: "life depends on one examination" , which pushes a lot of pressure on shas becomes .
China is a cimplementry with limited jobs .
The only wayeffort a good job is to enter a good university , which makes the exam becomes more and more difficult in order to find most talented students .
However , students lose their creativity and innovation since they have soaked in the exam paper for a long time .
Moreover , teachers and parents only care about t exam results instead of their talent , which will make students only good at exam .
Furthermore , the education in university is not good .
Some universities want to increase their popularity , so they approve more master degrees and PHD degrees , which decrease the level of master degree students .
In recent news , there is no difference between the employment ratios of graduate students and masters .
This will bury a lot of talented people .
Finally , many student choose to go oversea to finish their education or start their careers , which made China lost many talents .
In short , the education system in china killed talent of innovation .
Beside the education problem , the lacthe government for design projects is also a big problem .
As President Hu (2007) writes in his NPC report scientific development should depend on the situation of country development .
Overall saying , the productively level in China is not high , and the socialist market economy has established initially .
However , the gap between rich and poor tend to increase .
Government has spent lots of money on urban and rural development .
Moreover , as China become more open to the world , she faces constant intensifying international competition .
Comparing to some developed countries which have advantage in economic scientific , we will suffer more predictable and unpredictable risk .

All of these make the development of engineering design stuck in a difficult situation .
