I believe the current human need that should be given priority is the need to reduce traffic congestion as it has always been a problem left unresolved for many decades .
With the help of engineering design process , many of such problems that we face in this present world can be minimized and resolved .
Engineering design process flows through these stages of defining the problem , gathering information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution and finally testing and implementing of the solution .
Firstly , on defining the problem of traffic congestion and also gathering vital information on this human need .
The problem of traffic congestion is constantly happening throughout the world everyday and it is affecting the way we carry out our daily routines .
This problem leads to the loss of precious time that could be put to good use and it also affects the progression of work and major projects .
With this loss of precious time , we often have to make use of extra time to make up for the time lost in traffic congestion .
Thus it will also create an impact in the financial losses and holding back economic growth throughout the world .
Secondly is the generating of multiple related solutions , analyzing and selecting of a suitable solution .
One of the solutions that I came up with is to have a signboard attached to all traffic lights; this will indicate to all the drivers whether they should avoid travelling on certain roads that may have traffic congestion .
Although there are radio stations to report on traffic congestion ,  some drivers may not tune in to radio stations or may not know of other alternative ways to redirect their paths .
This results in accumulating the length of traffic congestions as the number of cars keeps piling up after it occurs .
This solution of indication can prove to be very useful , when an accident or traffic congestion occurs .
The sign board will have the three arrows mainly representing , left , straight and right directions .
For example in an event of traffic congestion , the central transport system will be notified in the shortest possible time .
Signboards that are in the area of traffic congestion and other possible affected areas would be updated and give suggestions to the drivers to redirect them away from the traffic congestion .
This central transport system would also provide an update for the traffic police; so that they may go down to rectify the situation .
Lastly is the testing and implementing of the solution .
With this idea of the solution , I would build a 3D replica of this system to test on the effectiveness in reducing traffic congestion .
I would continue to improve on the design with more stringent tests and experiments which will give me the most suitable configuration for a specific area on the island .
In conclusion , I see the need to improve on the transportation system around the world .
Using engineering design process , we could design a specific solution to allow the transportation system to have a faster and smoother flow of traffic .
As we advanced into dramatic change of technology , the world has made a breakthrough in science and achieved a milestone of success .
It is  that engineers are those who are playing a crucial role in the society while the world is expanding unremittingly .
This is because engineers are quintessential in designing products that meet human needs .
They utilize their knowledge to come up with new innovations which will give a fresh impetus to enhance the development .
In my opinion , current human need that should be given priority is having electric vehicles that operate entirely on battery power .
As we all know , petrol is a non renewable natural resource and hence changes of its price have a big influence on the world economy as all main transportations are using it as fuel .
Therefore , it is necessary to design vehicles that move by low cost electricity .
Electric vehicles can receive their power from a number of renewable sources that is transmitted into the vehicle through the use of electrical cable and stored in battery .
Through this , the dependence on  crude oil can be minimized gradually .
In addition , air pollution is worsening nowadays .
By using environment friendly electric vehicles , the pollution problem can be alleviated by decreasing the smog level .
Furthermore , electric vehicles typically have less{noise pollution}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Noise_pollution] .
According to Seyyed Khandani , Ph .D . , there are 5 steps for solving design problems so that the process meets the need .
Firstly , engineers must recognize the need and define the designing problems such as how far the driving range of a fully charged electric vehicle is and etcetera by gathering enough information , running experiments and performing computation .
After that , engineers should start gathering pertinent information to reveal  facts about the problem .
This step is quintessential as it makes sure that their efforts and time  are not wasted at the wrong place .
Then , engineers will use creativity to generate ideas that solve the problem by starting with existing solutions then trying to figure out and improve the weakness in those solutions .
Later on , engineers will combine their new ideas and tools into the existing solutions and finally unique solutions will be formed .
At this stage , engineers might have multiple solutions .
Hence , they have to analyzing their solutions and select the solution which is best suited for implementation .
The last step is to test and implement the solution that involves testing , construction and manufacturing of the solution to the design problem .
If the car passes all the tests , a new electric car is finally formed and will definitely meet the need .
Besides , engineers need to consider  the electric car's safety , cost and effects on the environment so that this engineering design meets the need .
For instance , ifthe electric car  design's cost is over budget , engineers might rather design combination electric-gasoline vehicles to cut down the cost .
In addition , safety of the car should be given priority in order for the design process to meet that need .
Thus , engineers have to confirm that the car is safe to be driven by running a few tests before the cars are supplied in the market place .
Engineers also have to run experiments on the emission from the electric carso as to make sure the car is  environment friendly .
To drive home the point , the engineering design processes will definitely meet that need if engineers persevere stoically whenever they meet failures during the process .
Engineers have a constant need to upgrade current technologies to keep up with the ever-evolving world .
Being a problem solver only means that they will constantly face a slew of problems that abound in the world .
Changes in the climate in recent times show that the Earth is embroiled in what is called global warming .
The need for more sophisticated technologies to reverse this damage caused to our environment has set engineers racing against the clock .
The war on terror never ceases as well .
The need for state-of-the-art weaponry and stealth vehicles has posed a tough problem to engineers as well .
However one human need that is most prevalent and disconcerting is widespread hunger .
The need for engineers to come up with food technologies that may fill the stomachs of hungry children is overwhelming .
Indeed , we have to solve this pressing problem before it becomes too late .
Another way to increase food production is to engineer grains and seeds so they produce more within a shorter timeframe .
They are genetically modified with desirable qualities to meet the needs and conditions of the place they are grown .
Crops are more robust and can withstand harsher conditions like strong winds , while carrying more grains atop their stem .
By genetically engineering many of our foods , we can actually increase food yield from the same plot of land in a shorter amount of time .
However , Khandani mentions that the solution is not perfect and we should keep revising and "going back to the drawing board" .
Our solutions are not one off .
We need to constantly modify them even as they bring about more problems .
In short , man will always find ways to solve our daily problems through engineering .
When people around the world are dying from hunger , engineers can be called to present possible solutions and find the best and most efficient way to deal with them .
Global warming is an exceptionally severe problem facing the world today .
It is a process whereby the Earth's temperature increases , which is attributable to the use of fossil fuels , and industrial or agricultural processes .
Man-made emissions release a great amount  of carbon dioxide which causes a large buildup of "greenhouse gases" .
One factor which contributes to the buildup is from power plants or factories .
Another major factor will be the carbon dioxide emitted from cars .
Though it may only contribute a small percentage to the buildup in the gases ,  as time goes by , the increase in the utility of cars will become a big contributor to global warming .
Thus a group of students from NUS came up with an idea of creating an eco-friendly urban concept car with zero carbon emission .
This group consists of students from the School of Design and Environment and also the school of Engineering .
This car was built from scratch with its body designed and manufactured by the students themselves .
It runs on a hydrogen fuel cell that drives the electric wheel hub motor .
In this way , it will achieve twice the energy efficiency compared to the burning of gasoline in the internal-combustion engines .
In addition , with the design of the eco-car , mechanics will have easier access to the components for trouble-shooting .
With such attractive advantages installed in the eco-car , it might slowly be introduced to the society as a form of transport so as to solve the problem of global warming .
Because the eco-car runs on hydrogen gas , this will lead to the reduction in the usage of petroleum and thus save the natural resources for better usage .
However , there will also be disadvantages with regards to the creation of the eco-car .
Though the eco-car may seem to be the perfect solution to solve the problem of gasoline combustion cars , it will cause conflicts with many car manufacturers such as Toyota or Nissan .
With this invention , the governments will strongly recommend civilians to replace their current vehicle with the eco-car .
As a result , there will be a negative impact on the sales for the current car manufacturers .
When all of these happen , it will also affect the economy and also the jobs of the sales personnel .
Another disadvantage of the eco-car will be the resources that it uses .
Take gasoline combustion cars as an example; when it is running low of fuels , the driver can easily top up his vehicle at any petrol station nearby .
But as for the eco-car , the resources it uses may not be readily available , so it will not be very convenient .
Although the eco-car may be a great invention to remedy the problem of global warming , we should not solely depend on it .
Instead we should put more focus on the other factors which have greater impact on global warming
Most of the products today are created using a conventionally generated technology but there are a few products which were invented in a skunkworks environment .
For example , the first laptop computer was produced in a skunkworks environment because Toshiba , a Japanese electronics company , had suffered huge losses with its failure in the desktop computers' market in the 1980s .
So , the company refused to invest in the research and development of the laptop computer (Rogers) .
Even though conventionally generated technology is more popular nowadays , both ways of production have their own advantages and disadvantages .
Both ways of production are similar in their motive .
The intention of the teams is to research and develop their product hoping to come up with a new invention  or make the existing products better .
For example , a research and development team with financial support from the company research on the company's product and try to improve the existing products and create new products for the company .
It is almost the same for the team working in skunkworks environment .
They believe that the products they are working on will be a success even though they are not supported by company .
However , there are differences between the two of them .
Firstly , they differ in financial aspect which is the main aspect .
Productions using conventionally generated technology have full financial support from the company .
With the financial support from the company , the research and development team can have a comfortable and productive workspace .
On the other hand , there are no or very little financial support for the team working in skunkworks environment .
Therefore , skunkworks environment usually is not comfortable to work in .
Besides what is mentioned  above , the team using conventionally generated technology can afford state of the art devices which will increase the efficiency of research .
In contrast , the team working in skunkworks environment not only do not have those devices , but they have to bring their own equipment to work .
The second difference between productions using a conventionally generated technology with those from skunkworks environment is the creativity of the team members .
The main problem of the team in skunkworks environment is the financial problem as mentioned earlier .
The lack of money causes them to consider other options when inventing a product .
For example , they might look for used items to be use as inputs for their production .
In contrast , the team with full financial support do not really need to consider the cost of research; therefore they most probably could not come up with products which are more cost efficient .
Finally , after comparing both  ways of production , we will realize that both also have their pros and cons but in my perspective , production in the skunkworks environment is better mainly because of the freedom in inventing new things .
Without the supervision and control from the sponsor company , team members are able to explore new ideas that might not be parallel to the company's main objective .
That is why there is a significant number of people who are willing to work in the skunkworks environment despite the problems they face .
This is because these people believe that their inventions will benefit mankind .
Helen Keller made her miraculous breakthrough as she spelled W-A-T-E-R when water ran over her hand .
The importance of water lies in the fact that  it comprises 70% of a person .
Without food , one can still live for a few days .
However , without water , life will be shortened to one day .
No doubt water is the basis of life on this planet .
In the Maslow's Hierarchy of needs , water , together with breathing , food , sex , sleep , homeostasis and excretion are the ground basic of human needs .
Therefore it should be given priority as a current human need .
However , in real life , a problem may not be solved as expected by implementing a standardized model .
For example , for an idea of water conservation to be developed further , scientists need the financial support from government/corporations .
Self-funded projects are usually carried out in skunkworks environment where researchers have to bear the consequence of failure .
Furthermore , the whole process in the model which Khandani has proposed may take many years to be completed , making self-funded projects less viable if there is still no support along the way .
Another kink in the process is the selection of solutions .
Corporate bodies tend to look for solutions with maximum profitable returns .
Government entities also need to justify themselves if they opt for more expensive solutions which may/may not generate returns .
For example , compared to the water transfer project from another location with more abundant water supply , distillation of sea water will be a more expensive solution though it has the potential of solving the problem in the long run .
In conclusion , water is the urgent need for human .
To solve water scarcity with the engineering design processes is viable , but limited in its actual application .

This is called Design Process  which engineers use to approach problems .
According to Khandani , there are five basic steps used in a design process .
This five basic steps can also be applied to problem solving .
The first step is to identify the problem , which usually involves the process of knowing what the customer wants and what problems they are encountering with existing products .
Secondly we need to gather more information , like previous failed attempts at solving similar problems , whether a need for a new solution is needed or not and the problem with existing solutions .
.
Lastly testing and implementation is done on the solution .
All the steps are important as safety , reliability and economic factors are included and may have a huge impact on many peoples' lives .

Time is often wasted in the administrative part of the process .
Nurses in a clinic had to flip through archives for a patient's information manually .
Therefore a more efficient way of allowing people to see doctors is needed .
Engineering process can be applied to meet the needs of people and solve the problem .
After the problem is being identified , more information needs to be gathered .
Khandani said that inexperienced designers will skip this step and proceed to finding solutions , but efforts spent in gathering information will pay out later in the design process .
Engineers found out that in clinics , human errors of the nurse is present , resulting in longer queues .
So solutions like computerizing all administrative work and the processing of patient's medication is being implemented .
In this way , human error is eliminated and people can see the doctor and get their medication in a faster way .

As a result , WHO says heart attack as the 21st century's plague and calls for more attention on the heart disease .

That is heart pacemaker .
the heartnumbersisinthreatendiseasesWhat is a heart pacemaker ?
Basically , it is a medical device which uses electrical impulses , delivered by electrodes contacting the heart muscles , to regulatebeating of the heart .
With the help of pacemaker , patients whose heart rate are too high or too low can maintain an adequate heart rate .
According to classification , Heart pacemaker belongs to ergonomics which is a study of how people interact with machines .
As an ergonomical design , the primary requirement is safety .
Because the heart pa pacemakershould be implanted into patient's body before it can work well , it asks for higher safety requirement .
The material used to make a pacemaker is silicon , titanium steel and special artificial plastic , both of them is quite friendly to patients' internal environment and will not cause injury or other diseases to humans .
What's more , nowadays , the heart pacemaker is quite small with thickness only 10mm and weight only 40 grams .
Such kind of little size ensures a low possibility of hurting the human organs .
All in all , proper material and suitable size make the pacemaker much safer to use .

Technical innovations are essential to the development of a nation .
However , making innovations is not just as simple as thinking about new ideas and carrying them out , but something requiring complex engineering design processes .
According to Khandani , the process of solving design problems can be generalized to five steps: "define the problem , gather pertinent information , generate multiple solutions , analyze and select a solution , and test and implement the solution" .
In most cases , it is not easy to go through all these steps successfully due to the hindrances from various sources .
In this essay , I will talk about two problems which have been greatly hindering such engineering design processes in China .
One is the brain drain problem and the other is the capital problem .
Since China adopted the reform and opening-up policy in 1978 , countless promising students have gone abroad for further study .
China has spent a lot of resources to educate them and expects them to reward the society after further education .
Unfortunately , lots of these talents are unwilling to return to their motherland because of the much  superior conditions in developed countries , which causes the brain drain problem .
As we can see , the five steps of engineering design processes for innovations given above all involve qualified well-educated people .
Such a brain drain makes China fall into a severe shortage of talents who are necessary for the implementation of any stage of the process .
Since there are not enough people for engineering design processes , China is not capable of making enough innovations for higher living standards in a short time .
As a result , more educated people will go abroad , which aggravates the brain drain problem in turn and exerts a greater negative effect on the process .
Secondly , China is still struggling to meet its people's basic living needs as a developing country .
Every year China has to spend most of its revenue on fundamental infrastructure and national defense , etc .
Therefore , unlike US and developed European countries , not much capital can be spared for engineering design processes for innovations , which causes the capital problem .
As we all know , it is often costly to gather sufficient valuable information in this information age and carry out a new policy in today's materialistic society .
Thus in the course of engineering design , one usually needs much money for getting pertinent information and testing and implementing the solution .
Without enough useful information , people cannot come up with best solutions .
Even if they have made it , testing and implementing it is still impossible without sufficient capital .
Besides , when people are aware that not much capital is available , they may not choose the most efficient but more costly solution in the course of 'analyzing and selecting a solution' , which may bring about bad effects in the long run .
Therefore , the capital problem hampers engineering design processes to a very great extent .
Actually , the brain drain problem and capital problem have been restricting China's engineering design processes greatly these years .
But the government has done much to relieve these two and other similar problems .
I have the confidence that China will overcome these hindrances one day .
At that time engineering design products or systems will boom to meet people' needs .
Einstein once noted that"the god doesn't play dice ."
From his perspective , since every natural event happens as a result of a cause or collective causes , I am not sure if it is proper to refer to the discovery of LSD , short term of Lysergic acid diethylamide , as an accident .
At least it is not an intentional consequence like the discovery of risperidone , a medicine for mentally disordered people .
In the following paragraphs , I shall touch on the similarities and differences of their pharmaceutical effects , controllabilities and consuming groups .
Firstly , despite the fact that they focus on different aspects pharmaceutically , LSD and risperidone actually share some similarities on medical effects .
They both have strong corrective influence on mental disorder .
In 1993 , risperidone was approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration ,  for the treatment of schizophrenia , and bipolar disorder in 2007 .
Especially for pupils with age 13-18 , risperidone is the only approved drug agent in America .
On another hand , LSD was once widely used for treatments of mental disorder as well before  , which would be illustrated in the second paragraph .
However , LSD affects people in alcoholism in a positive way which is unachievable  for risperidone .
Secondly , the controllability of both the  short term and long term  effects of LSD and risperidone vary greatly .
Risperidone always gives a constant performance .
Beside its expected medical effects , the side-effects are also predictable .
The most common side effects include severe anxiety , akathisia , sedation , dysphoria , insomnia , sexual dysfunction , low blood pressure , muscle stiffness , muscle pain , tremors , increased salivation , and stuffy nose .
But for LSD , the physical and psychological effect vary greatly from one to the other , and is highly dependent on the amount of dosage , consumer's personality , mood , the surrounding environment and other variable factors .
Most importantly , the social issues arising from consumption of LSD are unexpected .
The typical physical effects are dilated pupils , higher body temperature , increased heart rate and blood pressure , sweating , loss of appetite , sleeplessness , dry mouth , and tremors .
Apart from physical and psychological effects , LSD also triggers intense spiritual experience which leads consumers to illusory images and feelings .
There is a great number of people who believe that LSD serve as a divine vehicle  which transports the consumers to the outer-space where the gods live .
There were several cases of suicide before the United States government banned LSD in 1966 .
Lastly , the consuming groups of LSD and risperidone consist of different people with different purpose , resulting in different social problems .
Normally , the consumers of risperidone are psychological patients who are seeking effective treatment .
However for LSD , it was mainly regarded as a means to get high by the American hippies .
Even the poets , painters and musicians tried to seek inspiration by consuming  LSD .
As a result , the consuming group of LSD is more complicated than that of risperidone .
According to the above , even though riperidone and LSD share some similarities in their pharmaceutical effects to a certain extent , they are different from each other in terms of controlability of side effects and their consuming groups .
The sport is one of the most important things in human beings life .
But , unfortunately , it is inevitable to get injured when we do sports .
Knee injury is a common injury in many sports , for example , basketball , soccer , skiing and etc .
And also , it is difficult to recover because of the complexity of the knee .
Among the various knee injuries , the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury happened in most cases .
If the sick do not recover completely , it is likely for him to get injured again at the same place .
Even worse it could affect his daily life .
So  ,the treatment of the ACL injury is considered as a very important problem in sports medicine .
ashownTo make the artificial ligament meet the need , scientists considered it in many aspects .
First , the artificial ligaments should they haveuse rerupturedreaction  .Second , it should be very strong  ,flexible and to abrasive  ,so that it can ensure thahimselfpatient can play sports in the normal level .
Third  ,it should have the ability to grow and combine with the reptured ligament .
After a few years research , an artificial one called LARS ligaments came out .
The LARS ligament is made of industrial strength polyester fibers .
The polyester fibers and the original design of the knit have been tested for rupture , stretching and wear .
The result has showed atat the LARS ligament is extremely resistant to flexion , traction , torsion , and resrupturedretching .
Also , the design has biocompatible properties to human beings tissues , because the intra-articular longitudinal fibers allow for tissue in growth .
Compared with the human ligaments , the LARS ligament is much more tensile .
Futhermore , if we use LARS ligaments in the reconstruction of cruciate ligament , the time of recovery can be reduce a lot .
The professional player who uses LARS ligaments can return to the courshown or 4 months after the surgery while the classic method will cost 6 to 12 months to recover .
This technology shows its advantages with the classic method .
And the invention of it gives the players and sports enthusiasts a better choice when they suffer the injury .
At the same reducedthere is also a pitfall about the artificial ligaments .
Because it appeared less than 20 years and we can not predict what could happen after 30 or 40 years , which artificial ligaments have been used for .
I think as it improves a lot in the future , it can take possession of the classic method finally .
STS , Science and technology studies , is the interaction of scientific research and social , political , cultural values .
Having taken shape in the 1960s , STS provides us another view of the innovation-development process in terms of social construction of technology .
Among thousands of technologies , laptop , one of the most important innovations in twentieth century , is a good example of socially determined technology .
The laptop , firstly manufactured by Toshiba in 1985(Rogers , 2003) , ten years after the birth of the desktop computer , has again brought about a tremendous revolution in our lives .
The idea of making a laptop was inspired by mainly three social factors: demand of customers , support of technical stuff , and source of funding .
wasthe laptopconditionsSecondly , the man power that provides technological support plays an essential rule to the innovation of laptop .
The idea of designing laptop was first not approved by Toshiba  , while Mizoguchi , the chief designer of laptop did not give up .
He organized a group of talented engineers who were selected from the military projects witharoseong professional skills and knowledge and started the research secretly .
After 24 months of hard work and thousands of times of practice , the first laptop was born .
The support of technical stuff brought a successful step towards the final goal of promoting and producing laptops .
Lastly , but nomainhe least , the source of funding made the production and sales roleainops possible .
Thougthe laptopresearch team has made ta laptopa of laptop came true , the laptop woubutt be finally put into production wthe laptop a large amount of money .
To the disappointment , the plan of producing the laptops had again been rejected due to the small potential market estimated by the company .
A new obstacle was in the way of Mizoguchi's laptop plan .
Fortunately , the potential of this innovation drew the attention of Nishida , anstaffrt at marketing .
With his cooperation , the sales of laptop had been guaranteed and the production was finally executed .
Last but not least of laptop cannot be separated with the three main factors .
The demand of customers inspired the deshaders , the support othe laptopnical stuff put the idea into practice , and finally , the source of funding ensure the sales .
Withouttheiry of these three factors , the dream of owning a laptop will be still a dream now .

There are two different perspectives for the development of technologies: technological and sociological point of view .
When viewed from the technological point of view , it can be seen that the technology , consisting of hardware and software , is shaped according to how technology has improved .
However , that is not true as it can be seen that considerations like market and cost are not taken into account .
Therefore the sociological factors like affordability and user-friendliness are used to determine the development of technologies .
An example of such technology is the Global Positioning System (GPS) .
The technology consists of numerous satellites that orbit around the Earth that provide its users with various functions ranging from navigation to prediction of weather , thus , widely used in transportation industries .
The military also uses GPS in various methods from missile guidance to enemy tracking .
Besides that , the public has also benefited from this technology as it can be used for search and rescue purposes and also as a navigation aid .
Numerous factors have brought about the development of the GPS: mainly the government , military and public demands .
First , the government had a great part to play in the development of the GPS .
In 1983 , the U .S . President Ronald Reagan decided that the GPS will be made available for civilian use after the Soviet Union shot down a commercial airliner which had navigational difficulty , bringing about the death of more than 200 passengers .
Since then , the government realised that the GPS is the key to providing a dependable way of navigation and thus , pushed for its development .
Currently , the GPS is widely used in the aviation and maritime industry so that similar incidents can be prevented .
Second , the military brought about revolution in the usage of GPS by integrating missiles and other artilleries with GPS which improved the accuracy and efficiency of the weapons .
Besides that , it allowed the soldiers to do scouting and accomplish their tasks at night through GPS- receivers that coordinated their movements with command posts .
When the GPS is paired together with satellite cameras , enemy tracking and identifying targets are made convenient .
Next , the public demands have pushed the benefits of the GPS further when gadgets are integrated with GPS to provide constant relative motion and time coordination .
Using such products , users are capable of navigating in any part of the world .
As such , even the user's estimated time of arrival can be calculated .
Such products have saved lives when rescuers tracked the GPS signals from their gadgets to locate the victim's whereabouts , bringing the success rate of search and rescue mission to a higher level .
Today , the GPS is a widely used technology in not just the transport industry , but also in military and civilian purposes .
It has also since developed into a cost saving technology as it saves not just petrol and gasoline , but also time and effort .
Besides that , many victims owe their life to GPS when rescued from disasters and accidents .
It has been published that the GPS will fail in the year 2010 , however , with its wide range of purposes and benefits , efforts are being put in place by various governments around the world to not just keep it functional , but also to improve its capabilities .
Therefore , we can expect to see more GPS-related technology in future .
The development of technology has benefited human beings in both scientific researches and daily life of human beings .
With the invention of microscope , scientists are able to observe molecules which form all matters .
Besides scientific researches , inventions and new technologies have indeed brought convenience to human beings .
With mobile phones and Internet around , individuals are connected to the whole world with a simple click .
As Rogers stated in his book , development of technologies is stimulated either by scientific research or by social reasons .

Serendipitous scientific discoveries often refer to those unexpected surprises scientists came across fully by chance in the area of science and technology .
These unplanned serendipitous "accidents" often turned out to be good results .
Actually a lot of major discoveries made by excellent scientists are unexpected gifts from good luck .
Some of them did change the course of history and still have a significant influence on the entire human race today , even the whole environment where we settled in .
For instance , the discovery of cosmic background radiation , the invention of the first microwave oven and the discovery of electromagnetism are all serendipitous .
In particular , pharmacology perhaps the most common fields where serendipity occurs .
The discovery of penicillin--a fairly common antibiotic in drug stores--is one of the most famous .
After the discovery of the new substance , he came to the problem of how to cultivating the mould and how to isolate and purify the antibiotic agent .
Both of them seemed to be quite difficult .
Fleming continued his research and trial for a long period of time with his assistant , but to no avail .
During World War II , the work was taken over by two other scientists and they soon found a technique to purify penicillin and started the mass production .
It saved a lot of soldiers' life in the war .
Of course Fleming's contribution was never forgotten .
He shared the Nobel Prize for physiology/medicine with the two scientists .
It is quite interesting that penicillin was once discovered by a scientist cultivateusly .
However , what would have happened if Fleming had never been concerned about the search for the cure or he had had no interest in this area at all ?
What would have happened if Fleming had ignored the contamination and just dropped it into the cleaning mixture ?
The whole world would have waited for more decades to see the discovery of penicillin .
It is just because Flmanys intriguedliveshis research that he could notice the mould contamination on the bacteria culture and stretch out further reflection on it , while others couldn't .
Hard work finally pays off .
Serendipity only favours those with high aspirations and determination who whole-heartedly dedicated themselves to their beloved career .
Century after century the engineering design processes for innovations speed up all-round social progress and create the civilisation we have today .
As far as I am concerned , the so-called engineering design processes for innovations actually means that the whole industry depends on the creative and passionate engineers to design new products or systems which can perfectly meet the society's demand .
In this way , the society is pushed forward .
That is why we say that scientific and technological process and innovation is the basic motive to promote productivity development .
However nowadays , we may find that these processes seem not so significant .
Perhaps some people will say that it is reasonable that the society is now in a relatively stationary stage since the modern scene was marked by tremendously and ever-accelerating change in the past few years .
But it is not the main reason in my opinion .
Just take my home country for an example .
The most serious problem which hampers the innovation process is that the technological base is relatively lower than the developed world .
Since industry innovation is a process with very high risk .
In other words , it runs a high risk of failure .
From the research report given by the government we can see that more than eighty percent of the companies involved in the research have some experience of breaking off or failure .
Because of the low technological base , the possibility of coming across with some bottlenecks in the innovation process is higher .
In this way , companies may dare not to pump money into the development of new products .
As we all know , enough funds are the basic guarantee for innovation .
Once the process is lack of funds , there is little hope for the process to continue .
Thus , the money we have already pumped in just becomes sunk cost , which means the company losses .
Then , this becomes a vicious circle .
High risk means less money pumped in .
Less money leads to higher risk of failure .
Finally , fewer and fewer companies will be willing to go for the innovation process .
Another very important factor in my opinion is about the lack of researchers .
As is known to all , the key to technological innovation is talents , especially those high-quality compound talents .
But the fact is that the lack of researchers has become the 'bottleneck' restrictions for most of the companies in China .
Statistics suggest that the R&D teams in companies tend to reduce .
What is worse , there are many companies which even do not get a R&D team yet .
Besides , the not so high salary can hardly attract high-quality talents to join the research team , which is also due to the lack of funds which I have mentioned before .
All these make it even more difficult for the innovation to born the fruit .
Anyway , we are living in such a world where everyone is down-to-earth .
People are always tending to do things that will benefit .
As a consequence , R&D may become the last choice for some talents .
benefit themselvesalways tend bearnot-so-high anhaveWorse stilldecrease in numberlacking innot dareAll in all , it is the low level of technological base and the lack of excellent researchersstableificantly hamper the whole process for innovation .
To improve the present situation , it is better for the companies to pump in more money to the process and attract more talents to contribute to the technology progress .
Additionally , companies should import the advanced ideas and skills from the developed world to improve the world , since l skill of themselves .
Only in this way can we expect a better environment for innovation and more significant scientific and technological progress .

In the old days , taking photos was a complicated process which was almost performed solely by professional technicians .
A photographer had to not only adjust all the settings manually , but also print the films with chemicals called film developer in a darkroom .
However , the recent two decades witnessed astonishing innovation in photographythe development of digital cameras (DC)which has made taking photos accessible to non-specialists .
This development came as a result of people's demand for more convenient photo-taking techniques .
Consumers' desire for more convenient usage and better photo quality shapes the development of DC technology .
Consumers' pursuit of better phodo quality also drives the innovation advanced DC technology .
The quality of a photo is mainly determined by the resolution of a camera .
To improve resolution , a company needs to conduct a considerable amount of research , including generation of new ideas , technology breakthroughs and reinsidetitive experiments .
carried aroundcess is hard , but companies are shas also resulted to sacrifice their time and labor for the development , since the better the resolution , the more customers will be attracted , and the more profit the companies will make .
Original digital cameras had a very low resolution .
For example , the first commercial DC , Dycam Model 1 , provided only 90 ,000 pixels (Kamps , 2008) .
After half a decade , the number changed to 1 ,000 ,000 .
The most advanced DCs today support more than 12 million pixels , which is over 100 times that of the original ones .
Such remarkable improvement shows the strong impact of consumers' requirement on pushing forward the DC technology .

The technology of nanorobotics (nanobots) is a modern invention that deals with the making of robots at  atomic level .
The development of nanobots came from the advancement in nanotechnology , and the idea of nanotechnology was proposed by physicist Richard Feynman in a speech in 1959 .
Nanobots are programmed to do specific tasks , and they are small enough to enter a human body .
These tasks are increasingly needed to improve the level of technology in medical treatments today .
Research in nanobots is intensively carried out in this area .
Hence , development in the technology of nanobots today is largely shaped by the demands of patients with illnesses that require better treatments .
The development of nanobots today is largely affected by the increasing medical needs in cancer treatment .
There are many injuries and illnesses that originate from nano-scale processes .
For instance , cancer cells damage the cells within the human body , and they cannot be treated effectively with the conventional treatment like chemotherapy .
Today , drugs for treating cancer are delivered to specific tissues by nano-particles within the body .
According to a journal by Amir Gur (2007) , "small-sized robots are already involved in spinal surgeries , and the use of nanobots allows minimising damage to the tissue in the procedure ."
The introduction of nanobots in medicine and biomedical research creates possible solutions to treat illnesses that macro-scale techniques would be impossible to achieve .
Vincent , D . (2008) .
The invisible revolution .
Nature , 451 , 770-771 . doi:10 .1038/451770a .
Furthermore , the early boom of nanobots was largely dependent on the policies of the government .
Research on nanobots requires huge funding .
Without the help from the government , the advancement would be slow .
According to a journal article by Vincent Dusastre(2008) , "the lobbies convinced the Clinton administration to launch the National Nanotechnology Initiative in 1999 ."
This was the catalyst that accelerated the development in nanotechnology .
For fear of losing to other nations , the government increases the funding to private and public sectors in the R&D of nanotechnology , and this in turn brings to the global development and innovation of nanobots .
Another important factor that is changing the landscape of nanobots is economy .
Our economy is greatly dependent on energy and raw materials .
Nanobots would be helpful in making materials that are efficient in storing energy and converting energy sources .
There are many benefits in developing nanobots .
They can be used to create a system that is affordable , fast , and compact .
Nanotechnology has ventured even further recently .
It is described as a new and important way of solving the problem of storage system and energy crisis .
According to an article , $20 million was granted to Stanford - one of 46 Energy Frontier Research Centres - to help the engineers to find energy  at the nano-scale .
In Conclusion , the technology of nanobots is a modern innovation that allows human to process tasks that are beyond what our beareye can see .
This technology is largely applied in the field of medical treatment today .
With  continuous development , nanobots would improve the lives of millions in the near future .

In Singapore , there are many creative ideas to solve the problems that are encountered in daily lives .
However , only limited number of the creative ideas have successfully completed their engineering design processes and hence launched in the market .
A large number of the creative ideas have failed in their engineering design processes because there are some problems in Singapore which may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
The main problem , however , is time constraint and this problem can be seen to significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations in companies , such as Creative Technology .
In Creative Technology , time constraint has significantly hampered its engineering design processes for innovations .
This time constraint is caused by competition from other companies which sell similar products and they may also be in the midst of designing similar new products as Creative Technology .
Therefore , Creative Technology has to work against time to complete its engineering design processes for innovations so that it can launch its new products earlier than the other competitors and hence , earn the rights to claim that the innovations belong to it .
Mr Sim Wong Hoo , chairman and CEO of Creative Technology , commented that being awarded the ZEN Patent to Creative Technology had helped it to protect its invention  in portable media players .
He then further commented that in order to be awarded the ZEN Patent , it had taken a major investment of time and effort by a group of its research and development engineers (Creative Technology , 2005) .
It can be seen that because of time constraint , the research and development engineers from Creative Technology had to sacrifice most of their time just to focus on the engineering design processes for their new product , ZEN , so that it can be completed as soon as possible .
Furthermore , because of time constraints , certain processes in the engineering design processes may be compromised  .
Therefore , time constraint is the main problem that may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
Another problem is that the designing process must  keep up with the rapid developments in technology , for otherwise by the time it is completed , it may already been rendered as obsolete .
According to St . James Press (2004)   , Creative Technology began manufacturing its own CD-ROM drives when it could not keep up with the rapid developments in drive technology; however , it was forced to abandon the effort , dumping its inventory and taking a loss of more than $30 million in 1995 .
From here , we can see that the Engineering design processes must be constantly  updated , for otherwise more problems may occur  that may significantly hamper engineering design process for innovations .
In conclusion , the two problems discussed   may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
That is the reason why it is never simple to have many innovations in Singapore .
However ,  there are many people who overcame the difficulties and successfully completed the engineering design processes for innovations , and I hope more people can learn from their experiences .
Since the 1970s , communication technology has made great advances , offering capabilities that are unthinkable a decade earlier .
The last decade of the 20th century saw a flood of new communication technologies entering the marketfor both the office  and home , according to the Central Statistical office .
This is the result of a better  understanding of people's needs and what technology they really want to use .
One of such technology is the mobile phone .
In the past , communication was slow and unreliable  .
In  most  cases ,  information would not even reach the desired destination .
As a result , people wanted a form of communication that was fast and reliable .
This  changed dramatically with the introduction of the telephone .
Firstly , it took away the necessity of having acommunication medium  , which made it more reliable .
Secondly , the telephone used electricity , which was literally accessible to every household and this helped messages to be passed around more quickly .
However , this was still not enough .
People then saw the need to be able to communicate on the go .
The society wanted to be able to communicate at anywhere and anytime and with anyone it wished .
This resulted in the invention of wireless telephony , commonly referred to as the mobile phone .
The introduction of the mobile phone allowed people  the ability to pass messages to one another quickly and accurately whenever they wished .
This meant that office workers were able to speed up communication and circulate information faster to allow new ideas to be spread quickly .
Being able to do this would  benefit the company and  have a positive impact on the economy .
Furthermore , even the military has benefited from this wireless telephony .
Through the use of wireless communication , soldiers were able to communicate with one another swiftly and with 100% accuracy when information was being passed around .
Due to the convenience of having a mobile phone , the number of mobile phone users has increased drastically over the years .
By 2002 , Japan had 55 million mobile phone users (out of 122 million) , China had over 200 million mobile phone users (out of 1 .3 billion) and about 90% of Finland's population had a mobile phone , according to the BBC in 2003 .
The mobile phone underwent further developments to enhance its features to suit its consumers .
As a result , by 2003 , the mobile phone was presented as more than just a tool for calling someone .
By integrating a variety of functions in a single handset , the mobile phone became a multimedia information processor fitted with an array of conveniences .
In 2003 , Nokia had a vision that the mobile phone will become a life management tool for business , work and leisure .
It will also take on the roles of  being digital navigator and a lifestyle accessory that will help individuals control and enrich their lives (Nokia , 2002) .
Looking back at the evolution of communication , the mobile phone is one that has been shaped by social factors .
Constant demands from the society caused mobile phone companies to continue developing newer phones that would satisfy their consumers and allow them to bridge space and time to such an extent that people can communicate more efficiently .
The health ministers of various countries have shaped the development of the new vaccine .
The virus is very contagious  , and thus this leads to its spread in  society .
There is a large demand for the vaccine by  various government bodies .
This could be seen  when for the governments of France , Belgium and Finland intended to purchase 50 million , 12 .6 million and 5 .3 million doses respectively (Cormac Sheridan , 2009) .
Another reason the government bodies to be concerned with the development of the new vaccine is the fear of mutation .
As  many more are going to contract the diseases , there is a higher  chance that the virus will mutate into a stronger strain .
The health ministers around the world are  developing  a vaccine  for the virus before it spreads too widely or mutates .
The public and the H1N1 patients are the other groups that shaped the development of the vaccine for the H1N1 virus .
Although figures from the WHO (World Health Organisation) have shown that out of the 160 ,000 cases only 1 .200 cases are fatal , people continued to be in fear .
This is due to a previous outbreak of another flu virus which has taken many lives .
Due to  fear  , there is a high demand for the vaccine , and as a result the pharmaceutical companies are given plenty of  business opportunitties .
Thus they became very concerned with the development of the vaccine .
Besides the large demand , any new development would also bring about a rise in the  pharmaceutical companies' share prices .
For example , on April 30 2009 , when Lipoxenpharmaceutical company announced the positive preclinical results for  an enhanced influenza vaccineand added that the technology should also work against the new swine flu strain , Lipoxen's share price went up from  6 .62 ($10 .11) to  21 .75 ($33 .23) (Brady Huggett , 2009) .

Both the military and civil demand for precise navigation promote the development of the Global Positioning System
Nowadays , almost everybody knows about GPS (Global Positioning System)  , and it has made a significant difference in our daily lives  ,  from guiding family hiking to airline navigation .
However , a lot of people may  not know that it is  a seemingly  new and advanced technology that has already  existed for more than forty years (Lowry , 2006) .
It is the military and civil demand for precise navigation that stimulates the development of the GPS technology  to what  it is today .
Besides  military demand ,  public appeal for a safe civil navigation has also promoted the development of the GPS .
In 1983 , a US civilian airliner KAL 007 was shot down by the Soviet Union Air Force by mistake when it lost its way and flew into the airspace of the Soviet Union without authorization .
Thus ,  the US civilians  blamed the government for its ignorance in the safety of civil navigation .
In order to calm the masses and avoid such disasters in future , the then president Ronald Regan promised to apply GPS to civilian users as well as military once it was completed (Lawry , 2006) . . And due to the immense pressure of the public , the US government turned off the SA (Selective Available) in May 2000 .
This leads the the GPS to develop from a critically military supplied technology to a  system for both civilian and military use(Gibbon Media& Research LLC , 2007)
The idea of GPS is first put forward in the nineteen forties .
Since then , both the military and the public have demanded for precise navigation  , which promoted  the further development of GPS and make it into what we see today -a precise dual-use global positioning system for both the civilians and the military forces .
Similarities and differences between technologies developed via research and via serendipitous discovery
Technology is the practical application of knowledge  , especially in a specific area .
Many technologies were developed via research or the interplay between scientific investigations and practical problems while some were serendipitously invented(Rogers ,2003) .
This essay will compare and contrast the discovery of penicillin and the development of embryonic stem cells  , in terms of impetus of the invention , involvement of the researchers in the innovation development and the of the inventions on society .
There are similarities and differences between technologies developed via research and  serendipitous discovery  .
In  future , more and more useful technologies will be developed and they can give us a lot of benefits .
One of the many innovations that help to make our lives convenient is "Refrigeration" .
This is a technology that is shaped by a society in the past which was desperate to preserve its food .
They used blocks of ice as cooling aids to preserve their food .
Ice from mountains or snowy areas were transported to warmer regions where they were wrapped in cloth and placed in cellas .
The ice box was made  of a metal linked box insulated with cork or snow dust with one compartment to put the ice and another to store the perishables .
However , this system was not very efficient and was inadequate .
The civil war in the US interrupted the ice trade .
Successive warm winter for a period of time created severe ice shortages leading to an unprecedented demand for new methods .
The desperate need for a way to preserve food as well as the idea of cooling to prevent the food from spoiling helped to shape the technological innovation of refrigeration .
The idea of refrigeration is built based on the principle that when  liquid changes to  gas , it absorbs heat as it expands in a self contained cycle , and  air or other fluid surrounding the device can be reduced in temperature .
Using this principle ,  the gas refrigerator and the electric refrigerator were built  .

The success of a technology not only depends on how well it resolves the targeted need but also the social considerations it incurs when being introduced to the consumer market .
"The network of power" , a book by Thomas Hughes ,  addresses one pertinent problem on the way we view technology .
We tend to be blinded by the benefits of a technology and overlook the importance of understanding it as an entire system .
By looking at the development of automobiles , from electric vehicles to gasoline-powered cars , we are able to understand how economic factors have influenced oil magnates , car manufacturers and the government  , which ultimately shaped this technological innovation .
To sum up , oil companies , car manufacturers and the government have considered issues from the economic point of view and realised that the consequences of making electric cars  are too drastic .
The oil and automobile industries are too lucrative and at the same time crucial to the overall economy  , so much so that issues regarding pollution and environment are secondary to it .
Hence , the automobile technology is ultimately shaped by oil magnates , car companies and the government  .
In Singapore , there are problems which could hamper the local engineering design process for innovations .
The two problems are attitude and funding  , which have severe impact on the local engineering process for innovations .
The engineering design process for innovations can be broken down into 3 stages:  creativity ,  process and  materialization .
The two problems will be elaborated on how they impact the engineering process for innovations .
The first problem that will hamper the local engineering process is attitude .
According to "Singapore's innovation journey" an article by Patrick Lambe , Singaporeans cannot innovate because they are conditioned to be followers rather than creative idea generators .
This could be  due to personal and  social attitude towards innovation .
We shall begin with the individual attitude and examine it hampers the local engineering process for innovations .
Singaporeans tend to be prudent and stable .
Being prudent , Singaporeans tend to be less adventurous when compared to their western counterparts .
One common scenario would be for parents to advise their children , especially those with tertiary education , to get a decent job and contribute to the family's expenditure .
If their children want to go into the research and development profession  , such as to become  a researcher in a university , they will be discouraged .
Children who later grow up into adults do not do not utilize their creativity  , which may be helpful in the engineering design process .
The second problem that could hamper the local engineering design process is funding .
Often , inventors who use their engineering talents to come up with innovative products fail to secure funding .
A good example is the formula racing car of the National University Of Singapore (NUS) .
The initial stages required the professor and his students to each come up with three hundred dollars to purchase the necessary parts .
However not all inventors have the luck of achieving initial success and thus receiving funding .
Funding affects all the three stages of engineering process for innovations .
Failure to secure funding will turn away inventors with engineering flair
In conclusion , the two problems that could hamper the local engineering process for innovations are attitude and funding .
They will have a severe impact on the three stages which make up the local engineering process for innovations .
Innovations can come about through serendipity or research .
Serendipity is the accidental discovery of a new idea , and the 3M post-it pad is one of such example .
On 4 July 2009 , The Straits Times reported the development of a new product to help the deaf experience sound , the Haptic Chair , by researchers from the National University of Singapore (NUS)  .
Both innovations bring benefit to the lives of people .
On 4 July 2009 , The Straits Times newspaper reported that researchers from the National University of Singapore (NUS) .
invented a chair that turns sounds into vibrations to help the deaf experience music .
This was done as a result of NUS PhD student Suranga Nanayakkara recognising the need for the deaf to experience sound .
The Haptic Chair , which comes with back cushions and a footrest , is embedded with speakers that amplify vibrations caused by sound waves .
The product is made with the understanding that sound waves , apart from travelling through air , can also travel through solid matter (Grace , 2009)
The difference between  serendipitous discoveries and  researched technologies are the types of resources invested in their development .
A serendipitous discovery happens by chance , and has no pre-allocated funds or project timeframe to  adhere to .
The post-it pads came about because the 3M researcher happened to have some non-permanent adhesive , and he decided to come out with a new product on his own .
Before he gave the post-it pads to others , no funds or expertise were assigned to him for the post-it's development .
In the case of The Haptic Chair , a team of researchers had worked together with Suranga Nanayakkara .
A lot of time and effort were put in by the team before it could actually come out with the product .
Research technology and serendipitous discoveries , despite being different , share certain similarities .
Both are by-products of people being able to recognize human needs .
For the 3M researcher , he has has identified the need to stick notes on paper without leaving adhesive stains to damage original documents; for the NUS student , he identified the need to create a product to aid those with hearing problems .
Both technologies benefit the lives of people , and have potentials for profit .
In conclusion , we have come to learn that new technologies can come about via research and  via serendipitous discoveries  .
What we do need to bear in mind is this: technologies of both natures serve different groups of people in different ways , and they ultimately bring benefits to the lives of people .
Innovation occurs when there is a need for a new product or service  .
When someone faces a problem and motivates people to find  ways to solve it  , new ideas are generated .
Technology is very much related with innovation , as we need  equipment to solve problem .
Many technological innovations are made via scientific research or  the interaction of scientific investigations and applying them on practical needs and problems .
A new idea is created  from the rigorous process of research .
Others may be serendipitously invented .
Serendipity means unexpected discoveries  or   inventions .
These findings are often unpredictable  .
Serendipitous discovery can happen to anyone as well as in any fields .
In conclusion , innovation occurs at anywhere and anytime .
The exchange of ideas and information plays a very crucial part in the process of generating new ideas .
Through constant exchanges of information about  problems , human needs and wants , we can come up with better ideas to solve problems and make our world a better place to live in .
Technology has made our life easier .
Rogers (2003) defines  technology as a design for instrumental action that reduces the uncertainty in the cause-effect relationships involved in achieving a desired outcome .
Most of the inventions were developed by application of scientific research on practical problems or needs .
However , some unpredicted technologies were invented by accident  .
For instance , the stove was invented via research and the microwave oven was serendipitously discovered .
Both the stove and the microwave oven are used to cook our daily meal at home but they were discovered in two different ways .
We will use these stages to compare and contrast the two different technologies .
Recognizing a problem or need is the very first stage of the process .
In the past , people used fire , coal , or heat from the sun to cook .
the stove was invented because people need to cookby applying heat to  the food .
In contrast , the microwave oven that we are using today was a side product of the microwave radio signal in radar for military purpose .
Dr . Percy Spencer discovered the microwave technology by serendipity when he found  that the candy bar in his pouch  melted when he was experimenting with his new magnetron .
The history of the stove and microwave shows that serendipity and researched technology have come from  very different beginnings .
Serendipity comes from a branch of a problem or need , while research technology comes straight from the problem or needs .
Next , when the basic and application research  are established , the development of the product will begin .
The first known stove was built on the ground with sticks forming a tripod to hold the cooking pot above the heat source .
After years of innovations and experiments , the stove nowadays is safer to use and more convenient .
Likewise , the very first microwave oven was very big and bulky .
Today , it has become very compact and light , and features like the automatic functions  allow users to cook with just pressing a button .
Therefore we can see that both the technologies share the similar development path .
One similarity between both categories is achieving the aim of improving the quality of life for  people .
The Bionic eyes are being developed as engineers thought of ways to improve visual displays in various fields , such as gaming and  the aviation industry .
They hope to develop lenses  that  will allow players to be entirely immersed in the game  , and  to move without any constraints .
For the aviation industry , it is hope that through the new technology , pilots will be able to know the speed of the plane almost immediately .
The  3M's Post-its come in very handy when people want to remind themselves of various events or when people want to comment on essays without  writing on them .
It is convenient to use as it can stick to almost any surfaces and be peeled off easily without leaving any marks .
However , there are also differences between the two categories .
One of the differences is how the technologies came about .
For the Bionic eyes , it was done via research after it was seen in a movie called 'Terminator' , where a woman is able to zoom into places that are far away .
This gave the engineers the idea of turning what they see in  movies into  realities .
So , they worked towards this goal and developed Bionic eyes .
Post-its was discovered accidentally by researches who were trying to find bonding agents that can be used to bind papers firmly to a surface .
It was a by-product of what the researcherswere trying to achieve .
It was once deemed  "worthless" until people found uses for it and it has become one of the most commonly used products in our daily life and one of the products that make the most revenue for 3M .
In conclusion , both technologies , be it developed via research or  from a serendipitous discovery ,  have achieved the aim of improving the lives of people .
Initial acceptance of the two technologies may be different ,which in turn  depends on the mindset of the public  .
One of the earliest inventions  was the wheel .
We continued to push for technological advances in different aspects of our lives so as to enjoy a better standard of living .
Over the past  decade , a new term "skunkworks" has surfaced .
This term describes the existence of a small groups of researchers who are not bound by corporate rules and politics , whereas conventionally generated technologies tend to require ensuring the survivability of the head company .
There are several similarities and differences between the technologies generated by  "skunkworks"  and  conventionally generated technologies .
Products generated by each environment may appear similar  , but they actually differ in many ways  .
The  environment plays an important part in shaping their distinctive features .
The second similarity is that for both environments , generally large amount of money and support has to be put in by the head company .
This is simply because in order to produce cutting-edge technology , large amount of research has to be done .
Hence , long hours are required before any results are visible .
A few examples include GM developing the first electric car named IMPACT , Apple developing their first Macintosh computer and Xerox's attempt at developing the world's first personal computer .
Thus , it is evident that huge amount of financing and support is generally required in both environments .
The second difference between the two environments is the working environment presented to the engineers and researchers .
This has resulted in very different products being developed in each environment .
The "skunkworks" environment has been able to provide the developers with the  flexibility and freedom required to break traditional barriers and develop cutting-edge technologies .
Furthermore , "skunkworks" environment is very stressful as compared to the traditional corporate environment due to the lack of financing and hence , the room for error becomes much smaller .
The last and perhaps the most significant difference in the environments has to be the difference in the features of technologies developed by each environment .
The "skunkworks" environment has generally been able to develop technologies which are well received by the public and continue to bring success to the head company .
An example of such a difference is again present in the IMPACT car and the Toshiba laptop .
Under the stressful skunkworks environment , the researchers from Toshiba are able to think critically and design a product to meet the needs of the society .
On the other hand , the researchers from GM have failed to realize that the public and society were not ready for their invention .
The limitation of their product also meant that it was only open to a small market .
In conclusion , it is clear that the technology churned out by a "skunkworks" environment differs greatly from that of a conventionally generated technology .
The features and characteristics of the "skunkworks" technology set it apart from conventionally generated technology .
An innovation may come from different ways .
The idea of such an innovation can emerge though some research or it may be from some serendipitous discovery .
That is to say , the common viewpoint is not totally true .
On one hand , one technology may be developed and polished through numerous research and experiment with a lot of effort .
On the other hand , some technology may be discovered purely by chance .
Two typical representatives are the electric cars and the Warfarin .
The electric car is invented by some hardworking engineers , while Warfarin is discovered serendipitously .
Although they are initialized differently , there are several similar stages of developing process .
