There are numerous problems that are faced by the world today .
Governments of different countries may have different agenda lists; however ,  aging population is definitely an issue present in the list .
Singapore makes it her top priority to create a safer environment for the elderly to live in .
Engineers play a huge role in assisting the government to achieve the aim of creating a better and safer environment for the elderly to live in .
With a safer environment , the welfare of the elderly will be improved and less social problems will occur .
Some examplesxamples of such engineering design are the building of ramps at the main entrance of the flats ,  handrails at the side of the stairs and providing buses for the wheelchair bound .
The pressing issue is to build a conducive environment for the old .
For example , the Housing Development Board (HDB) had implemented several designs to improve the convenience of the elderly , such as installing lifts on every storey and building wider internal corridors and hallways .
The designs had  proven to be useful for the flat holders  when the HDB first implemented them .
Thus , the government had implemented the Lift Upgrading Programme in 2001 , so that the owners have direct access to the lift at every floor .
According to Khandani (2005) , after each solution is generated , it must be tested and implemented to see the effects brought on by the solution .
In this case , there are positive effects associated with the engineering designs made for the HDB flats , and thus the government had implemented the solution throughout Singapore .
Generally , the engineering design process consists mainly of the five procedures mentioned by Khandani (2005) which includes defining the problem , gathering the relevant information , thinking of solutions to the problem , analyzing  and selecting one solution , and testing it out by implementing it .
Although all the steps mentioned by Khandani(2005) are crucial for designing a good engineering product , the most important step is to test  the solution and see  the public would response to it .
This is because every engineering product is designed to serve the people and  to bring a greater convenience to their lives .
In conclusion , engineering design is a never ending process , and it is the duty of the engineers to keep  coming up with solutions to solve the pressing issue of creating better products for the aging population .
An increasing  death rate due to traffic accidents has become a major problem in many countries .
The World Health Organisation (WHO) states that traffic accidents are in the ninth position among the reasons which lead to death .
When considering the European Union , 1 .3 million road traffic accidents occur each year , resulting in 1 .7 million injuries and over 40000 death annually( International Journal of Health Geographic) .
Even Singapore which implements strong traffic laws and regulations has also been affected by this traffic accident problem .
The accident rate per 10 ,000 vehicles has increased from 2 .34 in 2006 to 2 .60 in 2007 in Singapore ( Singapore Police Force) .
So , to reduce and solve the problem of traffic accidents , a new traffic system should be formed and it should be the current human need that should be given priority .
The engineering design process will be able to meet the need to form a new traffic system .
The  three important features in the engineering design process will cater to the need to form a new traffic system .
Another important feature is the idea generation process .
This is a very important process as it is the point where we will be able to come up with solutions to the problems .
In the process , we will be able to analyse the statistics/surveys that we have obtained and generate new ideas to solve the problem .
These solutions may include devices to identify speeding vehicles and  to make sure that there is sufficient spacing between vehicles .
The Netherlands was the first country to implement such road safety devices and they prove to be helpful as  road accident rates dropped by 25% in 2000 as compared to accident rates in 1985(citation) .
Gordon Walls states that the purpose of traffic planning is to provide a safe , convenient and economic movement of vehicles .
From this we can understand that it is essential to come up with a system which is useful in various ways .
So it is important to come up with ideas which will be  useful and economical  .
Thirdly , analysing and select the solutions will be the next step .
It is the point where we will  selecting the solution which best suits the current situation  .
The solution is then implemented and continuously reviewed .
In the field of information technology , there is a clear boundary between conventionally generated and skunkwork developed technologies .
Specifically , in the operating system (OS) market , there are two well-known examples--- the Mac OS developed by Apple and the free open-source Linux OS .
These two OS reflect the obvious difference between the two ways of developing technology in their hardware platform: interface and price .
The first main difference is their hardware platform .
While the Linux OS is simply no more than a software and runs on PC platform machines , the Mac OS is exclusively designed for the Mac platform manufactured by Apple .
Since Apple designs the hardware for Mac , it makes the operating system perfectly compatible with the machine .
That is one of the reasons why Mac OS has always been praised by art designers for its smooth performance and high definition graphics .
Meanwhile , Linux , coded in the skunkwork environment , does not have that much funds and ability to compare with Mac at that level .
However , Linux has its own advantage .
The second difference between Mac and Linux lies in their structures .
As an open source operating system , Linux' users are free to explore and modify the systems .
Mac users , on the other hand , are restricted from the entering the system files .
This makes the Linux OS more popular among computer programmers and others who work in the field of information technology .
According to Forbes , Linux is currently the most popular operating system for supercomputers .
It is agreed by programmers from largest IT corporations such as IBM and Sun Microsystems that Linux has so far the most suitable environment for high-performance computing .
Finally , there is the problem of security .
This is what Mac and Linux have in common .
Despite their different structures and platforms , the two operating systems are quite secured .
By not allowing modification of system files , a third party cannot hack into a Mac .
As for Linux , open-source only means users can read its source file .
With its secured configuration , it is still extremely hard to penetrate a Linux server .
On the other hand , the sociology aspect has to be considered as well .
Being a skunkwork project , Linux  has the advantage of price .
It is actually the only free operating system available .
However , this does not guarantee its popularity .
The requirement of a high level of computing  knowledge makes Linux not popular among the average computer users .
Mac , in contrast , was designed for  entertainment and it is easy to use .
Apple is also very efficient at advertising their product worldwide , and so even when Mac and its software are much more expensive than for a normal OS , they are still one of the most wanted .
Furthermore , with the  coming price drop , Mac is expected to be the operating system of choice for education and business .
It is not possible to define whether the conventionally generated OS or the skunkwork developed one is better .
However , each technology has its own pros and cons .
Therefore , the choice should be made based on the user's needs .
If it is a computer for an IT engineer , the choice would be Linux .
Oppositely , if the purpose is mainly for entertainment or paperwork , Mac would be the option .
Berman (2006) defines a hybrid car as one that encompasses an electric motor together with a conventional gasoline engine , with a computer controlling the interaction between the two .
They use fuel cells that convert hydrogen to electricity , which is then stored in batteries and is used to assist in the power surge required when climbing a slope or overtaking .
But why do we need hybrid cars when we have cars that run just as well on gasoline ?
Gasoline cars are already an integral part of our economy and lifestyle , providing us with mobility and personal freedom .
However , research shows that the world is fast approaches two billion cars (Sperling & Gordon , 2009) , and this poses a problem in the form of environmental pollution as well as causing adverse effects of our economy .
Environmental problems surrounding car production and usage are becoming an increasing threat to our world today .
According to Nieuwenhuis and Wells (1994) , "In the early 1900s , when gasoline cars starting gaining popularity , resources like gasoline and steel could still be found in abundance" (p .53) .
An increase in the number of cars on the road will mean an increase in the amount of oil burned , which in turn contributes to more air pollution .
Globally , transportation produces a quarter of all emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2) , the primary green house gas , with some 10000 billion cubic metres of exhaust fumeapproachingleased annually (Nieuwenhuis & Wells , 1994) .
Every time a car is driven on the road , it is actually draining the world'scausestional petroleum onsources , and contributes more to global warming .
Materials like iron , steel , plastic , and glass , are mined from the Earth and are used in the construction of cars (Nieuwenhuis & Wells , 1994) .
At the end of the car's lifespan , those materials that cannot be reused are then thrown in a scrap pile , contributing to land pollution .
Hybrid cars solve part of these problems by using more reusable material like plastic , as well as making them lighter and rely more on electricity to reduce fuel consumption and carbon emissions (Berman , 2006) .
While the damage done by our continued reliance on cars and gasoline is severe , it is still not too late to do anything about it .
In order to prevent more serious economic and environmental damatic reductions in oil use and carbon emissions have to be made within the next decade .
Policy makers and carmakers need to change the vehicles they design and the energy and transport systems they are embedded in .
Relying on hybrid cars might just be one of the most feasible solutions we can look at to save our planet .
When a new virus or bacteria is introduced and the human population has no immunity , a pandemic will occur , causing widespread mortality .
In each century , influenza pandemics have occurred around 3 times , when a new strain of the influenza virus caused simultaneous deaths worldwide (Roche , 2006) .
Therefore , it is crucial to come up with solutions to prevent the spread of diseases .
For example , Penicillin , which was discovered serendipitously , helps to prevent one from getting bacterial diseases .
Furthermore , during the recent outbreak of the Swine flu , Tamiflu has been developed to treat it .
Both Tamiflu and Penicillin benefit the human population though they work on different micro-organisms .
Most  bacteria have  rigid cell walls , which prevent them from bursting when they are placed in solutions of lower salt concentration  .
Penicillin inhibits the formation of cell wall , which is essential for the survival of bacteria , and thus kills them off .
However ,  viruses do not have cell walls and thus Penicillin has no effect with them .
In contrast , Tamiflu works well on the influenza viruses .
An influenza virus is able to infect a host cell due to the presence of a neuraminidase .
Tamiflu is  neuraminidase inhibitor ,  and thus the virus is unable to exit the host cell and dies (Roche , 2006) .
Moreover , the virus is also unable to spread and infect other cells in the body .
Due to the distinct difference in the structures of virus and bacteria , Tamiflu and Penicillin perform differently on them .
Ever since the introduction of Penicillin , deaths from infectious diseases are very rare .
Nowadays , majority of the people die from circulatory diseases and respiratory diseases (World Health Organization , 2003) .
Penicillin  has the ability to cure people who are from the once-fatal bacterial diseases .
Similarly , Tamiflu has also proven to be effective in the treatment and  prevention of influenza in adults and in children .
Roche announced that two new observational studies had shown that influenza patients treated with Tamiflu had significantly higher survival rates than untreated patients and the analyzed outcomes targeted on two different groups -adults and children diagnosed with the highly pathogenic A (H5N1) avian influenza and adults hospitalized with seasonal influenza ("Two New Studies ," 2009) .
The human population has indeed benefited from both Penicillin and Tamiflu as the survival rates from bacterial diseases and influenza viruses have increased ever since they are introduced .
Regardless of whether the technology is developed via research or discovered serendipitously , it  hascontributed significantly to mankind .
New discoveries and creations are essential for the progress of mankind .
For instance , there is always a need for new and better anti-flu drugs as virus  mutate very easily and will soon acquire resistance to Tamiflu .
Resistance to Tamiflu has been detected in a patient in Singapore who was down with the pandemic Influenza A (H1N1) bug and similar cases have also emerged in Hong Kong , China , Japan , Canada , the United States and Denmark (Andy , 2009) .
Perhaps in a few years' time , the real cure for influenza virus will be discovered serendipitously and till that day , influenza virus will continue to be a threat to us .
A skunkworks is an especially enriched environment that is intended to help a small group of individuals design a new idea by escaping routine organizational procedures (Rogers , 2003) .
The 5th most influential man of this century and president of Apple Computer , Steve Jobs , created one of the most famous and successful skunkworks .
The fruit of this skunkworks is the popular Macintosh computer , which is in great demand worldwide till date .
According to Macworld , the iMac , i .e .
desktop version of the Macintosh computer , has become the biggest-selling personal computer of all time within three years of its launch (MacWorld , 8/15/01) .
In fact , Apple is the number one computer company in both Australia and Japan .
Obviously , there must be a reason behind the popularity of the Macintosh computer as compared to a conventionally generated innovation such as the Sony personal computer .
It would be most appropriate to explain this phenomenon by comparing the key features of the two different types .
Also , the next key feature would be the working conditions of a skunkworks as compared to a conventional environment .
About fifty highly dedicated young computer designers worked day and night at a secret lab that was located behind the Good Earth Restaurant in Cupertino (Rogers , 2003) .
The young computer designers did not require any permission or papers to go ahead with the procedures .
All of them were committed and goal-orientated .
With the leadership skills from Steve Jobs and resources provided to the skunkworks , the Macintosh computer was introduced in 1984 .
It only took 4 years for the skunkworks project to be completed .
Therefore , the skunkworks was hugely credited for its success .
However , in a conventional environment , there are restrictions and standard procedures to follow closely .
This will cause distractions and time wastage during the course of production .
On the whole , a skunkworks generated product would have a higher chance for consumers to adopt and accept as compared to a conventionally generated product due to the unique features of a skunkworks .
In addition , there could be an increase in the number of companies that opt for a skunkworks .
The serendipitously discovered technology is the smog-eating cement while the technology found via research is the carbon-dioxide eating cement .
The two technologies vary in many aspects .
One such aspect is the support that these technologies receive among people .
In the case of the smog eating cement , the technology received some negative feedback due to its serendipitous background .
Thomas Cahill who is an atmospheric scientist at the University Of California , Davis , criticized that the final outcome of this discovery is uncertain .
He also said that the advantages of this technology are only applicable in some situations (Miller , 2007) .
This shows that people question the validity of the serendipitously discovered technologies .
This is because these technologies are invented accidentally , in other words , by luck .
Majority of people look at serendipitous discovery with distrust as the technology was not invented via research .
Technology discovered through research is the norm and serendipitous discovery deviate from the norm .
Most people think that serendipitous discovery was not well analyzed and hence the inventors might not know the side effects that the technology might cause in future .
However , the case is different for the carbon-dioxide eating cement .
It was positively accepted by most people .
In fact , this technology was accepted by cement industries and environmentalists incorrect in-text citation .This clearly illustrates that a well researched technology gathers more support as it is perceived that a technology that has solid proof (via experimentations and research) has lesser unexpected outcomes in future , compared to a serendipitously discovered invention .
However , there are similarities between the two technologies .
Both the technology aims to improve the quality of air .
Basically , both try to reduce air pollution .
Furthermore , Howard Liljestrand (an expert in environmental chemistry at the University Of Texas in Austin) mentioned that the "cost-efficiency" of both the technologies lies on how the technologies work in the future (Povoledo , 2006) .
Hence , both technologies aim to improve air quality and have their own limitations on their performance in future .
To sum it all , a well researched technology receives a lot more support among people than a serendipitously discovered technology .
Furthermore , it also has a wider range of funding partners than the serendipitous discovery .
Although they differ in some aspects , they are similar in their goal: To improve the air quality .
In my opinion , serendipitously discovered technology faces problems when it comes to gathering support and marketing while a well researched technology faces problems during the research and development stage .
Therefore , technologies discovered in both ways face problems in different areas .
There is no advantage whatsoever for either technologies .

Societal structure plays an important role in determining the evolution of a new innovation .
Norms and values from a social system will often heavily influence the technological design process .
This part of the development process is crucial to ensure that the innovation will be readily accepted by society .
The online video sharing website , Youtube , for example managed to grasp this concept and gained immense popularity within six months , hitting a peak of 4000 from 200 daily page views per million in May(Anderson , 2006) .
Youtube founders targeted the problems that most people faced; difficulty in sharing videos online and came out with many innovative solutions .
This resulted in a platform that enables web surfers to upload and play their videos online easily .
Being community-oriented , quickly catapults it to become the most popular video sharing site on the net .
In this present age , prevalent use of internet in many societies gave rise to a new "N-generation" .
Society's fast paced environmental and working conditions constantly mould the N-generation .
As such its behavioural pattern is one that expects fast efficiency and convenience as a norm .
One important feature of Youtube pertains to this idea and also contributes greatly to jumpstart its success .
The website is developed to integrate Macromedia flash player software tool that enable internet users to view youtube videos from their web browsers directly , without having to download it to their computers and view it with secondary video playing programs such as window media player (incorrect in-text citation) .
Thus , the time and computer hardware space needed to view a video is effectively  shortened to provide greater convenience .
This convenience and ease of use , appeals to many internet users who do not have very fast and stable internet connections by allowing them to watch their videos online as it downloads .
Also to incorporate efficiency into their design further , Youtube uses a standard video format that delivers reasonable video quality while minimizing download data size so that users will not experience choppy video pauses during video streaming .
Many N-generation web users also regard entertainment quality and media accessibility highly .
They access many other internet websites and are adept at using a wide variety of internet media devices .
This prompts Youtube to improve their content accessibility by designing its website to synchronise and be able to be viewed on other web surfing platforms such as the iphone , Apple TV (Apple , 2007) , PS3 and , Nintendo Wii game consoles ({Los Angeles Times}[HYPERLINK: http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Los_Angeles_Times][LAT] , 2009) .
Besides that , Youtube also implemented a function to embed their video in social networking websites such as facebook and blogs to allow for better accessibility to their media (Youtube , 2009) .
Furthermore , Youtube offers "high definition" video playback in which videos are shown at a higher resolution and superior sound to cater to high entertainment quality demands where enjoyment takes priority .
(Youtube , 2009) .
Greater accessibility unfortunately , also has a downside to it .
Since anyone can upload any video on to Youtube and allow anyone on Youtube to view it , many uploaded videos containing inappropriate content are easily accessible to minors .
For many societies , this is especially intolerable since it will violate their moral standing , conservative culture , religion and law .
Consequently , Youtube was faced with much criticism from the web community but it dealt with this problem promptly via introducing its content censorship policy .
Firstly , its terms of service forbid the uploading of offensive materials .
Secondly , adult web users are required to log in to verify their identity to view content classified as inappropriate for minors .
Lastly , it also relies on users to flag videos containing inappropriate content online which will activate a 24 hour review team to deal with it (James & Nicole , 2008) .
The three prong approach effectively clams down any users that try to violate the rules .
There is also another problem which stems from importance of copyright in society .
The exclusive right granted to the orginal original author to be credited for his work is valued to the extent that it  . . . became a law in many societies .
However , a huge amount of videos posted online consist of television shows , music videos , movies and animes that were without the permission of their creators .
This entangled Youtube in a series of pressing legal lawsuits from major media companies such as Viacom , Mediaset and EPL in an effort to protect their copyright material (BBC , 2008) .
Subsequently , this forced Youtube to introduce its "Video ID" system which will check uploaded videos with a database of copyrighted material and deny any uploading if it finds a match (Youtube , 2009) .
In summary , Youtube has managed to attain its dominant position on the net due to its ability to conform to the taste of its mainstream community web users while at the same time adhering to legal regulations .
It is also intensively consumer focused and very flexibleand is  able to adapt to the needs and demands of internet users quickly .
In addition , regular novel upgrades to its website continue to entice more webs surfers as well as generate more internet traffic to their website .
More advertising sponsors will be attracted to employ their services , and hence , sustain YouTube's continual success .
Youtube has grown so much that it became part of many people's media entertainment and web surfing experience .
With its huge influence on the cyber community , it might even become a platform which in turn will help shape our society in the future .
With this two sub-factors plus the slow acceptance of Bluetooth headset compared to other Bluetooth devices , potential manufacturers of the bike bug are deterred as it is not economically practical to mass produce the bikebikebugs .
It is therefore shown that for bike bugs to be successfully launched into society , much is needed to raise the bikebug's popularity among the public .

Conventionally generated technology and technology created in a skunkworks environment are methods of technology development which lead to the invention of innovations .
However , the processes that are taken through for developing an invention are different .
There will be two illustrations provided to compare on their development differences .
One would be on Compaq laptop computer; another would be on Toshiba laptop computer .
.
In 1982 , Compaq was trying to model the IBM's BIOS System as it was the most popular system in the past (Sysops , 2003) .
Being one of the manufacturers who wanted to outwit IBM , the inventors of Compaq pondered how to develop laptop computers that were faster ,  superior in qualities , and offered additional features to please consumers .
For this case , Compaq was in the mainstream of developing portable computers , but exceeded what IBM had to offer to consumers with  an awesome BIOS System .
In contrast , the problems of inventing the Toshiba laptop computer were not just about excelling in the laptop computer market .
When Tetsuya Mizoguchi , the inventor of Toshiba laptop computer envisioned developing a product which was compatible to an IBM system , he was obstructed by the fact that corporate leaders at Toshiba deemed the development of such a product as difficult (Rogers , 2003) .
Moreover , the company at that time suffered huge losses in marketing their personal computers .
With strong disagreement from the company , Mizoguchi could not realize his dreams of making laptop computers .
In spite of these differences , both Compaq and Toshiba flourished in the laptop computer market with innovations that were laboriously created .
In 1983 , more than 53 ,000 units of Compaq laptop computers were sold (Sysops , 2003) .
In 1986 , Toshiba made tremendous sales of ten thousand units within fourteen months (Rogers , 2003) . .
Though Compaq and Toshiba took different approaches in developing laptop computers , they had the same motive of creating great laptop computers and took part in the big pie in the market .
We are living in the flourishing era of telecommunication with hundreds of mobile phone brands all over the world .
However , Research In Motion Limited , or RIM - a Canadian wireless device company founded in 1984 - , with its smartphones BlackBerry , is still one of the most successful brands in the market with the revenue of US$ 11 .065 billion in Fiscal 2009 (RIM , 2009) .
The achievement of BlackBerry is an example of how social construction has led to the triumph of a technology .
Initially , BlackBerry smartphones were introduced for  plural , politicians and lawyers (McKenna , Waldie , & Avery , 2009) .
Therefore , the emphasized function of the smartphones at that time was to receive and send emails .
Consequently , BlackBerry Enterprise Server (BES) was also released to help  businessmen keep track of their works and keep in touch with their employees .
As the demand of the 'so'called normal users increased , RIM had to evolve .
In fact , according to Dabrowski , the majority of subscribers in the three months which 'ended' on February 29th was "non-enterprise" users (Dabrowski , 2009) .
BlackBerry smartphones were made to become more accessible to the users by increasing the memory and embedding entertaining features such as music player , integrated camera , and 65 ,000-color display instead of monochrome display .
The remarkable launch of Apple's iPhone in 2007 was predicted to outdo the success of BlackBerry smartphones in the market .
Nevertheless , "despite the popularity of Apple's best-selling device , RIM still tops the league of smart phone sales" (Peel , 2009) .
Each group of users had different purposes of using the mobile phones .
The majority of iPhone users were young adults who were fascinated by the appealing appearance and entertaining features of iPhone .
On the contrary , BlackBerry users were into the phone for its outstanding support for working environment together with acceptable features for relaxation .
However , the launch of iPhone "was a boon for RIM as the touchscreen handset raised the public's awareness" (Peel , 2009) .
In 2008 , RIM introduced Storm , its first touchscreen device instead of a physical keyboard .
The release of Storm marked a milestone for RIM when it gave up its well-known QWERTY keyboard to give way for a new trend .
Sarcastically , BlackBerry Storm did not yield the expected outcome .
Its SurePress touchscreen was a hindrance to fast typing .
It seemed that RIM realized its failure in providing the users with a convenient experience using the touchscreen device .
The latter BlackBerry smartphones were equipped with fully-support QWERTY keyboard , a preferable feature by BlackBerry users .
"Perhaps RIM's success continues to be a surprise because it appears to defy the prevailing model for which companies thrive and which companies fail in personal technology" , "but RIM is an example of how smart engineering and a keen understanding of customers can allow a small company to survive in the shadow of better-financed giants" (Austen , 2004) .
In other words , RIM has defied all odds and survived due to its understanding of the needs of its users , the risks from its enemies , and other social factors that could shape the success of an innovation .
Firstly in the case of SwRI , the main objective (SwRI , 2009b) of the development is to produce enhanced exterior coating for electronic components that has to withstand high level of wear and tear .
Some examples on the form of deterioration can be caused by (SwRI , 2009b) over exposure to strong sunlight , corrosion by polluted vapour and severe collision with firm particles .
Therefore SwRI wants to develop a technology that can fabricate extremely robust , impermeable and durable coatings .
On the other hand , CWRU wants to develop (ScienceDaily [SD] , 2009) a packaging technology to maintain the freshness of consumable product .
In order to do so , there is a need to boost the exterior packaging of a material so that the material is able to prevent destructive gases from passing through it and at the same time minimize the use of the material during production .
Next on methodology , SwRI adapts their (SwRI , 2009b) PEMS technology to produce an exceptionally strong and solid nanocomposite covering for the components .
This technology uses global plasma to eliminate unwanted deposits before performing the coating process .
In addition the use of high ion flux allows the layer of covering to be held onto the material more firmly .
Combining this technology (SwRI , 2009b) with nitride-based nanocomposite coating , SwRI is able to produce an even tougher coating than by a single-phase coating .
In contrast , CWRU discovered its technology by means of serendipitous finding , the group realized that (SD , 2009) polyethylene oxide (PEO) crystallizes as a single layer is able to produce extraordinarily gigantic and impermeable single crystals .
This discovery allows the group to minimize the amount of raw material used tremendously and at the same time reduce the passing of particles by more than 100 times , (SD , 2009) .
On the whole , it is not important whether a technology is discovered via research or by serendipity discovery and given a similar technology it is not necessary for them to have similar objectives , applications and methodologies .
This is because the most important issue is that both the technologies are able to improvise the outer layer of materials , making them more durable and long lasting .
For example like the wings of the airplane , with the help of the new discovery they are now more resistible to the air pressure and strong air resistances .
Hence both the developments can be considered big contributions to the world technology .
Robotics technology plays a significant role in the military forces of modern era .
Many nations , especially the United States , are increasingly focusing their research on the field of robotics today for military purposes during war time .
Their research focus is attributable to the change in today's war strategy and tactics where the enemy is no longer easily noticeable in the open as easy targets , as Randall Steeb , senior scientist at Rand Corporation , points out (Voth , 2004) .
As a result , an important technology called the Battlefield Extraction-Assist Robot (BEAR) was invented in 2006 and the invention was caused by a growing demand for robots to perform more perilous tasks in place of the soldiers , particularly in the areas of search-and-rescue and hazardous materials handling (Antal , 2009) .
Firstly , search-and-rescue is a crucial mission that is better performed by robots than the combat medics during times of war .
One of the reasons is the way military robots are built and configured .
For example , robots such as BEAR are built to be more robust than a human being to carry wounded soldiers over long distances and are configured to be capable of overcoming obstacles such as stairs or rough bumpy grounds during the rescue (Atwood & Klein , 2007) .
Another reason is that it reduces the risk of losing a human's life .
For instance , in situations where robots are not used , wounded soldiers will have to depend on their medics to search for them .
During the search , the movement of the medics might draw the enemy's attention and trigger them to attack .
On the other hand , if the robots are used and they are attacked by the enemy , the military team can  simply deploy new robots at strategic locations where the robots can avoid any chance of encountering the enemy .
Another impetus for the innovation is the ability of the robots to handle hazardous materials .
Due to the unpredictable environment of the battlefield , dangerous materials such as hidden explosives can be planted at any point by the enemy .
As such , the robots are needed by the military to help detect and locate the positions of the hidden explosive devices and then defuse them before they explode .
Robots of such configuration like BEAR have also become a part of the U .S . military operations .
Over the recent years , for example , robots with such capabilities have been greatly used by the United States to disable numerous bombs in the battlefield in Iraq and Afghanistan (Minkel , 2008) .
And as a result of their successes , there is an increase in the demand of bomb-defusing robots .
On the whole , changing demands of war strategy today has led to the increase in the research and development of more advanced and sophisticated technological innovations such as BEAR to perform search-and-rescue in place of the combat medics and to handle and remove dangerous explosives and other hazardous materials hidden on the battlefield .
In the years to come , the world can expect to see the use of the advanced military robots to be an integral part of every nation's military force .
The usage of miniature UAVs in the military are common today with the Lockheed Martin and Aerovironment being the two main competitors .
The Lockheed Martin (Lockheed Martin , 2009) has been proactive with skunkwork invention ever since  , pioneered by L .Kelly Johnson .
On the other hand , the Aerovironment adopts conventional processes for invention .
Recent years have shown that the Desert Hawk created under the skunkwork environment has not been performing as well as the Raven made by the Aerovironment .
Lockheed Martin and Aerovironment both built the UAV based on the similar roles and functions for military use .
The primary role is to provide day and night low altitude reconnaissance to provide early warning for any potential threat (Lockheed Martin , 2006 & Aerovironment , 2009) .
The secondary role of the UAV is to provide target acquisition for the manned aircraft to minimise the chance of any danger to the pilot .
The UAV are designed to be easily operated and lightweight for the ease of operating it from almost all terrains and conditions .

Apart from the similar roles , the Aerovironment is able to stand out with their functions .
As the UAV o operate on all types of terrain , conventional landing method was not used .
However ,  has adopted two different ways to land .
The Desert Hawk was designed for crush landing (Staff Sgt .
C . Todd Lopez , 2004) .
This was not very popular among the users as it will affect the durability of the machines .
In contrast , the Raven  use of  advance programming to aid landing by making the UAV to experience deep stalling mode (Army Technology , 2009) to greatly reduce speed and impact for landing .
This function helps the user to reduce cost on maintenance .
With the rich history of the Lockheed Martin's skunkwork environment , everyone would expect them to be above or at least on par with their competitors .
In this example , it was proved that the conventional process of innovation won the competition .
With all the improvement and continuous development , it makes the future generation of UAV to be better than what we have today .

Technology has been evolving fast throughout in the 50 years .
New products are invented every day .
In fact , these technologies may be categorized into two types: conventional  and skunkworks .
One example would be Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop .
Mac laptop was created by Apple in a conventional way whereas Toshiba laptop , the first laptop in the world , was produced in a skunkworks environment .
We may evaluate both of them by investigating their designs , durability , and portability .
As laptop is created for the convenience of the customers , both Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop are similar in their portability .
Being the first laptop producer , Toshiba was successful in turning the idea of portable computer into reality .
The smallest laptop it produced , Toshiba's Libretto U100-S213 , has only the size of 21 .0 x 3 .33 x16 .51 cm and weighs  2 .2 pounds .
Obviously , it is much more portable than many of the other laptops .
On the other hand , Apple has also released its highly portable laptop called Macbook Pro which is the thinnest 17-inch laptop in the world .
Since it has the smallest thickness , its weight is also very small .
Hence , we can see that both Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop are similar in their portability .
However , in spite of being highly portable , Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop have significant differences in their designs and durability .
Apple aimed to make Mac its own unique laptop .
As a result , the corporation spent a lot of time in designing Mac laptop .
Mac laptop is designed to be beautiful in its appearance and advanced in its operating system and software .
Its fashionable design has brought it many customers , especially the young people .
According to a Student Monitor survey conducted in US in 2009 , 43 percent of the university undergraduates in US preferred to buy Mac laptops .
While Apple works hard to ensure that Mac laptop has the most gorgeous design , Toshiba focuses more on the performance instead of the design of the laptop .
Despite the change in size , Toshiba put little effort in changing the appearance of the laptop .
There has not been dramatic changes in the design of Toshiba laptop over the last 20 years .
Besides , the two brands of laptop also differ in their durability .
Since the lifespan of the laptop might be difficult to measure , we can investigate the durability of their batteries .
The battery is the most significant device of a laptop .
Computer engineers always endeavor to enhance the quality of the laptop batteries in order to enable the laptop to work longer without plugging in A/C supplier .
The latest Macbook Pro has achieved the maximum working time of 8 hours on a single charge .
In order to achieve this , Mac has adopted two innovations , which are bigger battery pack of lithium-ion cells as well as adaptive charging .
The battery pack in Macbook Pro occupies the space of the removable battery and obtains  40 percent more capacitance .
In addition , adaptive charging reduces the wear and tear on the battery and gives it a much longer lifespan .
In contrast , although Toshiba has also adopted lithium-ion cell battery pack in its laptop , the longest battery life was measured to be 5 .1 hours , which is much shorter than Macbook Pro .
Therefore , in terms of design and battery durability , Mac laptop has  better performance than Toshiba laptop .
On the whole , there are quite a number of similarities and differences between a conventional technology and a skunkworks technology , just like Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop .
Although Mac laptop seems to have a bigger market , Toshiba never stops innovating new types of laptops .
In addition , without Toshiba , we may not see Mac laptop today .
It is hard to conclude which technology is better: conventional or skunkworks .
They both have their advantages and disadvantages .
As long as the importance of the innovation is highlighted , the development of the technology would be bright .
When the first laptop was developed , Japanese computer users found it hard to work .
This was mainly due to the lack of space for a desktop computer .
Furthermore , most of the Japanese did not have a computer at home .
These factors clearly show that there are favorable market conditions for the development of a portable computer in Japan .
Hence , thesedrove Tetsuya Mizoguchi to develop a portable computer , although the idea was rejected by his company , Toshiba (Rogers , 2003) .
He recognized the market potential of the portable computer and continued to develop a portable computer without his company's knowledge .
The laptop could have  developed much earlier , if Toshiba had taken the risk to develop the portable computer .
During that time , Toshiba had just suffered huge losses with the failure of their latest personal computer (Rogers , 2003) .
Therefore , they were unwilling to take risks , and stuck to known methods that worked .
If the leaders in Toshiba had been willing to take the risk to believe in Mizoguchi's idea , the laptop would have  developed much earlier and will not have taken 2 years to be developed .
The quality of the laptop would have also been much better , as they will have more funds and more talented people to develop the laptop .
After the first laptop was successfully developed , Toshiba still refused to market the laptop .
Fortunately , the idea of the laptop was not discarded , as it was later marketed aggressively by Toshiba Europe , which felt that the portable computer has great market value (Rogers , 2003) .
It proved the Toshiba Company wrong , as the laptop proved to be a great marketing success , with 10000 units sold in just slightly over one year .
This  resulted in the birth of the laptop , as it started gaining popularity .
The laptop's rising popularity led to the innovation of the laptop , as it was a great marketing success .
This has also led other companies to develop their own laptops; so as to gain a portion of the market share .
With more competition , each company  constantly tried to outdo each other by constantly developing and promoting their latest plural .
This trend has stayed on even till today , where we can see many different brands of laptops competing with each other .
The case of the birth of the laptop shows us that a good and feasible idea could be discarded and not be used , if they were not given the opportunity to be developed .
In the case of the laptop , we may not be able to see a laptop today if Mizoguchi did not aggressively push for his idea .
This shows that an idea , even if it is workable and has obvious benefits , will not be developed properly without the support required .
Therefore , an innovation will only become a product , if factors such as economic , government support and usability of the product supports the development of the innovation .
In Singapore , there are two problems that many Singapore engineers may face when designing and innovating .
The first problem might be the lack of key qualities like creativity and an open mindset caused by the kind of education system we have and the environment we grew up in , while the second problem might be the aging population in our country .
These might  be the two factors hindering local engineers from producing potentially creative innovations .
Firstly , Singapore engineers lack the creativity and it might be due to the kind of education system in Singapore .
The lack of creativity will definitely lead to problems faced by engineers when it comes to innovating new products .
Singapore's education system is more curriculum-based or in other words more book-based .
Even though there are "Art" lessons and "Design & Technical" subjects in secondary schools , it is still not enough to allow students to explore and nurture their creativity and designing abilities .
Modules and Subjects that explore a student's designing talent and abilities are only made available during the later years of their studies .
For example , students can only study these modules during their Polytechnic or University years .
Therefore we can see that students are only encouraged to  explore and express their creativity during their tertiary years of studies .
I feel that a short 3 to 4 years of tertiary studies is not enough to properly allow students to fully develop their creativity .
This will therefore affect them when they enter the working society as professional engineers .
Without enough creativity , local engineers are bound to face problems in their course of work , which is mainly innovating .
In addition , local engineers are also more "traditional" in terms of their mindset , in other words "kiasi" and kiasu" .
Many local engineers possess this kind of mindset and it is probably because of the environment they grew up in and accustomed to .
We Singaporeans are very well protected and taken care off in our country thus it is only natural that the "kiasi" and "kiasu" characteristics manifest in us .
Due to this mindset problem , local engineers are often not willing to take risks as they are afraid of failures .
Local engineers might be able to think out of the box but they usually dare not venture out of it and apply their ideas to their innovations .
Thus this might affect them in a way that by not trying out new and refreshing ideas , the end product of their innovations would definitely  lack lustre and appeal .
Therefore , with this problem local engineers are bound to face problems while innovating .
Secondly , the aging population in Singapore might have contributed to the problems faced by Singapore engineers .
As we  ,  the aged in Singapore might not be as tech savvy as the youngsters .
With an aging population , it means that older citizens form a relatively huge percentage of the total population in Singapore thus it also applies to the consumer market .
Many older citizens are unable to keep up with the pace of changes taking place in the current society and are usually slower when it comes to learning and adapting to new technologies and innovations .
Therefore , with this problem in mind , local engineers often face challenges that require them to come up with innovations and create products that not only appeal to the younger generation of Singaporeans but also to cater to the aging population .
In all , the problems mentioned above may potentially hamper local engineers from coming up with good ideas and innovations .
Therefore we might need to first look into the causes of the problems such as the Singaporeans' "Kiasi" and "Kiasu" mindsets caused by the kind of environment we live in and probably the education system for the younger generations in Singapore .
As is known to all , nowadays  ,science and technology are playing a more and more important part in social society .
We can even say that science and technology have been treasured so much that they are almost treated as a symbol of a country' strength .
Design , therefore , as an important source of more advanced science and technology , is being valued more and more by people and even countries .
As the saying goes , knowledge is wealth , knowledge is power .
In spite of such facts , however , there are still some problems appearing in our country which hamper engineering design processes for innovation .
As a result , in the long run , the problems will make a bad effect on the development of science and technology .
The first problem that hampers engineering design is the old education style .
In China , we attend classes just to remember useful knowledge which can be applied in the exam .
We are always adapting such a teaching pattern that teachercountry'sand students memorize .
That is to say , teachers never value the importance of training students' thinking ability .
Besides , in the examination , we only solve problems with methods that teachers taught us and almost never think about other methods .
In other words , faced with a problem , we cannot solve it using our own methods .
What is more , teachers also do not pay much attention to practical activities , such as social research and experiment class .
In fact , they just think It a waste of time .
iconsiderTo be a designer or inventor , the most important and also the basic quality is creativity .
Only when scientists have rich experience and various methods can they succeed in their work .
Also , before they can begin to design , they must know about their objectives first .

In Singapore there are many constraints which hamper the engineering process for innovations .
As of such , engineers have to resort to new means and ideas when they design a system .
The two main problems are the ageing population and the mindset of Singaporeans .
In this year's National Day Rally Speech , Prime Minister Lee Hsein Loog mentioned about the rapidly increasing ageing population .
This fact is very true and real .
The birth rate in Singapore is not able to support the uprising ageing population .
The impact of it can be very problematic if not dealt with prudently .
Firstly , the majority of the elderly population are often not in touch with the newer technologiesand most of them are unable to handle modern gadgets .
As of such , they often resort to using more simplified means such as the telephone .
Secondly , they are resistant to change .
If given the choice to send a letter , they would rather manually write the letter and send it via mail then to send an email .
Because they are technologically impaired , they would prefer to use more traditional methods .
Lastly , an ageing population would mean the special care that to be directed in order to cater to the needs of them .
Devices must be easy to operate and their welfare must be taken into account .
Following that , the mindset of Singaporeans also plays a big role .
Singaporeans are very money minded .
This is due 'to' the kind of society we are brought up in .
Electric Road Pricing , Certificate of Entitlement and housing cost all cultivates us to be money conscious .
In fact Singapore is one of the most expensive place to live in .
Hence Singaporeans are more unwilling to take risks as the cost of failure would be very tough to recover from .
We are reluctant to invest in research and explore new frontiers .
In addition , there is a lack of creativity nowadays .
New products in the market are similar to already existing products .
Take Apple's iTouch for example .
Ever since its release , all the major phone companies such as Nokia , Samung and Sony Ericsson have released their own versions of a touch screen device .
This lack of creativity does not only relates to Singaporeans but it is a global phenomenon .
As of such , these two problems can really hinder the growth of engineers in Singapore .
Engineers have to take into account the feebleness of the elderly and their technological constraints .
Extra care and effort must be provided to consider the safety and wellbeing of the elderly .
Moreover due to the trend , products must be centered on them rather than youths .
Engineers would also need to open up to more ideas and research .
Although getting their financial support might be a challenge , it is something they have to overcome in order to progress .
Our government does in fact provide some kind of incentives to researchers .
In short , although the ageing population and the mindset of Singaporeans may prove to be a challenge to engineers , it is possible to overcome them .
Engineers must be open to new ideas , adept to their target consumers and be willing to take risks .
The movie star , Paul Newman said , "I never learnt as much in the classroom as I did staring out a window and imagining things .
"() Generally , design is a process of an imagination being produced by a human .
How creative or attractive the product is  will depend on the imagination of a designer , regardless of which area a designer focuses on .
However , by producing an innovative product on the market , it is not an easy task to achieve .
Most of the time , it is often hindered by multiple realistic problems .
There are two major problems which hamper engineering design processes for innovation .
The first problem is due to government related issues while the second is related to  environmental issues .
First of all ,  government related issues will affect the engineering design process .
This is because an engineering design involves a series of complicated steps such as drafting outline , analysis and problem-solving as well as product implementation and the final testing of the product before being shipped to the market .
Furthermore , the designing process is a long term investment as it may require engineers to spend a lot of time and money in order to come out with an innovative product .
Therefore , the support of the government will lead to a different outcome .
A good government will come out with a clear policy to help its people along the way such that 'it' financially  supports the engineers and  provides sponsors for other organizations to assist in the work of an engineer .
On the other hand , a bad government such as a corrupted government will make the design process come to a standstill .
As a result , it may end up in failure eventually .
However , even if the engineers have received  financial support from the government or other organisations , the funding may be limited sometimes due to long term processes which involve problem solving methodology and testing for the innovative design to be carried out .
At the same time , the government and the companies will doubt 'whether' this engineering design is workable or not if it takes too long to progress .
Therefore , the engineers will come across problems due to insufficient funding and eventually it leads to a standstill .
The second problem that hinders the engineering design is the environmental issues .
Frankly speaking , there are engineers who only care about the profit they are going to make and do not 'regard' the effects 'that these designs' bring to our environment . .
Therefore , they may come out with ideas for their own interest and benefit .
For instance , in Taiwan , the most popular transport is motorbike .
Everyone owns one , especially in Taipei .
In order to meet the demand in the market and to attract more people to buy , different designs for the motorbike are also invented .
However , due to the increase in demand for motorbikes , the use of motorbikes results in environmental problems such as air pollution and resource depletion of fossil fuel .
Therefore , the fossil-fueled motorbikes are forbidden in some countries .
In conclusion , I do think that  government policies and environmental issues will hinder the engineering design for innovation .
A good government has to come out with a clear policy to benefit  its people 'as well' as be concerned about the environment environment .
Otherwise , most of the engineering design for innovation could be a failure 
There are many different types of engineering disciplines in Singapore .
Basically , according to Jonathan Dunder (p .2 - 9) , there are eight different types of engineering .
These are the architectural , biomedical , civil , computer , electrical , industrial , mechanical and software engineering .
Each serves different engineering industries .
For architectural , it is more related to designing of buildings for commercial , residential and industrial purposes .
As for biomedical , it is the design of devices intended to be used in medicine .
Civil engineering is the focus of structuring designs for infrastructure such as bridges and roads .
Electrical engineering is the designing of electronics , software engineering is the designing of software applications that relates to operating system whereas computer engineering is the combination of software and electronic engineering which focuses on both the engineering design .
Industrial engineering is the designing of multiple manufacturing products while lastly  mechanical engineering , which is the oldest of the engineering field , is the designing of the mechanical systems .
There are so many engineering fields .
So what is engineering actually ?
According to Jonathan Dunder (p .1) , engineering is the designing , troubleshooting and testing of products 
Designing of engineering innovation may take up to several years of processes to see the ideal final output product coming to reality .
Innovation involves three different stages of journey .
There is the creativity , when several ideas come to mind , followed by the process where these ideas  slowly turn to reality by  .
Finally is the entrepreneurship process where innovations are introduced into the new market .

According to AutoCar Magazine (2008) in China , there are about 2600 new gasoline cars on the road everyday in Beijing , Shanghai , Tianjin and Guangzhou .
The rapid increase of  cars exhausts more carbon dioxide which is actually worsening the Green House effect .
People really need some innovation to solve this problem and save our earth .
Although countries like the US have already spent more than 10 years to do research and development on electric cars (e-car conversions) ,  there are still two main problems that significantly affect its growth in the market of China .
The government support is one of the main difficulties that prohibit the development of electric cars .
First of all , the running duration of  electric cars is what the government is concerned about .
By using the most advanced batteries , a fully charged electric car can run about 160km () .
However , compared to  gasoline cars which can last for 500 to 600 km , the distance travelled by the electric cars is still considered as too limited .
The government worries that the electric cars will restrict the development and expansion of the big big cities due to its short running duration .
Second , the cost for building the infrastructure of the electric cars is really a big amount of money .
There are about 600 cities in China .
Imagine how much it costs if the battery charging facilities are built in every car park .
Besides that , the development of the electric car industry will definitely affect traditional gasoline car industries  Thousands of petrol stations will have to close  petrol related service industries will also be severely affected .
As a result , many people working in these areas will lose their jobs .
The government is reluctant to see such kinds of bad influence to the economy .
In conclusion , the government will not support the development of the electric car .
Another main problem is that building of electric cars may affect our environment .
Many people suggest building electric cars  is eco friendly .
However , the major source of electricity comes from coal power generation in China .
Although there are wasted gas treatment processes in those factories , carbon dioxide emission is still unavoidable .
The only advantage is that the factories have high efficiency  resources resulting in  less pollution .
Besides that , making use of batteries will also have negative influence on the earth .
Normally , batteries are not biodegradable and there are toxic substances , such as mercury , inside the batteries ) .
If people do not treat them properly , the toxic substances may flow into soil and rivers and affect our environment .
In conclusion , government support and bad influence of the environment are two main reasons that restrict the development of electric cars .
For making use of the electric cars in our daily life , the engineers still have a long way to go .

As we can see very commonly in MRTs and buses , the needs of elderly in public transport are not taken care of .
A few years back , the Land Transport Authority (LTA) introduced the 'Priority Seating' scheme which is meant to help the elderly , parents with kids , pregnant ladies or handicaps .
However , the scheme did not achieve its aim as people continue to occupy the 'Priority Seats' and did not give them up to those who need it more .
Just a few months back , the LTA decided to make some changes to it .
open inverted coma not requiredThe LTA , SBS Transit and SMRT , have standardised the signs for priority seating in MRT trains .
The new signs are in blue and white , aligned with the colour code for the International Symbol of Access , and state 'Reserved Seating' instead of 'Priority Seating' to make the call-for-action to give up the seats in a more authoritative and forceful manner  In addition to the 'Reserved Seating' scheme , the Public Transport Council (PTC) launched "a public education program titled 'A Happy Journey Starts Like That !'
to promote graciousness on public transport"  in the recent months .
One of the aims of this program is to promote the idea of giving up the reserved seats to those who need it more .
As we can see from the above examples , the LTA has been putting in a lot of effort in trying to make the 'Reserved Seating' scheme more effective .
The scheme might have improved the situation to a certain extent; however , it is evident that the problem has not been solved .
There have been a lot of topics on forums on the internet regarding the issue of 'Reserved Seating' .
"It is sad to say that there has been no impact .
People are still seating on thee seats even when old folks are standing near them .d" () .
This was a comment by someone after what he saw in the MRT .
Here , we can clearly see that the problem has not been solved .
To tackle the problem , I have generated three solutions .
Firstly , instead of having a 'Reserved Seat' , a "Reserved Carriage'   is a better idea .
- A whole carriage specially for the elderly and others who are entitled to it .
After giving it some thought , I believe the 'Reserved Carriage' should be the center carriage of the train .
This will not only provide convenience for the elderly (and others entitled to the 'Reserved Carriage') , it will also be good to standardise this throughout all the MRT stations .
The 'Reserved Carriage' will be blocked off and to gain access to the 'Reserved Carriage' , one must tap his/her EZ-Link card .
This concept is similar to the method of entering the MRT station but of course , money will not be  be deducted .
As senior citizens already have special EZ-Link cards , this can be used to gain access to the 'Reserved Carriage' .
As for the others who are also entitled to the 'Reserve Carriage' , they can apply for a special EZ-Link card which will allow access to the carriage too .
Secondly , we will use  the idea of the 'Reserved Seat' .
However , each seat is 'locked' by a bar across the seat .
Similarly , to gain access to the seat , one must tap his/her EZ-Link card .
Upon tapping  the EZ-Link card , the seat will be 'unlocked' and people who are entitled to the 'Reserved Seat' are now able to sit .
The same idea can be used towards the wheelchair bound area .
(Option 2) .
Lastly , I have read a couple of comments online , saying that those who are not entitled to the 'Reserved Seat' but are actually sitting on it are to be fined .
This is indeed a very good idea as the best method to deter Singaporeans from doing something is to implement a fine .
However , much has been said about Singapore being a 'Fine' city .
By doing so , it might be cost efficient but we are acknowledging to the world that we are indeed a 'Fine' city , to the extent of fining people for not giving up 'Reserved Seats' .
(Option 3) .
Therefore , I would not agree with this method .
As the third option of implementing a fine has already been taken out of my choice , I would like to compare between the first option and the second option .
There are four points of comparisons I would like to discuss .
Option 1 is definitely less costly than option 2 .
In the first option , it requires only 2 - 4 systems in each train station while in the second option , it requires a system in every train carriages for each 'Reserved Seat' .
However , option 1 is less flexible as compared to option 2 .
In the first option , those travelling together with the elderly are not able to enter the same carriage while in the second option , the elderly can be accompanied by their children or grandchildren .
This lack of flexibility leads to the third comparison of safety issues .
As other people are not able to accompany the elderly or those entitled to the 'Reserved Carriage' , they are not taken care of in the carriage .
In the case of emergency , there will be a lot of safety issues arising from it .
In the second option , however , the elderly are taken care of by the other commuters even in case of emergency .
The last comparison is the usage of  space .
In option 1 , there will be a lot of standing space wasted in the 'Reserved Carriage' , while in option 2 , it makes full use of the space and no space will be wasted .
As we can see from the above comparisons , option 2 is much better than option 1 except for the costs .
It is more flexible , makes full use of the space around and most importantly , it is safe .
I believe that if the LTA really hopes to solve this problem , the cost would not be an issue .
Therefore , option 2 will be a more feasible solution .
In conclusion , whatever schemes or ideas that might be implemented in the future , there will definitely be a lot of discussions and debates regarding it going on .
Forums on the internet will continue talking about it and so will the media .
This issue will never be solved completely unless Singaporeans learn from the culture of Taiwan or Korea for example .
I saw a documentary on CNA and they were showing that the reserved seats in their train remains empty despite the fact that the train was crowded yet no one occupied these seats .
It was mentioned that the Koreans have much respect for the old and  they are more gracious" (David , 2009) .
Singaporeans need to learn how to be more courteous and gracious and care more for the elderly and needy .
The bottom-line is that no matter how many new innovations engineers can invent , they can only reduce such problems but not eliminate them completely .
If you ask me , the one and only way to eliminate this problem depends on us !
In the eastern part of the globe there exists a place called India , renowned for its wide heritage and tourist spots; the country is also famous for one other thing - corruption .
In a country where most of the rural population is below the poverty line , it's not a surprise that corruption exists , however its mere existence has hampered the design process of innovation .
Corruption is everywhere and its not limited to the government alone , but has spread to the greedy private sector as well .
Corruption in India is on a totally different scale , people here don't take money just to do things out of their way but to do their jobs as well !
For example , let us consider a government officer in the housing board development sector , his job is to attest any stamp paper that may come his way for approval , if it were an ideal country he would do his job but this being India , you would probably pay him a handsome amount to just do his job !
As shocking as this might sound , this is nothing but the truth .
Since corruption spreads like wildfire , this practice has ended up in almost every other sector of the government thereby affecting the overall development of the country and its resources .
I .H .When a new technology emerges , it first has to go through the government's "tests" .
Basically , it means you have to "satisfy" the higher government officials before your technology can be made available to the public .
Not it is  can "satisfy" the government , thus some technologies are never made available to the general public , which essentially means it has no chance .oP becoming an innovation !
These malpractices are one of the reasons for the greedy nature of the private sector as well .
For example , the government demanded a lot of money from the private mobile phone service providers for spectrum allocation during the auction for 3G frequencies .
This hefty price tag has delayed the rolling out of the 3G service in India whilst other countries are moving on to 4G .
Just when you thought corruption is not enough to bring India down , there is another big problem yet to be eradicated - poverty .
About 42% of the population lives below the International poverty line !
This indirectly affects the design process because most new technologies requia lot of takers in the initial stages for it to become a success .
For example , broadband costs in India are still one of the highest in the world , simply because not a lot of people are aware about it and thus not a lot of them want to take it , this forces the ISP (Internet Service Provider) to raise increase the profit margin per person .
Is this because of the lack of IT literacy in India ?
Well , first , the literacy rate needs to improve before we can even start thinking about IT literacy .
The government education system at the primary and secondary level is a total flop , the syllabus is outdated and the curriculum is something of a joke .
India has a long way to go in terms of primary and secondary education although university level education is on par with the international standards .
T .All in all , poverty and corruption are the weeds in the endless fields of possibilities called India .
Only about five years ago , when people acquired information , they went to libraries or read newspapers .
However , within this short five-year period , there is an utter change in people's response .
The instinct of most people now , when they encountered any problems , is to seek help on Internet .
The first step is always going to any search engine such as "Google" to type in what they want .
According to the survey conducted by Nielsen (2009): 256 million people visited a search engine in December 2006 81% of the global Internet population .
The use of search engines is so ubiquitous today that people often forget the fact that it was commercialized only in recent few years .
This is certainly attributed to the fast advancement of Information Technologies .
Nevertheless , there are some socially determining factors that should not be neglected .
First of all , internet search engine is the kind of tool which requires least cost , to both viewers and advertisers .
With the wide scope of internet coverage and common usage of laptops , it is economically advisable to use search engines for information gathering .
Comparing with gointhe Internetkstores or libraries and watching TV , which cost people time and money , it is cost effective to search information through search engines .
For advert ,sers , the cost of search marketing is much lower than th .fThis is 81%e advertisements in other forms like on TV programs .
In this world where profit means so much , more and more advertisers are exploring the new field of search engine advertising .
The economic factor really contributes to the growth and development of search engines .
Secondly , search engine is a relatively easier tool that everyone can accept .
For example , the homepage of Google is very clean and simple .
Without much distractions from fancy designs and display of every piece of information , users can access to what they want toComparedectly .
Moreover , the sophistication of the search engines enables users to accurately describe the information they want and view them in an assorted manner .
In addition , search engines are mostly globalized .
For example , "Google" has many versions in different languages .
Singapore also has its own "Yahoo !"
search engines .
This helps to expose their people to the outside world by browsing other countries' WebPages through search engines .
Thus the above mentioned features have encouraged more people to use search engines .
The last but not the least , search engines lead people into a realm of information .
It is so resourceful that people basically can find anything they want by typing some words in it .
It really links up the real and the virtual world as people gain knowledge from internet and apply it to the everyday life .
It does no only have a vast database , but also possess advanced functions which classify and sort these information into different categories .
For instance , the "Google" scholar function allows users to search specifically scholastic articles .
Furthermore , as most search engines use "spider" protocol , the information presented is least biased because they are listed out based on their relevance to the user's input .
Without many advertisements to disguise the truth , users can process the information more conveniently .
As a result , the problem of too much irrelevant information present in books and TV can be alleviated .
The development of search engines is thus undeniable and spontaneous .

Engineering design process is usually a cyclic process where decision making is required .
Often , engineering sciences , basic sciences and mathematics are applied to convert the available information optimally to achieve the desired deeds .
Basically , this process can be divided into  various steps including identifying objectives , defining problems , conducting research , analyzing solutions , making decisions , presenting the products and finally , selling the products .
These are the universal steps in the process which is followed by most  engineers .
Nonetheless , there are problems that significantly hamper the engineering design process for innovation .
In Malaysia ,  corruption within the political system has led to slow development in design processes .
Besides , the education system introduced leads to a lack of creativity and innovation by engineers .
In addition , the a lack of creativity and innovation have been identified to be the main problems  hampering the engineering design process , which might be due to the current education system in Malaysia .

s ,  they expect that every solution will be provided .

Students have been treated in a way that discouraged independent thought and learning processes , thus indirectly hindering their ability to analyze and interpret problems due to lack of creativity .
In conclusion , corruption in the political system and the lack of creativity by engineers ,  , significantly hampers the the engineering design process .
