In conclusion , even though penicillin's discovery was accidena similar impact from the comparishave both broughto technologies that the invention is actually comparable to those developed by researches .
The developments of both technologies are similar in terms of the complexity of the processes and the impacts of the technologies are equivalent .
Many countries are faced with the problem of an aging population .
As the elder population grows larger and larger , the burden on the younger generation and the government becomes greater and greater .
Some people say that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
I think the government can implement positive policies to limit the money spent on the elderly indirectly .
Encouraging a later retirement and giving out subsidies based on the financial need are efficient ways to reduce the amount of money spent on the growing population of the aged .
The government has to limit the money given to the elderly because the expanded population of the elderly can lead to serious problems in economy , society and productivity .
Spending increase for the aged will surely reduce the country's total deposits and thus reduce the general social investment , imposing a negative impact on the sustainable , coordinated , steady and fast development of the nation's economy .
({http://bbs .chinadaily .com .cn/redirect .php ?gid=2&fid=6&tid=58116}[HYPERLINK: http://bbs .chinadaily .com .cn/redirect .php ?gid=2&fid=6&tid=58116]&goto=nextoldset) Encouraging the later retirement is a effective method to solve this problem .
First of all , it is good for employers .
As the aging population becomes larger , more people retire than  usual .
It can be predicted that more people will leave their work and fewer people can enter the work force .
If people can retire at a later time , the company can keep a balance of the work force .
Furthermore , longer work lives can certainly increase  productivity of the nation .
On one hand , the elderly can feed themselves without the pension from the government .
On the other hand , the amount of the tax will go up as the productivity increases .
Therefore , the government can give out more benefits .
This method is used by the countries which are confronted with the aging problem , for example , China , Canada .
Now it is accepted and used by more countries .
Giving out subsidies based on the financial need is another policy that government can make to reduce the pressure and burden .
Not all the elderly people need the help from the government .
For some people , they had saved enough money when they were young or they can still make their living when they are old or they are supported by their children .
They are able to ensure their quality of life for the rest of their lives .
These people do not need the pension from the government .
However , some people cannot live without the pension from the government .
Usually these people do not have a good education or they have some disabilities .
The government has the duty to take care of them .
If the government can give out the pensions according to the financial need , the amount of money spent on the elderly will not climb rapidly even if the aging population increases at an incredible speed .
Australia has already taken this policy and more countries are taking this policy into consideration .
Some people may say that the government should treat every citizen equally .
Hence , it is unreasonable to choose people to give out the subsidies .
Although every citizen has the same right , the government must ensure the living condition of its people first .
Giving everyone a pension means that some people's living standard will be affected but giving out money based on the fanatical need means everyone can live in a good condition .
The pension is not important to the people who are able to live a good life in their twilight years .
However , the subsidy is essential to the people who are not capable of feeding themselves .
Thus , the government should choose people to give out pension .
Although more and more countries are faced with the aging problem , the government can make some policies like encouraging later retirement and giving out money based on financial needs .
These policies can both limit the money spent on the elderly and ensure the living standard of its people .
Everyone will grow old one day; it is just another phase in life .
With every phase in life , comes its own set of problems .
Throughout the process of aging , people will face certain problems relating to health , finance , and socialization; and many of these problems are usually interrelated .
Just like every set of lock comes with a set of keys , every set of problems comes with their own set of solutions .
Now , with the help of technological advancements and the reforms of government policies , the aging process has certainly been made easier to a large extent .
Extensive research and development has been done in the medical field to make our lives easier .
Through research and development , new technologies are being created .
With the help of these technologies , many possibilities have emerged .
Diseases that were thought to be incurable in the past are now curable .
Many diseases can be detected earlier and thus prevented .
Also , many age-related problems can be cured , either fully or to a large extent , using these new technologies .
All these have helped to make the process of aging easier , as the aged can lead better lives with fewer health problems .
Also through research and development , many lifestyle guides that help promote healthy lifestyle become available .
It is known that by having a healthy lifestyle , one will have fewer health problems and thus will need to spend less on healthcare .
By saving more on healthcare , the financial stress on the aged will be relieved .
Therefore , through the help of research and development , the aged live better lives , and have fewer health problems .
However , as healthcare technologies improve , the costs of healthcare also increase .
As these new technologies involve the usage of newer , and more advanced equipments , the costs of using such technologies tend to be higher than in the past .
There is a small percentage of the elderly who are not financially secure .
For them , using such new technologies is either impossible , or it will create further financial problems .
Also , another side effect of improved healthcare technologies is that people tend to have a longer lifespan .
With prolonged life , the aged might face certain issues .
There are diseases which are incurable , but the life of the victim can be prolonged using these new technologies .
However , these technologies are expensive .
Prolonging the life of the victim can be financially draining on the family , and cause financial and social tension within the family .
This becomes the case where solving one problem creates another .
However , with the help of government policies , this problem can be solved .
Financial aids can be made available to these families and help relieve the financial stress .
Recently , government policies have also undergone several reforms to better cater to the aged in the society .
These reforms in policies are aimed to help the aged cope better with aging .
These policies encourage the elderly to retire later .
Also , they lower barriers to elder employment .
With these , the aged can have longer working life , and thus accumulate more wealth to support themselves through their old age .
Also , the government helps relieve financial stress by subsidizing healthcare costs , and providing financial aids to the elderly  .
These healthcare costs include hospital and caretaker fees .
Healthcare system is also restructured to cater to the aged .
An example is by building more community hospitals , nursing homes , and home care .
These will provide competent and appropriate care for the elderly patients .
Through the reforms of the government policies , the aged has been well taken care of .
In conclusion , current research and development , and policies have certainly helped to ease the aging process to a large extent .
New technologies have been created to help eliminate many  age-related health problems .
Government policies and the restructuring of the healthcare system have helped the aged cope better with life .
However , not every elderly in the society can get to enjoy these perks , especially those who are bound by financial problems .
Therefore through current research and development and policies , the aging process has been made easier , but  only to a large extent .
Until recently , the problems of an aging population have become a major concern among all the nations throughout the world .
Governments of many countries have come up with policies and solutions to decrease elder dependency and slow down the process of a fast aging population .
Aging statistics taken from the United States of America administration of aging show people above the age of 65 represented 12 .4% of the population in the year 2000 but are expected to grow to be 20% of the population by 2030 .
The statistics have shown that in time to come , the problems of a fast aging population will be too overwhelming for the society to handle; therefore , we have to slow down the aging process .
A fast aging population will have serious detrimental effects in developed countries .
Caring for health of the aging population will pose a problem for the government .
The country's economy will also suffer as a small number of young working population will have to support a bigger umbrella of elder generation .
This will tax and stress heavily on the small working population .
A lot of resources will also have to be spent on the elderly people .
However , policies have helped to reduce the effects of an aging population .
I have to agree that current developments and policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Singapore has encouraged people to retire at an older age and companies to keep their employees for a longer time .
Legislative changes were made in Singapore in 1993 to put the retirement age at 60 , and then to move it up again from 60 to 62 years in 1999 .
This will help the working people to save more money and be more financially independent when they are old and have no income .
In this way , the working population will not be stressed  too much by the elderly population .
The government also has encouraged and provided incentives for companies to employ elderly workers .
This will help the elderly to be more in touch with the society and keep their physical health in good shape , which will in turn reduce diseases .
Singapore has also helped working adults to save money when they are working so that when they retire , they will still have money for living expenses .
Singapore introduced the Central Provident Fund (CPF) in 1995 as a compulsory saving scheme to help workers to benefit in their retirement .
Employees will contribute twenty percent of their salary while employers will contribute thirteen percent towards this saving scheme for workers .
The purpose of this saving scheme is to emphasize on self reliance .
To meet healthcare needs , Medisave is introduced to allow CPF members to use their CPF savings for hospitalization .
In this way , most problems of the aging population are taken care of .
Singapore has also emphasized and instilled filial piety to the children of the aging population  to support their parents through meeting their financial needs and emotional needs .
The children of the future should provide for their parents as much as they can even though their financial status looks bleak so that the aging population will not have to rely too much on government help .
Children also should arrange for their parents to live under the same roof so as not to only provide for them financially but also to show care and concern to their aging parents .
For example , children of the aging parents are able to bring their parents to consult a doctor if any minor medical conditions arise , thus preventing serious illnesses from developing .
Singapore has encouraged people to buy an HDB flat near their parents by subsidizing a substantial amount of money .
By living together , the children can also provide a listening ear to their parents and even warn them against making wrong decisions .
This will definitely reduce the fiscal cost of elder dependency .
However , some critics might disagree with this strategy .
No matter how much we encourage young people to care for their parents , it's still their personal choice; the society or the government cannot force them to do their part .
However , if the government does a good job in educating the young people and introducing policies to encourage young people to be more caring towards their aging parents , this would be a very effective strategy .
This is because what the aging population needs are their children's provisions and their care and concern .
In conclusion , I think that many developments and policies have helped to reduce the aging process and also solve the problem of a fast aging population .
Although this problem cannot be solved in a short period of time , theses policies and developments will help to curb the problems of an aging population .
Nowadays , against a changing technology background , many of the social problems that have troubled people for centuries are being eased .
Among them is the aging problem , which leads to a restructuring of the social composition .
Many pessimistic predictions were made by people about this problem .
However , with the assistance of Information and Communication technology (ICT) , the situation could be fundamentally shifted through mainly three ways .
Firstly , the development of ICT can reduce the aged people's difficulties by changing the workspace .
Instead of being forced to travel from and to the office every day , now they can simply stay at home and finish their work through the internet .
This change effectively eliminates their disadvantages in terms of mobility compared to the young people .
Coming along with the workspace shift , the job itself will also change .
Nowadays , fewer and fewer jobs require certain level of performance .
Those repetitive and tedious jobs are now performed by machine and jobs become more of managing people and resources , especially with Information Technology as the medium .
This change of job nature makes a huge difference to the aged people's constraints for physical conditions are no longer employers' top concern .
Besides  changing the workspace , ICT also brings good news to the aged by changing employment relationships .
It is well known that for the aged people , jobs are really hard to find .
9 out of 10 employers would be reluctant to hire  old people because they are afraid that they can not work as efficiently (which is always not the case) .
However , with the introduction of ICT , many more new jobs are created , a large percentage of which are self-employed jobs .
So for the elderly , a new choice is offered to them: after their retirement , instead of heading into the job market and competing with people probably half their age for a post , they can start up their own business .
There are plenty of opportunities out there on the internet .
What matters is their  , not their age .
Opponents may probably argue that ICT is a privilege that only benefits the young people .
However , the truth cannot be farther than that .
Although young people have an advantage for they have been exposed to the technology from early ages , the aged people still stand a high chance to succeed , as long as they can adapt to new features quickly .
After all , the internet is a common property of which every one can enjoy a share .
Current research and development in the field of ICT has largely shaped the society .
It makes aged people remain productive by changing the workspace , reforming the employment relationship and offering easy access to re- education .
Technologies like this promise to offer us even more new dimensions to deal with existing social problems in the years to come .
Nowadays , the life expectancy of people has increased thanks to the healthcare technology which keeps getting better .
This should be a very good thing to hear .
But , there are consequences to this .
Since people have longer life expectancy , the number of elderly people increases .
This leads to the issue of the aging population .
The aging population causes a lot of problems , since a lot of money will be used to support the elderly .
Wikipedia stated that "As of July 2007 , medical costs for a typical inmate in the USA might run an agency around US$33 per day , while costs for an ageing inmate could run upwards of US$100 .
Most State DOCs report spending more than 10 percent of the annual budget on elderly care .
That is expected to rise over the next 10-20 years" .
This money could be used for the development of other areas .
So , we have a question here .
Should public spending on the aged be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development ?
In this essay , I will tell you why public spending on the aged should not be limited .
Firstly , limiting the public spending is not efficient .
We have to calculate the limit carefully so that it will be enough for the elderly .
Even if it has been done correctly , since the public spending of each person is different , a trouble will still be there .
Consider if  an elderly person has been sick for a long time and his/her spending has already reached the limit; are we going to tell him to die because we will not provide him with anymore money ?
There are a lot of alternative methods that we can use to cope with the aging population .
Peterson (2001) in his review "A Graying World" suggests six ways to cope with the aging population .
We could use any of these six ways to cope with the aging population , without having to limit the public spending on the elderly .
It should also be noted that , limiting aging spending in healthcare will not bring much impact since "the annual growth in national health spending is not mainly due to increasing demand from ageing populations , but rather has been driven by rising incomes , costly new medical technology , a shortage of health care workers and informational asymmetries between providers and patients" (Rheinhardt , 2003) .
Secondly , the elderly have the right to be protected because they have worked for the country before .
We should not forget that the younger generations are raised by the previous generation .
So , the younger generations should repay them by providing their needs during the old age .
We , younger generations , must realize that someday we will grow old as well .
When we grow old , how would we like to be treated ?
Would we like to be treated as a burden  ?
It is really selfish if we treat the elderly badly but still want to be treated nicely when we grow old .
It may be argued that the elderly might misuse this service and fully rely on the public funding rather than trying to cope on their own .
However , we must not forget that a lot of people have no choice but to rely on the government .
"The most significant aspect of the growing percentage of elderly people in the population is the marked increase in those aged 85 and over .
Among this group is a large number of elderly people who are severely impaired physically and/or mentally" (Henwood , 1990) .
These people have no other choice but to rely on others for their funding .
Would we forget them because of the small group of people that use this service to become lazy ?
Therefore , we can conclude that we should not limit the public spending on the elderly .
There are a lot of people who could only rely on this service to survive .
We should remember their deeds and we should also remember that we will become old one day .
Limiting the public spending on the elderly is also not an efficient way to cope with an aging population .
So , the government should use a more efficient method to cope with the aging population instead of limiting the public spending on the elderly .
"The critical challenge of an aging society is not so much how to accommodate the older population , but how to ensure the productivity of future workers , regardless of age" (Friedland and Summer , 2005 , p .1) .
Major increases in public spending for pension fund and health care costs for the elderly will slow economic growth in most countries , even in developed countries .
Therefore , the government should focus more on how they can reduce this spending , so that the economy will not be damaged .
This can be done by improving workers productivity and increasing labor force participation .
In other words , the government should spend more on creating jobs and educating the population .
People with higher education are expected to get more salaries and accumulate wealth when they are still young , so that  will not be too dependent in their old age .
Thus , public spending on the aged should be diverted to other more important aspects .
Some people may argue that there will be insufficient protection for the elderly if the government shifts this fund to some other areas of the country's development .
For example , people say that old single women , whose incomes are mainly not high , are vulnerable and need special care .
It might be true to some extent , but we should also consider that the government will only limit the public spending on the elderly , butthey will not eliminate it .
This means special policies will be made for those with special needs .
The government will still take care of those who cannot take care of themselves .
Furthermore , we should also realize that today's group of older people is different from the past's .
Friedland and Summer (2005) stated that the meaning of "retirement" and "old age" nowadays is different from what it was in the past , as future groups of older people are likely to be even better off .
They are wealthier , healthier , and they have better education .
In addition to implementing special policies , the government could allocate more funds for educating young people .
Education is very important because employers tend to hire workers or employees with high education and experience in their fields .
Low education in a country may result in increases in the number of the unemployed , which eventually hamper the economic growth because people who are jobless are very dependent as they do not earn money for living .
Furthermore , the country will also lack  trained labor force .
For instance , Indonesia , the world's 4th most populous country , has 109 ,900 ,900 labor force , but the rate of the unemployed was very high (9 .10%) in 2008 (CIA , 2008) , due to low literacy rates .
The lack of education is the priority problem in Indonesia , mainly caused by the great number of people who still live in poverty .
The current situation is worrying as when this generation ages , the government will need to provide a certain care for them .
In other words , the new policy to cut off public expenditure on the aged cannot be implemented in this condition .
Hence , it is again the government's role to subsidize the education so that everybody at least can get the standard level of education .
Education alone is not enough because even if the society is better-educated  there may not be adequate jobs available and the unemployment problem still exists .
The government should create and maintain new jobs .
Therefore , they will need to create a supplementary budget for job creation .
In fact , some countries , such as Korea , have begun to implement this policy .
Korea has planned to spend 3 ,500 billion won in 2009 to help maintain and create jobs , and through this , 552 ,000 new jobs are expected to be created (Ministry of Strategic and Finance , 2009) .
This policy aims to boost the economic growth potential as there will be less tough competition to get a job .
Besides increasing the number of new jobs , the government can try to invent a new type of job , which can be done by people regardless of their age , including the elderly .
For instance , telecommuting part-time jobs , which do not require the workers to be in the workplace , are good to be implemented nowadays , by means of our advanced technology .
Clearly , there are many ways to limit and to divert the public spending for the elderly people without slowing the economic growth .
By providing good education and good jobs , our life will be guaranteed until our old age .
Governments and policy makers will take the main role to formulate the best policies to deal with the long-term economic and social challenge of global aging , so that we are fully prepared to face this  issue .
Aging is becoming a hot issue when the percentage of the elderly in the society is continuously increasing .
Certainly , when the number of aged people rises , public spending on this group will have to be raised as well to take care of this group .
However , I think there should be a limit on how much shall be spent for the elderly , because the government needs to use more money on country development .
First of all , spending money on development is the most effective way to address the aging population issue .
Actually , the problem of more population getting aged does not lie in the demographic change , but in the fact that the productivity of the nation will decline .
When the government tries to spend more and more on the aged , it will lead to a lack in money for development , then a slower economic growth , which will finally leave the government with less choice to spend for the elderly people .
In contrast , when focusing on country development , particularly economic growth , the country can earn more money .
With this extra money , the government can have more to spend for the whole society , and the money for the aged will be increased as well .
In fact , "if real economic growth averages about 2 percent per year between now and 2050" , Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer claim , "government expenditures as a proportion of the economy in 2050 might not be substantially larger than what it is today" (Demography Is Not Destiny , Revisited .
Center on Aging Society , Georgetown University , March 2005) .
Secondly , imposing a limit on public spending for the aged can make people spend money more responsibly .
For most people , if they know they will have to take care of themselves more when they are old , they will be forced to save money for the future .
They therefore will have to think more when spending money , and will try to reduce wasting extra money on unimportant things .
Moreover , nowadays , with better living condition for the whole life of a person , many old people may not be in poor health . .
Hence , extra care for additional health care may not be necessary for many elderly people .
.
Many opponents may argue that the aged are the most vulnerable group in the society and thus need more and more attention .
However , to help these people become less vulnerable , it is not so good  when they are already aged .
"Prevention is better than cure" .
Thus , focusing on social development as a whole , and improving living condition throughout the life of people is actually a better way to help people gain a better health and become less vulnerable when they are aged .
Moreover , when more money is spent for people when they are younger , it could raise a better workforce for the nation .
The productivity of the country will therefore be increased , and again , with more wealth earned , public spending in general , and on the aged , in particular , will be increased as a  result .
In conclusion , although the population of the earth in general is getting aged , which could lead to certain consequences , the government should not be panicked to address that problem in a temporary way by increasing public spending for the aged as much as possible .
Rather , the government should focus on developing the nation as a whole , especially maintaining the economic growth , because this is the long term and most effective way to solve the aging problem .
Have present studies , development and policies helped to relieve the aging process ?
This is the question many people grapple with and the core of the debate lies in the impact they bring on the aging process .
In my opinion , I agree to a large extent that current research , development and policies have helped ease the aging process .
In the course of my essay , I will first show how economics , medicine , architectural and technological inventions and social policies have helped ease the aging process while financial constraint can limit the effectiveness of easing the aging process .
Firstly , economics have helped ease the aging process .
Due to the growth in the awareness of the different financial needs over an individual's life cycle , financial institutions have designed and introduced a wide range of products to meet these needs .
For example , a person will need health insurance to protect oneself from the high cost of medical treatment .
Also , with the insurance coverage , an individual can seek adequate medical treatment to recover from any sickness .
The various products available have helped to minimize the impact of unforeseen events so that an individual can save resources to meet aging needs .
In addition , as education opportunities increase , economies around the world have transformed from labour intensive to knowledge-based .
This has extended the working life of the labour force .
With longer working life , people will be able to accumulate more wealth which they can use to support themselves in their old age .
Therefore , people will have saved enough money by the time when they are old to maintain a certain standard of living .
Secondly , architecture has also helped ease the aging process .
With the increasing prevalence of obstruction free buildings  , the mobility of the senior population is significantly increased .
For example , buildings are fitted with lifts , ramps and more railings to allow people who are physically challenged to access .
With mobility , the elder generation can have the same mobility options as they were young and continue to live their lives on their own .
The reduced dependency on others will ease the pain of aging .
Thirdly , the modern state of technology has significantly eased the process of aging .
Many tasks in life are made easy with technology .
For example , robotic vacuum cleaners have made housekeeping very much effortless .
The safety features in household appliances have enabled the elderly to take care of their own needs safely .
Overall , technology has allowed the elderly to reduce their dependency on others , and has improved the quality of their lives .
Fourthly , advancements in medicine have significantly increased the life expectancy of mankind .
Many diseases that have plagued mankind in the past are now curable or can be vaccinated .
Long term illness such as diabetes is more effectively controlled , and the treatment process has become less painful .
As one ages , they need not suffer the torment of illness as the previous generations did , and are able to spend more time on other meaningful activities .
Fifthly , various social policies have been introduced to ease the aging process .
For example , filial obligation is stressed through informal and formal channels to increase the willingness of the next generation to support their own elderly parents .
With their children supporting them , the elderly will no doubt be happier and enjoy their golden age .
Furthermore , in some countries such as Britain and Singapore , people are required to provide for their own old age dependency .
They are compelled by law to save and invest more of their income earned while they are active in the work force .
In this way , the elderly will have a sum of money available to support themselves in their golden age when they retire .
However , many of these advances discussed require financial resources to achieve .
For example , the wide range of financial and technological products comes at a cost .
For those who are not able to afford them , they will not be able to enjoy the benefits .
Social policies also require funding in order to put the plan into action .
Therefore , the ability of recent advancements to ease the aging process can be greatly limited by financial constraints .
In conclusion , economics , medicine , architecture , technological inventions and social policies have helped to ease the aging process but they require financial resources to achieve .
Therefore , the elderly and their children supporting them must have sufficient financial resources in order to take advantage of the benefits of modern day advancements to ease the aging process .
In recent years , there is an increasing number of countries faced with an ageing population .
The problems of an ageing population have led to these countries coming up with measures to counteract the problems .
One of these measures is to increase public spending so as to ensure that the aged are taken care of .
Yet , at the same time , this money could be spent on other areas of the country's development .
Therefore , some may argue that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
However , I do not support this argument as increasing public spending on the aged is a necessary step for the government to take in order to prepare the country to face an ageing population .
Firstly , improving on current facilities to better suit the aged is compulsory .
We have to prepare more healthcare teams to specialize in treating illnesses related to the old as it is commonly known that the old are more prone to illness .
Thus , by increasing the amount of healthcare workers focusing on treating elderly illnesses prevent the situation of the lack of healthcare workers for the elderly in the near future .
Also , we have to create an environment which is elderly-friendly so that the elders are able to take care of themselves without the help of others .
Being able to take care of themselves is very important as this greatly decreases their dependence on others and hence reduces their burden on their children and the elderly will not feel that they are useless by not being independent .
Therefore , this public spending on improving facilities should not be comprised for the welfare of the elderly .
Similarly , the government has to provide elderly benefits as most of the elderly are no longer in the workforce and thus have no regular income .
The elderly depend on their savings or their children to support themselves through the old age .
Some of the elderly may not have saved enough to last them till death or their children are not willing to take care of them .
They are faced with the problems of living a proper life .
A proper life refers to having home , three meals and adequate healthcare .
Therefore , it is important for the government to step in to provide help for these poor elderly so that they could have a proper life .
If not , these elderly may die because of hunger or the lack of proper healthcare due to poverty .
However , an argument against this is that most people feel that old age is not the responsibility of the government and the government is not obliged to take care of the elderly .
The elderly ought to be independent .
Nevertheless , if the government leaves the elderly who are fighting old age alone without care , it would be too cruel of the government .
In other words , the government should not leave those elderly in lurch to struggle on their own for survival .
In addition , the elderly may encounter biasness against them .
This is a social problem where the government has to step in to solve it .
Ageism may be present in the working or social life of an elderly .
These unfair treatments that the elderly face may  pose a psychological problem to them .
For example , the  aged may face discrimination when looking for jobs as compared to the young and also , the old age may receive less all-rounded treatment in the healthcare sector based on the stereotype that they are in the natural process of aging and that they are less likely to recover .
The government then has to interfere to educate the public to be less prejudiced against the  aged .
This will take up part of the public spending which should not be limited .
On the other hand , public spending on the aged should be limited so that money could be diverted to other areas of the country's development such as the economic sector .
If the economy improves , people would earn more money and thus the burden on the children taking care of their old-aged parents would be relatively less as they could better afford the costs of taking care of the elderly people .
On the contrary , this is only applicable to filial children who are willing to take care of their parents .
Those elderly who are unfortunate or those who have no children may face problems as they would have no one to take care of them and would be worse off without any help from the government .
As a result , public spending on the aged should not be limited as it is needed to help these elderly .
To sum up , the government has to assume responsibilities in taking care of the elderly and to ensure that the country is adequately prepared to accept an ageing population; thus , spending on the aged should not be limited and money should not be diverted into other areas of the country's development .
Statistics from the World Health Organization (WHO , 2006 , What are the public health implications of global ageing ?)
stated that:
From 2000 until 2050 , the world's population aged 60 and over will more than triple from 600 million to 2 billion .
Most of this increase is occurring in developing countries - where the number of older people will rise from 400 million in 2000 to 1 .7 billion by 2050 .
The baby-boom generation has created a need to improve and provide care and services to the aging population .
I agree to a large extent that current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Technology plays a significant role in providing aid for and improving the lives of the elderly .
Current technologies have provided aids and support to the elderly in the fields of personal health technologies by reducing the cost and time of medical appointments and increasing the effectiveness of health record tracking .
It is also important that ageing related problems are highlighted so that corresponding policies can be implemented , for example the introduction of the pension system and  late retirement to reduce elder dependency .
Firstly , the goal of personal health technologies will be to change from a centralized model where the elderly would go to the hospital where healthcare is provided , to a distributed model wherebyhealthcare services are delivered to  where the elderly live .
Information technology applications have enabled the elderly to initiate communication , keep track of their personal health record and also make follow-up appointments which can be conducted through Telemedicine .
Telemedicine was introduced to provide care for the patient from any location with the help of transferring electronic information through various technology applications and equipments such as the web camera .
This technology delivers care directly to the homes of the elderly at an affordable rate and provide right information at the right time which benefits decision making of the medical officers involved .
It allows the elderly to be more active in taking care of themselves at the comfort of their own home .
It may be argued that telemedicine might not be as effective as contact monitoring and hands on attention .
Nevertheless , such applications have helped to reduce the time spent in hospitals and medical costs , improve record tracking practices and speed of communication .
Next , national  policies such as pension systems are arranged to provide the retired elders income .
The fund may be set up by a corporation , the government , or any other organization to pay the  retired workers .
In the context of Singapore , the Central Provident Fund (CPF) is set up to provide Singaporeans with a retirement plan .
The benefits of the CPF scheme are classified into , retirement , healthcare , home ownership , family protection and asset enhancement .
Critics of this position point out that the cost of providing pensions leads to the increased taxes on the workforce .
However with the help of the pension system , it has provided the elderly with a retirement fund , thus reducing the elder dependency on the children of the elderly .
Last but not least , in light of the challenges of ageing population , many countries have changed their policies with respect to early retirement .
By encouraging later retirement it will help to reduce elder dependency .
Opponents of this position argue that there would be an increase in the wage base with a lower retirement age , because people will save less as they need less wealth and lower savings .
However working longer also means providing sufficient savings for old age; it will also help increase the economic growth and instill a sense of belonging and self value to the elderly .
Moreover , lifelong learning empowers the elderly to lead a better lifestyle through social interaction and contribution to the community .
In conclusion , technology and  national development and policies have helped ease the aging process .
Technology applications such as Telemedicine which aids the tracking and handling of medical reports and appointments  encourage the elderly to keep track of their personal health through a cost and time effective system .
In addition , pension schemes and later retirement help to reduce elder dependency through providing a retirement plan and increasing the economic growth .

Firstly , with a higher budget to spend in other areas such as education and defense , a country may develop even more rapidly .
With little economic growth , a society may be faced with fewer options on how to take care of people who are least able to take care of themselves .
However , with sufficient economic growth , this would not be the case as there would be more options and fewer persons in need of the help .
With more educated youths , the size of the economy and the tax base would be bigger and the cost burden of an aging population may be spread over a larger and more productive future generation .
Such is the case in Scandinavian countries where generous public funding for prenatal incentives and investments in children , for example in education , has helped curb the problem of an aging and declining population .
Furthermore , in a more educated society , more people are equipped with the knowledge to better take care of themselves and hence help lessen the amount of healthcare spending .
Secondly , by setting boundaries on public spending , people will be less reliant on  government to take care of their every need such as in healthcare .
Elderly dependency can be reduced when they are forced or encouraged to plan and provide in advance for their own old-age livelihood .
When enforced by law or encouraged to save and invest more of their income while still in the work force , people will then save a sufficient amount of money to take care of their health  when necessary rather than depend on the government spending to support their health in their old age .
Dependence on the government can also be reduced by encouraging later retirement ages , longer working lives and lower requirements to elder employment  , which can be achieved alone with an increase on the eligibility of age for pensions and government incentives for the elderly .
Also , when people work longer , they will be able to accumulate more money to be used to support themselves in their old age .
In Singapore , the government has tried using schemes such as CPF (Central Provident Fund) , Medisaveand Medishield and even scrapped  the pension scheme in order to encourage more Singaporeans to take greater responsibility for their own health  .
Lastly ,  limited public spending on healthcare will encourage more working adults to take better care of their elderly parents .
With the elderly to look after  , there will be more stress on filial obligations thereby increasing the willingness of adults in the future to take care of their elderly parents by all means .
In an increasingly  society , working adults often have no time , attention , care and even finance to take care of their elderly parents and thus eventually abandon them in homes .
However ,  depending on the support and care from  the family may be a better and cheaper alternative to take care of the elderly  than depending on the nursing home's nurse to take care of one's parents .
However , detractors may disagree with the stand that  public spending on healthcare should be limited and the money should be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
Limiting public spending on healthcare may not solve the social issues that have surfaced due to the problem of population aging .
It merely leaves the individual and his/her family more responsible for their healthcare issues .
Some of these costs may eventually end up going back into the public sector through other means .
The society may face  a wide range of social issues on education , housing and many more which may not be solved by setting limits on healthcare expenditure on the government's part as this may instead create even more problems .
Yet , in the first place , spending on healthcare may not be a good way to solve societal issues such as the lack of filial piety amongst the youths and over dependence on the government to solve every problem one might face  .
In a nut shell , government spending on the aged in  healthcare should be capped at a certain limit to take care of people who may really be in need while the rest of the budget should be shifted to other areas of the country's growth .
With a limit on healthcare expenditure in the government's budget , there may be a better investment in the area where the government's budget goes to , people would be more self reliant and lastly it will instill a stronger sense of filial obligation in the youths .
"Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development ."
Clearly , this suggestion considers the interest of the country but not the aged .
Although the country's development is essential , it cannot neglect the frailer aging group of the population .
Regardless of the problems an aged population may bring along , it cannot diminish the fact that the elderly is still part of a country's assets .
If the government decides to cut its expenditure on the aging population , the elderly will be struggling for their survival as many welfare benefits will be limited .
Instead , the government should continue to promote welfare programs that aid the elderly in terms of housing and healthcare .
Indeed , there are many problems associated with an aging population .
For example , the elderly people are in need of social and healthcare attention because of their feeble physical condition .
This increases burdens on the younger workforce as they have to bear the cost of healthcare services required by the elderly .
Other than that , an aging population will hinder the economic growth due to its lower productivity .
However , it is a fact that citizens are part of a country's assets regardless of their age .
We cannot abandon them just because they bring along several problems .
It is the responsibility of the younger population and the government to support the aged .
This is because the older generation contributed to the workforce during their younger days .
It is their hard labour that has paved the road for us today .
As a result , the younger people and the government should reciprocate the hard work by helping the elderly .
Even if the elderly is able to support themselves , the government should continue to assist through other policies .
However , priority should be given to the needy elderly , especially for older people with a lower education background and less savings .
One of the welfare packages that the government can provide is "housing" .
A handful of old people have been left stranded on the streets without shelter .
Some have been abandoned by their families while others cannot afford a house because of their financial difficulties .
These people definitely require attention from the government .
Therefore , the government should not limit public spending on the aged population .
Instead , they should invest on introducing new policies that can help these homeless elderly .
Another welfare package the government can offer is "healthcare" .
Health is the most common problem faced by the elderly .
As they age , their body constitution becomes weaker .
As a result , they are more vulnerable to sickness and disease .
They have to make occasional visits to the doctor for diagnosis and remedy .
The cost is high , especially nowadays when new technologies and treatments are expensive .
This is where the government can provide financial aid for the healthcare services required by the aged .
The government can subsidize part of the healthcare expenses incurred by the elderly .
This will lighten the burden of the aged population as well as the younger workforce .
Therefore , public spending for the aged should not be reduced for the country's development .
Instead , the government should increase their spending on the aged so that they can reach out to more needy senior citizens .
Certainly , if the government diverts its spending to other areas of the country's development , the country would enjoy greater economic growth .
Because of that , the government would be able to collect more taxes , which can be used to aid the aging population .
On the other hand , with little economic growth , the government has no choice but to cut down on benefit programs for the aged .
However , it takes time to realize a noticeable increase in economic growth .
It may be many decades from now .
By that time , an unfortunate group of the aged will have been deprived of welfare programs previously planned for them .
These people will suffer as the country works toward other areas of its development .
This is because the country has to limit its spending on the aged while expanding other areas of development .
This is where the government has to make a tough choice between the aged and the country's advancement .
Clearly , the consequences of cutting expenditure on the aged outweigh the alternative in many aspects .
A sizeable segment of the aged would suffer through the process of achieving  economic growth .
Consequently , they would be struggling for survival with the limited welfare policies available to them .
In other words , if welfare programs for the aged are reduced due to limited spending , many problems would arise .
Subsequently , the government would have to spend more resources to solve the problems that arise .
Therefore , it is better to give equal if not more spending to the aged , while keeping existing welfare benefits in place .
Current psychology researchers claim that there are several pillars to being a healthy individual .
Therefore , to have pillars such as having sufficient social support and having an active engagement in life helps the elderly to cope with the inevitable stress of elderly life .
Current technological developments have been developed to help the elderly ease the process of aging .
For example , the latest developments of assistive technology can make important contributions to the care of elderly people in elderly institutions and at home .
Care at home is often the preferred choice of the elderly and is generally more affordable for care providers than putting them into an institution for the elderly .
The elderly need some form of monitoring technology to help improve their safety when no one is able to be around to look after them all the time .
Remote health monitoring solutions such as to keep tabs on their blood pressure , body temperature and their heart-rate can raise alerts for medical attention quickly .
Inventions such as fall detectors , pressure mats and bed alerts can improve the elderly home owners' safety and their personal abilities to cope better at home alone .
Technologies have also been designed to help the elderly maintain their own independence .
One invented device uses optical sensors to monitor how these elderly pick things up and how they use them .
It can tell if a person does something wrong such as mistake a bottle of vinegar for drinking water; or if they are doing certain things in the wrong order .
This technological invention can also be extended to monitor how the elderly interact with other devices such as a television , a DVD player or a washing machine .
A screen called the "technology coach" will then reveal the problem and show them the correct way of interacting with these devices .
Another invention uses Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology to track which medications are taken and when .
This can prevent the elderly from taking the wrong medication or overdosing themselves and thus jeopardizing their own lives .
In addition , adding a motion sensor system to provide a daily update of the elderly can help bring peace of mind to distant relatives who are concerned about the safety of their elderly family members who might be injured or ill and , worse of all , unable to call for help .
We have seen how technologies are able to replace human supervision and to monitor the condition of an elderly person round the clock , which is less possible with human care providers .
One may argue that these technologies could potentially isolate the elderly further from their families and keep them indoors even more .
This is no longer true because advanced technologies have managed to put a face to high tech devices .
A technology called the Digital Family Portrait enables the elderly and their relatives to hang up a special digital frame on their walls to receive updates of what's going on in  .
This technology can also be used to receive video phone calls from neighbors within the neighbourhood an elderly person lives in .
Furthermore , the elderly who have difficulties getting out of their homes can tap on various video technologies to draw themselves closer to their neighbors and faraway relatives through activities such as playing chess with them or engaging in a simple conversation .
We can see how technology was never meant to isolate people .
Instead , it is meant to be a life enabler to increase the quality of life , like helping the elderly stay indoors safely and providing maximum possible social interaction and social support from their neighbors and relatives .
Therefore , current research on technology targeted towards the elderly  not only helps ease the aging process , but it also increases the quality of life significantly for these elderly folks .

As Singapore's population ages , there are many questions  on how to help the elderly cope with the aging process .
with the government's emphasis on tackling the rising problems of an ageing population , current research and development have helped to ease the aging process through introducing policies , upgrading  facilities and providing quality healthcare services .

Firstly , we will be looking at the social policies that the government has introduced in order to encouraged people to save for their old-age dependency .
They introduced laws and encourage people to save and invest more of their income earned while they are active in the work force .
The government created public awareness of early planning and proper saving strategies which are necessary to ensure that we have enough money to last us through our old-age after retirement .
Early planning means that we have to start saving once we step into the workforce .
This ensures that by the time we retire , there will be sufficient savings left to spend for our old age .
The government has also set up a mandatory saving scheme for all working Singaporeans .
It is called the Central Provident Fund (CPF) .
However ,  some people , especially the younger ones ,  disagree with such a scheme .
They believe that they should have control over their earned income instead of being 'forced' to contribute a portion of their income to such a scheme .
They feel that the responsibility of saving should not be controlled by the government but by themselves .
In my opinion , younger people tend to spend what they earn and neglect planning for the future .
They are not aware of the problems they may face after retirement .
Thus , with the public awareness of saving for old age and the CPF , one will have sufficient savings for their old-age dependency .
Secondly , as we grow older , we tend to experience more health problems such as walking difficulties and deteriorating physical strength .
Therefore ,  the development of an elderly-friendly environment helps to ease the aging process .
An elderly person is not afraid to walk around the housing estates or travel in public transport as these facilities have become more accessible to them .
One of the infrastructural developments that we can see is the building of lifts to serve all levels of new and existing HDB flats .
This eliminates the need for an elderly person to climb the stairs in order to get to the level that the lift does not stop at .
Another development is the building of more slopes instead of steps .
The elderly will have an easier time walking up and slopes than stairs to get to their destination .
These are some of the benefits that can be seen around our housing estates .
Public transportation such as the MRT and buses have implemented a similar concept  in the building of their facilities .
MRT stations have built lifts to allow the elderly to travel up to and down from the platform with ease .
Public buses have steps-free entrances and exits for easier mobility of the elderly .
However , some people question if the spending on all these upgrades to increase accessibility for the elderly is necessary .
They feel that the money spent should be used on strengthening the economy instead .
But if we do not maintain a good infrastructure that caters to the elderly , no matter how good the economy is , the elderly will not be able to enjoy accessible and user-friendly facilities that make their life more convenient . .
Lastly , better healthcare services that are readily available to the elderly ensure that they are well taken care of .
One may be afraid of growing old as more health problems will arise and it may be difficult getting the necessary healthcare .
However , now we will be able to get the proper care and rehabilitation due to improvements to healthcare facilities such as public hospitals , nursing homes and polyclinics .
We have a team of well-trained doctors and nurses who are committed to taking care of the elderly who need special attention .
We also have groups of medical specialists who are always finding ways to improve the healthcare of the elderly through better medication and rehabilitation .
As a result , more day rehabilitation centres and nursing homes have been built to handle the demands for increasing healthcare .
In my opinion , the elderly do not need to worry about getting good healthcare services as it is easily found anywhere in Singapore .
In conclusion , we can see that research and development has brought about improvements that have played a part in easing the aging process .
government policies are involved to ensure that proper saving for the future is in place , the upgrading of public facilities have helped create an elderly-friendly environment and  better healthcare services have been made available .
I concur with the writer's view of reducing elder dependency by encouraging later retirement , longer working lives , and lower barriers to elder employment .
Firstly , encouraging later retirement for the elderly can drastically change individuals' attitude towards work .
This in turn will provide a positive mentality to better prepare them for their old age .
For example , when the government announces measures to encourage later retirements , the citizens would be prepared for what is to come and  be more ready to accept it , thus reducing elder dependency in the long term .
Secondly ,  extending individuals' workinglife will often result in the accumulation of more wealth which can be used to support them in their old age .
This acts as a safety net to dramatically reduce the need for elder dependency .
For example , an elderly person who has worked for 50 years compared to one that has worked for 40 years should have considerably more savings .
Lastly , lowering barriers to elder employment can also reduce the need for elder dependency .
With the ability to work and also a sustainable income , the elderly will find themselves less dependent on others .
Moreover , their gained experience can prove valuable to the economy .
For example , with increased measures bythe government fto put the elderly into the workforce , the elderly will be able to depend on themselves .
All in all , the strategy on reducing elder dependency through the 3 methods can prove to be valuable for an aging society .

Indeed , perhaps everyone is afraid of aging because it not only marks deterioration in physical health and significant psychological changes , but also places more financial burdens on the government and the society , because obviously , the elderly need fiscal support , better health care and facilities specialized for their age-related problems .

From my point of view , this recommendation is completely reasonable and convincing for several reasons .
First of all , investment should be focused more on education as it takes a higher priority than other fields of development because education plays a very important role in the society , determining the wealth and success of the entire nation .
More specifically , a good education system will produce a more talented and creative generation who can replace the current old generation and continue to devote their best to develop the country' economy in the future .
One example of necessary financial support is the investment on developing and upgrading the current facilities used in education , including information technology equipment , laboratories and library systems .
This is particularly important to the education in developing and less developed countries , like Vietnam , China , the Philippines and Malaysia , where teaching and learning still utilise traditional methods with little IT support and the use of old textbooks , as well as using laboratories with obsolete devices .
With improvements in educational facilities , students will be able to accessup-to-date knowledge more easily , as well as experiment with and apply what they have learned in reality .
Another way to carry out this strategy is that the budget can be used to promote and export the country's education .
This is exactly what the Singapore government is doing to attract excellent students from other nations .
By providing tuition grants (of 80%) and financial aid for living costs of foreign students along with a career bond , Singapore will have a greater workforce serving them for at least 3 years after graduation .
Another area that the government needs to be concerned about is the environment as hundreds of environmental projects (such as reducing the level of green house gases and noxious fumes in the atmosphere or promoting the use of non-plastic carrying bags) are waiting for capital and fiscal support .
In such small nations (in terms of geographical area) like Singapore , this issue is particularly important because every climatic change or pollution problem is likely to negatively affect the whole country , especially the physical health of the people , including the aged .
Therefore , solving this problem means the elderly will be taken care of by the government , even though it is an indirect way .
Moreover , the environment is a global concern; it influences everybody in the world .
Thus , protecting it means we are protecting not only the young but also the elderly; not only the current generation , but also the future ones .
Therefore , there should be more policies on supporting environmental protection projects as well as monitoring and penalizing violation of environment laws .
Besides the concerns surrounding environmental protection and education , public spending on the aged should be partly transferred to public infrastructure development projects such as public transportation , schoolsand hospitals because such developments are directly related to the improvement in the living standards of senior citizens .
Firstly , a modern infrastructure will bring about s , effectiveness and efficiency .
One example of this is the extension of access to most public places and even on public transport vehicles for people with physical disabilities , through designing paths or elevators specialized for wheel chairs , or placing special directional signs for the elderly with sight or hearing problems .
Secondly , due to its higher efficiency , such facilities will help reduce operational costs and subsequently decrease the cost of living for citizens .
For instance , a well organized public transportation system will help minimize the use of private vehicles , which is costly , and reduce traffic congestion and accidents .
And therefore , to some extent , the elderly will indirectly benefit from this policy .
In conclusion , people may be upset with the idea of limiting public spending on the elderly because they may think that the aged increasingly lack  care from the society .
However ,  considering the positive impacts it brings about to the entire society , obviously the advantages will outweigh the disadvantages .
Hence , this idea should be carried out soon for the sake of everybody and the government needs to promote and analyze the pros of this policy in order to avoid misunderstandings  .
