According to an interview with Leonid A . Gavrilov , Ph .D for the Journal of Anti-Aging Medicine () , the aging process is defined as "any process , which contributes to age-related decline in performance , productivity and health .'
Over the years , research and development specifically in the field of technology has made significant contributions to address this process of increased inconvenience .
Although critics of this position point out that technology is still short of significantly slowing aging , current research and development has to a large extent eased this process and made life easier through the introduction of technological inventions .
This essay will discuss the impact of some of these technological inventions and how it helps the aging population cope with their decline performance , productivity and health .
Certain objections must , of course , be considered .
One may argue that older people are forgetful and are not able to learn new things .
Also , with the advances of technology , it is impossible for the older people to learn the complex nature of new technology such as using the text messaging function of a mobile phone .
However , this argument is flawed .
Aging does not affect our ability to learn .
Although it might take an older person a longer time to learn , the cognitive function does not decline with age .
While an older person might have " some difficulty with short-term (working) memory" as cited by James Pirkly ,  "long-term memory generally remains sound ."
Also , although technology itself is complex in nature , there are technological inventions tailored for the older people and we will take a look at two of this technology .
Firstly , the current technology of mobile phones and personal device assistance (PDA) has in a lot of aspects contributed in addressing issues arising from health and decrease performance in terms of mobility .
These devices (mobile phones and PDAs) have various functions and applications that assist the user to complete daily essential tasks that are made difficult due to aging .
The quick dial function allows the elderly to seek emergency or medical help promptly with just a press of a button .
This ensures that the elderly are attended to when they are alone at home and suffer a fall or have any other injuries that need attention .
The global positioning system (GPS) function that are found in certain devices allow loved ones to keep track of the elder's movement and if the elderly gets lost , the loved ones are just a call away .
Applications such as the Baycreast's Memory-Link Program that can be installed on a PDA have functions to set time-based alerts and snapped photos to aid the elderly in remembering important details .
These applications and functions amongst many are easily available on the market and are there to ultimately help the elderly age in the comfort of their own home .
Secondly , the technological invention of Med-eMonitor , a device  helps the old to differentiate the various prescription drugs and when exactly to take it .
Managing the different drugs that often look similar in appearance is a challenge for the elderly .
With their ever-worsening eyesight and memory loss , this device seeks to help ease that burden .
This device has different compartments to store different medication and each compartment has its own unique time reminder system with instructions .
When it is time for the elderly to take a particular medicine , a musical chime will be played .
When an elder opens that compartment , text instructions are displayed clearly on an LCD screen .
If the musical chime is not attended to , the device can place a phone call to family members or care givers .
Current research and development particularly in the field of technology has in a huge way helped the elderly cope with the demands of aging .
The 2 types of  that are mentioned in this essay are amongst many that facilitate the old in handling age-related decline in health , performance and productivity .
As technology continues to advance , more tasks can be done and aging will soon be considered a transition rather than a problem .
Cutting down spending on the elderly will only increase the seriousness of the aging issues .
Over the years , journalists and scholars have been publishing articles regarding how public spending on the elderly are rising and will be increasing in the future and the consequences of it .
They think that this will become a financial burden for the young generation and working adults , who will be contributing to the public spending .
It is normal that tax-payers are very concerned on how policy makers make decisions on how their hard earned money is pent and whether the policy makers are making full use of the money .
Hence , more and more people are suggesting diverting the money to other areas of development , which they think is beneficial to them as compared to spending on the aged .
But , this is definitely not a good suggestion because I believe that the government should always put their people as the first priority when making decisions .
If they were to ignore the needs of the elderly and focus on the development , it will obviously bring more social problems to the society .
Furthermore , this aging population is very much dependent on the public spending to cover their daily needs , more importantly their medical expenses .
They  usually have low income level or are below poverty level .
Daily expenses and medical needs might become a burden for them .
I believe this is one of the reasons why most of the  refuse to see a doctor and accept medical treatment when they are ill because they think that it is a waste of money .
Without the help from public spending , they might face financial problems in order to maintain their living and health condition .
Illnesses and various diseases  always seems to attack the old people as this group of people are weaker compared to other age groups .
It will be more worrying if they need special or long term medical treatment that might be too costly for them to handle .
From the all the reasons mentioned above , it is very clear that cutting down public spending for the old age is not a good choice in order to divert the money for the areas of development .
The group of elderly people is getting bigger which tells us that the current policy is not applicable anymore in the future as there will be more demand from the elderly .
In order to have more money for other areas of development , one of the ways is to reduce other sectors of public spendingsuch as  education , for example .
So , the suggestion to cut down spending for the old age people is not a good solution to use the money for other areas of development .

For instance , The Singapore government encourages the university educated or professionally qualified mother to have at least 3 or more children by giving tax rebates of $20 ,000 or more .
On the other hand , the government has begun to provide a subsidy of $100 for employed mothers when their 3th preschool children is placed in approved full day child care centers .
There are also unrecorded leave for mothers to take care of the sick children .
The "three , if you can afford it" policy  has increased the total population of Singapore citizens and has allowed the population of the country to younger .
Different types of policies have been introduced to improve the welfare of the elderly so that they are able to benefit from it .
One of the policies that has been introduced is the housing policies such as lift upgrading , elderly fitness corner and studio apartments .
Firstly , the government has implemented the lift upgrading program to build new lifts in  housing blocks which have direct access to every floor to cater to the elderly residents who have painful legs and who are wheelchair bound .
According to Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong s the old lifts have been replaced with the new lifts which previously only stopped at every third or fourth floor (Lee , 2009 .
With the newly upgraded lifts ,  more convenience to the elderly is provided
Secondly , elderly fitness corners are built to cater to the elderly to exercise more in order to lead a healthy lifestyle .
They are strongly encouraged to use the facilities at the fitness corners to do a light workout to improve their health conditions .
Having regular exercises helps to prevent any chronic diseases such as high blood pressure and heart disease from attacking the elderly ( , 2009 .
Besides exercising , the elderly are also able to interact with their  , thus widening  their social network .
Through a healthy and active lifestyle  the elderly  are able to live longer and stay free from illness (Balaji , 1999 .
With that , they are able to return  to work and continue to contribute to the society .
Thus , not only do the elderly  benefit from it , the country's economic growth may also benefit since they have valuable experiences in the industry .
However , critics of this position argue that the government should not spend time and resources to ease the aging process .
Instead they should implement more policies on the younger generation to boost the economy growth so as to move towards a knowledge based economy and also to introduce more schemes to increase the birth rate so that the government is able to meet their goals .
Moreover , it is the children's responsibility to take care of the parents instead of the government .
If the elderly well- being is not well taken care of , the younger generation may not want to reconsider giving birth since the society is unprepared for the aging population in the future and this will cause more elderly living in this society .
If the society is well-prepared , the younger generation does not have to worry about their own welfare when they turn old .
Besides that , not all children have the ability to support their parents as they might be facing financial problems and hence are unable to take good care of them .
In addition , some elderly do not have any children .
Therefore the elderly need the government's help to meet their physical needs .
In my opinion , public spending on the elders should be limited and the money can be diverted to other sectors of the progress of the country .
Indeed , the aged  were once the main human resource that  contributed greatly to the development of the country and thus deserve the welfare of getting public spending , as a token of gratitude .
Yet that token of gratitude should not be too much till it may drag down the development of the country .
Instead , reformed policies should be implemented to limit the public spending for the aged , and meanwhile , to make sure that their welfare is still taken care of .
To begin with , public spending on the aged population has become a burden to the tax payers .
It is known that the money proposed for the eldercare nowadays has comprised a large portion of the government spending .
For example , according to the Singapore budget report of 2009 , the payout for the Senior Citizen Bonus is at least SD$73400000 .00 for that year .
This figure has not  included the other programmes that are proposed for the senior citizens .
As the source of money for the government is mainly the tax payers , this figure translates as  a burden on these contributing citizens .
Furthermore , in these few years , the amount of money that is allocated for the eldercare has been increasing .
If this trend does not change in the next few years , the average citizens would have to pay more , in order to enable the government to use the money for the aged ones .
In other words , the income that they earned would be constantly reduced .
This may result in the feeling of indignation in the tax-payers towards the ruling government - which is not an advantageous condition for the further growth of the country .
In fact ,  public funding for the welfare of the aged  is still needed in some ways , but it is  so crucial until it should comprise such a huge section of the government spending .
As an alternative , some of the policies should be reformed to shift a part of the government duty to the family of the elders , and even the elders themselves .
For example , people should be compelled by law to take care of their own parents .
The family should carry out the responsibility to look after the elders .
Besides that , most of the elders do have their own savings or investment that they have accumulated since they were young .
Anyway , in the case of  homeless , childless and jobless ,  they should savour the benefits from the eldercare programme by the government .
Or else , they may have to end up suffering without assistance or even notice of the others .
Thus , in conclusion , the public funding for the aged population should be limited , for the good of the tax payers , the overall development of the country and the familial happiness of the elders .
Then , the money that is cut off from that sector can be diverted to the other areas of the country .
The problem of aging population has become worse and worse in many countries .
For instance , Singapore is said to be the third-fastest ageing nation with a doubled proportion of people aged above 65 in 2020 .
(Lee , 2008) Aging often becomes terrible as the elderly are drained from high medical and healthcare fee .
Thus governments' pension , subsidy and medical insurance perform a main role to help such old people .
However , to solve the aging problem is not merely spending more money on the aged .
Certain fields' pension could be limited , such as the ones' who are financially independent after retirement .
On the other hand , there are other crucial areas where governments need to give strong financial supports , such as education and economy .
Furthermore , investment in these areas will help to solve the aging problem as well .
Pension , subsidy and medical insurance is the main way through which the government can directly help the aged , however , this does not imply that more financial support would definitely lead to better sitution .
Now f .scal policy to help the aged does not satisfy everybody's needs .
Firstly , in terms of pensfees , the government's regulations always determine the amount of pension given to a person by how much he or she has contributed to the society .
Mostly , these productive people are able to accumulattypes of h wealth to fight for their aged problems .
t the same time , research reveals that these people can often be productive and healthy even after retirement .
In contrast , those who are less succesupport their life will get comparably less pension to support them .
Their low-skilled and physical jobs limit their possibility to continue working after certain age .
These men have to cope with their miserable sunset years with limited pension , and this is where the pension system's imbalance lies .
Secondly , in terms of subsidy and medical insurance , the government often fails to differtiate the levels of need among different groups of people .
For example , people who have chronic disease should receive more subsidy and better medical insurance .
For those who work in high polluted industry , they should also be specially considered .
Therefore , the government's financial support should depend on people's financial state and healthy state .
What is more urgent and practical comparing to purely spending more money on the aged is to restructure the pension , subsidy and medical insurance systems to ensure the limited government's money can effectively help the aged .

Education is the root of a country .
It is widely believed that the most important treasure of a country in 21st century is talents .

Thus education deserves huge financial support from the government .

Hopefully , such broad education could evoke love in everyone's heart , and let all people take initiative to care about the old people in our society .

Besides education , spending money on economy development is also very important .

Without this , China could not possible to achieve what it has today .

Recently , the aging population has caused lots of social and economic problems , which has drawn the attention of more and more governments .
However , what most governments do is just to increase public spending on the aged  , which is not enough to tackle the issue and even decreases the country's development .
In fact , it will be more efficient to limit spending on the old and use more money on economic development .
First of all , it cannot be ignored that there will be more choices to care for those who are in need with sufficient economic growth .
For instance , Cambodia possessed a very slow development for a long time .
With a large population living in poverty , its government spent quite a large amount of money on the needy .
The situation is similar for the problem of aging population .
If more efforts and money are spent on the development of economy , there will be much more benefits gained from it in turn .
Therefore , we are provided with more choices to care for the elder people .
Secondly , it is not necessary for governments to spend too much money on the elderly to resolve the problem of aging population .
Alternatively , by requiring people to provide in advance for their own old-age dependency , governments can also solve this problem without slowing down economic growth .
In some countries , like Singapore and Britain , people are encouraged or compelled by law to save and invest a certain portion of their income when they are active in the work force .
This method proves to be very effective .
With enough money saved or invested during the years of work , the elderly  become less dependent on financial aids from governments .
Moreover , there will be more money diverted to other areas to promote the economic development .
Instead of increasing spending on the old , the problem can also be tackled by encouraging the elderly  to lead longer working lives .
That is an effective way to solve some economic and social problems caused by aging population .
A good example is that the UK's government managed to solve pension drain by using this method .
Furthermore , longer working lives can definitely help lessen the pressure of younger generations , which protects them from being overwhelmed by overloaded work .
What is  most important is that longer working lives give the aged opportunities to accumulate wealth for later lives , making them less vulnerable to the changes of outer aids .
This will truly benefit the aged who are completely dependent on pensions from governments .
Some people may have doubts about the productivity of the aged and argue that it is their right to lead a peaceful lives .
However , this is not true .
On the one hand , life today is different from the past , in part because of demographic and economic changes .
The population aged 65 to 75 is healthier and better educated than those in this age group in past generations .
Most people who retire  from work today are still energetic and in quite good health .
So there is no doubt that the aged are able to lead longer working lives .
On the other hand , since the aged are mostly more experienced and patient , there truly exist some  jobs more suitable for them .
In that case , they are even more productive than younger workers .
It is shown that we are able to efficiently solve the problems caused by aging population with limited spending .
Through the methods of requiring people to provide in advance and encouraging longer working lives , more money can be diverted to other areas to promote  economic development .
And with sufficient economic development , there will be more choices for governments to care for the old .
It is well-known that the world is facing a growing aging population and this trend is unlikely to be reserved in the short term .
In order to let the aged enjoy a relatively good life , the governments grant pension and other benefits for the old .
In 2006 , the Chinese Government granted over 500 billion RMB of pension to 460 billion pensioners nationwide , and the medical expenses of these people were more than 3 times that of the young population .
Without a doubt , this will leave a heavy burden on the growth of the economics with the rapidly growing aging population .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should be limited so that the money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
Firstly , it is not worth spending a lot of money on the aged at the cost of the whole society's development .
Money should be transferred to some more important areas .
In fact , if the ecmics of the whole society can ensure a steady growth , then it will be much easier for the country to undertake the pension .
Although the aging problem is worsening , it is not a wise choice to focus too much attention on the issue .
When the limited money is made the most of , the aged can benefit from the various prospering departmeeconomyver the country , even maintain a self-sufficient life without the financial aid from the government .
Secondly , governments can encourage every citizen to save for their old-age dependency .
If everyone starts to save when they begin to work ,  most of them can be independent in finance after retirement .
Nowadays investment companies or insurance companies provide a variety of investment plans which can satisfy the needs for most people .
For example , in Singapore , people begin to save a certain percent of his salary into his bank account , in order to pay the housing loan , car loan or for advanced age .
Many developed countries such as Britand Australian also carry out this policy .
If people are not willing to save in advance , then the government can compel people to save by law .
Spending the governmentoney is not the most effective way to solve the aging problem .
We can also achieve the goal of easing the aging process by encouraging advance savings and providing suitable jobs for the old .
Since the money should be reduced by promoting these two policies , more goodsy can be transferred to other more urgent areas .
In a nutshell , money spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
I agree with the question that "Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development ."
The greying population are expected to double by the year 2030 , "one in five Singaporeans will be over 65 , up from 1 in 12 today" () .Therefore the amount of public spending required are also expected to rise proportionately .
The Government should limit public spending so as to prevent over reliance of the elderly on them which  in turn causes an even bigger strain on the shrinking work force .
Therefore , the Government should focus on increasing productivity of future workers and making the citizens more independent rather than  expanding the budget .
Some of the ways to do so is to make saving compelled by law , to elderly to come back to the workforce , and in healthcare aspects .
Law Compelled Saving
In order to cultivate the sense of self reliance the Government should make a compulsory law for the working adults to save into a special account with their monthly pay .
One  such example is the Central Provident Fund (CPF) scheme used in Singapore over 5 decades .
This policy helps to prepare the citizens for their retirement while they still have the ability to earn an income .
This would ensure that each citizen would have some amount of money to fall back on when they retire and would in turn lessen the needs for subsidies or help from the government .
Education should also pay a part in allowing the future citizens to know the importance of early retirement preparation and planning .
Increase Workforce
One of the major problems of an ageing population is the lack of workforce to drive the economy .
Since the human's life expectancy has generally increased over the decades , it is essential that elderly  work and earn more income for their retirement while it is possible .
Therefore the retirement age should be pushed back and elderly should be encouraged to upgrade their skills and continue working as they are a country's invaluable resource with a lot of experience .
By tapping on the large number of elderly , the country's workforce will be increased and more people will be available to drive the country's economy to encourage growth .
With sufficient economic growth , there will be lesser needy people as well .

Vulnerable Group of Elderly
In conclusion , I agree that public spending should be limited as citizens should not be over reliant on their Government and the focus to solve such problems should be to increase workforce and also make use of more money on lowering healthcare costs  in other areas of the country's development .
Nations in Asia are suffering from the problem of an aging population .
With the increasing problem , the government has no choice but to spend a large sum of money to help and allow the process of aging in the society to be easy and convenient .
With policies , resources and money set aside for elders , elders are prepared to retire and enjoy retirement in a more fulfilling manner .
Reasons for the government to increase their spending on the elders include , the importance of an elderly in a family setting is important and we should all respect them in all aspects Elders in countries have given most of their lives in their homeland and as a result become a significant part of development of their nations .
In return , the government should take care of our elders as a means of gratification .
Lastly , the potential contributions of the elders would be valuable for the current generation .
Aging is the accumulation of changes in an organism or object over time .
Aging process happens naturally and does not result from disease or accident .
The effects of this process differ from each person but most likely they will suffer from declining organ function .
Vision and hearing loss , smell problems , and memory loss are some examples of illnesses that often attack the elderly .
These illnesses will affect their daily lives in some ways such as cause inconvenience in social life and inhibit their activities .
Nevertheless , current development in technology has produced a variety of devices that help simplify the aging process .
Research shows that of people aged 70 years , 8 .6% report problems with both hearing and seeing" .
This vision impairments and hearing loss can be a serious problem to the elderly as they may lead to misunderstanding in communication .
Elderly who suffer from vision and hearing loss will find difficulties in making a phone call , listening to voice mail , and using text messages with cell phones .
However , the development in technology has eventually overcome such problems .
In 2006 , an electronics brand , Samsung , launched its Jitterbug J , an excellent cell phone for the elderly .
This gadget provides the elderly a simple way in making phone calls and using text messages .
Jitterbug cell phone suits the elderly as it has loud and clear sound as well as large and brief on-screen text .
A satisfied customer , MakenzieB , purchased a Jitterbug for her 62-year-old mother .
Her mother absolutely loves it and could easily understand how to use it .
She can easily call her family and check voicemail by herself .
Technology development has also helped the elderly with smell problems .
A statistic from National Institutes of Health shows that "More than 2 million adults have disorders of smell" .
These problems are more common in elderly because the sense of smell changes as people age .
When sense of smell changes , elder people will lose the ability to detect smoke , leaking gas , or airborne pollutants and toxins .
Thus , they will need warning devices to detect smoke and carbon dioxide .
A device called The Shake-Up Alarm is a solution to this problem .
The Shake-Up Alarm contains  two parts: smoke detector and signaller .
When smoke is  detected , the smoke detector will transmit signals to two receivers which are a bed vibrator and a strobe light .
The bed vibrator can be placed under a pillow or mattress .
Thus , the vibrator will alert the owner even when he falls asleep .
The second receiver , which is a strobe light , will flash 60 times per minute .
The other illness that usually attacks elderly is memory loss .
According to a mid-March story from HealthDay , "5 .4 million Americans over 70 have memory loss that affects their daily lives" .
One problem that occurs as an effect of memory loss is a difficulty to manage a strict schedule of numerous prescription drugs .
Many pills look similar and there are different instructions for taking each of them .
Thus , it will be a big problem for the elderly with memory loss to remember the instructions of each pill .
However , there is a device called Med-eMonitor which can help ease such burden .
Med-eMonitor is a pill organizer which functions as medication separator and system reminder .
This device also shows on-screen instructions which will help elderly take the drug with proper dosage and schedule .
Another device that can help elderly with memory loss is Mnemonic .
Mnemonic is a wrist-wrapped device that reminds the owner about important events or meetings .
It has a special feature which is built-in accelerometer which will keep the display on top no matter which direction it is rotated .
In conclusion , every person will face the aging process and as a result , various diseases such as vision and hearing loss , smell problems , and memory loss are likely to attack as they age .
After all , nowadays research and development in technology has eventually provided a variety of gadgets that suit the elderly and help them handle the aging process .
Thus , elderly will feel convenient to do their daily activities and live independently .

Problems led by decrease in manpower come along; however , research was made and strategies were proposed meanwhile .

A research conducted by The Center for Disease Control and Prevention in the United States showed that " [1]about 80% of the population aged 65 and above has at least one chronic health condition , and 50% has at least two" .
Some of the most common chronic health problems which the elderly suffers from are arthritis , heart disease , and cancer .
These diseases often decrease the quality of life of the elderly because they cause the elderly to lose their ability to live a normal life as they used to live .
However , some recent medical inventions give us promising solutions to these health problems related to aging and hence ease the aging process .
[2]Almost 43 million adults in the United States suffer from arthritis .
One of the most common types of arthritis is rheumatoid arthritis .
Rheumatoid arthritis can affect many tissues and organ but mostly attacks the small joints .
The disease disables the elderly from doing their normal activities because it causes the joints to become swollen and limits their movements .
Moreover , arthritis and related conditions are the leading cause of disability in the United States .
[3]The most frequently affected joints in the hand are finger joints .
This fact is quite worrying since fingers are the most frequently used part of a human hand .
Nevertheless , researchers at Royal Hampshire County Hospital have invented [4] "a particular type of silver ring splints worn on fingers which is effective in controlling hyperextension deformity of finger joints , which is common in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis" .
This new treatment method replaced the old massive plastic rings which were worn to stabilize the joints .
Many patients who have received the new silver ring treatment commented that [5] "the silver rings look better than the old bulky ones .
They are also more durable and stronger ."

[6] Heart disease makes up more than 30% of deaths in American adults aged 65 and above caused by chronic disease , making it the disease which kills most elderly .
The most fatal symptom of heart disease is heart attack .
When heart attack occurs , blood supply to part of the heart is interrupted , causing some heart muscle cells to die .
This often causes severe heart failure because the heart muscle cells cannot regenerate themselves due to the absence of myoblasts , which are the cells forming muscle cells .
In the past , these dead cells caused by a heart attack could not be replaced .
But today , thanks to a new heart  treatment called "Heart Myoblast Cell Injection" , heart attack victims can get their healthy heart muscle cells back .
[7] In this new treatment method , myoblast cells are extracted from the heart  patient's own thigh muscles .
After that , the cells are cultured in the lab then injected to the heart of the patient .
Research show that new tissue formation and improvement in the heart function of the patients were found after this treatment .
The lead researcher of this treatment at the Arizona Heart Institute , Nabil Dib , says , "Through this heart  treatment we can regenerate a scar tissue caused by a heart attack , which is the opposite of what we learnt in medical school ."
[8] While heart disease is still the leading cause of death in the elderly , cancer comes second .
[9] In the United States , Lung cancer kills more people than other cancers .
The traditional method to cure lung cancer in a patient is by surgery or radiotherapy which is given five days a week for six to seven weeks .
Radiotherapy process can be burdensome because of its frequency , especially for those who do not live in cities with equipped hospitals .
However , cancer specialists from Temple University have found a new method called Stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) .
[10] Unlike the ordinary radiotherapy , SBRT can be stopped after three to eight treatments .
Another advantage of SBRT is it can double the survival rates of early stage patients .
The survival rates of SBRT are as high as surgical methods , which some patients cannot have because of their conditions or refuse to have .
[11] Experts are very optimistic that this new treatment can replace the old radiotherapy and surgery .
Curtis Miyamoto , M .D . , chair and professor of the Department of Radiation Oncology at Temple University School of Medicine said that "With the success of this technique , we're now questioning whether we'll even be doing surgeries on these patients in the future ."
[12] Colorectal cancer is the second  cancer-related killer in the United States after lung cancer .
Most  colorectal cancer patients are elderly because the possibility of having colorectal cancer increases with age .
Chemotherapy is often recommended to cure the disease depending on the patient's condition .
The problem is , most elderly patients are not as fit enough as younger patients to stand chemotherapy .
Nevertheless , some scientists from The United Kingdom have found a vaccine called TroVax which is able to cure kidney and bowel cancer .
This includes colorectal cancer .
The research on the vaccine showed that "[13] One patient who was given the vaccine has seen his tumour disappear totally  .
Another two have seen their tumours reduce in size , and in three people the cancer has been stopped in its tracks .
50 patients have had the vaccine and 95 per cent of those that can be evaluated have had an 'anti-tumour response" .
Unlike chemotherapy which can cause depression of the bodies immune system because it kills not only bad cancer cells but also good cells which contribute to the body's immunity , this vaccine works in a totally different way .
The vaccine improves the body's immune system to fight a particular disease which in this case is colorectal cancer
Recent inventions offer medical solutions to the elderly suffering from chronic medical conditions such as arthritis , heart disease , and lung cancer .
These inventions help the elderly to live a healthier life .
By living a healthier life , the elderly people can live their days more normally and hence this will help them in the aging process .

A survey done by Strait-times shows that old people spend nearly 90% of the rest of their life at home , 53% of them hire maids to assist their living and that they develop some diseases due to inappropriate home design .
An old woman in this survey said it is not very convenient for her to use the wheelchair at home and her eyes feel tired very often .
If old people have the layout of furniture in a more organized way they can live by themselves more comfortably .
Meanwhile the adjusted daylight can also benefit their health .
Thus , it is essential to redesign homes for old people to ease their aging process .
First of all , layout of the home is extremely important for old people to manage their living at home .
Firstly , by making sure that the house has single level living , no steps in main entries , no obstruction in the hall way and bedrooms open to the sitting room can reduce the accidents at home for the elderly .
This can be further illustrated by a research conducted by Hunter Centre for Health Advancement in Whales .
It finds that 71 home accidents are reported by 607 elder people in four weeks and 70% of the accidents are falls .
Secondly , more flexibility can be gained if the door is constrained to 36'' and the cabinets do not exceed 67'' high and counters provide a space for your knees when sitting in .
So people with wheelchairs do not need to have someone to assist living , and in such a way they would have a positive attitude toward aging .
And psychologist from university of taxes indicates that being positive delays aging .
Equally importthe layoutighting is another concern about the elder's health , especially the eyes .
, light should be used carefully for eye health .
Such as rliving spaceghwith nong with controlentry pointsnses is also necessary to increase the illuminopening intoor eye protection , and glare should be avoided by choosing the material of the wall , ceiling and mirror to fight against cataracts .
On the other hand , getting enough exposure to daylight can fight against osteoporosis and insomnia .
The best solution is to gain daylight through the ccaused by fallingg .
With the daylight sustained , skin would produce vitamin D more easily , which is critical for strong bones and teeth .
And a study by Gloth (1995) suggests that half of the elder people are under the vitamin D levels .
Furthermore , since old people stay at home for the most of the time , adequate sunlight would help them Psychologistsle of the universityght Texashus prevent them from sleep disorders .

As information and technology has been developing dramatically , the elderly nowadays are being helped with many modern facilities , helping them to ease the aging process .
The aging process usually comes with several phenomena such as bad vision , bad hearing , backache , hair loss , etc .
much progress have been made in science , especially medicine , to provide the elderly with convenient tools for their lives .
For example , dealing with bad vision , which is very popular among people above 60 , we now have special lenses and eye drops , together with traditional magnifiers which are being improved more and more to help the elderly with their eyesight , furthermore special hearing-aids can do a very good work in reinforcing the hearing ability .
In terms of medicine , we also have skin cream to prevent wrinkles , anti hair loss drugs , special medicine for osteoporosis , heart disease , etc .
to provide different ways to ease the aging process .
* "Older Americans Big On Internet , Elderly Not There , Yet" {http://seniorjournal .com/NEWS/SeniorStats/5-01-19SeniorsInternet .htm}[HYPERLINK: http://seniorjournal .com/NEWS/SeniorStats/5-01-19SeniorsInternet .htm]
In addition , technology has also brought to the elderly many convenient tools to help them to be independent in their lives .
Nowadays many houses are equipped with intercom doorbell to help "respond to visitors without having to rush or feel panicky" (1) , thus preventing them from falling .
Electric appliances are accompanied with remote controls which are easy to use and remember so that the elderly can flick through television channels or turn on and off lights and fans themselves .
What's more , wheelchairs now do not need physical strength to move , but thanks to the controls with some different-color buttons , the elderly can use an electric wheelchair and skillfully direct them to wherever they want within the house and around the neighbourhood .
For children working at offices who cannot keep their eyes on their old parents , they can install the webcam system around the house to watch over the parents while still doing their job .
Perhaps the most modern tool for the elderly that has been invented is robots , which have been brought from factories to home to do house chores .
They can do various things and multi-task and thus help the elderly a lot in the house .
For example , the robot named Domo is programmed to not only hold cans and tins but also identify other food with different shapes and quickly find an desired object to accompany the elderly whenever they need(2) .
Or in Japan , where nearly a quarter of the population is at age 65 and above , robots are being used very effectively to help lift the elderly or support them in moving .
Some of them can also respond to oral commands such as "forward" , "back" , "right" , "left"(3) , very convenient for the elderly because they often struggle to remember the buttons and the functions to run a machine .
Who says computers are just for teenagers and the youth ?
With significant advances in information and technology , today the elderly can also use the Internet to join some virtual communities especially designed for them to meet their peers and talk about many things with one another instead of staying alone all day in the house waiting for their children to come home after work .
Singapore recently has launched an Internet portal "I Not Old" ({www .inotold .com}) especially for the elderly , "to provide them with social platforms , games and information"(4) .
In America , a survey has been conducted by the Kaiser Family Foundation to find that one third of seniors above 60 and two-thirds of people between 50 and 64 get access to the Internet .
What are they looking for ?
They search healthcare , such as how to consult a doctor online without having to leave home , or drug information , etc .
(4)
In conclusion , the elderly nowadays are being helped a lot with different advances in technology , to become more and more independent and to live on their own .
We now can feel safe to leave home on our business and leave them at home , knowing that they are supported and equipped with all the things they need .
And with the rapid development in technology , we know that in the near future , many more things will be invented for our parents .

Firstly , for a graying population around the world , lots of policies have been applied to control the birth and death rate or to balance the age structure .
One of the most possibly effective ways is the "two child" population policy in Shanghai , a big city in China .
The Shanghai Daily says about 22% of the population is over 60 years old .
additionally , for a long time , the Chinese population was controlled by a "one child" policy .
As a result , an increased aging population has developed  .
Therefore , "a "two child" policy can relax this problem and boost a higher birth rate , with a government campaign that encourages couples to have a second child .
However , due to a lack of financial incentives , there is still no official announcement with regard to this .
Secondly , to cope with the aging process , an increase in healthcare demand can be organized by improving system performance , redesigning service delivery , support informal caregivers , and shift demographic parameters .
Obviously , the older people use more healthcare than young people .
Nevertheless , health costs are independent of the age structure , which defines the distribution of predetermined expenditures .
Particularly , in Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) , aging population does not have any connections to health expenditure as a part of GDP .
For example , the over-65-year-old Swedish made up 17 .3% in 2000 , but Sweden just spent 8 .6% GDP on health .
The former in Australia was 12 .7% , and the latter was 9 .3% , figured in 2001 and 2002 .
Thirdly , as  mentioned in "A graying world" by Peter Peterson , late retirement not only solves the employment problem , but also lightens the financial burden on the young .
In countries with a limited labour force , taking advantage of experienced , stable employers is very important , as it also contributes to the family income and saves  training cost .
Moreover , providing work to the older people helps them from being bored , alone , and maybe  depressed .
Therefore , the younger people who are the breadwinners of the family are more relaxed and under less pressure , so their work will be more efficient but less stressful .
In conclusion , due to a development in various areas , world has to face a problem of aging population .
Awaring of this , lots of countries have applied a plenty of effective policies to adapt to a new changing world .
Although there are many developments and improvements for it , it seems that some governments still have not seriously concerned on it .
There is a robot project called Twendy-one under research at WASEDA University .
This project aims to develop a daily life support robot for the aged .
(Sugano Laboratory , 2007) Currently , this 147cm tall human-symbiotic- robot can perform conversation with people; provide motion support and perform sophisticated tasks such as fetching seasonings from the refrigerator and picking up a piece of bread from the toaster and put it to a plate using a food tong without spoiling it .
With these functions , this robot may bring great convenience to the life of the elderly and ease the aging problem if it can be industrialized .
In fact , there are a number of researches like Twendy-one , which focuses on technological innovations helpful to the aged people , is being done currently .
Judging from the outcomes of these researches , the aging process has been eased to a large extent mainly in three fields: visual assistance , health monitoring and mobility support .
First , technological inventions provide solution to the vision problem that comes with aging , presbyopia .
The aged may choose to wear optical lenses for presbyopia , and current research has raised this lens technology to a new height .
For example Bifocal Contact Lens has been invented recently .
(Pizzo & Segre , 2008) Each piece of this kind of lens is divided into two parts with different focus .
This enable the presbyopputting it ton a , usually the aged , to see both far objects and near objects clearly without changing lens .
Moreover , this kind of contact lens rides on the eyeball but does not roll together with the eyeball .
This means , when the patient look down , he or she can use the lower part of the lens to read and use the upper part of the lenwhich is being currently done to look at distant objects .
Besides , the aged may also choose to carry a portable digital magnifier which takes picture behind the device , magnifies it to desired clearness and show it on the screen such as PocketViewer .
(HumanWare Group , 2009) With these technological inventions , the aged may be able to read and write like young people .
Hence , the pressure of aging process is reduced .

Technology has improved our daily life a lot .
It impacts  our work , leisure and home .
when compared with the past , today , everything can be done easily with the aid of technology .
As the speed of  technology grows , people in the society age as well .
Recently , the aging population has been a a cause of concern for governments and society .
By 2050 , many people in the first world countries will reach 51 .
(1) In order to ease the global aging process , people have begun using technology with the hope of helping the aging population .
Internet and automated gadgets are some of the technology that were used  a few years ago to help the elderly .
Today , the internet has become so common in  society it has beingused to help the aging population .
People have started to create a link from the elderly to the their family members .
For example , in the United State some family members actually give their elderly a GPS device which can help to keep track of their location  anywhere and at any time .
As people get older , the chances of them getting lost are much  higher and with the help of a GPS device , their loved ones can easily find out their current location when they get lost .
Another way of helping the aging population are automated gadgets .
With the automated gadgets , it can help to take care or monitor the elderly especially when they are alone .
An example would be the Med-eMonitor , invented by InforMedix , which acts as a medicine reminder for the elderly .
This gadget actually is just about the size of a VCR tape and operates on a rechargeable battery which can last for two weeks .
Inside this gadget , are many compartments that can help to separate the medication and also allows users to set a date and time .
It also comes with a reminder system , on-screen instruction and a line of communication .
When the time has come for medication , the gadget will play a musical chime that will alert the elderly .
When the user press on the button a LCD screen will display the instruction for taking the drugs , for example , some drugs are to be taken before meal or with a empty stomach .
If the musical chime is not responded to by the elderly and the medication is not taken , the gadget will place a phone call to the family members to inform them .
(2)
Besides using internet and automated gadgets individually , people have also combine them as one device .
In the United State there are devices that can also help to connect the elderly to the doctor without having them to go to the hospital everyday .
For example , the elderly with Cardiovascular diseases can be attached  with an intelligent small device which is called a Chronicle system in their body to monitor their "heart rate , physical activity , body temperature and right ventricular (RV) pressure in them ."
(3) the results gathered by the device are transmitted to the doctors through a remote monitoring so that their health can be monitored even if they are at home or in the hospital .
Using internet and automated gadgets have helped to ease the aging process a lot .
Both the elderly and their family members can receive many benefits from technology .
As time passes , our aging population grows and so does our technology .
But as technology grows , it can provide us with more inventions that can help to ease the aging population process .

"We have an ageing population and the demand for elective surgery continues to increase , which provides us with a real challenge" .
(1) This famous quote by Australian politician Michael Wright not only illustrates one of the problems the government has to deal with an the aging population but also points to the pressure the aging population place on the medical system .
It appears that aging population has become the biggest and common concern for countries all over the world , especially those in Europe and Japan .
Many researchers have recently stated:" To a large extent , current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process" .
From my point of view , supported by many reliable online articles , I agree with the claim above .
The diverse obstacles associated with an an aging population creates lots of pressure , ranging not only from medical services but also to the education system too .
For instance: A survey conducted in British Columbia on the impact of aging population on social services shows that as the average age of citizens increases , so does the health care cost per capita .
(2) The government has to reserve a greater portion of the budget for taking care of the aged because they are more likely to suffer from ailments that almost always occur with old age (such as: diabetes , osteomalacia . . .)  .
Or let's take education as an example: when the majority of the population is old people , which means that the average age of a student in the university will increase .
Students tend to stay in the colleges longer and as a result , the cost on education will rise significantly .
It's also predicted that the cost on education in British Columbia will rise 40% between the period 1989/1990 and 2015/2016 .
(3)
On the other hand , the scientists keep giving out new technological inventions to help the elderly feel more comfortable and content with their ordinary life .
They present wireless and mini hearing aids to enhance the listening ability of  elderly as well as artificial limbs for them or walking sticks to aid them standing and walking around .More specifically , designed elevators used for the elderly  in wheelchairs are everywhere , which plays an important role in helping them to access higher levels in tall buildings .
The older they get , the worse their body organs function , which leads to the situation that they really need some help from inventors to retain their original life .
Without these gadgets and assisting tools , now they would suffer numerous and tremendous difficulties in communicating with other people or going around as well .
The next question that needs to be debated is: "How much money should the government spend on  medical care for the elderly ?" .
In my opinion , the government should use much more money towards taking care of the elderly  due to the following : Firstly , the aged are citizens who have contributed a lot of money to the National Treasury through compulsory taxes like land-tax , income tax . . .  therefore they deserve receiving more care from the authorities .
Secondly , as long as you take care of the elderly well , the average longevity of the citizens will rise significantly .
As far as we are concerned , many economists evaluate the wealth and development of a country not only by its wealth , but also on how the average longevity of its citizens is .
In conclusion , it's unassailable that: To some extent , current research have helped ease the aging process .
This mission not only lies on the scientists' hands but also require some support from the society in general , and the government in particular .
If the government reserve more money on the medical care for the elderly , absolutely they'll be more satisfied with their life .
That's the best solution in comparison with other inventions from the scientists .
Disability affects some people .
Aging affects all people .
As we know , people are living longer today than they used to , and this is resulting in a much larger elderly population than before .
Also , as we grow in to adulthood , many things start to change in our life .
Aging is an unavoidable process , beginning at conception and ending with death .
The process does not proceed at a uniform rate all over the body .
As we age , the organ systems of individuals age at different rates .
Our body gradually slows down in early adult life .
So , current research and development or policies in particular fields of science and medicine have helped to ease the aging process .
Technology can help the elderly with their hearing problem and hearing impairment is one of the five most chronic conditions of aging .
According to research , it is estimated that one out of three people over age 64 has some hearing impairment; this increases to almost one out of two persons over the age of .
But , nowadays , there are many assistive devices available for persons with hearing impairment .
That is what technology is !
For example , vibrating alarms allow older people with hearing impairment to wake from vibration than by auditory alarm .
Also , door knock alert allows older people with hearing impairment to see a blinking light rather than hearing an auditory "knock" sound .
As we know ,  chronically ill patients need to check in with a health-care provider every day and answer questions about their current symptoms allow for immediate intervention .
So , numerous telehomecare devices have been developed to allow health-care providers the ability to manage follow-up care of the chronically ill .
This technology allows patients to sit in the comfort of their own homes while health-care providers conduct routine and comprehensive medical monitoring procedures in their offices .
One example of this type of technology is Aerotel's Medical Parameters Monitoring (MPM) devices , which allow data to be stored for immediate consultation and treatment , as well as for future reference .
Other than those technologies used in developing devices to aid old people's hearing and illness , home , as we know is a very "important" to the older people .
They need a comfortable home for their retired life .
So  , there is a new technology in our modern world now  , Well@home Telemanagement System from Patient care Technologies ,Inc .
This Well@home devices has an interactive function similar to a bank ATM .
This technology reminds patients to take their medication; instructs patients through text , illustrations , and the spoken word on what , when  , and how to make their medication; ask patients if they would like to learn more about their medication; provide administrative , side effect , and storage information to the patient  etc . , .
This will help the older people a lot so that they would not to be "thrown"nto the old folks home because of their disability at home .
As the world goes on , Technology has been applied to public transportation in the development of Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) that enhance older persons mobility by providing better information before and during a journey .
[1] Many of the age-related reduction in function that contribute to driving cessation can impede mobility independence when using public transportation systems , The application of technology within an ITS can support deficits in vision  , hearing  , cognition , and sensorinotor function .
Technology in itself is not the only panacea to solve the aging global population .
So , there should be improvement in every field of study and research to ease the aging population and to enhance the quality of life for a global population that will double in size by 2050 .

Since the birth of human beings , our ancestors have gone through the 4 stages of life , namely birth , aging , illness and death .
It is a process that began when we were first born .
It is inevitable that we will eventually become old and vulnerable to problems and diseases that are associatede with old age .
Therefore , there is a need to improve the life of the elderly in order to ease the aging process .
It is not unknown that Scientists have been researching while governments are constantly improving development and policies for the elderly .
The current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Firstly , modern medical research is able to treat and cure deadly diseases that we were incapable of previously .
With the current advances in medical technology , we are able to remedy and prevent diseases more effectively .
Previous generations had no knowledge of illnesses like diabetes , hypertension and high cholesterol which leads to more severe problems like heart attack and stroke .
With modern research , medicine have been produced to assist in treating the problems .
The findings were used for the prevention of these illnesses , thus the elderly who are more prone to these diseases are able to take more precaution with their health .
We can cure and treat everything easily and conveniently but it is always costly .
In fact not many people can afford long term medical treatment especially for elderly who have either retired or have savings that are not enough to cover the expenses .
But on the other hand , policies are made to engage the potential financial problems .
For example , Medisave is made compulsory for Singaporeans to contribute part of their income into saving for medical use .
A minimum balance of $15 000 is required in Medicsave to prevent premature depletion which will be needed for future medical needs , more precisely during old age .
Also benefits such as national medical subsidy schemes have been introduced to subsidise the medical cost for the elderly .
The Elderly are given a subsidy of $360 annually for chronic diseases like diabetes , hypertension and high cholesterol .
These policies make medical treatment more affordable and less taxing to the elderly .
To summarize , with the current medical research , development and polices made by  scientists and the government , it has definitely slowed and eased the aging process that everyone will experience .
Although our lifespan have significantly lengthened from 60 to 65 year to 75 to 85 years in developed countries .
However ageing will remain the same for today and will not change at least in our time .
Regardless of country , race , language or generation , staying young , healthy and active is the dream of every person in this world .
From the birth of mankind , we have been searching and trying all means and ways to ease or stop aging .
This process or searching and examining has never ended , ever after decades .
This is even  more obvious  in this century , where the standard of living of the generation X has improved compared to the past .
They have begun to realize that their life expectancy is now much longer than that of previous generations .
Therefore , the demand for anti aging products and treatments to restore health and beauty has grown significantly .
Men and woman past the age of 40 feel more empowered than ever to take control of their bodies and redefine the aging process .
To ease or slow down the aging process is to have the ability to lengthen the lifespan of our youthful healthy days .
As such , life extension is the main concept that most companies are engaging in to target aging issues .
These anti-aging promoters from various nutrition companies are promoting their own brand of nutrition , in the form of diets or supplements , to extend lifespan .
These products use different raw materials and food processing methods , which they claim  is safe and effective for consumption , after rounds of testing .
However , mostly they work and agree on the same common theory , which is the importance of keeping a stable blood sugar level , achieved in part by managing the glycemic indices of food choices .
[1] An example of the 2 diets with different approaches and with some support from scientific research is the Palaeolithic diet and Caloric restriction .
An alternative to the use of nutrition products to ease aging process is the research and development of Cosmetic interventions such as skin treatments and plastic surgery .
They are widely used to mask the effects of aging , although they do not actually affect lifespan .
Some of these surgeries include skin resurfacing , eyelid surgery and Botox treatments , cosmetic dental procedures and many more .
In addition , Anti-aging creams such as "Olay" and "Loreal" is also getting more popular and commonly use by both men and women .
These are mostly moisturiser based cosmetic skin care products marketed with the promise of making the consumer look younger by reducing visible wrinkles , expression lines , blemishes , pigmentation changes , discolouration and other environmentally (especially from the sun) related conditions of the skin .
[2] Despite great demand , many such products and treatments have not proved to give lasting or major positive effects .
However , it is on the rise at many age levels and has been embraced by many age groups including teenagers .
Another issue connected with the aging process is the terror of memory loss .
According to one  research conducted by the Natural Marketing Institute (NMI) [3] , memory loss and losing brain capacity is the biggest fear of the aging baby boomer population .
Their research had shown that 52 percent of females and 36 percent of the males in United States has memory loss and losing brain capacity as their biggest fear .
Hence , research on means to prevent memory loss and increase brain capacity is essential and important in helping to ease the aging setbacks .
Currently in the market , thereare brain supplements such as "Prevagen" and "Essential Youth" [4]; products which claims to have remarkable formulas , which can help old people look younger , feel better , think faster , remember more clearly , thus enjoy their life again  .This is out in display in all corners of the shopping and healthcare centre .
These products were advertised with the support from TV artists and provide documentation testing from scientists .
When it comes to matters related to healthcare , research is never ending .
Scientists have also carried other studies and proposed other strategies of life extension .
Some examples will be the studies of Cloning and body part replacement technology .
They suggest that therapeutic cloning and stem cell research could one day provide a way to generate cells , body parts , or even entire bodies (generally referred to as reproductive cloning) that would be genetically identical to a prospective patient .
Others suggest Cryonics [5] , which is the low-temperature preservation of humans and animals that can no longer be sustained by contemporary medicine until resuscitation may be possible in the future .
However , these 2 researches involve debatable points in ethics and religion which need to be resolved .
Ethical and theological opinions of cloning and cryonics tend to pivot on the issue of whether this method is regarded as interment or medicine .
Aging is a process which cannot be stopped and it is going to be a much more critical  issue for mankind in the next decade , while the ratio of working adult and to the old is further reduced to one-one .
It is a problem that every country is facing , and if it is not properly dealt with , it will hold back the country's development and be an economic hindrance .
As such , in conclusion , the researches in medicines and other field such as technology and social policy is one of the  most importance issues currently .
With education , detail and proper planning now it will help to ease numerous problems that the country and family will face as the population ages .
According to the Singapore Department of Statistics (2008) ,  life expectancy in Singapore continues to increase .
The report shows  that the life expectancy of people is increasing with time  , which implies that the aging process is becoming  than before .
why if this tendency happening now ?
There are various fields contributing to this tendency , including science , technology , economics , government policies , medicine and psychology .
It can be argued that the development of technology plays an important role in this .
In conclusion , with the development of technology , the aging process will become slower .
Technology really helps the old a lot in easing the aging process .
Hopefully , the elderly will benefit  from the fast developing  technology .
Technology has vastly improved during the past century  and made life easier for the elderly around the world .
In the case of  developments in terms of Architecture , this has been true thus far .
In our current society , one which faces a graying population , Architecture has played an active role in creating a safe and greatly accessible environment for the elderly .
With better knowledge in Architecture , homes and places outside home are made user-friendly for the elderly
Moving around at a speed and mobility which they had decades ago was not possible , but Architecture has changed our homes in a manner which assured that the elderly can at least move around without facing many  difficulties .
Homes that are user-friendly to the elderly have features that allow the elderly to move around easily .
One such feature is having homes with only one floor built .
Another  such feature will be homes with wider corridors .
Both of the mentioned features allow greater mobility for wheelchair bound elderly or elderly who move around with the help of a walking stick .
The elderly have always been stereotyped as people who are prone to slipping and injuring themselves .
To ease such worries of the younger generation , developments in Architecture have the means to solve such problems .
In areas where the floors tend to be wet , such as the toilet , anti-slip tiles can be installed to induce greater friction even when the floors are wet .
Furthermore , grab bars can be mounted to the walls of the toilet to aid the elderly in sitting down or standing up .
In parts of the home where a staircase must inevitably be built , handrails or barristers can be built for support if the elderly wish to climb the stairs .
As the number of elderly that live alone rises , the government has seen the need to provide special housing for them .
In terms of Singapore , the government has decided to develop blocks of rental 1-room flats which have lifts that stop on every floor , an alert alarm to call for help in the event of emergency  , and support hand bars in the toilets and along common corridors to facilitate mobility of the elderly .
For the elderly who are able to better support themselves , they can choose to stay in rental flats or studio flats .
Besides homes , Architecture has made the community more user-friendly for the elderly .
New shopping centres such as Orchard Centre and Ion Orchard have elderly-friendly facilities such as ramps or ground floor entrances toilets for the disabled which are also user-friendly for the elderly .
At City Link , there are machines installed to maneuver wheelchairs up and down the stairs .
Architecture has raised the standards of living up to a point where even the elderly that have low mobility are able to move around as they wish .
Certainly , developments in the field of Architecture have helped to ease aging process .
Victor Hugo , poet and novelist , once said that "Forty is the old age of youth; fifty the youth of old age"[1] .
Old age is therefore not the end of our life but a start .
There are many physical and mental ailments that often arise from aging , such as brain degeneration , discrimination from the public , social isolation and no sense of direction in life .
To reduce the negative impact of the aging process , it is therefore important to create a role model for the elderly , to eliminate ageism in the society ,  and ito improve detection of depression and encourage lifelong learning .

Fighting ageism is essential to ease the aging process of our society .
One way of fighting ageism is educating the people about the adverse effects of old aged stereotyping  .
In a study done by Levy and her colleague , older individuals with a more positive self-perception of aging  lived 7 .5 years longer than those with less positive self-perception of aging[3] .
Critics of this position feel that people should not be pressured to participate in lifelong learning  "for the good of society" .
[6] However , this is  as there are also many benefits that lifelong learning can  .
Engaging in lifelong learning can help build our body , mind and spirit to be ready for future challenges .
In a book "Learning Later , Living Greater" co written by Nancy Merz Nordstrom and Jon F .Merz , the authors highlighted the benefits presented with supporting case studies on lifelong learning .
