There are accidents happening every year , whether due to human mistakes or design defects .
People have been putting efforts to improve engineeringdesignsto eliminate unexpected accidents .
Not surprisingly , psychology plays a crucial role in engineering design processes .
Engineering psychology can be understood as the study of human behaviors , as well as designing and building mechanical devices or artificial environments to improve human interaction with a system , and to satisfy anthropometric or psychological requirements so that people will use the devices (Wickens & Kramer , 1985) .
Up till now , the most deadly aircraft accident in aviation history has been the Tenerife accident on March 27 , 1977 , with a death toll of 583 .
In Tenerife airport , two planes , KLM 4805 and Pan Am Clipper 1736 , collided with each other .
Basically , both human errors and system failure led to this tragedy .
Although there is not one definite cause for such accidents , the correct use of psychology in certain areas , including the design of the airport , the communication procedure and the training of manpower , may help to prevent similar disasters in the future .
Secondly , communication was also a serious problem in this accident .
Actually , the Air Traffic Controller (ATC) was using only one channel to communicate with two approaching airplanes at the same time .
The controllers did not consider that the same frequency made them unable to hear each other clearly , so that the ATC failed to get the information that the Pan Am was still on the run way .
To make things worse , as professional controllers , they should have used standardized terminologies for communication , but they actually did not .
Words such as "take off" should never have been used in an ATC clearance but they did .
The ambiguous language caused confusion such that the Pan Am pilots , the KLM pilots , and the ground controllers did not get the proper information .
Some people may argue that during those early years , having lowly educated air controllers was inevitable .
It was hard to find a Spaniard speaking English fluently .
However , people still need to consider communication as an important issue and try to find a precise and standard language for aviation communication .
Last but not least , the training of the captains and the crews also contributed to the accident in a sense .
The captain of the KLM was used to being a training captain , which means he conducted training flights more than regular line flights .
However , many operational problems only emerge during the actual flight .
Hence , when the captain encountered problems , he may not have kept calm and made the correct decision .
Though the accident cannot be entirely attributed to the captain , he had the highest power and should have been experienced enough to seek safety for all the passengers .
Hence , both theoretical and operational training should be reinforced for all training captains and crews . .
In conclusion , in the Tenerife accident , the failure to consider several crucial factors in the airport design , the communication systems and the manpower training , indirectly caused the accident to happen .
The use of psychology in the design process can help the designers to consider these issues more thoroughly and perhaps influencing his decision .
The result of any of these minor changes could perhaps have prevented the accident from ever occurring .
According to a BBC report , in Europe alone , there are 165 nuclear reactors .
On the other hand , there are also countries that are against this idea , such as Germany , which is withdrawing  its nuclear programme (BBC , 2009) .
The reason for opposing nuclear programmes is that nuclear accidents release harmful radiation that has adverse effects on humans and the environment .
This is seen in the nuclear accident at Three Mile Island in 1979 followed by the Chernobyl accident in 1986 , which have reinforced fears of nuclear power in the people .
In addition , many are concerned that nuclear reactors are prone to being used as weapons of mass destruction by terrorists and hostile countries .
Thus , they are against the idea of building nuclear plants .
With these concerns in mind , scientists and engineers have developed six Generation IV nuclear reactor concepts with enhanced safety features that would prevent another Chernobyl .
Furthermore , nuclear energy is a clean alternative to fossil fuel as it emits far less greenhouse gases (Gianni , 2006) .
In this essay , I will discuss the benefits of the molten salt reactor (MSR) , which is one of the six Generation IV concepts , and show that it is superior to the very high temperature reactor (VHTR) in terms of safety , performance and cost .
Firstly , in terms of safety , the VHTR is said to be a relatively safe nuclear reactor because it includes a back-up emergency core cooling system .
However , the MSR operates under an even safer condition .
Unlike the VHTR , the MSR adopts a passive emergency cooling system .
The method of cooling in the MSR is more efficient than the VHTR because if the MSR coolant salt overheats and overflows , the coolant salt will be transported to various storage tanks which are installed with passive decay heat cooling systems , so they are verified to be critically-safe .
Besides the storage tanks , freeze valves that will automatically open whenever they detect overheating of the salt are also installed .
As a result , heated fuel will be disposed of immediately without threatening an explosion or leakage (Joseph & Angelo , 2005) .
Therefore , the MSR is a much safer reactor than the VHTR .
Secondly , the overall performance of the MSR also surpasses the VHTR , making the MSR a better nuclear reactor .
The VHTR operates at a core outlet gas temperature of more than 900 to 1000 with output power estimated to be 600MW .
On the other hand , the MSR is able to not only operate in small sizes , but also in large sizes .
Besides the varying sizes that an MSR could work in , it is also able to operate at two varying temperatures of 705 and 1000 (Butler , 2004) .
At 1000 , the VHTR's overall plant efficiency is about 50% while the MSR's overall plant efficiency is about 60% .
This shows that at the same temperature , the MSR is at least 10% more efficient than the VHTR .
Therefore , countries should invest in the MSR which is more efficient than the VHTR in terms of overall plant efficiency .
Last but not least , waste recycling in the MSR allows better usage of materials as well as ensures a lower cost of operation .
The wastes produced in VHTR go directly to the repository .
However , in the MSR system , wastes produced from generation of electricity will be recycled .
The system collects and processes the wastes according to their physical and chemical properties , and separates the residual fuel from the wastes .
During the process , plutonium and uranium would be recovered and then recycled to produce more energy .
This in turn reduces the volume of material disposed of since plutonium and uranium make up almost 97% of the entire mass of fuel used in generating nuclear energy .
This will also lead to reduction in costs since capital spent on reactants are significantly reduced (The National Academies Press , 1984) .
Therefore , adoption of the MSR as an alternative to electricity production is a wiser choice than choosing the VHTR .
In conclusion , the MSR is a much better reactor than the VHTR as the MSR is safer , has higher overall plant efficiency and more efficient recycling method .
Thus , we should invest in the MSR to produce energy efficiently .
Scientists and engineers are now thinking of developing a new generation of nuclear reactors that can solve many problems such as green-house effects , the rising prices of energy and the safety of nuclear reactors .
In "Nuclear Power's New Dawn" , Butler (2004) mentions six concepts of Generation IV (GenIV) reactors .
Among them is the supercritical-water-cooled reactor (SCWR) which is considered a popular one because of its many obvious advantages .
While some proponents totally support further research and development funding for this concept , others still doubt  the benefits of the SCWR since there are many challenging problems in the R&D process .
Three of these problems are safety , efficiency and practicality .
It is often argued that the SCWR is rather safe in comparison with other generation IV reactor concepts because it operates at rather low temperatures , ranging from 510 to 550 C (Butler , 2004) .
Although this argument is true , high operatingtemperaturese is not the only source of accidents in a reactor .
In fact , the pressure inside a SCWR can reach 25MPa which is ultra-high and dangerous .
At sucha levell of pressure ,the steel used in nuclear reactorsl is easily corroded by high temperature water .
Another safety problem comes fromthe veryy fast turbine speed of the SWCR (about 3600 rpm , twice as fast as the existing Light Water Reactor (LWR)) .
Moreover , an extremely abnormal event has been recognized which is the loss of feed water (or coolant) (GIF , 2002) .
Therefore , we must stress the importance of finding suitable materials that are stress-resistant and anti-corrosive anddevelopg a reliable auxiliary feed water system .
The SCWR has very high efficiency (about 45% versus about 33% efficiency for the current LWR) and can churn out electricity at prices that , on paper , are competitive with coal and gas , and vastly cheaper than existing nuclear reactors(Butler , 2004) .
However , one disadvantage of the SWCR is that it , in fact , is the only concept among the GenIV reactors that does not produce hydrogen fuel .
The temperature needed to split hydrogen from water in a reactor is from 700 to 900  C and even if the SCWR could produce hydrogen , separating it withe liquid water would become a big problem .
Hydrogen fuel is considered the energy for the future since it is carbon-free , non-toxic ,less of a fire risk and more highly efficienty than petrol .
Furthermore , it should be note , that if most car owners switched to fully electric cars , many countries would need to double their electricity production (Louis , 2009) .
Therefore , itwouldd be better if we develop reactors that can generate hydrogen fuel rather than ones that can only generate electricity .
The SWCR is preferred to other GenIV concepts because of its simple design , which indicates that it will be cheaper and easier to develop and operate .
However , other GenIV reactor concepts seem to be practical , too .
One example is the very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) which can produce hydrogen fuel and which can be completed by 2020 (the earliest delivery for the SCWR is 2025) .
Moreover , the estimated amount of money needed for R&D activities for the VHTR is about $670 m (versus $870m for the SCWR) .
Last but not least , the efficiency of the VHTR (even higher than 50%) is also higher than that of the SCWR (GIF , 2002) .
Although the VHTR also has its own challenges in R&D , it is , besides the SCWR , highly interesting to the experts .
Although it cannot be denied that SCWR is the most practical one among the six concepts of GenIV reactors , it is not the only choice .
Developing a new generation of nuclear reactor costs us not only a huge amount of money , but also a lot of time and manpower .
Therefore , we must consider carefully when choosing whether to develop the SCWR or other concepts .
The public is very concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors and there have been debates on whether Generation IV nuclear reactor should be built or not .
Issues being discussed were safety of operating the nuclear reactor as there have been catastrophic events in the past like the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl disaster (Butler , 2004) .
Long term storage of nuclear waste and the amount of time the nuclear waste needs to be fully decomposed .
The cost of building a nuclear reactor as it involves billions of dollars of taxpayer's money .
These were the main factors why few nuclear reactors have been built in the past few decades in many countries and I agree that Generation IV nuclear reactor should not be built .

On 26th April 1986 , a severe reactor's meltdown occurred in Chernobyl nuclear plant , Ukraine which released more radioactivity compared to the time when atom bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
In the accident , 56 people were killed and about 600000 people were exposed to significant levels of radiation (Greenpeace , Jan2009 , p .6) .
This accident is considered as the worst nuclear disaster in the world .
As the result , many people were afraid of nuclear power even until today .
Hence , most people oppose the revival of nuclear reactor while support the renewable power such as solar power and wind power .
Despite there are a lot of opposition to the reborn of nuclear power; there is some evidence which show that the potential benefits of molten salt reactor (MSR) far outweigh its dangers .
Opponents of nuclear power claim that nuclear reactors are totally insecure as the incidents of Three Miles Island and Chernobyl led to catastrophes .
Another example was the technical failure in the Forsmark nuclear power plant in Sweden , 2006 .
According to the former director of that plant , it was pure luck that the plant had no meltd; otherwise , it could be another disaster (Greenpeace , Jan2009 , p .6) .
However , the possibility for a Mareo melt is relatively small compared to the old nuclear power plant .
This is because molten salt reactor has different safety approaches which can prevent the meltdown .
FiAlthoughthe molten salts have low chemical activity at the sea-level pressure .
They are also mechanically stable as their boiling point is very high .
Besides that , there is a passive cooling system which includes passively cooled dump tanks that will perform emergency cooling and shutdown in any emergency conditions (Forsberg , C .F , June2006 , p .4) .
Moreover , in a MSR , the mobile fission products are removed continuously and reused afterward .
This means that the accident rate can be reduced to the minimum .
Opponents also mention that there is no solution to radioactive waste .
Since the beginning of nuclear power , radioactive waste has remained as a major problem .
Reprocessing the radioactive waste once became a useful method .
However , according to a study published in 2001 , there was a significant increment of leukaemia among under-25 year olds who were living within 10 km of La Hague nuclear reprocessiants , in northwest France (Greenpeace , Jan2009 , p .5) .
Yet , reprocessing the radioactive waste and recycle the salts seem to be possible in MSR .
In fact , MSR would still produce hazardous waste and radionuclide .
Nevertheless , the organic components in that wasteuld be oxidized in the molten salt oxidizer (MSO) and radionuclide would be retained in the salt .
The salt would then be recycled and reused in the MSR (Gat , U . , Jun1993 , p .3) .
Some of the radionuclide still left out in this recycling process .
In order to get a shorter-lived radioactiv , the radionuclide is combined with some mixtures such as glass , ceramic and concrete .
e radioactive waste is brought to an optimum for disposal and lesser harmful radioactive waste is produced by MSR .
embodiesbecausetypes .In conclusion , despite many people are still opposing the concept of reactor generation IV , I believe that MSR could bring the nuclear power to another new age .
MSR has many advantages such as cost-effective ,nimize the danger of disposal and it has a nearly perfect safety precaution which reduce the accident rate greatly .
Hence , it has the potential to become the main source of energy in the next decade .
Engineering is concerned with improving equipment from the point of view of mechanical and electrical design , whereas psychology is concerned with the mind and behavior (Stanton , 1996) .
As such , people often find it difficult to associate psychology with engineering .
However , psychology in fact complements engineering process .
As defined by Blum (1952) , psychology in engineering is concerned with adapting the equipment to people , based upon their psychological capacities and limitations with the objective of improving overall system performance .
Theoretically , analysis of the mind and behavior of man can effectively reduce accidents due to human error , by adopting measures that takes into consideration the limitation and capacities of man .
Opponents often argue that psychology is unnecessary in engineering .
The employment of psychologists would simply incur unnecessary cost .
In fact , many engineers would rather consult their intuition than a professional ergonomist in the designing process .
Furthermore , the effectiveness of the use of psychology in ensuring safety in engineering processes is being questioned .
The safety issues in engineering processes are often seen with great concern and various rules and regulations are set to ensure mishaps from occurring .
Thus , with these precautions , the use of psychology is deemed as unnecessary .
Another point of contend is the use of psychology to prevent engineering errors .
Engineering errors are integral parts in the designing process and engineers have adopted the measure of introducing corrective actions such as adding on to the system to minimize or eliminate such errors .
Hence , the use of psychology would serve little use .
However ,  safety precautions and corrective actions are not fail-proof .
The likelihood of accidents occurring stays high despite these measures .
Although safety precautions are set , the tendencies of violation of the rules are not to be neglected .
The rules and regulations are drawn down with consideration of ideal behavior of system users yet it is unlikely that all men follow the same code of behavior .
Thus measures to reduce errors resulting from deviation from ideal behavior should be formulated with the aid of psychology which analyses the behavior of man .
In addition , psychology can be applied to predict errors in the designing process due to human factors and preventive measure can be taken to avoid mishaps due to these errors .
Furthermore , it is essential to note that the most damaging errors made by the engineering team is not regarding the technical aspect of the engineering process but with regard to ethic issues which often jeopardize safety .
Hence analysis of the mind and behavior of man may potentially help rule out the possibilities of such occurrences .
In the case of the Hyatt Regency walkway collapse , human error was undeniably one of the most influencing factors underlying the failure of the structure .
Even though the collapse of the walkway was due to the failure of components of the structure , it would not have been fatal if the errors were identified and corrected in time .
Psychology can be applied to various stages of design processes to prevent accidents .
Use of psychology in engineering process is also necessary in predicting the possible dilemma faced by end users using the product and the possibility of wrong usage which can cause potential harm .
Study of behavior of man is necessary in the prediction and adjustment of the system to suit users .
In the case of the Hyatt Regency accident , the failure to foresee the large crowd and hence larger workload is one great mistake made by the engineers .
As a heavily advertised project , engineers should have anticipated response from the people .
Hence , it will be of importance to verify the maximum load that the walkway is able to withstand .
In the event that the crowd predicted is above the maximum load the walkway can withstand , possible measures can be taken to divert the crowd , and ensure load within a safe boundary .
In the case of the Hyatt Regency accident , the application of psychology would possibly have prevented the accident .
It is apparent that the negligence of the engineering teams was to be blamed for the accident .
Opponents of VHTR might claim that Lead-Cooled Fast Reactor (LFR) exhibit better safety features for its selection of molten lead as relatively inert coolant (Generation IV Technology , n .d .) .
However , the VHTR offers higher degree of passive safety; for instance , it is built undergroundanduses the earth to sink most of the heat produced .
In fact , the graphite encased fuel will not be damaged when the reactor heat is radiated through its steel vessel out of the high thermal inertia graphite moderator core (Ragheb , 2007) .
Moreover , building the reactor underground offers a greater level of security , as there are limited exit routes to the ground .
This feature would also immensely reduce its threat of being a terrorism target , enhancing the physical protection of the reactor .

What Is Nuclear Reprocessing ?
(2000) .
Retrieved October 15 , 2009 , from {http://news .bbc .co .uk/2/hi/uk_news/647981 .stm}[HYPERLINK: http://news .bbc .co .uk/2/hi/uk_news/647981 .stm]
Since reprocessing of nuclear waste can eminently reduces raw fuel input and conserves the world's uranium supplies () , opponents might argue that the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor[HYPERLINK: http://www .gen-4 .org/Technology/systems/gfr .htm] (GFR) , {Molten Salt Reactor}[HYPERLINK: http://www .gen-4 .org/Technology/systems/msr .htm] (MSR) , {Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor}[HYPERLINK: http://www .gen-4 .org/Technology/systems/sfr .htm] (SFR) , and LFR offer better performance with the adoption of reprocessing (Butler , 2004) .
However , the VHTR offers high thermal efficiency in supplying electricity and producing hydrogen , alongside process heat applications .
Operating at 1000 degree Celsius , the VHTR is able to produce 50% more electricity using the same amount of fuel compared with conventional plants .
The high operating temperature also enables hydrogen production using thermochemical process , with superior efficiency .
In addition , heat produced by the VHTR can also be utilized in a broad range of process heat applications , such as coal gasification (Gen-IV , 2005) .
On the other hand , reprocessing is extremely expensive , costing more than uranium fuel itself () .
Hence , it would be impossible for nuclear power to compete with coal and gas in the market for electricity .
Opponents might also maintain that GFR , MSR , SFR , and LFR provide better waste management , seeing that up to 96% of waste produced is being recycled through reprocessing (Butler , 2004) .
However , this would oppose the aim of creating a proliferation resistant reactor .
On the contrary , the VHTR does not have this issue , for it operates in a once-through uranium cycle .
Since plutonium - the main substance in manufacturing nuclear weapon - is not separated with the nuclear waste , it cannot be easily extracted to build nuclear weapons () .
The great proliferation resistance provides assurance to the society , avoiding suspicion between countries about any secret nuclear weapons program that might cause misunderstandings .
Therefore , the high proliferation resistance that comes with VHTR averts the emergence of new nuclear weapons states , and keeps nuclear weapons capability out of terrorist hands .
It should be evident that the Very-High-Temperature Reactor is the best among the 6 evolutionary concepts of generation 4 reactors .
The VHTR is equipped with superior passive safety features with its underground construction , which also greatly increases its security and physical protection .
Furthermore , the VHTR offers high thermal efficiency , while retaining the capability of hydrogen production and utilization in heat process applications .
Finally , the VHTR also provides high proliferation resistance , which prevents the production of new nuclear weapons , maintaining peace in the world .
Therefore , in my opinion , the Very-High-Temperature Reactor should be given priority for further research and development funding .

With the fast growth of Earth's population , the demand for nuclear power is rapidly increasing because of its higher efficiency in producing electricity among the non greenhouse-gas-emitting sources .
The potential benefits of nuclear energy have led many countries to do extensive research and development on nuclear reactors .
However , many controversies emerge over the development of nuclear reactors because of fear of nuclear leakage and accident .
No new nuclear power plants were built in the United States since the accident at Three Mile Island in 1979(Butler ,2004) .
Considering the fact that the global warming has becoming an increasingly serious problem nowadays , the development of nuclear power is quite necessary .
"Global warming and rising energy needs are rehabilitating the concept of nuclear power .
But if it is to figure in the energy equation , it will need to be cheaper , cleaner and safer" , says Declan Butler .
In the research for cleaner and safer nuclear reactor to meet the increasing demand for energy , new generation nuclear reactors have been researched by a consortium of ten nations .
Furthermore , it is quite necessary and urgent to set an overall direction of nuclear reactors .
Some people believe that the very high temperature reactor (VHTR) is the most phave emergedng reactor and should be largely put into use in the near future .
However , compared with VHTR , the sodium-cooled fast reactor (SFR) has more advantages and should be chosen as a main type of reactors in the future .
Proponents of VHTR claim that it operates at a higher temperature which is much more efficient than the SFR .
It is true that the higher temperature enables the reactor to work more efficiently; however , it also raises a huge inherent safety problem .
As a reactor which also produces hydrogen which is combustible , it is likely for the VHTR to explode at high temperatures .
Once the accident happens , the related safety components of the reactor would not work .
In contrast , the SFR does not have this safety concern for its operating temperature is jusreactorf that of the VHTR .
Furthermore , the closed fuel of SFR can utilize almost all the energy provided by the fuels and the recovery and recycle of the actinides in SFR can reach about 99 .9% , which indicate the a high efficiency of SFR .
Opponents of SFR claim that the radioactivity of its coolant sodium is harmful to the environment .
Although the sodium is radioactive and easy to have chemical reaction with water and air , the self-activated shutdown system of SFR has largely reduced the possibilities of the leakage of sodium .
Furthermore , SFR has a relatively large thermal inertia and a large margin to coolant boiling which ensure the safety of the use of sodium .
More important , there is an extra loop which is called secondary system acts as a buffer in case of the reactions between the sodium and water (Roglans , Allen & Line , 2002) .
In this way , it can largely avoid the release of radioactive elements and become safe and environmentally friendly .
Another argument advanced by opponents of SFR is that it can only produce electricity and it has shown little promise of becoming an econoeasilylehasr so far (fast reactor , N .D) .
It is true that the VHTR can produce not only electricity but also hydrogen; however , the electricity is more widely used than the hydrogen nowadays .
Actually , the hydrogen energy system is not very mature because of the limited technology so far .
The electricimportantlyilh demand nowadays and the SFR can completely meet the demand of markets for ctricity .
(M .Ragheb , 2007) .On the other hand , the cost of the research and development of SFR is only about 610 million dollars , which is much less than that of VHTR .
All of these facts show that the SFR is more economic and flexible than VHTR .
economicalmaturedIn a nutshell , it can be seen that the arguments against the sodiuooled fast reactor are inconclusive and not valid .
On the contrary , the SFR system has moreVHTR on its safety , efficiency and costs , which made the SFR a promising reactor .
Therefore , the research and development of sodium cooled fast reactor is necessary and overwhelming .
The train accident at Eschede was one of the world's deadliest railway accident to have ever occurred .
The accident resulted in a total of 101 deaths and caused 88 injuries .
The cause of the accident was due to a broken wheel that led to the derailment of the entire train ( 1998) .
Further probing into the accident revealed that although the wheels were not fully tested and commissioned , the wheels were already in service .
At that point in time , no facilities existed in Germany to test the failure limit of rail wheels , thus design and specifications relied heavily on materials specifications and theory .
Furthermore , in-depth investigations revealed that before the night of the accident , the maintenance crew did not carry out their maintenance jobs properly .
Therefore , if a psychologist had been in place during the designing , testing and maintenance phase , the chance of the accident happening would have been minimal .
However , if a psychologist was present during the designing phase of the wheel , he could have pointed out that the datasheets were prepared by other engineers also , and engineers can make mistakes too .
During the testing phase , the psychologist would have proposed that the engineers further test the wheel at a much higher speed , observe  problems the wheels might develop under wear and tear conditions .
He would also have said that since there were no testing facilities present , the engineers could have brought the wheel out to other countries to run the required tests .
Furthermore , Fraunhofer Institute  told the company that it is possible that the wheels would fail earlier than expected (09) .
Yet , no actions were taken by the company to replace the failing wheels .
To ensure that the wheels were replaced , the psychologist , in this case , would have constantly reminded the engineers to correct the errors present on the wheels .
One of the important issues bothering people nowadays is the lack of energy supply and an increase in global warming due to the emission of greenhouse gases from current generation reactors .
This issue has been raised in various contexts and different views of the issue are shared and discussed .
Mainly , the controversies of the issue are on the safe and clean operation of nuclear reactors , such as the handling of nuclear waste and prevention of terrorist acts (Butler , 2004) .
In addition , the cost of constructing nuclear reactors must be  , given the economic constraints today .
One way to address this issue is to provide funding to further research and develop Generation IV reactors , particularly the Very- High-Temperature Reactors (VHTR) .
Although the cost for building Generation IV reactors is very high , the issue of the increase in demand of energy today needs to be addressed .
In fact , an amount of $1 .1 billion is needed to build a Generation IV reactor prototype (Butler , 2004) .
Moreover , the cost estimated also needs to take into account plant decommissioning and nuclear waste storage costs .
On the other hand , the VHTR produces both electricity and hydrogen .
As a result , many countries that largely depend on oil for their energy needs realise that hydrogen might be the fuel of the future and solution to their problems .
Furthermore , it is reported that if oil continues to be used , the energy demand from US transport alone will cause the nation's oil imports to soar by 78% by 2025 (Butler , 2004) .
Next , the society is concerned with the safety and security aspect of Generation IV reactors .
Even though Generation IV reactors might generate threats from terrorist attacks to acts of wars , stricter laws and policies could be set in place for counter measures (GreenPeace , 2005) .
The recent Iran's nuclear disclosure to the world has threatened the equilibrium of power within that particular region of the world (Grier , 2009) .
A solution to this could be to enforce countries that are intending to build nuclear reactors to sign the nuclear pact with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or else legal actions might be taken against them .
In addition , it is reported that the generation IV reactors will quietly switch themselves off and cool down in an event of an earthquake , a terrorist attack or human errors (Brockie , 2009) .
The waste and pollution produced by nuclear reactors is a worrying issue to both the environmentalists and the public , however the U .S . Department of Energy (DOE) has already considered this issue and more attention is paid to it .
Today , we have about 270 tons of separated plutonium essentially in storage in multiple countries (LaMonica , 2009) .
Therefore , the U .S . DOE has named out a few important researches and development challenges if generation IV reactors were specifically used for nuclear purposes .
The U .S . DOE realises that nuclear energy has a reputation as a polluting technology , hence it must be addressed (Numark , 2000) .
Moreover , since VHTR is a CO2 emission free reactor , it will not contribute to global warming .
In addition , the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) experts suggest that the U .S . should take time now to develop different "advanced fuel cycle" technologies (LaMonica , 2009) .
For these reasons , it is acceptable to jump into the conclusion that generation IV reactors would have the required technology to prevent the waste problem if it is going to be built .
On the whole , the debate on the provision of funds to further research and develop on generation IV reactors has been around for quite sometime .
The reasons for my support on the provision of funds are because there is a global shortage of energy supply and generation IV reactors are generally more efficient and environmental friendly .
In addition , new technologies could be researched to provide a solution to those problems that remain unsolved .
In order to do so , additional funds , efforts and assistance need to be provided to the research and development of generation IV reactors .
'Design process' is a linear sequence of events that has a start and an end point while 'psychology' is the study of the mind , its mental function and behaviour .
By approaching the design process from a psychological angle , the usability , functionality , safety and required user competencies of the design product are ensured to match user expectations .
The major engineering accident chosen for this essay is the space shuttle Challenger accident .
The accident occurred on  28 January , 1986 when Challenger disintegrated over the Atlantic Ocean seventy-three seconds into its flight , causing the death of its seven crew members .
Why is the psychology approach important to the design process ?
A system of machines , however advanced it is , can never operate by itself .
Everything that involves management , operation and decision-making comes back down to humans .
However , the human mind is a very complicated subject and a lot of problems might surface during the design process .
Therefore , psychology plays an important role during the design process in order to prevent any accidents from happening .
The Challenger accident was caused by faulty components and poor launch conditions .
The failure of the O-rings in its right solid rocket booster ignited a spark and subsequently , the flame impinged on the external fuel tank .
This then caused its structural failure and aerodynamic forces further brought about the disintegration of the space shuttle .
One human error , or more specifically a design error , led to the accident .
The two rubber O-rings in the booster were not resilient enough to withstand the hot high-pressure gases produced .
It was not known if the O-rings were able to seal properly at temperatures less than 12 C and the launch was done in cold weather at a temperature of -1 C . The booster's O-rings had been designated as a "Criticality 1" component which means that the failure of both the O-rings would result to the destruction of the orbiter and its crew .
The defect should have been identified and rectified first before the O-rings were used .
Secondly , poor decision-making also contributed to the Challenger accident .
The NASA management felt invulnerable from the accomplishment of its Apollo programme .
NASA was pressured to meet Challenger's launch schedule when the launching was delayed because of the poor weather conditions , low surrounding temperature and a defective micro switch .
The pressure was further increased when the then Vice President of the United States of America , George H . W . Bush was present to watch the launch .
All of these subconsciously affected NASA's decision-making to reduce the safety and quality of the system .
Back in 1977 , Morton-Thiokol , the contractor in charge of the Challenger's solid rocket boosters , knew that the boosters had problems when the O-rings experienced erosion in the booster joints in almost half of the shuttle flights .
In 1985 , a redesign effort was started .
The NASA management was briefed on the problem but they were not in support of the redesign team .
If better decisions were made , there would have been fewer problems .
Other than that , there was also communication failure between the Morton-Thiokol engineers and the top NASA officials .
The engineers could only reported to their immediate managers who only report to their direct supervisors .
Because of this mindset , the engineers dared not go above supervisors with their concerns for fear that they might lose their job .
On several occasions , the manager of the Solid Rocket Booster project , George Hardy from Morton-Thiokol , was told by the Marshall Space Flight Centre engineers that Thiokol's booster's field joint design could not be accepted .
An engineer suggested that the secondary O-ring is useless with that joint rotation .
Despite that , Hardy did not inform Morton-Thiokol and it was accepted for flight in 1980 .
It is clear that communication failure was also the cause of the accident .
In conclusion , if psychology is not given consideration during the design process , the possibility for an accident to occur will be high .
Thus , it is important to include psychology in the design process as human factors can affect the safety and quality of a system .
In view of today's environmental problems of global warming , there is an increasing necessity to introduce a clean , safe and efficient alternative energy source .
Although the nuclear power plant is considered safer and cleaner than fossil power plants , the devastating consequences of its occasional meltdowns deter the general public and policy makers from accepting it .
However , the development of technology has resulted in a continuous evolution of nuclear energy systems .
One of the latest prototypes of generation IV nuclear reactor is the Lead Cooled fast reactor (LFR) .
Unlike the previous generations of nuclear reactors which are constantly critiqued by opponents , the LFR is considered to be not only safer in different aspects , but also more sustainable and economical .
Social security is another safety issue that involves much dispute .
Since the 911 incident , there have been concerns about the unimaginable consequences of terrorist attacks on nuclear plants .
However , the LFR has made improvements on its physical structure to minimize physical damage from external attacks .
For example , the reactor uses independent , redundant and diversified Decay Heat Removal (DHR) loops to control damages and prevent potential radioactive releases (World Nuclear Association , 2008) .
There is no flammable or reactive coolant materials used to ensure that no big scale explosion occurs when being attacked .
In fact , various studies have shown that nuclear power plants can withstand such attacks better than almost any other civil constructions (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
The physical protection promises top security of building nuclear power plants like the LFR .
While the benefits of the LFR are largely acknowledged , its limitations and potential risks should also be recognized .
For example , as corrosion of lead may take place under high temperature , the LFR only works under 550 , which in turn limits its overall efficiency .
Also , operation of nuclear plant should be closely regulated to prevent any abuse use of nuclear materials .
This requires a concerted effort from countries around the world .
In fact , such regulatory agreements already exist .
An example will be the International Atomic Energy Agency's (IAEA) safeguards system under the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty (NPT) .
Nuclear power plants are gaining importance in the world as they help many countries , such as France , to maintain power independence .
Yet the non-nuclear weapon states should be monitored to prevent any undeclared nuclear activities .
In conclusion , the LFR helps enhance safety of nuclear power stations while not compromising economic factors .
Though it may not be the optimal design because of its potential risks and limitations , the LFR is still one of the possible future energy plants .
After all , we should expect the nuclear industry to dominate in generating world's electricity in the future as technology matures .
Nowadays , with the increasing population of the society , the limited resources cannot meet the large amount of demand of energy .
In order to overcome the energy shortage situation today , human beings have tried many ways to explore new kinds of energy , for instance , natural energy which includes wind energy and water energy .
However , the consequence is not that satisfactory , due to its low efficiency and high cost .
Therefore , scientists and publics have suggested that we can develop one kind of energy which can produce high energy efficiently , and that kind of energy is known as nuclear energy .
It seems a perfect solution to the bad situation nowadays , however , the use of nuclear energy becomes a controversial issue which causes fierce discussion among not only scientists , but also publics .
In my point of view , using nuclear energy is the right way to meet today's increasing energy demand , due to its high efficiencyand environmental emission .
There are several disadvantages of using  nuclear energy: The funds paid on developing this technology is high , the time taking to explore the technology is long and there exists dangers which can actually be solved .
Besides the above two factors , some opponents may believe that it is dangerous to use nuclear energy .
We use Very-High-Temperature-Reactors (VHTR) , which is one of Generation IV reactor concepts , as an example .
Due to the special design of its Helium Coolant , Graphite Reactor Core and temperature controlled system , the danger can be greatly reduced .
It is true that dangers still exist , however , with the development of the technology , it is desirable that those dangers could be overcome .
Design process is a linear sequence of events which was started by creative human act and ended with an invention of a new product .
It is also a kind of planning on how to apply the knowledge to the making of an object or a system .
Psychology is the characteristics of mental states and the science of human behavior .
It plays an important role in every human attempt in design processes .
({http://dictionary .reference .com/browse/psychology ?o=100074}[HYPERLINK: http://dictionary .reference .com/browse/psychology ?o=100074]) .
There is a relationship between psychology and design process which can prevent accidents from happening .
In conclusion , an accident is never caused by a single component failure or a single human error .
Psychology plays an essential role in design processes .
The role of humans in safeguarding complicated socio-technical systems cannot be neglected .
If the psychology factor is not considered in design processes , accidents may happen easily .
Hence , psychological inputs should be incorporated in design processes .
"The reasonable person adapts them self to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to them self .
Therefore , all progress depends upon the unreasonable person ."
(George Bernard Shaw) .
This sentence indicates why engineering psychology will become closer and closer to our life .
What is engineering psychology ?
Generally speaking , engineering psychology is concerned with adapting equipment and environment to people (Blum , 1952) .
This adjustment is based on people's psychological capacities and limitations , and the aim of it is to improve the overall system performance .
The conception of engineering psychology is first brought out during the First World War , when people found that the efficiency of machines was reduced sharply when they were operated by women instead of men (these machines are designed for men and not women) .
Since then people began to realize that sometimes the engineering problem was related to equipment design rather than the people who operate or other mechanical reasons .
However it is hard to say that whether we can solve the engineering problem by simply improving the psychological problems , since for many engineering incidences the technical problems had occupied an overwhelming part .
Hence in this essay I will argue about the proportion of psychological problem and technological problems during engineering incidence and give a conclusion from my own view .
incidencesproblemsBased on the report provided bhimself(1990) , 92% of all nuclear utility accidents between 1983-1984 were caused byhimselfnd only 8% of them were cause by control room operator .
For instanerious incidences which are cited frequently in technical literature .
They were happened in Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
The failing for the first one include: operators are unprepared to handle serious accident due to the lack of training; complex and confusing operating procedure led to the operators' incorrect action; serious managerial problem within the Nuclear Regulatory Commission .
None of these deficiencies explain thwasbasic causes in terms of the 'operating error' .
Moreover Reason(1987) suggests two main reasons for this kind of incidence in his own report for Chernobyl .
The first factor related werepeople misunderstands of effect of their action on the whole system , and the second factor is kind of persistent action which is made by a small and cohesive group in the process of pursuing an unsuitable aim .
What is the most iroidences for his theories is that afterproblemsing these engineering psychology problems , quite a lot of America's nuclear institutes begin to train their staff in a psychology-related way , which indeed prevent the nuclear accidents from happening again till now .
problemsTo sum up we can conclude from these two aspects that the human factors and the technical factor areonnected incidenceshave not happenedayed a role in the accident .
To simply solve one of them will contribute nothisolvethe accident .
Engineering accidents are not always caused by technical problems and the issue of engineering psychology will become hotter and hotter witht of technology in the area of advanced transportation , co-operative work , teleworking , health , pollution and leisure .

With the fast development of human society , we are facing more and more demanding energy requirements .
After centuries' exploitation , oil and coal , which human have deeply relied on in the past few hundred years , will dry up soon .
As prediction shows , the two main energy resources will be unable to sustain the industry demands in less than one hundred years time .
To solve this problem , people tried to find different energy substitutions , among which is nuclear energy .
Nuclear energy has many advantages .
Firstly , it is environmental-friendly , with no greenhouse gas emitted .
Secondly , nucofhas incomparable workihumansficiency with other energy resources .
One kilogram uranium soon dry up the same amount of energy as that released by 2400 tons of standard coal .
As carbon dioxide emission soars and energy demands increase rapidly recent years , the nuclehave triedtion is finding its way to the table .
To satisfy the increasing demands of nuclear energy , scientists are desperately searching for ways to improve the reactors' work efficiency .
Consequently , generation IV nuclear systems are born , including six models .
They are Gas-cooled fast reactor , lead-cooled fast reactor , molten salt reactor , sodium-cooled fast reactor supercritical-water-cooled reachave increasedvery-highinrature reactor .
Among all kinds of nuclear reactors , very-high-temperature reactor is an advanced one and has a broad prospect .
It supplies heat with high core outlet temperatures , which enables applicwereons sucwhich includesogen production or process heat for the petrochemical industry .
This allows for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
What's more , the recycling system is well-developed .
Given so many advantages of VHTR , we should devote more effort in promoting the reactor development .
However , some people may doubt the practicability of building such a high-efficiency nuclear reactor since it operates under such a high temperature .
Actually this should not be a worry .
Generation IV International Forum (GIF) , as the authority in nuclear power development , has shown the data which demonstrates that the basic technology for the VHTR has been well established in former High Temperature Gas Reactors plants .
Many prototypes are available as experience to develop VHTR .
Many national laboratory and vendors are very keen in the research of VHTR , such as: PBMR , GT-HTR300C , ANTARES , NHDD , GT-MHR and NGNP in South Africa , Japan , France , Republic of Korea and the United States .
Many of them have made significant breakthrough .
Hence , there is a great chance that VHTR will come to the world soon .
As the result of scary impressions left by two severe nuclear plants accidents in history , many people reject VHTR because of the security issue .
However , we should see the two accidents are both due to human factors rather than the reactors' own deflects .
What's more , many scientistsve studied the operation security of VHTR , like Hu , S . , Liang , X . , Wei , L . He reported his research results in "{Commissioning and Operation experience and safety experiment at HTR-10}[HYPERLINK: http://htr2006 .co .za/downloads/final_download_papers/D00000052 .pdf]" , on the Third International Topical Meeting on High Temperature Reactor Technology in South Africa and put forwards some constructive suggestions to improve the security condition of high temperature reactors .
Considering all these inspiring achievements on VHTR , we should have confidence that we will build secure nuclear reactors which will avoid tragedies happening .
competitionsAfter all the above , we can see that we have many reasons to support arch on VHTR .

Originated from the Ernest Rutherford's theory about atomic structure and Albert Einstein's well known mass-energy formula , the development of nuclear power has bypassed a glorious century and become one of the major electrical energy sources now (U .S . Department of Energy , n .d .) .
While amazed by the enormous energy generated by the tiny mass , people are also concerned about the negative perspectives of nuclear power .
Those against the development of nuclear power claim that it is safety threatening , costly in research and building plants , and not renewable (Public Citizen , 2006) .
Nevertheless , with the gas-cooled fast reactors (GFR) concept in hand , further research and funding should be devoted to expanding nuclear power .
The major refutan to developing nuclear power is about its threat to the safety of the public since conventional nuclear power produces radioactive waste and has a possibility of nuclear powhas becomeliferation (Public Citizen , 2006) .
However , safetn once the GFR concept is deployed .
GFR utilizes the waste reprocessing method , which minimizes the public's exposure to nuclear waste's radioactivity (Butler , 2004) .
Besides , the primary GFR core is loaded with transuranics from spent LWR fuel such that the plutonium created in waste reprocessing is diluted and consequently the proliferation resistance of the nuclear power plants is enhanced (Hejzlar , Pope , Williams & Driscoll , 2005) .
Furthermore , GFR adopts a passive cool-down system that reduces human's intervention substantially and thus enhances the safety of nuclear power plants (Butler , 2004) .
People also argue that developing nuclear power technology and constructing nuclear power plants are too expensive and it is not worthwhile since other cleaner energy sources could be cheaper in the future (Public Citizen , 2006) .
Nevertheless , analyses have been done with the result that plant capital cost can be reduced by up to 25% compared to the traditional Rankine cycle using the supercritical CO2 direct cycle (Hejzlar , Pope , Williams & Driscoll , 2005) .
Moreover , besides electricity power , GFR concept plants can also output hydrogen (Butler , 2004) .
Subsequently , it counterbalances its large cost to a great extent .
Another great concern of environmentalists is that the amount of Uranium on earth is limited , which means that nuclear power is not sustainable and subsequently less worthwhile for further development (Golay , 2004) .
Nonetheless , it has been shown that GFR achieves high Uranium utilization by breeding , also known as reprocessing (Hejzlar , Pope , Williams & Driscoll , 2005) .
Analyses also indicate that the amount of Uranium resources was increased by 15 percentages in two years to 2007 for intensified mineral exploration and iproducelso proven that Thorium can also act as nuclear fuel (World of Nuclear Association , 2009) .
As a result , the limitation of Uranium would be less of concern while considering the expansion of nuclear power .
With consideration of the current worldwide energy shortage , population expansion and global warming , it is appealing to bring about the generation IV nuclear power supply using GFR concept for its tremendous energy output and zero carbon emission .
Nevertheless , obstacles like finding irradiation-resistant materials and core design still need to be overcome by researches through hard work (Butler , 2004) .
Contrary to the opponents' concerns about nuclear power safety , cost and sustainability , it has been shown in the above that the generation IV nuclear power supply under the GFR concept is able to achieve higher safety goals , lower its building cost and make great economic contribution by splitting hydrogen , and exhibit improved sustainability .
Meanwhile , it produces immense energy and is free of carbon emission , which makes it even more ideal for power supply .
It is then predictable that the near future would witness the rise of nuclear power equipped with the generation IV reactor concept , GFR .
The Chernobyl incident on 26 April 1986 at Soviet Union was one of the most tragic catastrophes .
When the nuclear reactor exploded , tons of radioactive substances were released into the atmosphere .
The result was a contaminated food cycle and acute cancer-related illnesses .
Some of the damage reports done by scientists suggest that a minimal of 30000 deaths in 1986 were related to cancer arising from extreme exposure to the radiation .
To add on to the figures , the current death toll stands at a frightening 500000 .
According to Blackeye(2004) , the accident was primarily caused by a flawed Soviet designed reactor .
This reactor , named reactor bolshoy moshchnosty kanalny(RBMK) was actually meant for producing nuclear weapons .
Design of the reactor was such that even when the rate of cooling of the reactor was insufficient to compensate the increase in temperature , it will still be operational .
In other reactor designs , either the plant or the reactors will be automatically shut down .
This tragic event could have been avoided , or at least , the resultant damage  kept minimal if psychology was implemented in the operating process and procedures of the plant .
The use of psychology could have minimized the damage or even prevented the accident by influencing the engineers to use a reactor that is safer and has a negative void coefficient .
This is because should things turn out not be as expected , thousands or even millions of people could be affected .
Also , the people working in the power station should not be placed under danger
Next , in order to make the power plant as profitable as possible , use of psychology was omitted .
Steps associated with safety were excluded from the daily routine .
Also , accident prevention system coverage was not extensive .
Companies running the plant would only see the extra steps mentioned above to be unnecessary .
If psychology was used , the accident would probably not have happened as the Soviet government would fund part of the maintenance cost so that the necessary steps to ensure a safe working environment could be implemented .
Hence , the accident could have been prevented .
Thirdly , as mentioned by ILO Online(2006) , there was an absence of proper training and safe working environment .
The workers were not given adequate training to handle and operate the machinery involved .
While some may argue that training was unrecorded or informal , it is only proper to provide authorized and thorough training so that accidents can be avoided .
As the saying goes , it is human to make mistakes .
Based on Wilpert(2007) ,had psychology been used in this context , the explosion at Chernobyl could have been averted .
As mentioned in the previous point , funding from the government could have helped to reduce the strain on the firm running the plant .
External parties could have been called in to provide the training required .
With reference to the points mentioned above , it can be clearly seen that in today's context , where technology is getting more and more advanced , the consequences of a failure or breakdown in high-tech installations is devastating .
Applying the use of psychology in the engineering design processes may make it more costly and slow it down .
Nevertheless , when it comes to safety aspect , it definitely pays to add another step to the process and take precautions .
26 April 1986 marked the day when the lives of many in Ukraine changed forever .
Stemming from a simple experiment by engineers to test the cooling pump system when there is no power supply , the series of events that followed snowballed into the better known Chernobyl disaster .
At the end of it all , many were left dead and many more affected by the radioactive plume .
If the decisions by the engineers at duty in the plant were delivered with consideration , the Chernobyl disaster would not have tainted history .
Therefore the use of psychology in influencing engineers towards making proper decisions is a crucial one .
Psychology enhances understanding of design processes , helps foresee problems and as a result reduces problems too .
The opposition might argue on the cost and the need to implement psychology in an engineering design process but the imminent need to prevent accidents overpowers all opposition .
The use of psychology in design processes reduces problems by enabling an engineer to consider the pros and cons of his decision .
With psychology as a guiding tool , engineers are able to think of the possible fallbacks of their decisions .
Most design related problems are because of the difficulty people face in understanding the consequences of their actions (Stanton , 1996) .
While opponents might argue on the impertinence of the use of psychology and its effectiveness in reducing problems , it is undeniable that the use of psychology makes all team members take meticulous care in implementing decisions and hence make the design process safer .
Furthermore , the use of psychology lubricates cohesiveness among team members making the working environment friendlier .
A friendly environment would mean opinions are effectively shared .
Stanton (1996) remarked that the Chernobyl incident sparked due to the syndrome he terms as "groupthink" where small groups become unswerving in the face of an unfavorable situation .
With the use of psychology , members in the team are at greater ease in challenging a wrong decision and thus stalling an accident .
On the other hand , one could argue that the cost of hiring a psychologist is too high and cohesiveness can be easily achieved through games and interaction .
However , many of these people fail to consider the number of lives that are placed in jeopardy should the design process fail .
Therefore , the use of psychology and thus the need to hire a psychologist can be considered as an investment to prevent accidents .
The use of psychology would seek to improve engineering designs by preventing  human errors associated with the process .
A psychologist will seek to understand the mindsets of various members and thus foresee human error on their parts .
Shelton (1999) discussed the impact of human error on even the simplest tasks .
With human error being the trigger to accidents (Wilpert ,2007) , it is very crucial to nip human error in the bud .
Opponents might suggest ergonomics instead .
They would challenge that the design process should be made to suit the engineer so that human error on man's part can be avoided .
This argument cannot hold mainly because human error is evident everywhere and changing the design process would only mean a new set of human errors .
Instead with the use of psychology aiding the sculpting of a safe design process  , we can prevent accidents .
In conclusion , the use of psychology plays a huge role in facilitating any design process and ensuring that mishaps are completely avoided .
In the case of the Chernobyl accident , if psychology was inculcated , the mistakes by the engineers could have been prevented .
Many lives could have been spared .
Many people would have been freed from the painful marks of the Chernobyl accident .
Even though many would argue on the prospects of using psychology in design processes , one can say that the use of psychology depicts an accident free future vividly .
As more engineers feel stressful from their high workload , psychologist plays an important role in their work .
Most engineers only care about how to apply technology into practice , but they seldom care about how to make products that can be used easily .
Designing products should considering psychological factors for consumers and operators .
An inadequate industrial design may lead catastrophic consequences .
(Bernhard , 2006) Many people argue that psychology is non-related with engineering design; companies do not need to spend extra money on the unnecessary outcome .
But I consider psychology as the requisite factor for engineering work .
Human error has been recognized as the main reason for industry accidents; psychology can prevent human error happening .
