People nowadays have fierce controversy over the use of nuclear power due to the appalling nuclear accidents happened at Three Mile island and Chernobyl , or even the recent nuclear accident at Sellafield , England .
These accidents destroy cities , take people's lives and leave many deadly post-effects in the future decades .
Then , why do people continue using nuclear power ?
In fact , nuclear power is the cheapest power people can produce (The Virtual Nuclear Tourist , 2006) .
Therefore , facing this benefit , safety becomes the main concern when people choose to continue using nuclear power .
A series of generation IV nuclear reactors are newly designed for better efficiency , in the meantime , they are also improved on safety issues .
Among all the reactors , supercritical water reactor (SCWR) is outstanding for its high thermal efficiency and also better reliability .
However , opponents argue that SCWR is not reliable since it has no prototype .
Moreover , SCWR is operating under very high temperature and pressure , which makes SCWR less likely to be further developed .
Even though SCWR has not been tested yet , it is proved to have less possibility to cause nuclear accidents that happened before; it is easier to implement compared to other generation VI reactors , and it has a relatively high thermal efficiency which makes its long-term cost relatively low .
as hasof causingFirstly , opponents may doubt the safety and reliability of SCWR .
This doubt arises from the lack of knowledgewhich occurreddesign of this reactor .
The nuclear accident happened at Chernobyl was mainly because the nuclear plant utilized positive void coefficient of reactivity , causing it impossible to stop forrking process when things went wrong .
(Bodansky , 2004) On the contrary , SCWR uses negative void coefficient instead , which could effectively reduce the possibility of this kind ofS DOE Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee & the Generation IV International Forum , 2002) .
Finally , SCWR has a higher thermal efficiency of 44% compared to LWR of 33-35% (Baindur , 2008) .
However , opponents may point out that this high thermal efficiency is achieved at the expense of operating under very high temperature and pressure , which could increase its potential danger .
This concern is necessary but SCWR has overcome this issue .
The coolant in the SCWR system is supercritical water , which has very high specific heat , so that in very effective acting as a coolant .
Besides , this system is simple to construct and control since only one phase of coolant is present throughout the process (Generation IV International Forum , n .d .) .
Therefore , the safety issue concerning high temperature and pressure is overcome to some extent .
To sum up , although there exists disagreement of the use of SCWR due to its issue of reliability and safety , SCWR is worthy for further research because it bases on two current technologies , which increases its reliability , and its design principle improves its thermal efficiency compared to LWR and reduce the possibility of causing nuclear accidents .
Hopefully , SCWR could be better improved on current problems in the future development .
Given the memories of the two accidents which happened in 1979 at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania and in 1986 at Chernobyl of Ukraine , some people may still have not recovered from the great horror when they hear nuclear power .
However , instead of nuclear power , the fossil fuels people have been using are bringing various challenges to human beings .
On the one hand , people are facing the challenge of energy shortage because fossil fuels are nonrenewable .
On the other hand , burning fossil fuels produces the "green gases" such as carbon dioxide that have resulted in serious problems like global warming .
Therefore , some high-efficient , sufficient and environment-friendly energy is urged .
And because of high-efficiency and cleanliness , nuclear power is coming back into human consideration .
Recently , the generation IV International Forum (GIF) came up with six generation IV reactor concepts .
Among the six reactors , the Very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) stands out and may probably be the first choice as future fuel although some people may worry about its safety and cost .
Opponents may claim that the safety of VHTR cannot be controlled , which allows potential accidents .
However , VHTR is much safer compared to the past nuclear reactors .
First of all , instead of using water as coolant , VHTR uses helium gas .
Hence there is no need to be concerned about the safety of the reactor coolant .
The advantage of using helium as the nuclear reactor coolant is that helium is an inert gas which is single phase , and it will not chemically react with any material (International Atomic Energy Agency , 1997) .
In addition , exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , which is quite different from most of the other possible coolants (Youchison et al . , 1987) .
Secondly , for the material of VHTR , the ongoing 30-MWth HTTR project in Japan is intended to demonstrate the feasibility of reaching outlet the temperature up to 950 C coupled to a heat utilization process .
Thirdly , there are two unique designs of VHTR , which enhances the safety .
One is that the reactor and the gas turbine system are separated fromthe hydrogenn production plant , which is aimedatoisolatinge the hydrogen plant fromthe reactorr system during the abnormal events ofthe hydrogenn production plant .
The other design is that there are three control valves to mitigate the thermal variation of helium gas , which can automatically control the power generation rate when some abnormal events occur in the IS process such as process pump trip (Japan Atomic Energy Agency , 2007) .
In this case , the number of the accidents caused by human factors would be decreased .
Opponents may also argue that VHTR will cost a lot .
It is a fact that the cost for VHTR is high .
But among the 6 generation IV reactors , the cost of the VHTR is the second lowest , which is about $670 million .
Except the Sodium-cooled fast reactor (SFR) whose cost is $610 million , the cost of the other 4 reactors ranges from $870 to $1000 million .
However , the VHTR can generate electricity with high efficiency , which is over 50% at 1000 C , whereas , normally other reactors only have an efficiency of 33%-50% (The U .S . DOE Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee and the Generation IV international Forum , 2002) .
Moreover , VHTR produces hydrogen for vehicles' fuel .
And the US Department of Energy (USDE) has claimed "Without a switch to hydrogen , the energy demand from US transport alone will cause the nation's oil imports to soar by 78% by 2025" .
Thus , USDE has made the VHTR its first choice (US Department of Environment , 2004) .
To conclude , it should be evident that the arguments against the safety and cost of VHTR are invalid .
Since VHTR uses helium as a coolant , the research of the materials for VHTR is also ongoing , and also there are unique designs for VHTR , the safety of VHTR would be enhanced a lot .
Besides , compared with other generation IV reactors , VHTR costs less .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen as future fuel , which is environmentally-friendly and can effectively solve the energy shortage as well .
Therefore , VHTR is a promising and practical form of power .
According to recent findings , the current fossil fuel reserves are expected to be depleted in less than 40 years (Richard Black , BBC , 2009) and at the same time our energy consumption is increasing exponentially .
So , does mankind have a solution ?
Actually , we do and the answer is non-conventional sources of energy like Wind , Geothermal , Hydroelectric , Solar energy and the most promising one being Nuclear Energy .
The current generation of nuclear reactors look very promising , though not all of them seem to address the problems of safety , cost and performance .
However , one particular reactor seems to address all these problems , the VHTR (Very High Temperature Reactor) .
Firstly , the VHTR has a core outlet temperature of about 1000 degrees Celsius this high temperature increases the efficiency of reactor and also enables us to use it for applications such as hydrogen production (VHTR , Generation IV technology forum) .
The hydrogen produced can be used in automobiles , which in turn help decrease the carbon emissions by 30% when compared to modern day diesel engines (Jack Ewing , Business Week , September 2009) .
Although some people have raised the argument that current generation materials which are used to build nuclear reactors cannot withstand such high temperatures , it is now safe to say that an ideal candidate for the material has been found .
The material is moulded and extruded fine grained isotropic graphite which can be used for both core and support applications .
This is the same material which is being used in the Japanese , South African and Chinese high temperature test reactors (Bill Corwin , US Department of Energy , 2003) and has proven to be very successful .
Lastly , most of the technology involved in the VHTR is already in its development phase and the reactor can be shelled out as early as 2020 Butler , Nuclear Power's New Dawn , 2004) .
This is a deciding factor as the current reserves of fossil fuels won't last long and the sooner we make nuclear power the mainstream source of energy , the better it would be for us and Mother Nature .
Although people might suggest the use of Carbon Capture and Storage in the existiKadak .C .Andrew)missions to a great extent , it should be pointed out that this is merely a solution to delay the problem that we would eventually face .
In summary , it can be concluded that nuclear power is the answer to the current energy crisis and the VHTR is an ideal candidate because it (Butlerlyectric energy efficiently but also provides hydrogen which can help decrease CO2 emissions .
It is also much safer than the current generation reactors and has been well designed to counter any possible error that might occur due to human or technological factors .
Clearly , the reactor is the future of nuclear power generation .
There was a train disaster which occurred on the 3rd of June 1998 near a small town in Lower Saxony , Germany .
No one would have thought it would happen .
Such a super fast , state-of-the-art Inter Express trains of German Railways rolled out of the tracks and split in two , due to a bridge falling onto the train .
It resulted in 101 dying and 88 being injured .
Although there were many causes to be pointed out for this train accident , I think the biggest cause is that no one was aware of the importance of the use of psychology during the design process .
It was reported that the direct cause was a wheel with a composite construction which is relatively common on light railway transit vehicles , but are unique to ICE 884 in high speed trains which replaced the original wheel .
Furthermore , those replaced wheels just were inspected regularly .
However , it has still carried out some of discussion about the difficulties of such inspections and the frequency with which they take place to be used to debate with the method .
It cannot be denied that this is a human mistake which can be avoided by applying  psychology .
Psychology can make engineers aware that they are not only  normal persons , but are also professionals .
Their professional specialty can change other people's life , even save a life .
If they understand that , I believe that the engineers would not have used those composite construction wheels and used wheels which had not been checked properly and approved  .

Introduction
The Chernobyl accident that happened on 26 April 1986 , has led everyone to realize the damages and consequences that we might face when we built a nuclear power plant .
[Greenpeace International , 2009] Nonetheless , the Chernobyl accident was an outcome due to an old technology and poor management in the past .
In the next 50 years , demand for energy would definitely double with rapidly growing technology and production [Michelangelo Network , 2008] .
In conclusion , although the there are several advantages of the VHTR but however there are factors that makes it difficult to implement as it is more expensive and limited by choices of construction materials as compared with the GCFR .
I would give my fullest support for the concept of GCFR among the six concepts proposed in the Generation IV International forum .
Nonetheless , the decision to implement the reactors still falls in the hands of the countries that are highly interested as budget for every country is different .
[Cogeneration TechnologiesTM  , 2002]
With present day technologies , the Generation IV International Forum has proposed six new and advance nuclear reactors .
The six nuclear reabuild are not only sustainable and economically viable solutions; they are also safe and reliable source of energy .
Among the six concepts of nuclear reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor , (VHTR) and the Gas Cooled Fast Reactor , (GCFR) are quite similar , but has more benefits than VHTR in terms of performance , sustainability and cost .
the Gas Cooled Fast Reactor hasa safePerformance
VHTR is a high performance reactor which uses helium to cool the heating components during operation .
VHTR uses a mixed fuel composition to operate and this composition can produce improvement in fuel performance thus making it a very effective reactor in generating electricity .
This composition is a mixture of 15% carbide and 85% oxide in the fissile particles .
[European Union (EU) Energy Research , 2009] GCFR is a concept which uses the reference design of VHTR , thus it is also a reactor of high performance .
Since GCFR operates at 850 degrees Celsius , therefore there are more choices of materials that can be used in the construction of GCFR .
[Idaho National Laboratory , 2002] Because GCFR operates at a lower temperature as compare to the VTHR , therefore the materials used for construction is cheaper and there are more choices of material available .
comparedSustainability
GCFR is an excellent choice in terms of sustainability because it is capable in minimizing radioactive waste more effectively as compared to the VHTR .
The nuclear waste of the GCFR is able to be put back into the process multiple times , and this reduces the nuclear waste produced .
[Generation IV International Forum , 2009] The reduction of radioactive waste uses processes called pryo-chemical or hydrometallurgical .
[Commissariat   l'energie atomique , 2007] With this there is a great reduction of nuclear waste , and money can be saved on building a storage site for nuclear waste .
Therefore , GCFR not only can have efficient energy conversion with the current design but also has an economic benefit outcome .
[Idaho National Laboratory , 2002]
economically beneficialbuildtoCost
The cost for building a VHTR prototype would cost US $1 .1 billion .
However for GCFR , the total ten year budget of GCFR is US $940 million and it includes the cost from planning to completion of the reactor .
However this is shared by all eight Generation IV International Forum members .
Therefore the annual budget for each country is US $7-8 million .
In this budget , the required sum of construction cost is US $300 million .
[Idaho National Laboratory , 2002]
Conclusion
Nowadays , since  fossil fuel is running out at a very high rate , people are seeking another alternative energy resource to replace the traditional fossil fuel resources , which have been used by humans for hundreds of years .
One of the alternatives is nuclear power .
However , the public is very concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Actually , with the improvement of technology , the generation IV reactors are safe enough .
Moreover , these generation IV reactors are also very economic and promising .
Amongst these generation IV reactor concepts , I think the lead-cooled fast reactor is very competent and should get further research and development funding .
With regard to safety , people are usually afraid of the accident caused by the nuclear reactors .
This is because  once a nuclear reactor accident happens , it would be a huge disaster to both the creatures and the environment within that area .
A very famous accident , which is also used by the public to oppose building nuclear reactors , is the accident at Chernobyl which happened on 26 April 1986 .
As a result of this accident , 28 people were killed either immediately or within a few years , and 17 more died during the next ten years .
Moreover , according to the estimation , there would be thousands of people dying from cancer in the next forty years .
Another famous example is the accident which happened at the nuclear power station at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania on 28 March 1979 .
Although at Three Mile Island the discharge of radioactive material was too small to cause any harm , it still caused a great public reaction (Kletz , 2001) .
But for Lead-cooled fast reactors , people do not need to worry much about safety .
The temperature needed to operate lead-cooled fast reactors is about five hundred and fifty to eight hundred , which is relatively higher than today's light-water reactors and can avoid the risk of coolant boiling , and the pressure is rather low (Butler , 2004) .
More importantly , unlike some other materials like sodium , lead does not react with either water or air .
These features give lead-cooled fast reactors a significant safety advantage .
Furthermore , as the technology has improved so much , even if an accident happens , the damage is probably not that big .
For example , in the Three Mile Island accident , nobody was killed  or injured .
All radioactivity was contained as designed .
Therefore , lead-cooled fast reactors are very competent in this aspect of safety .
Besides safety , the economy is also a very important aspect which people should take into consideration .
At present , to build a nuclear reactor is still costly .
According to a study conducted by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) , even reducing completion time to just four or five years , and lowering construction costs by a quarter , would still not put the nuclear plants in contention with coal , and would just barely match the price performance of a combined-cycled natural gas-powered plant (Nivola , 2004)  .
However , since we can eliminate the need for an intermediate heat transport circuit in lead-cooled fast reactors , and lead is relatively cheap when compared with other materials used in other fast reactors , a large part of cost would be saved through this .
In addition , the high temperature of the lead-cooled fast reactors can also be used for thermochemical hydrogen production , which would contribute to reducing the cost as well .
According to Weaver (2005) , the lead-cooled fast reactor has a fifteen to thirty years' core lifetime .
That is quite long .
And furthermore , the earliest delivery time for lead-cooled fast reactors is 2025 (Butler , 2004) , which is not far away from now .
And because of its safe and economic property , we can certainly expect a good performance from lead-cooled fast reactors .
In conclusion , with the improvement of technology , nuclear power is becoming a very reasonable alternative for us human beings to choose to replace today's fossil energy resource .
Furthermore , the lead-cooled fast reactor is competent to get further research and development funding , because it is both safe and economic .
The prospective of lead-cooled fast reactor is very promising .

Chernobyl accident , happened in 1986 , was a nuclear reactor accident .
The explosion finally led to the evacuation and resettlement of over 336 ,000 people .

As design is defined to be a human activity which aims at altering products' properties or functionalities so as to meet social expectation (Wilpert , 2006) , there have been controversies on whether psychology should be considered as an influential factor in the design process or not .
Some insist that insights can be gained when analyzing design process using psychological approach .
However , there are also voices arguing that most of product or system designs are merely driven by technology (Wilpert , 2006) .
Both sides of evidences taken into consideration , psychology should be considered as an important factor that is influencing design due to its crucial role in facilitating interactions of social and technological factors , analyzing human expectations as well as planning work process of design .
First of all , psychology serves as the crucial connection between social and technological factors .
Design itself is to combine human expectations and standards with technical specializations .
No matter what the designers are to work on , complex systems or everyday products , psychology is helpful to gain insights of problems that may be encountered or prevent undesirable aapproaches .
For everyday products design , it is quite understandable that if the technical configurations are similar for all , psychology could help designers make a difference by humanly consider making improvements that are more user-friendly in design .
More impactful consequences of not applying psychology in design are that serious failures can happen in complex projects and systems hence cause loss of life .
For instance , the collapse of Nicall Highway , two stretches of highway road linked by Merdeka Bridge , located in the Central Region of Singapore (Vernon , 2000) , could have been prevented if psychological approach were adopted in the design and construction process .

It consequently led to lack of time for examining everything with enough caution and designers even misinterpreted building codes in such a rush .

In conclusion , psychology plays a significant role in the design process , as it serves as essential connections between social and technological factors , influences and reflects social expectations , it can be applied to avoid technical errors athe majorilures in complex systeof temporary used to optimize design plan .

It is known that global warming and rising energy consumption are the major challenges for people to solve in the near future .
In order to resolve such problems , a few nuclear reactors have been built in the past decades .
As it is not sufficient to provide energy power and not environmentally friendly , a new set of theoretical nuclear reactor designs are currently being researched to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Research into these reactor types was officially started based on several initial goals .
The primary goals being to improve nuclear safety , efficient thermal performanceand reduce cost .
Many reactor designs are being considered to  meet the generation IV goals of today .
Two of the generation IV reactors called Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor and Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor are highly appreciated and accepted in modern nuclear power plant systems .
In terms of performance , securityand cost cost , both  reactors are well designed .
However , to compare the two fast reactors specifically , it is better to choose Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor as the new reactor to meet the generation IV nuclear plan instead of Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor .
To begin with , truly speaking , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has high thermal efficiency which converts the raw material to the power energy with range from 39% to 47% .
(M .J . Lineberry & T .R .
Allen , 2002) compared to the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has the thermal efficiency about 48% , which is generally higher than sodium-cooled fast reactor .
(W .F .G .
van Rooijen , 2009) In addition , under the high performance , both  reactors need to work under high temperature .
Specifically , for Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , the temperature is about 550 while the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is about 850 .
(Butler .D , 2004) Hence , from general chemical knowledge , it is more convenient and efficient to convert energy under higher temperature .
In thermal performance , both  reactors have good  features especially for energy conversionhowever , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor may have additional advantages .
Secondly , it is appreciated that the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has some safety features .
It includes a long thermal response time which is a large margin to cool boiling .
Then , it is a primary system that operates near atmospheric pressure .
Meanwhile , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor is based on safety countermeasures for self-controlled shutdown function and controlling function .
(M .J . Lineberry & T .R .
Allen , 2002) The Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor ,  not only includes a basic self safety control functions but also has many safety approaches  applied to the system to make it work safely under high temperature with additional safety devices being added to the equipment .
Recent research and development with in depth studies for safety shows that , , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor system has through experiment demonstrated its security aspect .
(T .D .
Newton & P .J .
Smith , 2007) Hence , it is safer when it works properly .
Furthermore , in terms of cost , the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor was economical  with the use of high burn-up fuels .
It uses advanced materials and innovative design options to reduce  power plant capital cost and lower operating cost .
However , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is also well designed especially for waste recycling; GFR tries to minimize the release of gaseous and liquid effluents to the environment .
It takes into account that the management of waste from equipment is also important .
GFR systems are designed to allow for self-treatment by applying fuel manufacturing operations .
In addition , GFR can direct energy conversion .
Hence , it makes best use of energy and reduces the entire cost .
(T .D .
Newton & P .J .
Smith , 2007)
In conclusion , both the The The Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor and the the the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor achieve generation IV primary goal to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor works with  good thermal efficiency under a lower temperature when compared to Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor .
Moreover , it is designed well in terms of safety and cost .
Similarly , the GFR system offers significant potential to advance generation IV sustainability goals through its thermal efficiency , direct energy conversion , safety arrangement and proper cost .
Over all , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has advantages over Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor with respect to thermal efficiency , security  and cost .

The drastic industrial development and advancement in science and technology has led to the rising energy demand  .
Searching for alternative energy sources becomes the main effort of the whole world , especially those industry-developed countries due to the dwindling energy supplies from coal and fuel .
The past few years have seen repeated calls from some of the world leaders to introduce nuclear energy as an alternative energy source to replace fuel and coal in the near future .
Generally , nuclear energy is generated through the process of nuclear fission and nuclear fusion of radioactive elements .
The energy loss in this process is dissipated in the form of heat , where it can be used to generate power and electricity .
The invention of Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) is one of the latest Generation VI nuclear reactors that have high potential to replace  coal and fuel as an energy source .
Nonetheless , debate on the using of this nuclear reactor has become a hot issue today due to the negative effects that would be brought to humans as well as other living organisms on the earth .
On the whole , further research and development funding for SWCR should be provided as all these weaknesses of nuclear reactors can be overcome via evidences and discoveries from the research done .
In conclusion , despite the evident harm nuclear power can cause , we should not immediately rule it out as a possible source of power in the future .
Further researches have shown that The Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) can achieve great safety by its design modification , lower and reasonable cost of its construction and power generation and has high efficiency in terms of electricity and power generation .
Therefore , further research and development funding for the Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor (SWCR) should be provided as it stands in  good stead to become the future's power generator in the near future .
I agreed that the high cost , the safety issue of nuclear power reactor and problems of wastes recycling .
However , the generation IV reactor the supercritical-water-cooled-reactor (SCWR) will solve these problems straightforwardly .
Firstly , SCWR is still facing a financial problem .
To build a nuclear reactor and its prototype will cost over US$1 billion .
If the government uses this money to build more fossil reactors , the increasing fossil reactor plants will help the situation of lack of energy .
However , in a long term , nuclear reactor plants will reduce the cost compared with fossil reactor plants .
It is true that the initial cost of building a fossil plant is low , but the long-term costs which keeping it working are high says PBMR Company international marketing manager Gert Claassen .
Furthermore , the SCWR reactor's efficiency and relatively simple design ,  would be cheaper to build and run than normal reactors .
Therefore , the cost is not a problem for SCWR .
Secondly , it is too difficult to find an appropriate coolant for nuclear reactor .
However , the coolant of SCWR is supercritical water .
Normally , the critical point of water is the point at which the water exists as a combination of the liquid phase and vapour phase .
The condition of this point is at temperature of 374centidegrees and a pressure of 22 .1Mpa .
However , for the supercritical water , the critical point is much higher than the normal water .
It is about 510centidegrees at 25Mpa .
Therefore , the coolant can sustain under the high temperature and do not have any phase change .
Thus , it can produce a great amount of energy .
For that reason , to find a suitable coolant will not be a problem because there is no difficulty to find water in earth .
Thirdly , people are worrying about the waste of nuclear power , because the waste of reactor is normally radioactive .
If we are not able to handle the wastes well , the nuclear pollution will trigger the catastrophe .
Nevertheless , SCWR could work out this problem .
The coolant for SCWR is supercritical water and the waste of water is still water as well .
Therefore , this waste are not radioactive and it is much safer compared with the wastes of previous of reactors .
Moreover , SCWR has built a system for water purification through supercritical oxidation .
This system is to convert the waste water into potable water .
Then the reactor can reuse this water as coolant again .
To sum up , the supercritical-water-cooled reactors solve general problems which the normal nuclear power reactors have .
Therefore , the SCWR is feasible and reliable .
The SCWR 's revival would benefit the whole population .
For the public , the problem of global warming and other environmental problems caused by emissions of fossil fuel will be eliminated .
Politically , the nuclear power will maintain their energy source independence and reduce the conflicts of energy possessing .
To engineers and scientists , the applications of nuclear reactors would encourage them to find more efficient way to generate energy from reactors and the improve the safety of reactors in case of any accidents  .
Generally speaking , the nuclear power will be the fuel for the future .
People will obtain safer cleaner and cheaper energy generated by nuclear power reactor .
We are now marching into a new era of nuclear age .
Generation IV of nuclear power is now undergoing development and research .
Very-high-temperature Reactor (VHTR) which is operated by open fuel cycle is one of the six concepts of Generation IV reactors .
It has an operating temperature of 1000 C and uses high pressure during reaction stages .
VHTR is one of the best substitutions for coal plants from a science perspective as it does not pollute the earth and it does not need to use as much fuel as other forms of energy .
The question of whether we should have nuclear powerplantst as an energy resource is controversial .
People stand against it as they havelittle knowledgea about the nuclear power plant .
Cost , safety and performance are three major aspectsofr opposition to this technology; nevertheless , there is still an unyielding need to support further research and development funding for VHTR .
People believe that it would be costly to start up a new nuclear industry .
It is true though .
According to Mansilla (2008) maximizing the system efficiency does not guarantee a minimum cost .
Still , in point of fact , nuclear power plants can reduce the expenditure in producing more energy in the long run .
compared to conventional plants , VHTR can bring out 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel .
Since that VHTR uses a lower amount of fuel to produce higher amounts of energy , it is much more economic than other power plants regardless of the start up cost , as the start-up cost can be compensated in the long run .
Needs for energy are neither going to decrease nor are sources of energy going to increase .
Therefore , when sources of conventional plants are severely depleted , its cost will soar up  and become uneconomical; on the other hand , VHTR uses half the amount of fuel to produce an equal amount of energy , hence it can last longer .
Safety of a nuclear plant is the issue that concerns the public the most .
The reactor core explosion at Chernobyl in Ukraine was a catastrophic failure .
It raised public's uncertainty about the safety of developing new nuclear power plants .
However , VHTR is being designed to avoid such circumstances .
VHTR is coated with a layer of graphite which can be used to slow down neutrons in order to control the nuclear chain reaction and it is covered with an ultra hard ceramic layer .
Furthermore , it uses helium , an inert gas as a coolant .
Therefore it can avoid any radioactive material from escaping if an accident happens .
Moreover , a back-up emergency core cooling system (ECCS) has been designed .
ECCS can remove excess heat and avoid damage to power plants in emergency situations , such as terrorism .
In addition , VHTR would be able to function without the need to reprocess plutonium waste .
This would be able to prevent the creation of nuclear power weapons as plutonium is an ingredient to produce advanced nuclear weapons .
People assume that VHTR has lower performance when compared to other kinds of Generation IV power sources .
According to research , VHTR is a thermal reactor which relies on moderators to slow down neutrons while Gas-cooled Fast Reactor , Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor and Lead-cooled Fast Reactor are relying on fast spectra .
This gives people a wrong assumption that VHTR  .
However , the performance of reactors also depends on operating pressure and temperature .
Researchers anticipate that VHTR's cycle efficiency could reach above 50% while comparing to Molten Salt Reactor , for instance , which could only reach around 44% to 50% .
Furthermore , VHTR is designed to efficiently produce both electricity and hydrogen at the same time .
In conclusion , the opposing reasons for not supporting further research and development for VHTR are arguable .
The initial cost for VHTR is high but it can be covered in the long run by its quantitative energy output .
Likewise , VHTR is being designed with adequate safety precautions to prevent a tragedy from happening .
It has better performance as well since it has high efficiency and both electricity and hydrogen as its reactive product .
Concepts of nuclear power plant in generation IV have shown substantial improvements in cost , safety and efficiency especially VHTR .
Consequently , more research and development funding should be given to VHTR .
As the society develops rapidly , the demand for energy also increase in tandem .
However , fossil fuel , our conventional source of energy , is nearly running out , which means we need to find alternative sources of energy .
As a result , nuclear power has received renewed interest after over 30 years when no new nuclear plants have been built .
In adoption of nuclear energy , we need to consider cost , efficiency and safety features .

July 17 , 1981 in Kansas City , Missouri , United States , while dozens of people was gathering on the walkway in Hyatt Regency Crown Centre and seeing a dance contest , the walkway collapsed and caused 114 people died and 200 injured .
After the accident investigated , the main cause of the accident was a significant change in the design of the walkway .
The original design by Jack D . Gillum was using a set of steel tie rod to suspend the two walkways to the ceiling , but the contractor proposed to use two separate tie rods: one collected one walkway to the ceiling , and the other connected the two walkways .
Jack D . Gillum and associates did not calculate the alternate plan before they assigned on the paper .
Thus the accident happened .

On January 28th , 1986 , the US Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 73 seconds after launch , killing the entire crew .
This is a disaster in human history and is a tragedy of NASA .
The cause of the disaster was reported as the failure of an "O-ring" seal in the solid-fuel rocket on the Space Shuttle Challenger's right side .
However , this is not the only factor resulting in the tragedy .
The report also said that the officials of NASA ignored the concerns voiced by engineers and insisted launching the shuttle at risk .
In other words , not only the technical factors , but also the human factors caused this disaster to appear .
Therefore , psychology in design processes , in my opinion , could have prevented this accident .
Firthe 28th oof Januaryreparation of psychology in design processes could have saved the Space Shuttle Challenger .
Actually , from the time it was first scheduled to lift off on January 22nd , to the when it was finally launched on January 28th , liftoff was delayed several times for various reasons .
Obviously , the preparation for this project was not good at all .
Arguers may say that no matter how good the preparation was , there were still some unpredictable factors that might lead the mission to failure .
Well , it is true that the errors cannot be prevented completely; nevertheless , we should try our best to reduce theoccuro the least level that we can accept .
Apparently , the condition of Challenger was not what we can accept as safe .
Furthermore , if the preparation was well done and the "O-ring" problem was fixed during the process , Challenger could have been saved .
Secondly , should the decision-making system be made better , the tragedy could have been avoided .
Faced with the choice of whether to put off the mission for safety or to carry on the misn at risk to save money , the oon thei28th of Januarythe latter one , which was a big mistake .
Furthermore , they also had policy failure on competitive bidding for manufacturing company and defects of supervision system .
All these factors contributed to the unreliability of the safety of the mission .
Although NASA have to face the pressure from the public and the political , they should aware the consequences of the failure , which might make the situation evone thatorse .
If the highest levels of NASA had made The Challengeron more objectively and scientifically with the help of psychology in design , putting the mission off like before , the disaster could have been prevented .
As discussed above , the Challenger disaster's causes lie not only on the technical factors , but also on the human factors .
In my opinion , the root cause is the human factoa launch wrong decision made by the officials .
Though it was indirect cause , its influence is so large that it was morean airportant than the technical factor .
Psychology in design processes , whose significance has been showed in this accident , should be paid moretragedyn to in the future engineering design .
Only in this way , can the safety of projects be improved efficiently and guaranteed .
There has been a debate between two Generation Four reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) and the Supercritical Water Reactor (SCWR) , as to which  reactor has superior performance .
On the one hand , engineers use the most advanced technology and concept to design the VHTR .
On the other hand , the technology applied on the SCWR is developed from conventional technology of an older type of nuclear reactor , Light Water Reactor (LWR) .
The supporters of VHTR attack SCWR for its "obsolete" technology and its incapability of generating Hydrogen as a co-product of electrcity .
Nevertheless , I believe the most practical thing ends up being the most useful thing .
In my opinion , the SCWR outmatches the VHTR at both performace and cost .
When people compare the two types of reactors , they tend to focus on the temperature at which reactors operates .
Then , they discover that the VHTR is operating at a temperature level which is almost twice as that of the SCWR .
As a result , a misleading conception arises , which is that the VHTR works much more efficiently than the SCWR  .
Indeed , temperature is an indicator of how efficient the reactor is .
However , it is by no means the only indicator .
According to Prof Mirko Ascic's scientific journal (ASCIC , 2005) , the energy of neutrons in the reactor is the dominant factor that affects the process of converting heat to electricity .
The fact is the SCWR has about four times as many neutrons in the energy range above 6 .2 MeV and about 16 times as many neutrons below 0 .1 eV .
These two energy states of neutrons are closely related the fusion of two fuels , U235 and Np237 .
As a result , The SCWR has a higher performace up to 4 percent compared to the VHTR .
For people who are obssesed with the VHTR , one main reason would be it allows an easy way to generate a clean natural energy , Hydrogen .
It is unnecessary to describe how huge the amount of fossil fuel the world consumes everyday and the influence of burning the fuel on the whole environment .
Scientists have been searching the most suitable and the most economical surrogate for fossil fuel for decades .
And reactors with super-high operating temperature seems to be the ultimate answer .
However , in my opinion , reactors that can generate Hydrogen are just "gimmicks" .
After all , electricity is also a perfect energy which has no side-effect on the environment .
Furthermore ,  using Hydrogen , which has just begun developing and is far from matured , electricity has been with human beings for over a hundred years .
The technology of electricity can be found everywhere  and big automobile manufacturers have started to discuss the possibility of replacing fossil-fuel-powered cars with electricity-powered ones .
Thus , the critical question arises .
How to produce electricity economically ?
In my opinion , the SCWR is the answer .
The SCWR is built  of low-cost electricity .
In addition , the two technologies needed to build the SCWR are already at hand , which are widely-employed  by current Generatioon Three LWRs .
Unlike the VHTR which uses rare gas Helium as a coolant , the SCWR simply uses water to cool down the system .
As a result , the SCWR costs much less to build and greatly simplifies the nuclear plant .
In conclusion , the most advanced technologies may not be suitable in a certain condition .
The SCWR has proven itself to be more capable at both high performance and low cost .
In this sense , the SCWR is a better nuclear reactor compared to the VHTR for our future .
By the year 2030 , many of the current operating nuclear power plants in the world will be at or near the end of their operating licenses .
Therefore , research and development of Generation IV technologies are being conducted by participating countries in the Generation IV International Forum .
Some of the developing concepts include the "Very-high-temperature" and "Molten salt" nuclear reactors .
Competitive costs and financial risks of nuclear energy systems are constantly being compared .
In the case of the Very-high-temperature reactors , the cost of running the plant is lower when compared to Molten salt reactors .
The efficiency of the VHTR is also >50% as compared to conventional reactors .
VHTR produces hydrogen as a byproduct , thus increasing the chances of utilizing the reactors for other energy sources .
VHTR's technology is based on an upgrade to current HTR technologies .
Therefore , the estimated time to receive the technologies will be earlier when compared to MSR .
MSR's research requires scientists to work on new materials which can withstand the usage of molten fluoride salts .
On the other hand , VHTR's research had been mapped into proper stages and there is a large pool of researchers working on it .
, the time span needed to reach optimum standards will be later than VHTR , thus putting VHTR ahead in the economy race .
Safety issues involved in generation IV reactors are mainly on temperature and chemical reactions during high pressure operations .
As the generators are designed to operate at temperatures up to 1000 Degree Celsius , prevention of a reactor meltdown would be important as a repeat of the Chernobyl disaster during the year 1986 would not be acceptable .
This is especially for VHTRs as they operate at temperatures up to 1200 Degrees Celsius as compared to the lower pressured MSRs .
There is no doubt that the world is moving towards nuclear energy development in the future 20 years from now .
The current race to develop the best reactor for use is still questionable as all the reactors have their own strengths and weaknesses .
However , with the current VHTR's achievable research goals , it will probably be the generation IV reactor to lead the pack in years to come .
At the turn of the millennium , the rising of Asian countries such as China and India has intensified the competition of energy .
In 2007 , China consumes a third as much oil as the United States , which burns a quarter of the world's oil every day .
(HYPERLINK "http://topics .nytimes .com/top/reference/timestopics/people/m/jad_mouawad/index .html ?inline=nyt-per" \o "More Articles by Jad Mouawad"Mouawad , J .
New York Times) By 2030 , China and India together will import as much oil as the United States and Japan do today .
In addition , there are concerns about the impact on global warming due to fossil fuel power plants .
Fossil energy use is responsible for about 85% of the human-caused carbon dioxide emission produced annually .
(Pachauri , R , IPCC) Hence , fossil fuels are not a viable means to meet the increasing demand of energy .
Thus , other reliable means of energy have been considered , of which , nuclear energy holds the greatest potential .
Using nuclear processes to produce energy is not a new concept .
Since the first poweractor was built in the Sovietfornion in 1954 , there are consumedear power plants in operation at present .
(IAEA) Meanwhile , nuclear power has not risen to be a top choice because of worries about leakages of radioactive substances from the plants .
For example , the explosion of reactor 4 in the Chernobyl power plant resulted in 237 deaths due to radiation .
In another accident in the Three Mile Island in the US , 140 thoand people living within a five mile radius of the plant evacuated after the meltdown of a cooling system .
Moreover , in this post 911 era , many worry about nuclear power plants becoming the terrorists' targets .
Acknowl(Pachauri , 2007) nuclear power to meet the world's energy appetite , several countries have formed the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) to research on the possible nuclear technologies and to mitigate the risks posed by them .
Two of the six short listed systems are the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor (SFR) and Super Critical Water Reactor (SCWR) .
Both of these systems , especially the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor , promises higher efficiency , lower operational cost and enhanced safety measures over current generation of reactors .
In the SCWR , liquid water , which is used as coolant for the 650oC reactor core , is pressurized to 2500 times the atmospheric pressure , to the supercritical state .
Firstly , at this high pressure , water has a larger range of operating temperature .
Thus , the reactor can function safely within a greater range of temperature .
Secondly , supercritical water also has the highest heat capacity .
This means that water can absorb a higher amount of energy for the same volume of water , thus having a better rate of heat transfer compared to the current generation of reactors such as Boiling Water Reactors (BWR) and Pressurised Water Reactor (PWR) .
Better heat transfer also allows the coolant to have a slower flow rate of the coolant , thus saving cost by using of smaller pumps and piping .
Thirdly , water does not change phase within the coolant cycle due to its increased boiling point .
This would allow the coolant to have a laminar flow , increasing the efficiency of the coolant .
Hence , the plant would have 45% thermal cycle efficiency .
the supportResearchRegarding the safety aspects of the nuclear reactors , the GIF has set high targets Comparedcto .
For the SCWR , the use of water at the supercritical state allows the coolant to be functional and effective at a right range of temperature .
The absence of a change in phase would also make the reacand thus safer to operate .
All this is possible with the highly pressurized water .
Meanwhile , SFR does not have the problems regarding maintaining the coolant at high pressure .
Instead , the challenge lies in keeping the sodium coolant from direct contact with air .
As sodium is highly reactive , it reacts violently with the airdoesrom the environment .
This difficulty is overcome by using a two-step cooling solution , whereby sodium is used to cool the core , and a secondary coolant , such as water , is used to cool the sodium .
Also , SFR has the added advantage of closed fuel cycle , which helps in the management of highly radioactive actinides .
This wfocusedprevent the proliferation of the nuclear waste .
Finally , nuclear-enriched materials being kept at high temperature would prevent them from being stolen and use as weapons by terrorists .
usedkeeping nuclear-enriched materials at a In conclusion , SFR stands as a more viable option to be the solution to the world's energy crisis .
Though the deployment cost is high at present , the burden will be shared by the many countries support the technology .
Also , the performance of SFR is ensured based on the findings of the various researches conducted .
Finally , well-planned safety measures and actinides management would ensure the SFR would function safely within its use .
Nuclear accidents like the Three Mile incident and the Chernobyl disaster left a bad aftertaste in the eyes of the public .
Furthermore , the constant threat of nuclear terrorists and the issue of radiation leakage made nuclear energy even more unpopular .
However , as mankind evolves , nuclear energy could possibly be making a comeback .
Facing the issues of rising oil prices and the long term availability of fossil fuels , governments are now rethinking their national energy strategies .
One of these strategies is harnessing nuclear energy .
Going nuclear would provide the growing economies with a constant and steady supply of energy to sustain their economic development .
Furthermore , it also addresses the issue on global warming as it does not produce greenhouse emissions which could further aggravate the situation .
Though the public may be concerned about the safety of operating a nuclear plant , we should continue to develop nuclear energy as its economic and environmental benefits outweighs its risks .
One potential reactor concept that we should look at would be the Very-high-temperature reactors (VHTR) , as it addresses the concern over uranium reprocessing and the impact of a nuclear accident .
Furthermore , it gives significant economic and environmental advantages as it is more energy efficient and it also produces hydrogen which could be used for other purposes .
(Butler 2004 , Six generation concepts)
One of the public's concerns over the safety of operating a nuclear plant is the issue of nuclear waste management .
Given the current controversy regarding Iran's uranium enrichment program , whereby the technology could be used to develop nuclear weapons( Nasser Karimi , Associated Press Wednesday , October 7 , 2009 ) , the public has the right to worry since there have not been much transparency from Iran .
This concern would be diffused if we are developing VHTR , since its design does not incorporate a waste recycling component hence there would not be a basis for any uranium enrichment program .
Therefore , there is no need to worry about the reprocessing of uranium for weapon proliferation .
Another concern on the safety aspect of nuclear plants is radiation leakage due to improper disposal or infrastructure failure which could be caused by a terrorist attack .
Radiation exposure is an inherent part of nuclear energy and some believe that living near a nuclear plant would increase the risk of cancer and that any nuclear accident would result in high casualties .
After the Chernobyl accident , many scientists predicted that the radiation exposure of that incident would have caused a million deaths hence causing panic and hysteria among the public which eventually made nuclear energy unpopular .
However , in 2005 , a report done by IAEA and the World Health Organization deduced that the incident caused 56 direct deaths and suggested that there may be 4 ,000 extra cancer deaths among the approximately 600 ,000 most highly exposed people({IAEA Report}[HYPERLINK: http://www .iaea .org/NewsCenter/Focus/Chernobyl/]  ,2008 .)
which were significantly much lower than previously thought .
Therefore previous claims by scientist were over exaggerated and the public should be educated on the issue of radiation exposure so that they do not oppose the idea because of misinformation .
Furthermore , active safety measures were also put in place , checks for radiation leakage are done frequently by experts and nuclear plants are located at isolated places to minimize exposure .
They are also well guarded to deter any terrorist attacks .
To further put the public's mind at ease , the VHTR is also designed to automatically shut down in a case of an accident hence minimizing radiation leakage and foiling any terrorists' attacks .
Therefore this further enhances the safety aspect of running a nuclear plant and should adequately address the concerns of the public .
As the world copes with the rising cost of oil , governments are investing into different energy fields to diversify their energy sources so as to increase their countries' energy independence .
Some argue that we should not be investing into nuclear energy as it is expensive to build and run and that it is not a renewable energy source , hence we should invest into renewable energies which are more sustainable .
Though renewable energy may be sustainable , their energy supplies are intermittent depending on environmental factors .
Therefore , they are unable to meet the intense energy demand of our growing economies .
Nuclear plants are more expensive to build than the other energy sources , but it is a premium that we have to pay to obtain a reliable and consistent supply of energy to drive our economic progress .
Furthermore , the VHTR concept has a high fuel burn up ratio which translates to an efficiency of 80% which is significantly higher than renewable energies which have efficiencies of 20-30% (Prof Tan , Powering the new millennium , 2009) .
The VHTR also produces hydrogen which could be used as another source of fuel for power plants or could be sold to industries which use it , hence generates a source of revenue for the state .
It is also good that we diversify our energy sources to booster our energy security .
Hence we should continue to develop nuclear energy as it is a proven tool to obtain constant steady supply of energy .
Furthermore the high energy efficiency and potential uses of hydrogen , gives it more economic advantages over the renewable energies .
Another issue that nuclear energy would address is global warming .
As we know global warming is mainly caused by greenhouse emission from the burning of fossil fuels and its impacts include climate change and the flooding of low lying area hence jeopardizing the survival of our future generations .
Nuclear energy is 'clean' as it does not release any greenhouse emissions .
Furthermore , the ability of the VHTR to produce hydrogen provides another source of clean energy which we could utilize to power our economies and cars which are the main contributors of greenhouse emissions .
By reducing the carbon emissions from these two sources , we would be able to buy us more time to develop technologies to tackle the global warming issue; therefore we should develop the VHTR to aid our cause .
The design of the VHTR has incorporated a lot of safety features which enhances the safety of operating a nuclear plant .
Coupled with that , the strict regulation of the IAEA and its frequent checks ensure that the infrastructure remains safe and intact hence safeguarding the interest of the public .
Furthermore , the high power efficiency of the VHTR makes it economical to operate and the production of hydrogen provide a source of revenue for the state as well as another alternative source of clean energy which reduces greenhouse emissions .
Since the VHTR is able to benefit us economically and environmentally , we should continue to develop it despite its risks .
Opponents said that it is safe to use the electric car on the road , as quoted from "Electro Automotive" (n .d .) , they claimed that it's fully safe as the battery does not leak even if an accident occur .
However , the car is still not fully safe for operation .
The design has an overall light protection by the lightweight body frame .
The idea of using such is so that lesser battery power will be used to drive the vehicle , in order to travel longer distances , as compared to heavier frames .
Because of the nature of light weight , it will lead to one bigger safety issue , accident consequences .
Accidents can happen anytime , and hardly avoidable .
Roger (2003) mentioned that many mavens , known as car addicts , were worried that if an accident were to occur , especially with heavier vehicles , chances of the electric car being smashed is relatively high , the fact that current population of vehicles is still fuel driven .
This indicates danger to both driver and passengers .
One suggestion is to design better , stronger and safer materials for the frame of the electric car .
At a small cost of a slightly slower speed , accidents can be prevented and reduced if drivers practice safe and considerate driving .
Moreover , there is added protection with the stronger frame .
Opposition claim that the electric car is good as it helps reduce the reducing the rate of greenhouse effects by having no harmful emissions compared to fuel cars , Partha (2009) said .

By comparing the prices , it shows that more drivers will prefer choosing the fuel car , as partially because of the need to charge the electric car every 100 miles , while a fuel car go up to 1000km or more , as most drivers need to travel longer distances without visiting the petrol station that frequently .
If there are more users who use the fuel cars , it will hence increase pollution , not decrease even with the technology of electric cars .
One solution is to improve the design of electric cars such that it can run longer distance , with the same battery power .
This may in turn , interest drivers that this will be a better option , as fuel depletes one day , electric cars may become the better choice of transport , which will also saves the environment .
Lastly , with the slow speed of the electric car of 50mph quoted from "Pros And Cons Of Electric Cars" , critics think that it will be safer for the drivers and passengers , and accident rates can be reduced .
However this may not be true .
This is because , comparing the amount of fuel cars owned , to the amount of electric cars owned , electric cars are very low amount in ratio .
Hence there are more heavy fuel vehicles on the road that runs faster than electric cars .
This will increase risk and rate of accidents that may occur , as electric car which is slower may become a potential obstruction to the "faster" fuel cars , and if collision occurs , chances of electric car drivers getting severely injured is high because of the lighter body frame as discusses earlier on .
A solution is to design higher power output of the electric car such that it can travel faster speeds to be on par with current fuel vehicles such that it reduces the accident rates , hence increasing safety of the car .
In conclusion , there is a need to improve the electric car to increase safety and fully utilise its safety features .
For example , reinforcing its body frame with stronger materials , and increasing battery power capacities .
As time passes , the government is likely bound to increase fuel price , making fuel cars an unworthy choice .
But for now , as the technology is not readily available yet and fully safe , there is no reason to get an electric car .

In recent years , despite the contentious debate of using nuclear power to meet our ever-increasing energy needs , the world has started to consider nuclear energy as a future fuel source which is believed to  more environmentally friendly  compared to fossil fuels .
Hence , late in 2002 , Generation IV International Forum (GIF)  announced the selection of six reactor technologies which they believe represented the future shape of nuclear energy .
These were selected on the basis of being a clean , safe and cost-effective means of meeting increased energy demands on a sustainable basis , while being resistant to usage of materials for weapons proliferation and secure from terrorist attacks (US Department of Energy , 2009) .
In this essay , I would present my argument to support further research and development funding for the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) as opposed to the Supercritical Water Reactor (SCWR) , from the perspectives of security , performance and costs .
Firstly , proponents of SCWR claimed that the very high-temperature concept of VHTR reactor can be detrimental to safety if a loss-of-coolant accident (LOCA) occurs .
This means that if there is a break in the pipe , coolant will be lost and cause the reactor to heat up very quickly , resulting in the release of toxic gases and fission products into the environment .
However , this may be an unfounded concern in years to come when we consider the fact that the Korean and the US governments have worked for the past three years on developing and validating advanced computational methods for simulating LOCA in a VHTR , in an attempt to prevent such an accident from happening (Chang , 2006) .

Proponents of SCWR also claimed that VHTR produced high volume of nuclear waste which can be a potential source of nuclear weapons for the terrorists .
However , this claim may not be entirely valid because the waste produced , though in high volume , is considered low-level (low in radioactive content) .
The fuel pebbles used in VHTR are also very 'durable' in the sense that it is very difficult to extract the trapped fission products inside which render it a less favorable choice as a nuclear weapon .
There is also another design feature of VHTR that makes it a preferable choice of reactor over SCWR .
In contrast to SCWR which uses water both as the coolant and moderator (a substance that control the fission process) , VHTR uses helium and graphite as coolant and moderator respectively .
This means that if there is a leakage of water in SCWR , the plant will not be able to operate at all .
Next , VHTR has better performance than SCWR in three main aspects .
Firstly , in terms of burn-up rate of the fuel , for VHTR , it is possible to burn up to 65% (US Department of Energy , 2008)of its initial fuel as compared to SCWR which is capable of only burning up to 45% of the initial fuel (Buongiorno , 2003) .
Secondly , due to the high operating temperature of VHTR , the large amount of heat produced can be used for many purposes , ranging from providing domestic energy supplies and refining crude oil , to providing energy for hydrogen production .
This is unlike SCWR , which can only produce electricity .
Hydrogen production ,  an energy--intensive process , is important as hydrogen holds enormous promise as a power source for the future generation .
This is also one point that makes VHTR a more economical plant than SCWR .
Lastly , VHTR uses graphite as the moderator , which according to nuclear experts , is an excellent moderator as compared to water which is used in SCWR (Cogeneration Technologies , 2002) .
VHTR also uses helium gas as the coolant which is an inert gas .
Hence , the plant can be operated at high temperatures without having to worry about corrosion of the plant pipes .
This is different from SCWR , which uses water as the coolant and hence there is a possibility of the pipe's corrosion by water .
Lastly , proponents of SCWR claim that the construction cost of VHTR plant is much higher than SCWR due to its high operating temperature .
This would not be a valid claim if we consider the fact that VHTR is built to operate at a long life span of 60 years (Lee , 2005) which is much longer than that of VHTR .
Hence , this makes it justifiable to spend more money to build VHTR plant .
In conclusion , I would like to reiterate my stand that VHTR is a better reactor design than SCWR in terms of safety , performance and costs , and hence funding should be given to support the research and development of VHTR .
