Nuclear technology has experienced several revolutions in the past fifty years .
The nuclear reactors currently in operation are Generation II and III reactors .
Generation II reactors were first developed in the 1950s , and were widely adopted in the following 40 years .
Generation III reactors , invented in the 1990s , are the most advanced in use nowadays (Wallenius , n .d .) .
However , after the concept of Generation IV reactors were raised by GIF in 2001 (Butler , 2004) , whether governments should solely focus on current nuclear reactors or split the funding for the new generation has become a controversy .
In my opinion , governments should fund the Gen IV reactors , as they possess remarkable advantages in terms of safety , performance and costs relative to the old designs .
Some people claim that Gen II and Gen III reactors are safe enough for operation .
Despite the accident in Chernobly , Ukraine , which was mainly caused by man-made operating errors (Chernobly accident , 2009) , no major accident occurred in the past two decades .
Compared with funding the Gen IV reactors , they think that governments should rather use the money to reinforce the safety of currently operating reactors .
However , malwastions that had the risk of being disastrous happened from time to time .
For instance , in 2006 , part of the Forsmark-1 reactor in Sweden failed to startlbecameesulting in a catastrophic meltdown .
A Belgian reactor experienced a similar problem in the preceding year (Nuclear reactor safety , 2007) .
Such incidents imply that the potential risks of the Gen II and Gen III reactors cannot be ignored .
The Gen IV reactors can significantly change this risky situation .
Take the VHTR reactor as an example .
In this new design , the fuel pellets used in nuclear reaction are fused in graphite pebbles and coated with ceramic layers which effectively prevent the radioactive materials from leaking .
In other words , no radioactive damage will occur even if there is a meltdown (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , the Gen IV reactors are more reliable than the previous generations .
In order to achieve safer operating environment , government should fund the development of the Gen IV .
reducingthe petrochemicalThough the Generation II and III reactors have been maturely adopted in electricity generation , the drawbacks in their designs largely confine the potential power of nuclear energy .
In order to optimize its power to meet the increasing demand of electricity as well as to maintain long term sustainability , governments should fund the Generation Icomparableinstead of the old generations .
In the 21st century , one of mankind's most pressing problems is the energy crisis .
Fossil fuels , being non-renewable , are being exhausted at a rate faster than it can be replenished .
Hence , in order to solve the energy crisis we need to look for other sources of energy .
Nuclear power is one such example of an energy source .
It is deemed to be much cleaner , greener and more effective than traditional fossil fuels .
This essay will address some issues concerning nuclear generators and other opposing viewpoints .
The main focus will be on a particular Generation-IV reactor , namely the Very-High-Temperature Reactor (VHTR) .
Nuclear power is an important source of energy for the future , hence more funding should be provided for research and development of nuclear reactors .
The third factor that is of concern is costs .
It has been a known fact that nuclear power plants require high-start up costs .
Funds have to be inserted so as to support the high technology machinery and also create a safe environment with proper safety guidelines protecting the reactors .
addition , leaksing licenses have to be bought from the government , so as to ensure safe operation of the nuclear power plants .
Furthermore , in order to fully support our energy needs , a lot more nuclear reactors have to be built around the world (Butler , 2004) .
However , once the basis infrastructure has been laid down , nuclear power turns in to a readily accessible and cheaply rtrue ,erable source of energy (European Physical Society , 2007) .
Hence , it would be able to last us a much longer time compared to fossil fuels .
Furthermore , with 4 of the 6 Generators-IV reactors being able to use reprocessed radioactive waste (Butler , 2004) , it wprocess , no surprise if nuclear power is able to last much longer than we expected .
Hence , it would be logical to support the research and development of nuclear power plants .
expectFinally , the last issue would be on the performanise nuclear reactors .
It is widely known fact that nuclear power is able to produce much more energy compared to traditional fossil fuels .
This is simply due to the nature of nuclear fuel being to produce muchforgy .
Hence , it would be unfair to compare the nuclear generators with traditional powerts .
In this case , comparison should be done between nuclear power plants and those of other renewable sources .
Similarly , nuclear power plants are superior as we can produce nuclear energy constantly whereas basic sources are less predictable .
Furthermore , comparing thintoeration-IV reactors with older nuclear reactors , the new reactors are much more efficient , some of them like the VHTR produce hydrogen at the same time (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , support should be given to develop nuclear power .
The most awaited Tata's Nana car was finally unveiled at the Auto Expo 2008 .
It was a very proud moment for Tata as it was the cheapest car compared to all other cars found around the world (Massey , 2008) .
The target of Tata was to make a car which most of the citizens in India can afford but it came out to be a big talk among car dealers too .
They were very much surprised by the unique design and  amazed by the stunning price .
It just costs about one lakh (Rs 100 ,000) which is US2500 dollars (Darukhanawala , 2009) .
Although it was a surprising package , both positive and negative arguments about the car were presented at the Auto Expo 2008 .
The main issue discussed was  safety .
There were mixed reviews concerning the safety of TaTa's Nano among car dealers .
The big question raised was whether Tata's Nano was safe to drive on normal roads  .
So , my stand as a reviewer is that Tata's Nano lacks safety .
There are three important reasons for my stand .
Secondly , the car lacks safety features .
It is a big surprise that Tata has just neglected some of the most important features like the airbag , parking sensors , fog lamps and traction controls in its design .
Many who bought the car are complaining especially about the safety aspects of the car .
For example , a citizen of India  stated that there are not enough safety features and that the Nano is a very bad design (Gangadharan , 2008) .
The designer of Nano claims that even designs such as a car without lights and doors were considered during the design process .
This really makes everyone feel that Tata's main intention was to make a cheap car and the safety issue was not a big concern for them .
But their argument was that these features were not a necessity on Indian roads (Massey , 2008) .
However , Tata should realise that the car is not only going to be sold in India but  marketed in other countries .
So , if other countries are not willing to purchase the car because  it lacks safety features , then it will be a big loss for Tata .
Thirdly , there are some flaws in the design .
Only one side mirror is found in the design (Daily Mail , 2008) .
Tata should understand that it is not safe with only one side mirror .
Drivers will definitely have difficulties spotting the vehicles which are coming from behind and this may even lead to accidents .
Besides that , the wheels look small .
It seems that it lacks stability .
So , while travelling on slopes or heavy traffic , it could be dangerous .
There are also complains that the car is not comfortable .
The most important thing to be considered when designing a car is comfort .
The more comfortable the driver feels , the more easy he will find it to drive the car .
Thus the journey will be smooth and accidents could be prevented .
So , clearly it seems that there are some features that need to be changed .
To conclude , Tata's Nano needs modification .
It would be better if tougher materials could be used , more safety features  added and some required changes  done to the current design .
These will really improve the safety aspect of the car .
Tata may argue that these will increase the price of the car .
But I strongly feel that those who want to purchase the car will not mind paying a little more if it is going to provide a safer ride on the roads .
A nuclear reactor is an apparatus that produces nuclear energy by performing nuclear reactions ("Nuclear reactor ," 2009) .
The reactor was invented because of the increasing demand for an alternative source of energy that could substitute crude oil .
Nuclear reactors can produce cleaner and higher energy than  crude oil .
However , there is always an intention for the public to reject the idea of using nuclear reactors .
The public is concerned about safety in the operation of nuclear reactors .
The disaster that happened at Chernobyl , Ukraine , in 1986 is one reason of the public's anxiety .
In the disaster , the nuclear reactor exploded and spread the radioactive debris across Europe .
As a result , thirty one people were killed in  disaster (Butler , 2004) .
Nonetheless , a VHTR (Very-High- Temperature Reactor) , which is one of the generation IV reactor concepts , has the technology to prevent the disaster by using helium as its coolant and by producing waste with low radioactivity .
The VHTR can also produce both electricity and hydrogen through a very efficient process , so the cost of running a VHTR will not be as high as other reactors in the long run .
Therefore , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
First of all , opponents argue that helium , which is used as a coolant in the VHTR , could explode because of the high operating temperature and pressure of the reactor .
This argument may arise because of the lack of knowledge about  helium .
Helium is , in fact , an inert gas .
Therefore , helium will not react with any material due to its stability (Youchison , 1987) .
This is also why helium is widely used to fill blimps .
In addition , helium will not become radioactive as other coolants do when they are exposed to radioactive radiation .
Thus , helium is safe to use as a coolant in VHTR .
Thirdly , critics argue that the nuclear reactors are producing radioactive waste and this waste can harm the environment around the reactors .
It is true that the waste that contains high radioactive material , such as , plutonium , can affect the environment severely .
However , the waste of the VHTR is less radioactive than the other reactors .
The VHTR has high thermal efficiency and high fuel burn up .
This is why the concentration of the heavy metal radioactive matter in the VHTR waste is relatively low .
The waste of the VHTR will then go to a repository after being reprocessed and meeting the certain acceptance criteria (Shropshire , 2004) .
In addition , the operation of the VHTR does not depend on  plutonium reprocessing , which is a controversial issue (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , the VHTR waste is much safer than that of the existing nuclear reactors .
To conclude , in spite of claims that nuclear reactors are dangerous and costly , the VHTR with its improved design , can overcome these issues .
The VHTR can produce electricity and hydrogen efficiently in a much safer way without producing hazardous waste .
Hence , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
Mention nuclear power and the general consensus are fear and rejection , and Chernobyl comes to  mind .
Dirty power , they will say , and it is not worth the risk , despite ironically being much cleaner and powerful than the current fossil fuel-guzzling power plants .
However with the formation of the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) and its six new reactor designs , it is hoped that nuclear power can be tapped upon with full consent of the public .
These reactors , still in the designing and testing phase , excel in areas of sustainability , safety , economics and proliferation resistance (Bouchard and Bennett ,2008) , all which are specially intended to address all issues and challenges that nuclear power faces in a world combating the production of greenhouse gases , but in the safest possible way .
The six new reactors  mainly differ only in their choice of coolant used in the system .
VHTR , being a descendant of the Generation II gas-cooled reactor , uses helium gas .
While a tried-and-tested choice , it is puzzling as there are better coolants proposed among the new designs and yet not favoured .
Helium gas is abundant on the Sun's atmosphere but only at trace levels on the Earth's surface (AIR LIQUIDE , 2009) .
Furthermore its common extraction is from fossil fuels , so one can imagine our source of helium when the oil wells eventually run dry .
In addition , helium is not the only coolant that is chemically inert with the fuel; molten lead is another viable option and is plentiful on the Earth's crust .
Last  but not least , gaseous coolants have low thermal transfer properties , hence requiring an intermediate heat exchange with a larger surface area (Chapin , et al 2004) .
The system core temperatures of LFR can reach up to 500 (Idaho National Laboratory , 2005) , almost 50% lower than that of VHTR and present significant differences in the operations of the plants .
Even though thermal efficiency of LFR is lower , 43% compared to up to 50% for VHTR (OECD Nuclear Energy Agency , 2000) , it is offset by offering a higher likelihood of reassurance to the public .
The use of low temperature means LFR can actually be built using the current technology , though some improvements may be needed .
Molten lead , compared to helium , is a superior and cheaper heat transfer medium , hence increasing the portability of the power plant by reducing the need for a large intermediate heat exchanger .
One of the reasons why Very High Temperature Reactor is better for funding is because of its safety factor .
Safety factor is heavily considered because if an accident occurs at nuclear reactor sites , it can result in massive releases of radioactivity .
Therefore in this context , safety design in VHTR has been introduced to take care of all the uncertainties and accidents which might occur with the ultimate goal of protecting the environment and people from being exposed to radiological hazards of potential release from the nuclear power plants .
And it includes the development of passive heat removal systems , low power density and easily cool-able geometry .
Helium is used in the heat removal system as a coolant because it is an inert gas and it will not react chemically with any other material .
VHTR will also be equipped with graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations .
The graphite has tiny pellets of uranium fuel encased in it and they will absorb heat without failing and releasing radioactivity .
As VHTR would be expected to operate at a very high temperature , all these are essential to prevent the reactor from being over-heated .

However , some experts have pointed out that if such high temperature is stimulated within a reactor , a new hardy alloy may be necessary to protect the inside layer of the reactor .
To get those alloys  would already cost millions .
How about the construction cost of the entire power plant which is still unknown  ?
Furthermore , it is easier and cheaper to build other generation four nuclear reactors compared to VHTR .
For instance , for supercritical water-cooled reactor , it is relatively cheaper to build because it uses water as coolant instead of helium in VHTR .
So , the process of handling the phase change of helium to another state is not needed and this kind of simplification can largely reduce the cost .
When the cost is reduced , cheaper electricity can be provided to the public .
But in terms of performance , VHTR is a more efficient concept compared to others in generation four nuclear reactor concepts .
Even though it might prove costly at the beginning  it pays off well as it produces both electricity and hydrogen fuel instead of electricity only .
High temperature processed in the reactor can be used as a condition to yield hydrogen from sulphur-iodine cycle , which is a series of thermo-chemical processes that will fail without a sufficient source of heat .
Hydrogen fuel produced can be used in vehicles as its onboard fuel .
Also , as it is operating at higher temperature , it produces more electricity compared to the rest .
In conclusion , VHTR is a very promising energy system to provide us electricity and hydrogen cogeneration .
Currently , VHTR development is in the early stages .
There are enormous items left to do in order for this concept to succeed in future .
Therefore , more research and development should be carried out so that in future this concept can become the energy supply for everyone on this earth .

The Chernobyl nuclear accident , which occurred on 26 April 1986 , had resulted in massive radioactive fallout into the atmosphere that affected millions of people .
Because of the catastrophic effects of a nuclear accident , no nuclear reactor has been built since then .
However , as global warming is becoming a more pressing issue , we have now turned to nuclear reactors to provide us clean energy .
Which generation IV nuclear reactor we should choose ?
Although some have chosen lead-cooled fast reactor (LFR) over very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) because of the various benefits LFR has over VHTR , there is some evidence that VHTR is much better than LFR .
Supporters of LFR claim that LFR is much safer than VHTR .
One of the main reasons for LFR being safer is LFR , which operates at around 550 degree Celsius , has a lower outlet temperature than VHTR , which operates at around 1000 degree Celsius (Butler .
2004) .
It is believed that the higher the temperature , the greater the risk of a nuclear meltdown .
However , VHTR is designed to work at such a high temperatures .
In VHTR , its graphitic core structure , helium coolant , and coated fuel particles allow VHTR to withstand high temperatures (Chapin al te .
2004) .
Thus , it is able to attain thermal stability .
In short , operating at 1000 degree Celsius is not much of a safety issue since VHTR is safe and reliable at high temperature .

In  terms of the coolant used by the two reactors , VHTR is safer than LFR .
LFR uses lead as its coolant .
Lead is corrosive and may form polonium , which is a radioactive substance , when exposed to radioactivity (Loewen al te .2003) .
Given the presence of the radioactive polonium and the corrosiveness of lead , it is not safe to use lead as a coolant .
On the other hand , VHTR uses helium , which is a chemically inert .
Thus , it reduces the safety hazards which can arise due to the corrosion and the irradiation of the coolant .
Supporters of LFR also maintain that LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
In terms of cost to build the reactor , LFR costs around US$700 million (Neil W . Brown .
2006) while VHTR costs around US$1 .1 billion (Butler .
2004) .
In addition , in terms of the cost of coolant , lead costs around US$0 .24 per 100 grams (MetalPrice .com) while helium costs around US$5 .20 per 100 grams .
In terms of these two factors , LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
However , there are other factors that will also affect the cost of operating the reactor , such as maintenance costs .
For instance , since VHTR is specially designed to operate under a very high temperature , it will produce hydrogen , which is a source of clean fuel .
The economic production of hydrogen (H2) by thermochemical cycles ,  can reduce the maintenance cost for operating the VHTR .
The final argument advanced by the supporters of LFR is LFR performs much better than VHTR .
Unlike VHTR , LFR will reprocess its nuclear waste .
Thus , LFR can use the nuclear reactant to its maximum before disposing it .
However , recycling of nuclear waste will result in the production of plutonium , which can be used for nuclear weapons (Butler .
2004) .
In fact , United State has refrained from reprocessing of nuclear waste .
Hence , recycling of nuclear waste is not safe in terms of security .
In addition , VHTR is more efficient than LFR .
It is because the higher the outlet temperature , the greater  the efficiency of electrical generation .
As VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , there is an efficient conversion of energy from heat to electricity .
From data , for the same amount of fuel , VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity compared to conventional plants (Chapin al te .
2004) .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen fuel that can be used to produce electrical energy .
VHTR generates electrical energy in two ways , from the nuclear reactant directly and from hydrogen fuel .
In conclusion , VHTR is safe because it is designed to attain thermal stability and it uses an inert coolant , which is helium .
In addition , it is cost effective because of its economic production of hydrogen .
Furthermore , it is also efficient because it is operating at a very high temperature .
Hence , it should be evident that VHTR works better than LFR in terms of security , cost and performance .
Since VHTR is one of the better options among the generation IV nuclear reactors and it is feasible , we should invest in and support  further research and development on VHTR .

But as the environment issues becomes a high-profile problems and under the situation that this kind of non-renewable resource will be ran out in the near future , people begin to seek some other methods that can support the world as before .
Nuclear energy is one of the most promising energies which can take the place of fossil fuel .
Nuclear is now widely used in many countries and plays a more and more important role in the 21th century .
Recently , according to survey nuclear power produces around 11% of the world's energy needs and could take more proportion in the future .

In addition , hydrogen is not the only by product , heat and electricity will also be generated during the nuclear processing .
The heat will be transferred to relevant nuclear reactions .
The electricity , of course , will be used as electric power , supplying to the society .
Base on the information form DISCOVER: The VHTR should produce electricity about 40 percent more efficiently than do most reactors in the United States(New Tech Could Make Nuclear the Best Weapon Against Climate Change , Elizabeth Svoboda) .
Then we can conclude that actually the production of electricity is also very large indeed .
In term of safety , firstly , the design takes advantage of the inherent safety characteristics of a helium-cooled .
Helium should be very stable and inert even under high temperature condition , so this kind of inert gas can protect the system during the refrigeration processing .
Secondly , the graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations can reduce the risk of using VHTR .
Numerous tests and calculations have shown that it is virtually impossible for the this kind of graphite become unstable , self-sustained combustion or incurring ignition will not happen during the process .
Thirdly , the VHTR has a safety characteristic of low decay heat .
That means low system pressure and low thermal energy will store in the core with low power density and easily cool geometry , then decay heat will be dissipated passively by conduction and radiation even under the most severe accident conditions .( . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .)
So the damage of the decay heat will less serious .
The security of VHTR can be guaranteed , because of these three features that protect the system form collapsing .
After more than 20 years of evolution , medical robots have becomee one of the great inventions in this  technology driven world .
In the past , medical robots helped the surgeons to diagnose the patients' internal organs and perform minor surgerys .
But in recent years , due to the technology advancement on the medical robots , prototypes of these robots surgery systems are now able to perform more precise , accurate and complicated surgery , such as reaching for untouchable tissue on the patients with the surgeons controlling them remotely .
Moreover , the surgeons are able to reduce their stress levels while performing surgery and the robotic surgery systems are able to maintain the stability of their arms for long hours of surgery .
However , there are many issues revolving around the use of the robotics surgery system compared to traditional human operated surgery 
The first issue is that the public is concerned that robotic surgery will be expensive . .
This is the first thought that appears in their mind when they heard of such surgery for the first time .
However , this is true for medical fees , especially surgery , and it is even more expensive when compared with traditional methods .
This may be the only disadvantage that the patients are going to have but there are lots of advantages for them if they are willing to use medical robots to perform surgery .
"Patients experience less trauma , blood loss , risk of infection , scarring and pain .
Hospital stays are also generally shorter ."
This is quoted from one article by Debra S . from Reuters .
Another article from Newsweek , reported by Jennifer B . mentioned , "Forbes was walking within hours of his surgery and was discharged the next day .
By midweek he was walking three miles daily .
In 10 days he was back at work .
After three weeks he was playing golf again ."
From these , we can see that patients are definitely benefiting in many ways especially when the they are able to go back to their normal daily life within a  shorter recovery time .
The public is also concerned about the safety and reliability of the robotic surgery system , for example , the system breaking down in the process of surgery .
They are worried if this would have happen to them during surgery .
However , the public can rest assured on this matter because the hospitals have always been doing maintenance of the robotic systems .
As a matter of fact , this is the biggest downside for having a robotic system in the hospitals .
An article in The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists mentioned "The system costs hospitals about $1 .6 million and requires an annual $100 ,000 maintenance contract , according to Dr .
Advincula ."
"Da Vinci system costs $ 1 .4 million and annual maintenance costs of $ 100 ,000 with a lifespan of five years ."
Another article added .
This shows that the hospitals always have engineers around to maintain the robotic systems regularly to prevent any failure from happening .
The last issue of public concern is  that the surgeons are not well trained in controlling the robotic surgery systems .
This is a valid concern as the patients are placing their lives in the surgeons' hands .
However , the public , especially the patients , do not need to worry about this issue , as there is a robotic surgery training center  in Singapore to train the surgeons .
The surgeons are responsible for proper training and follow training standards for using the equipment .
The surgeons are encouraged to have more practices before operating on the patients .
"The more you do , the better you're going to get , said Dr Kevin Zorn" 
In brief , with the advancement of medical technologies , the robotic surgery systems  definitely benefit both the patients and the surgeons .
While the patients are able to recover quickly and return to their normal lifestyle , the surgeons are able to perform more surgery as they spend less time on each patient and requireless manpower in the operating theater .
In my opinion ,  robotic surgery systems help to extend the lifespan of one human being .
Therefore , the public should not fear  the robotic surgery and should have confidencet and trust  the surgeons and the technologies they are using .
The industry of the nuclear power is reviving in the 21st century .
In 2001 , the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) came up with six new concepts for generation IV reactors .
Among these , a concept called "Very-high-temperature reactors" (VHTR) was widely accepted and respected .
However , the accidents of reactor meltdown and explosion that happened in the past makes the public worried about the safe operation of the nuclear reactors .
Chernobyl disaster is a classic example which happened in 1986 at Chernobyl in Ukraine .
The nuclear reactor core exploded and killed more than 30 people immediately and also spoiled the environment from then on (Grigori , 1989) .
Whether it is necessary for the further research and development funding for VHTR therefore becomes a big issue that is being widely discussed .
A number of oppositions are aroused to stop the funding for the six generation IV reactor concepts because of not only the security risk but the inefficiency and the great cost as well .
Despite such concerns and queries , however , the new concept of VHTR does reach the public's requirement in terms of safety , efficiency and cost , and the further research and development funding for it is definitely needed for resolving the energy crisis and also developing new materials and techniques .
meetwere raisedhas becomeThe nuclear power industryVHTR cannot ensure safety .
They probably assume that all nuclear reactors must have great possibility to cause disasters .
However , this is not the fact .
The VHTR concept makes use of a helium-cooled , graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations (Futterer , 2006) .
As it is well-known , the helium , which is used for coolimadeas inherent safety characteristics to enhance the security of the whole reactor system .
Thus , it largely reduces the possibility to cause explosion or other accidents .
The VHTR system , if successful , will prevent most accidents to occur .
Finally , many people are worried about the high cost of establishing such kinds of the VHTR systems .
This may be true , but the value the VHTR system can raise and the benefit it will obtain cannot be ignored .
Firstly , the VHTR system can largely contribute to easing the energy throughis that is widely spread all over the world , which could save a large amount of financial budgets .
As Butler (2004) mentioned , the very high temperature reactors can be used to sp hydrogen from water thermochemically , which can meet the need for hydrogen fuel of the future .
As the energy crisis becomes worse , the energy demand will cause US nation's oil imports by 78% without a proper method to convert water into hydrogen .
Therefore , the VHTR system has the positive potential of reducing the rising rate of the oil fuel and resolving the problem of the energy shortage .
In addition , the VHTR system has a perfect design for the waste recycling .
The fuel used in the VHTR system is uranium dioxide or uranium carbide pellets called TRISO fuel .
It is difficult to remove the product because the pellets are durable , and this design discourages weapon proliferation , which makes the waste easy to concentrate and recycle .
(Stanley , 2007) According to the figure given in Butler's journal , the VHTR system produces no waste because it goes directly to repository .
Hence , such a design for the waste recycling can reduce the cost for the waste processing .
Furthermore , a number of researches are needed to develop the VHTR system , including new materials such as heat resistance , and new techniques such as temperature control .
Once these researches have been done , it is not only the VHTR system will benefit , but also many other industries .
Therefore , the great value and benefit from developing the concept of VHTR is far more than the high cost it requires .
It is necessary for the further research and development funding for VHTR .
The first generation of nuclear reactors was built in 1950 .
Since then , continuous researches has been done to produce a better generation of nuclear reactors .
There are 436 active nuclear power plants in the world and 53 nuclear power plants are under construction .
Nuclear power plants represent more than 70 percent of our non-carbon generated electricity and consist of 17% of our world total energies consumption .
The benefits and usages of nuclear power plants are undeniable .
Nuclear power plants have been widely deployed in many leading countries in the world such as United States , Japan , and China which use the nuclear power plants as one of their main power sources to propel the energy industry .
The usage of the nuclear power plants is widely recognized and they are being integrated as part of those countries' promising energy sources .
Nuclear energy is the most concentrated source in terms of energy generation .
One kilogram of uranium can release the same amount of energy as that released by 2400 tons of standard coal .
It is a good alternative energy source which not only reduces the greenhouse effect ,but also helps solve the problems of limited fossil fuels .
For countries with limited natural resources , nuclear power plants serve as a dependable energy source .
According to the report from GIF (Generation IV International Forum) , tripling the number of nuclear power plants worldwide to 1000 plants could avoid the production of 1 billion tons of carbon emission per year by 2055 .
Nuclear power  is deemed to be a promising energy source for the future .
However , the nuclear leak incidents which  happened in the past few decades in countries such as Three Miles Island , Pennsylvania , Chernobyl in Ukraine , and Bhopal in India have posed doubts on the reliability of the nuclear reactors .
"It is unlikely that we can meet our aggressive climate goals if we eliminate nuclear power as an option .
However , before an expansion of nuclear power can be considered , key issues must be addressed including: security of nuclear fuel and waste , waste storage , and proliferation ."
Obama said in his energy plan that addressing certain key issues are needed before deciding to build more nuclear plants .
In response to this , the creation of the Generation IV International Forum (GIF) came into being .
It is an organization formed by 9 leading countries in the world: Canada , China , Euratom  , France , Japan , Republic of Korea , South Africa , Switzerland , and United States .
The organization tries to resolve security issues posed by the current nuclear reactors .
100 international experts from GIF and other world leading nuclear power plant research centers have gathered together to find the most promising nuclear systems .
This led to the proposals of the six Generation IV Systems which offer the most promising performance , in terms of sustainability , proliferation resistance and physical protection , safety and reliability , and cost .
The six Generation IV Systems are being designed to counter the problems faced by the current nuclear reactors .
These state-of-the-art nuclear reactors will be able to minimize nuclear wastes and reduce the long-term stewardship burden posed by traditional nuclear reactors .
They have integrated safety design and back-up systems to prevent accidents due to human errors and carelessness , therefore reducing the likelihood and degree of vector core damage .
Besides that , the new designs will have a much better life-cycle cost advantage over other energy sources .
The most important thing is that , they will not be an attractive route for diversion or theft of weapon-usable materials .
The physical protection of the new nuclear reactors will also prevent  acts of terrorism .
The six Generation IV Reactor are revolutionary designs of nuclear reactors .
Out of the six proposals  in the Generation IV Reactor , Very- High-Temperature Reactors (VHTR) stands out for its potential capability to achieve an excellent thermal performance .
This is the only reactor that is researched by all the partner countries in GIF .
It is technically realizable and technologically well established by vendors and national laboratories .
The great breakthrough in the research also suggests that the VHTR does not require intermediate refueling , therefore eliminating the likelihood of accidents .
The reactor operates by using a high temperature exchanger and electrical heater to avoid efficiency penalty and  enable the generation of electricity and hydrogen at the same time .
It iss also known that the ultra-long life VHTR systems can be developed with the use of minor actinides (MA) .
The Generation IV Reactor will be established after 2030 .
With today's high demand of energy sources , one can say that nuclear energy is an inevitable energy source of the future  .
Many people mistakenly equate nuclear power to nuclear weapons although , in fact , they are in basically different categories .
Nuclear power , for a long time , has been one of the most useful inventions that served the people .
The Generation IV International Forum , which was attended by  the ten nations specialising in nuclear power ,  introduced the six new reactor concepts ("Nuclear power's new dawn ," 2004) .
One of them , the Molten Salt Reactor , has a prospective application though there are several objections with respect to safety , cost and performance .
The first opinion that opposes the building of nuclear plants is the people's fear of danger .
Some think that nuclear plants emit radioactive waste into the environment , which may cause both pollution and genetic mutation; others are afraid of the safety system , meaning the plants might explode easily .
These thoughts are due to the history of some nuclear accidents , for example , the meltdown of a nuclear plant at Three Miles Island in Pennsylvania .
However , nuclear power as well as the new Molten Salt Reactor system , in fact , is safer and useful .
According to Declan Butler (2004) , the Molten Salt Reactor system mainly uses fluoride salts , which also belong to heat-and corrosion-resistant materials , as coolant , which can operate for a very long time and is also  safe and reliable .
The salts can keep the reactor's temperature at around 700 oC , which is acceptable in comparison with the others .
One advanced benefit from this system is its low pressure so that the reactor wall can handle good protection .
Another advantage of nuclear power is its green emission .
Current nuclear plants (known as Generation III) and also future ones emit only hot steam while other electricity producers like coal plants pollute the environment with CO2 and SO2 .
In short , the Molten Salt Reactor system is safe to operate and friendly to the environment .
Some people relate nuclear plants to buildings for research rather than for producing electricity , and the cost for producing is high .
In fact , among other Generation IV Reactors as well as electricity generators , the Molten Salt Reactor seems to be the cheapest way to produce electricity  .
This is because the coolant (molten salts) is cheap and recyclable .
Molten salts can be easily found in nature , and the purification technology used for them is simple and less costly than , for instance , lead-bismuth , sodium and helium .
Osman Kemal Kadiroglu (2006) noted that the cost for the same amount of power produced by nuclear plants is cheaper than any other power generation technologies .
He compared them in terms of the availability to build , cost to produce power and area of land occupied .
For example , the cost (in US dollars for fuel used per Megawatt-hour energy is $5 for nuclear and $11 for coal plants ("The Virtual Nuclear Tourist ," 2005) .
A nuclear plant can be built anywhere , which does not require natural resources .
Other sources of energy need natural resources to operate: swift water flow for dams , strong blast for wind turbines , sun beam for solar panels .
Hence , their availability to build up is limited .
Besides , land used for a nuclear plant is less than other alternatives .
Solar or wind power need a lot of land to produce the same amount of energy .
In conclusion , nuclear power is safe , clean and effective , which most  people seem to forget .
With the cheap , safe , recyclable , low pressure , having-additional-produce and high performance properties of the Molten Salt Reactor system , it is one of the most potential electricity generators for the future .

One of the Achilles' heels of nuclear power plants is the dangers of radioactive radiation leakage to the environment .
Areas around such power plants become environmentally hostile to human and wildlife health .
Unfortunately for nuclear power plants , the Chernobyl nuclear incident has convinced the public to not support nuclear plants .
However , the government is pushing for a new generation IV technology that is safer and ensures that the Chernobyl event does not happen again .
Generation IV nuclear reactor plants promises higher redundancy , higher efficiency , better safety features than its predecessors .
The main objective in this new technological research is to search for cost effective and sustainable solutions to nuclear power (Hejzlar ,2005) .
In this essay , we shall discuss the advantage of Lead cooled Fast Reactor (LFR) over Sodium cooled Fast Reactor (SFR) on the aspects of safety , cost and performance .
IThe LFR has better safety features compared to SFR .
The eldangerodium has a low boiling point of 1156 Kelvins , compared to lead's higher 2023 Kelvins , which is dangerous it becomes overheated and starts to boils(Hejzlar , 2009) .
In the event of an unprotected total loss of power , the LFR's core is able to passively quickly cool down , due to its low pressure drop and simple coolant design (Tucek , 2005) .
Compared to the SFR , it has a high pressure drop and thus its temperature would increase dangerously beyond its bpromiseoint .
Additional safety devices have toand betterplemented (Hejzlar , 2009) .
On another note , the low reactivity and inertia of lead allows safe removal of fuel if the fuel rod pins fail during installation .
On the other hand , lead can become radioactive and therefore harmful to life during refueling when the Kelvin exposed .
While research is beingKelvino control the lead's because itdioactivity , it is assuring that rboiling is done every 8 years in large plants and every 15 years in smaller plants .
The risk of radioactive leakage is therefore minimal over its span of usage .
Cost has become a very important criterion in the world today; in this case , the LFR fits the bill very well .
Considering the economics of scale , the cost of building materials such as steel and concrete will increase significantly , hence the size of nuclear plant has become a consideration .
The LFR's smaller core and lesser required cooling systems , such as the omission of an intermediate cooling link , saves significant building costs as compared to SFR .
In fact , the lead/bismuth-cooled SVBR-75/100 is the cheapest to build amongst other types of fast reactors .
(Hejzlar , 2009) Furthermore , it costs less per kWh of electricity compared to SFR .
Another strong advantage is the scalability of LFR that allows it to be used in developing and hard to reach places , for instance , Africa .
(Tucek , 2005)

Also , the SFR is projected to launch 10 years earlier than LFR .
For the time being , LFR has the advantage of having to cost less today .

atis thereforeAll in all , the overwhelming advantages of LFR as a future implementation of the new generation IV nuclear plant , proves that it is better than the SFR in all of the above aspects .
Therefore , we should push for development of LFR nuclear power plants .
According to statistics provided by the World Coal Institute , the remaining coal and natural gases reserves will only be able to last us for around 122 years and 42 years respectively .
Due to vast development and urbanization in both developed and developing nations , these resources are rapidly depleted to generate electricity in power plants .
Hence , to meet the world's energy needs , scientists are re-addressing the potential benefits of harnessing power through nuclear reaction , in which uranium is split to release energy .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) based its operations on the concept of generating electricity through such a process .
As a result of operating at a very high temperature , 900 degree Celsius , the VHTR functions at 50% higher thermal efficiency which allows it to generate more electricity .
Moreover , the processed heat that the nuclear reactor produces can also be used in other industrial areas such as hydrogen production , water desalination and the treatment of crude oil (Jacques , 2008) .
Despite the apparent benefits from harnessing energy through VHTR , the public continues to harbor doubts over the reliability and effectiveness of this technology .
Environmentalists claim that green energy such as solar , wind and hydro energy are the trusted technologies which we should focus our research and funds on in meeting the increasing energy needs .
While it is understandable that such technologies are everlasting , cheap and clean to adopt as resources used are free and renewable and the processes do not emit any harmful materials into the environment , we notice that these technologies cannot be readily implemented throughout the world .
This is because they rely heavily on weather conditions which vary drastically according to location and time or may be even unpredictable at times .
On the other hand , with its simple design and high efficiency , it is fairly cheap to build and operate the VHTR .
The VHTR can be built anywhere on an empty plot of land .
The fact that uranium is also widely available in ample supply is in contrast to the trend of the rapidly depleting coal and natural gases reserves .
Henceforth , nuclear power has limitless potentials for us to look into and the cost of its usage is fairly cheap .
To conclude , nuclear energy is relatively cheap , environmentally and socially responsible , and safe to use .
Most of the participating nations and organizations of the Generation IV International Forum are supportive of this new technology and they have pooled US$500 million over the next 5 years to fund its further research and development (Jacques , 2009) .
It is imperative for us to accept and embrace this new form of technology in order to meet the world's increasing energy demand .
An accident is often an unintended action which results in vast effects .
One example will be the Chernobyl disaster which occurred in 1986 during a non-routine operation .
There was a sequence of events that caused the explosion of reactor number 4 that led to the release of radioactive fission products to the atmosphere .
This resulted in many deaths , including those who died from the accident , those firefighters and majority who were exposed to radiation .
(Chernobyl .info) There were a number of reports published that summarized this accident , concluding that the sequence of events was due to human error and design faults .
There are arguments that the lack of knowledge of the operators and the technical failure of equipment could not be solved with the application of psychology .
However , it seems otherwise since psychology is a study of the human mind or behavior .
This incident occurred during a non-routine operation to test the ability of the turbine , in times of power failure , to produce sufficient power .
For that , all backup systems were switched off to avoid disturbance .
One main factor that resulted in the explosion was the activating of the emergency button by operators .
The operators were inadequately trained .
They did not know that with the activation of the button , there will be a sudden surge of power before dropping reactivity .
It is thus argued that psychology may not be helpful in this case as the behavior of the operators is beyond the control of the design engineers .
Even so , many still think that psychology may not come in handy in preventing accidents  , especially when it is due to technical faults .
In the Chernobyl case , the positive coefficient of the reactor is one major technical fault .
This characteristic will cause reactors to be unstable at low power levels .
It was due to the instability of the reactor that there was this rapid power increment resulting in explosions .
(Engineering .com) Despite this dangerous feature , engineers still chose this type of reactor as they deemed it as the best choice .
Another fatal technical fault was the chosen design of the control rods .
These control rods will cause a sudden surge in power before reducing reactivity .
It was thus argued that psychology is not useful as engineers were aware of the consequences but there was no better solution .
While it may be true that there was no better choice with the level of technology then , the engineers could have improved the designs .
According to Wolfgang Botsch , a similar error with the positive coefficient of the reactor had already occurred in Lithuania in 1983 .
However , sadly , this experience was not passed down to the design crew of Chernobyl .
Therefore , it is not right to say that the reactor was the best choice to be used in the plant .
If they had adopted the use of psychology , they might have reviewed safety records of that type of reactor in the industry before deciding on it .
Furthermore , the typical approach by the engineers to find solutions often starts with a fixed plan with the application of their knowledge .
However , in this process , there may be partial failures in the system which the engineers failed to identify and were thus unable to improve safety of the system .
Therefore , a systematic thinking is recommended , where engineers constantly analyze their own approach and decisions so as to take corrective action to improve the safety of the whole system .
By doing so , we are adopting the path of feedforward control of safety .
This is preferred to making corrections only after an accident has occurred .
It will be too late .
This evaluation is also part of psychology application , where the mistakes from the engineers are reduced as much as possible to safeguard the complex high hazard system .
(Wilpert .B , 2007)
It should be evident that psychology plays a huge role in the design process in order to ensure the safety of the system .
A serious disaster is usually caused by a series of events such as the case with Chernobyl .
After the incident , corrective actions are done but these are feedback controls of safety .
The path of feed forward control of safety should be adopted instead .
This emphasizes much on the use of psychology in the design process .
Engineers should anticipate the end users' behavior , reducing the complexity of the system while implementing safety measures .
With that , the disaster could have been prevented .
Men have always wanted to fly freely since the realization of aeroplane , therefore , being able to travel great distances with freedom of route and comfort has since been the aim of the transportation industry .
Back in 1940 , Henry Ford , chairman of Ford Motor Company , said , "Mark my words , a combination airplane and motor is coming .
You may smile , but it will come .
"(Moller , 2008) In year 2008 , the prototype of Skycar , priced at over US$3million , was invented and put on sale via the auction site , eBay(Techchee , 2007) .
Its developer , Moller International regarded the invention as the future of transport .
Being able to take-off and land vertically with very little noise , it soon attracted the attention of not just the US Army but also rich businessmen who can rely on it to travel to different places at ease(Yahoo , 2009) .

Although the designers modified the airfoil at the expense of rising it's cost , if the vehicle were to be less stable , will the consumer still be interested in the product ?
From various examples and historical facts , we can safely say that most consumers will not purchase a producty features that are up to standard .
Therefore , where design safety is concerned , it is of the utmost importance .

In near future , we should be able to purchase one at the price of a regular car .
The rapid development of countries and expansion of population have created a world that is increasingly unable to meet the demand of energy .Additionally , fossil fuel is criticized as the main contributing factor for green house gas effect .
As such , there is a pressing need to search for alternative renewable forms and energy which is comparatively more eco-friendly and highly effective .
In such a context , nuclear energy created by using the Generation IV (Gen IV) reactor is able to replace  fossil fuel , which is believed to be the main cause of global warming .
One such reactor is the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) which can "supply electricity and process heat to a broad spectrum of high-temperature and energy-intensive processes"  .
Some may argue , with skepticism , that the safety issues of this reactor are still imminent and hence , nuclear power should not be supported .
However , in my opinion , on the whole , the benefits gained from VHTR will far exceed the problems created .
Some skeptics feel that the building of VHTR is a risky investment , complaining that VHTR is an expensive source of energy , hence unfeasible .
Yet , although the fixed cost of building is high , it is myopic to merely look at the short run cost while neglecting the long run benefit .
Due to low maintenance , the fixed cost would be lower in the near future  .
Zheng L . reported that China is planning to install nuclear power capacity of 86 gigawatts by 2020 , up nearly 10 fold from the capactity it had by the end of 2008 .
The fact that China , one the world largest consumers of energy , is willing to spend high proportion of money for this project shows the  long run benefit that nuclear power can bring about , especially since the Chinese government has been always very pragmatic .
The final argument advanced by the opponent is that while high temperature makes electricity and hydrogen production easier , it also poses a threat of explosion .
For example , two incidents-an accident in 1979 in which the reactor core lost coolant and partially melted , and the 1986 catastrophe in which a reactor exploded and released radioactivity into the atmosphere(Sandra M) greatly increased concerns about the safety of nuclear power .
Yet , VHTR is actually still safe and reliable to operate , with improved accident management and mitigation and reduced off-side response with little human intervention .
Last but not least , some will question why helium with low thermal conductivity is chosen as its coolant given that some other coolant , for instance molten salt , allows better electric conversion efficiency than a helium-cooled VHTR operating at similar conditions .
However , the selection of coolant is based on many factors .
First , "helium gas provides a nonreacting cooling medium with a low nuclear cross section that can either directly drive a turbine for power production , or can be directed to process" (Gen IV) .
Second , VHTR uses helium as a coolant for safety purposes .
Helium is an inert gas , so it will not chemically react with any material , and exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , unlike most other possible coolants .
Balancing all these factors , Helium is still the overall best coolant .
Hence , this selection proves the safeness of VHTR .
Thomas Malthus , a famous demographer , published a theory that population growth will eventually outstrip resources .
Hence , the research for alternative energy is necessary .
Although there is certain undenied limitation of VHTR , I am strongly convinced that with the current technology advances , the limitation will be solved .
With more funds channeled into research into  this  area , the potential of VHTR could be maximized .
The most common method of power generation for close to 150 years requires the burning of fossil fuels such as oil or coal .
However , the byproducts from the burning of fossil fuels , greenhouse and acidic gases , have caused much devastation to our planet .
Perhaps a solution to save our planet will be to use a cleaner energy source -- nuclear power which does not emit any harmful gases .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is a Gen IV reactor that shows great promise and potential .
However , detractors of nuclear power cited the risk of another catastrophic accident , the proliferation of nuclear arms , the lower thermal efficiency of nuclear plants and the high cost of building a plant .
This article will attempt to justify the merits of funding further research on VHTR through refuting the detractors' claims in terms of safety , performance and cost .
Thesis Statement
Moreover , detractors have argued that the high temperature generated in nuclear reactors is not fully utilized anconventional non-nuclear energy generation methods have better perfohavence in terms of theraboutl efficiency .TS ERecently ,r plants have thermal efficiency of approximately 33% (Olander , 2009) compared to 70% and above forr non-nuclear power plants .
Firstly , the VHTR operates at close to 1000 C compared tproducing nuclear00  C in current nuclear reactors .
This higher temperature translates to the extraction of 50% more energy from the same amount of fuel (Butler , 2004) .
Improved engineering and design will further increase the thermal efficiency of the power plant in the future .
Secondly , although the thermal efficiency of nuclear plants is lower , the actual amount of power generated per unit mass of fuel is actually much higher than that of fossil fuels .
Hence the method of using thermal efficiency for comparison is not practical .
Lastly , because of the higher temperature , it is possible to produce hydrogen gas from water thermochemically (Elder and Allen , 2009) .
There is a demand for hydrogen gas which may become a fuel for cars in the future .
Therefore , the VHTR design is superior as it produces more energy and hydrogen gas
Another objection is raised by the taxpayers; they are not convinced with the heavy investment of building a nuclear plant .TS A nuclear plant costs on average , a billion dollars and is designed with a lifespan of sixty yes (Butler , 2004) .
Although the price is high , the nuclear plant will not produce any greenhouse or acidic gases .
Acid rain had caused deforestation and affected fisheries , the damages amounts to millions per year .
Global warming has been linked to the more frequent occurrence of natural disasters .
These disasters created uncountable losses in terms of damage to infrastructure , economy and lives .
In rebuttal to the "limited lifespan" of the nuclear plant , in sixty years , this nuclear plant will have produced much cheaper electricity and caused less harm to the environment .
These two advantages are definitely significant .
On March 27 , 1977 , the world's worst aviation accident happened in Tenerife , a Spanish island .
Due to the previous terrorism attack at another airport , excessive planes were diverted to the Tenerife airport .
The collision involved two Boeing 747s , KLM and Pan Am; KLM took off while Pan Am was still on the runway .
Many factors such as foggy weather contributed to the accident; however , the most significant causes are considered to be the ambiguous phraseology in the comment "We are uh taking off" or "We are at takeoff" from KLM and the single channel radio which made the crucial readback for clearance lost in radio squelch (Kilroy , n .d .) .
The accident happened mainly due to the KLM pilot's taking off without clearance (Kilroy , n .d .) .
Proponents may argue that with the input of psychology , the designers of the airport should have anticipated such possible dangers and stricter laws to insist on proper phraseology and check for clearance should have been put into use .
Granted , emphasis on proper phraseology might have improved the situation .
However , since the staff were working in a stressful environment , it is highly likely that they would have used improper phraseology subconsciously .
According to Karl Weick , professor of psychology at the University of Michigan , people tend to depend on what they are first taught and use most frequently under pressure .
Applied to Tenerife , the captain was a training pilot who was most familiar with the ambiguous word "takeoff" and the controller was Spanish who spoke with a strong accent (Weick , 1993) .
Hence miscommunication could still happen , having the tense situation of Tenerife in mind .
Moreover , even with the relatively stricter rules implemented after the accident , miscommunication still causes accidents such as the Garuda A300 Airbus crash in Sumatra (McMillan , 1998) .
For takeoff regulation , it is the first officer's responsibility to obtain ATC clearance and oversee the captain .
However , the first officer on KLM misunderstood the controller .
What is worse , the KLM captain wanted to take off without ATC clearance , and then took off before readback was completed after the suspension of his decision by the first officer to ask for clearance .
In addition , when the flight engineer doubted the clearance of the Pan Am on the taxiway , both the captain and the first officer ignored his query (ALPA (Air Line Pilots Association) , n .d .) .
With such poor cooperation between the aviators , the use of psychology might still have failed .
Other than human errors , the Tenerife accident is also a combination of various accidental factors .
Firstly , the terrorism attack was difficult to predict .
For the technical part , the centerline lights were out of operation which diimposed stricterhe two planes from seeing each other; the single channel radio made the response inaudible and there was no ground radar (ALPA , n .d .) .
Besides , the thick fog formed worsened the situation .
The adoption of psychology in design might have taken a few of the factors into consideration , but it was unlikely to have anticipated al and hence there would still be potential hazards .
Furthermore , the terrorism attack would reduce the effectiveness of improvements in equipment .
The airport was so crowded that the normal routines were blocked (Weick , 1993) .
With the combination of the fact that the controllers were bad at English and unfamiliar with handling Boeing 747s (Weick , 1993) , there was a high chance that accident would happen even with contingency plans .
In fact , the Pan Am was told to turn at exit C-3 which was impossible for a 747 so the captain decided to turn at C-4 and collided with KLM between C-3 and C-4 exits (ALPA , n .d .) .
Human beings have come across severe energy problems in the 21 century .
Scientists have put in a lot effort to the development in nuclear energy which is one of the major modern energy resources nowadays .
Nuclear energy is the kind of energy released by the splitting or merging together of the nuclei of atoms .
It is one of the clean and renewable energy which can help us solve the emergent problems of energy shortage .
However , some accidents during the decades of the use of nuclear energy resulted in many people worrying about their safety with nuclear energy around them .
For example , on April 26th 1986 , the leak and explosion in the nuclear power plants of Chernobyl (Butler , 2004) .
There are still many problems remaining .
But from my point of view , I believe nuclear energy can make much more benefits than the lost .
Hence we should pay great attention to and make rational use of nuclear energy .
The first reason some people are afraid of nuclear energy is because they cannot get rid of the influof effortfintoccidents like Chernobyl and Three Mile Island (Butler , 2004) .
But , something they mayclear about is in the half century of Nuclear Age , only about one or two deaths per year are attributed by nuclear energy accidents .
Compared withenergy sources the number of coal mine accidents deaths is much largerit reaches 7530 per year .
Besides that , nuclear power plants are safer than coal mines due to the reason that designers and engineers use the high-tech in buildinthen , for example ,lant and there are strict rules of operation .
So it is easier to guarantee the safety of nuclear power plants because if workers follow the regulations , no accidents will be caused .
Comparatively spebringg , many illegal coal minethoseith simple and crude facilities are still running underground .
It is the real hazard trouble .
And consider with one of the six generation IV reactor (A Technology Roadmaop , 2002) , lead-cooled fast reactors; scientists are trying to use lead-bismuth as new coolant .
It can keep nuclear reactor operating under lower temperature and pressure .
Thus it will make the nuclear core even safer .
From the above reasons , we can see that nuclear energy is not as dangerous as people expect , contrarily , it is one of the safest energy humans being can use in modern society .
the governmentand couldIn conclusion , nuclear energy is not dangerous to human being so thawasteshould make full use of nuclear energy to benefit the whole preventingnd .
It is said that the world's population will expand from the current 6 billion to around 10 billion by the year 2050 (GIF , 2002) , which will push us into an even more serious energy shortage position unless we successfully find new kinds of energy as soon as possible .
In fact , human beings have been seeking for the solution to energy issues for a long time .
So far we have already developed solar energy , wind energy , nuclear energy and many others .
However , none of these can be the ideal energy to us now due to the technological problems , economic concerns , or potential dangers .
Among all these new kinds of energy , nuclear energy is regarded as the most controversial one which has been the hotspot since its appearance .
Whether to develop and promote the use of nuclear energy has triggered firm discussion among both experts and common people .
In my opinion , we should give more support to nuclear development because of its high efficiency , none-greenhouse-gas emission and its valuable by-products during the reaction .
Some opponents may argue that other kinds of energy can also be environmentally friendly , such as solar energy and wind force .
There is no need to spend so much on nuclear energy development .
However , in terms of efficiency and economic value , nuclear energy has great advantages over both solar energy and wind force .
The Generation reactors are expected to increase the efficiency of electricity production to as high as 50% while the efficiency of solar energy is no more than 40% in the lab (U .S . Department of Energy , 2006) which means its actual efficiency of industrial application will be even lower .
Besides this , in the process of nuclear reaction , a large amount of hydrogen can be generated for the use in petroleum refinement and also as new advanced fuel in transportation (Vilim , 2007) .
It is said that for America , the energy demand of transport alone will cause increase of oil imports by 78% by the end of 2025 if it does not switch its dependence on oil to hydrogen (Butler , 2004) .
So the Very-High-Temperature-Reactor (VHTR) is believed to play an important role in America's energy crisis , because it can help to reduce the dependence on oil for its over 2 million normal cubic meters hydrogen production per day .
Though solar energy and wind force can also contribute to environment protection , nuclear energy indeed has its unique advantages which they cannot rival  .
R . B . Vilim (2007) .
{Interface Design Studies for the Production of Hydrogen Using the VHTR Coupled to the HTSE Process}[HYPERLINK: http://www .inspi .ufl .edu/icapp07/program/abstracts/7529 .pdf] .
2007 International Congress on Advances in Nuclear Power Plants (ICAPP 2007) .
Apart from this , opponents may be worried that the nuclear reactors would become the target of terrorists because of disastrous consequences after its ruin .
However , the new advanced feature of VHTR can effectively protect itself from the damage of terrorists .
Normally , the terrorists attempt to make an accident by shutting off the coolant or power supply of the system .
But they will not expect that the meltdown proof in VHTR can cool itself down when accidents happen and minimize the interaction with human beings (Butler , 2004) .
So , nuclear reactor would not be a desirable target for terrorists any more .
Besides these two points , there is a common concern among both experts and common people .
It is the health damage triggered by radioactivity .
First , we need to know the fact that most radioactive mass called plutonium waste is mainly produced during the reprocessing step .
However , in the VHTR system , the waste will go to repository directly instead of undergoing the waste recycling .
This can reduce the radioactivity of plutonium to a certain extent .
Furthermore , nowadays most nuclear reactors are built quite far from cities , so people do not need to worry too much about the effect of radioactivity .
To sum up , the Generation reactors have made great improvements compared to the older generation ones in terms of both technology and safety features .
On one hand , nuclear energy has the advantage of high efficiency , non--greenhouse-gas emission and the by-product hydrogen , which is supposed to be another ideal energy .
On the other hand , the fact that nuclear power plants contribute about 16% electricity to the world , which is the largest share among all the new developed energy sources (NEA , 2006) , indicates that nuclear power has become more and more essential to human beings .
Given both the advantages of nuclear energy and the current situation , it is practical and urgent for us to put concerted efforts to the development of nuclear energy .
