There are claims and myths that the Lithium ion rechargeable batteries that power the EV will explode and cause massive damage to the vehicle and the driver .
To ensure safety , carmakers are rigorously testing their batteries .
Nissan and Mitsubishi , for instance , expose the batteries to extreme temperatures , continuously charge and discharge the batteries , and smash them to experiment real road accidents (Rowley and Hall , 2009) .
Besides that , carmakers also improve the materials of the battery to minimize the risk of overheating .
An anti-impact cage is added to shield the battery from being crushed .
In order to prevent over charging and discharging , advanced microchips will be used to monitor the batteries' capacity .
With these improvements , Osamu Masuko , president of  Mithubishi Motors says that gasoline is relatively far more dangerous than batteries .
The electric vehicle carries large and heavy battery packs to increase the mileage per charge .
These heavy batteries result in an EV being much heavier compared to an identical gasoline vehicle .
However , if the weight of the batteries in the vehicles is arranged correctly , the EV should be able to achieve higher stability .
Other than that , in a crash test , the occupants of a lighter vehicle  suffered from higher damage compared to a heavy vehicle (insurance Institute for highway safety , 2009) .
In comparison , an accident involving a 1400 Kg vehicle will cause about 50 percent fewer injuries than a 900 Kg vehicle .
Therefore , the weight from the batteries brings safety benefits .
Recently , there have been debates on electric vehicles posinga hazard to pedestrians , especially to the blind or visually-impaired road users (Nuckols , 2007) .
EV is propelled by an electric motor in which torque is produced by electromagnetic forces .
Vibration and noise is minimal compared to an internal combustion engine .
Therefore , EV travel on the road inaudibly , hence the EV could surprise or cause an unexpected danger to the road users .
Tests have shown that the noise level that the EV produces while operating below 30 km/h is not noticeable for all types of road users .
Beyond that speed , more audible noise is formed by the air displaced by the body of the vehicle and friction on the  .
Thus , the European Commission and the US Congress are taking the initiative to set up a minimum level of sound for the EV , and the Japanese may add noise to the quiet vehicle (AFP , 2009) , so that the pedestrians and blind people are able to detect oncoming EV .
This shows that initiatives have been taken to make the electric car safe for the drivers and the pedestrians .
The heart is the most vital organ for every human being .
This brings no surprise to cardiovascular diseases being one of the leading causes of death in the world today1 .
Patients with cardiovascular disease usually suffer from heart failure , where the heart ceases to work leading to a sudden heart attack .
Heart transplant was the only option to save these patients initially .
This process requires finding a suitable donor with a compatible heart at a short period of time .
Proving to be very difficult , the mortality rate of cardiovascular disease remains high .
As medical technology advanced , heavy amounts of research and development have been put to finding a better alternative for saving cardiovascular disease patients .
The research and development efforts gave rise to the creation of Heartmate II .
Like how a heart pumps blood to the rest of the body , Heartmate is attached to a patient's heart to take over the role of the original organ .
Being readily available and sustainable , it is often used as a short-term replacement for patients waiting for a suitable heart donor to arrive .
Battery life is one of the main concerns that need to be addressed for toHeartmate II .
Currently , the external battery pack of two AA sized batteries supports the Heartmate II for a good five hours3 .
Though extra batteries can be brought to sustain the appliance , this may be insufficient and can be an area where human error occurs to cause fatalities due to power shortages .
As such , I propose an improvement in battery life by having a better power source , one that would last for more than half a day so as to keep the changing of the battery as minimal as possible .
This would lessen the possibilities for power shortage accidents to occur .
However , an improved battery life could lead to a compromise in the size of Heartmate II .
The bulkiness of the device could reduce the mobility of a patient and in turn increase the possibility for bleeding issues internally .
Essentially , what needs to be achieved is a compact and less bulky battery with longer life span .
Another factor to increase the safety of Heartneeds II would be the alteration of the materials used to manufacture the appliance .
Firstly , it has been reflected that users are facing problems with regard to issues surrounding water resistivity externally3 .
Being caught in a rain would prove to be fatal to a Heartmate II user .
Upgrading the material's water resistivity would make Heartmate II safer .
Furthermore , users could even enable the user to take a proper bath , instead of being restricted to just wiping themselves clean with a wet cloth .
In addition , the materials of the wall of the internal artificial ventricles and pump have to be made to have none or negligible resistance so as to ensure smoother blood flow rate .
Lastly , a lighter material should be preferable for the Heartmate II to reduce any strain whilst being attached to its users internally and externally .
All these elements are crucial to the performance and safety of the Heaa longere II .
There exist many more avenues that can be explored to improveusers Heartmate II and the invention of an artificial heart is still in early stages of its development .
Amidst this discussion , I feel that the cost should not be a determining factor in the construction and application for such health devices that could determines ones life and death .
Issues of security and performance hold the highest priority for mechanges could be made todesigns like the Heartmate II .
I strongly feel that the strife for more development and research should be done for the sake of creating a more durable and lightweight Heartmate III .
Over the decades , the quality of life has improved tremendously in terms of technologies .
People are now living in a world filled with technologywith every edge of the world powered by electricity .
This shows the significance of electricity as compared to the past .
However , the day when people use more electricity than they produce is approaching .
According to Butler , the global demand for energy is expected to double by 2050 (Nature ,2004) .
This forces people to resort to producing energy through nuclear reactors which have higher outputs .
One of the nuclear reactors of Generation-IV nuclear reactor concepts which are highly discussed is the molten salt reactor(MSR) .
Fundings should be allocated for further research of MSR as MSR is able to address the issues of safety ,cost and performance which are the main public's concerns .
Secondly , it has always been a general perception of the public that the cost incurred to build a nuclear reactor is always huge .
This results in not much effort being taken to initiate a nuclear reactor project as they believe the project is not feasible .
Another related concern is the amount of cost incurred for the maintainence of the reactor .
However , MSR is known to be among the cheapest nuclear reactors .
From the table shown by R .W .Moir(Nucl .
Tech .
139 (2002)) the cost incurred by MSR is 31 .3$ for every megawatt of energy generated per hour which is the least compared to the current technologies used .
Also , MSR will be using thorium as fuel as thorium is so abundant in the world as compared to current technologies which mostly use coal as fuel where coalis expected to last just for another 146years according to Energy Information Administration (EIA) .
These show that MSR is economical and should have cleared any doubts regarding further research on MSR as it is a feasible project in the long run as it makes use of resources which are abundant .
Lastly , the public has doubts about the performance of MSR .
Among the issues highlighted were whether it has higher output than other reactors and the technologies required to fully utilize MSR .
As the power required to overcome heat-exchanger pressure drops in a molten-salt system is typically about one-twentieth of a helium system , MSR has higher efficiency than most reactors .
Also , the size of a molten-salt heat-transport loop is only a small fraction of those using helium and is small relative to those for other coolant which leads to usage of a smaller area .
If funding is provided for research on MSR , there is no doubt that MSR can be fully utilised .
Although MSR generally generates less energy as compared to other nuclear reactors , the less space it requires can make up for it .
Thus , the efficiency rate is still very comparable to other reactors of high efficiency rate .
In conclusion , it is evident that MSR is worth the funding for the research given the attributes it possess .
If further research is  done , there is no doubt that MSR will be able to improve its weakness in having higher output as well as further refine  its strong points which are economyl and safety  .

The world is much concerned about the CO2 emission because of global warming .
So people are trying to find cheaper cleaner and more sustainable fuels for the energy supply to replace the traditional oil and fuel which are the main source of carbon dioxide emission .
Besides , the demands for the energy is soaring , a more efficient way should be used to generate energy .
Thus , nuclear power is a proper choice .
However , given the accidents of nuclear meltdown , people are worried about the safety issue of using new clear power .
While , experts have found a new generation of new clear reactors are safer and more effective than the old generation .
Among these , the very high temperature reactor , which is "a graphite-moderated , helium-cooled with a once through uranium fuel cycle" , is the most promising one (Very high temperature reactor , NA) .
It has high-efficiency electricity production and hydrogen generation , safety and comparable economics .
The very high temperature reactor , belonging to the new generation , has a high efficiency of energy conversion and the applications can be extend to hydrogen generation .
Firstly , it uses graphite as a moderator , a substance which neutrons collide with , so that the efficiency is demandd .
During the process , the moderator is one owayshe important ingredients .
A good moderator is the one that should not absorb too much energy when the neutrons bounce off nor absorb the neutrons before they split .
Graphite is nucleare comparExpertsdinary moderator which is water nuclearphite is hwhich  are resistant .
So using graphite increases the efficiency of the usage of uranium and reduce the lost of energy .
Secondly , operating at very high temperatures , a much higher proportion of the energy from the core can be turned into electricity and a much higher proportion of the U235 can be split .
Besides , due to the high temperature , hydrogen , which can be used in transportation and other industry is also produced from water splitting (Elder , 2009) .
While , People still wonder if safety is guaranteed after the accident related to the VHTR basic design which has a potential to cause the destruction of the reactor core (Takeda , 2001) .
However , several factors can help ease people's concern .
First is the choice for the coolant .
Helium , an inert gas , can reduce the risk from loss of coolant accidents .
Helium can be used at verygh temperatures without concerns about corrosion and without affinity to a chemical reaction .
Additionally , when it is exposed to radiation , it will not be radioactive .
Besides , the grawater , , used as the moderator , has large So ,ermal inertia , a high heat capacity and a stable structure even at hireducesperatloss .
Moreover , the fuel is coated uranium-oxycarbide , which permits high burn-up and retains fission products .
Therefore with these design , the risk could be lowered .
In addition , now computational methods can be used for simulating air ingress in the VHTR to help prevent the accident (Kim , 2009) .
fpeoplefety issue , in order to implement the very high temperature reactor , people also concern about the economic factor .
Without arguing , it is more expensive to build a new clear plant , while , after the start-up , the operating cost is cheaper because of ofh-efficiency , lower-cost high-temperature reactor for electricity and hydrogen production .
Reported by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission , the overall operating costs for nuclear power plants is roughly the same as the recent coal-fired plants and below the costs of operating most gas-fired generation units (Forsberg , Peterson , Zhao , 2006) .
Besides , a technoeconomic optimization method has developed and can be applied to the power conversion system of a very high temperature reactor , taking both investment costs and operating costs into acthis (Mansilla , 2008) Concerning over the energy resonewe availability , climate change , air quality , and energy security issue , nuclear power may take an important role in future .
The very high temperature reactor , being one of the possible systems of new generation power , which is aim to achieve improvements in economic competitiveness , nuclear safety , is promising to be implemented in the future .

That is to say , the possibility of radiation leaking closes to zero in the VHTR .

Most of the present research into the nuclear reactor designs is being directed into perfecting the series of reactors called the GENERATION IV REACTORS .
All these reactors are still in the design stage and do not have operational status .They are aimed at providing energy in a more safe and efficient way .There are 6 types of reactors amongst the Generation 4 reactors each with its own advantages and disadadvantages .However  , the type of reactor called the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) seems really promising and has much greater potential than the other models .
The fuel which is used in VHTR is uranium carbide pellets which are extremely heat resistant .
One of the major reasons for accidents in a nuclear power plant is the meltdown within a nuclear reactor .
With the fuel being so thermally inactive that it doesn't break down even in the event of a meltdown clearly poses as a major safety advantage .Another advantage is that the VHTR does not require frequent refuelling which extracts a heavy toll on the human labour  .
This takes care of a potential risk , human error .
In fact , the refuelling in this type of reactor can be achieved when it is still running .It is so highly efficient that a single pebble can last upto three years .
(U .S Department of Energy)
One of the major problems related to generating energy from nuclear fuel is the disposal of the spent fuel which is highly radioactive .
In the case of the VHTR the spent fuel is literally infissionable .
The energy generation is so efficient that there is almost a negligible amount of fissionable substance left .
China , Canada , France  , Japan , Euratom and the USA have already signed on the System Agreement for the VHTR under the Framework Agreement (GIF Annual Report 2008) .The total budget for the research and development of the Generation 4 reactors is estimated to be 6 Billion USD according to a GreenPeace report of 2005 (Butler  ,2004) .
Arguments to support further research and development funding for Very High Temperature Reactor .
Nuclear power promises a viable source of energy which is far cleaner and more cost effective than conventional thermal power stations .
However , there have been strongly differing views .
This is primarily due to safety , security and cost issues which can affect the public adversely .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of the new Generation IV reactors that is currently under research .
This new generation nuclear plant has been designed to deal with imminent concerns so as to prepare us for the nuclear power era .
Hence , there are plausible reasons to fund research and development projects pertaining to this area .
Critics of nuclear power maintain that the production of nuclear power is dangerous as there is a dangerous possibility of a radioactive leakage .
However , due to technological advancements in the VHTR , this is no longer an area of concern .
The coolant used in VHTR is helium , an inert gas that does not react chemically with any material .
Exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive .
As such , a leakage would not be radioactive .
The VHTR is a safe reactor which has a 'pebble bed core' .
Spherical fuel elements are termed as 'pebbles' .
Each pebble , containing thousands of micro fuel particles , is essentially a mini nuclear reactor made of graphite .
These pebbles are coated with multiple layers of hard ceramic  which results in the pebbles being extremely heat resistant .
If a meltdown were to occur , the pebbles will not crack easily or release harmful radiation or fission products .
As such , a leakage is unlikely to be radioactive in nature .
Some also argue that the production of nuclear power might give rise to more terror attacks .
Terrorists can extract plutonium from the nuclear waste for weapon production or simply use them as 'dirty bombs' for terror attacks .
But improvements made to the containment structure and a new reactor technology will prevent the terrorist from succeeding .
The 5 feet thick containment vessel will protect the contents from inside and outside .
The layers of ceramic coated on the pebbles are also very hard and durable .
Hence it would be very difficult for anyone to extract the fissionable materials within the reactor core .
In addition , the spent fuel from VHTR contains an insignificant amount of fissionable materials , thus it would pose less of a threat if it were to end up in the hands of terrorists .
Another argument from the opponents of nuclear power is that nuclear waste is non-biodegradable and that radiation from the waste is deadly for those who are constantly exposed to it .
However , the amount of nuclear waste and its negative effects will be greatly reduced with the use of VHTR .
The VHTR has the ability of using existing nuclear waste to produce electricity .
This will considerably reduce the amount of nuclear waste produced .
The half-lives of these nuclear wastes will be shortened to just a few decades instead of the few millennia with the existing technology .
With future technological breakthroughs  , nuclear waste disposal  will no longer be a concern .
Lastly , the public is concerned about the high price related to the production of nuclear energy .
The energy produced by the VHTR can be kept low due to the substantial amount of nuclear energy being produced compared to other energy sources such as coal , oil and wind .
According to statistics , the cost of producing per kilowatt-hour of nuclear power is only slightly above 2 cents in recent years , the lowest as compared to gas , coal and oil which are the three main energy sources in the world .
The implicit cost of pollution that we have to pay is also essentially zero .
This is because the only emission to the environment is steam , which does not pollute the environment in any manner .
Thus , cost should not be an area of concern for the general public .
It is therefore evident that safety and security issues have been well addressed by the 'new pebble bed core' of VHTR .
The problem on disposal of nuclear waste is also solved by the ability of VHTR to consume existing nuclear waste and producing nuclear waste with shorter half-lives .
Finally , high cost of nuclear energy is not a valid argument as its cost has always been one of the lowest in terms of implicit and explicit cost .
Hence , I conclude that there must be further research and funding for the Generation IV reactors .
Ever since the first robot was created in the 1950s , mankind has been trying to incorporate them into our lives .
From sending them to space in search of new habitats to deploying them deep in sea for research purposes , these new humanoids are being utilized to explore places which were previously inaccessible to humans .
However , it is only in the 1980s when robots were actually being developed to save lives (Robotic Surgery , n .d .) .
They come in the form of robotic doctors .
With the traditional mindsets the general public has , it is no wonder that the mentioning of robotic surgeons operating on a patient is strongly opposed .
Yet most researchers and experts beg to differ .
They believe that there are more benefits that can be obtained from robotic surgery as compared to conventional surgery , such as the reduction of recovery time .
Having said that , it may be too early to conclude that robotic surgery will replace conventional surgery , but based on current advancements to the system , it is foreseeable in the near future that people will turn to robots for all kinds of abscission .
The most defining issue regarding robots is  safety  .
It is not uncommon for people to experience a machine breakdown halfway through an important process , which can be frustrating and may sometimes lead to significant losses .
The breakdown may be a result of a mechanical part failure or a lack of power supply .
In the case of robotic surgery , a breakdown in the middle of an  operation can be disastrous .
The sudden discontinuation of the robot may hamper the proceedings of the operation , increasing the chances of infection and possibility of death .
To counter these problems , robotic systems like the Da Vinci System have in place a self-check mechanism that allows proper shutting down of the system in the event of a failure in either the self-check or the power source (Safety , 2008) .
This allows the surgeon in charge to be able to continue  with the surgery conventionally .
In this way , there would not be a huge time period where the patient is left with an open incision , thereby keeping any possible chances of infection to a minimum .
Another cause of concern has to do with the lack of expertise in this field of technology .
As robotic surgery is still considered new , not many doctors have the required savoir faire to make use of the device optimally and efficiently .
Together with the viewpoint of people considering robotic surgery the cutting edge technology now , hospitals are increasingly likely to obtain one even without a skilled doctor under its wings .
After spending a huge amount acquiring it , hospitals will be pressurized to make full use of it .
This spells danger as operating with inexperienced doctors is more pernicious than operating without the robot .
This is exemplified in a true story where a patient died because of complications after a robot-aided operation by an inexperienced surgeon (Sherman , 2009) .
In order to rectify this problem , hospitals with the robotic systems have designed training packages for doctors and assistants (Yarborough , 2008) .
With these preparations , the surgeons can have a better understanding and hands-on experience of the system , making it less likely for mistakes to happen .
Although there may be many doubts on robotic surgery , the benefits of it should not be overlooked .
As robotic surgery is also known as minimally invasive surgery , it does exactly what its name suggests .
The incision required for this operation is much smaller than traditional methods .
This signifies a massive improvement in recovery time and less pain endured by patients (Young , 2007) .
Also , as machines can be sterilized more effectively than humans , there is a lower chance of them being contaminated by external factors , which means less chance of the patient being infected .
robots for surgery is still in a developing stage .
It is vital that the safety aspects of the system be ameliorated before they can be implemented on a wider scale .
With the constant upgrading of the robots and surgeons , the time is nigh for humans to embrace robots as the new generation of surgeons .

Advocates and committees formed around the world to reduce global warming have been very active in the recent years .
Looking into every single opportunity to decrease the greenhouse gases emittedg into the atmosphere , we realise energy sources may be one of the emphatic points to be revised .

With the new generation IV reactor concepts , Lead-cooled fast reactor is the paramount choice for producing nuclear power as it surpasses the other reactors in terms of different aspects (Butler , 2004) .
With further research and development , Lead cooled fast reactors will be the future energy source which make security , cost and performance problems precedent .
Nuclear reactors haven been mistaken for a time bomb waiting to explode anytime because of the tremendous pressure contained inside .
It is also believed to cause a catastrophic accident that is very disastrous with any slight technical or human error .
Rebutting , it is actually not true as a power plant is too big to convert a part of its U-235 or plutonium into fission fragments and generate enough heat to fly apart .
On the contrary , a bomb is a compact object so the neutrons need not travel far to hit another fissionable atom which is what makes it so powerful .
This is a fact based on the fundamentals of physics on how fast fission neutrons travel (John , 1995) .
Lead-cooled fast reactors are also built with superior materials to resist strong knockings and vibrations to prevent any leakages of radioactive substances into the atmosphere .
It has been a strain to convince the public to allow nuclear reactors as they involve large amounts of radioactivity .
Accidents that have happened and serve as evidence of the dangers involving nuclear reactors .
However , accidents involving nuclear reactors have been relatively small , compared to cave-ins in coal mines which often kill hundreds .
Nothing is perfectly safe but nuclear energy is definitely safe enough to be relied upon as an energy source .
(John , 1995) Furthermore , lead-cooled fast reactor will be much safer compared to the conventional plants with  better and more comprehensive safety features .
It also operates at lower pressure compared to other contenders .
On top of that , according to Donald W .M .
(2004) , not only are low to moderate doses of ionizing radiation  not harmful , they stimulate the immune system and check oxidation of DNA through a process known as "radiation hormesis" , preventing cancer too .

people may expect design flaws in the plants and calculated the maintenance to incur more costs in a long run .

Very-high Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of the six generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV nuclear reactor systems selected by the Generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV International Forum for further development in 2002 (Preparing Today for Tomorrow's Energy Needs , para .3) .
The VHTR uses graphite as the core material and helium as coolant of the reactor to generate nuclear heat with core-outlet temperature of 1000 degrees centigrade .
This system can be applied to hydrogen production , petrochemistry , electricity generation and so on (U .S DOE Nuclear Energy Research advisory Committee and the Generation IV international Forum , 2002) .
Although the VHTR is promising , critics argue that it is not worth further research due to lack of suitable materials , potential safety hazard and high cost of construction .
However , these problems can be solved and the VHTR will benefit the society a lot .
First , opponents claim that the VHTR requires materials to reach high standard and currently there is no suitable candidate .
It is true that the requirement for the materials is tough to meet .
Materials used in the internal core structure are required to withstand at least 1000 degrees centigrade which is much higher than the melting points of most materials .
In fact , there is still a small number of ceramic and metallic materials with high melting temperatures and they are the potential materials for VHTR , such as carborundum with a melting temperature of 2730 degrees centigrade and tungsten with a melting temperature of 3410 degrees centigrade (Callister , 2007) .
Besides , aerospace materials are a source of reference for scientists .
The surface temperature of a space shuttle can reach more than 2000 degrees centigrade and certain materials have b successfully used .
Currently scientists are doing research to find new high-temperature-resistant materials .
In general , we are confident to develop suitable materials for VHTR .
Secondly , skeptics argue that there is potential safety hazard .
Ia high reasonable that people concern a lot about the safety since the Chernobyl accident and Three Mile Island accident happened .
Nuclear accidents are deadly disasters , causing economic losses as well as huge damage to the environment and people's health .
According to McCarthy (2009) , the VHTR is quite safe due to its special design which is different from reactors of the Chernobyl type .
Having a negative temperature coefficient , the VHTR can automatically slow down the nuclear reaction inside the core when the temperature rises .
This feature ensures that the temperature in a VHTR core can never be high enough to trigger a meltdown .
With this special design , the VHTR can shut down itself once anything abnormal happens .
Therefore , safety can be ensured for the VHTR .
Accidents like the Chernobyl accident will never happen to the VHTR .
more profit can be achieved laterinitialalthough theIn conclusion , obstacles like lack of materials , safety problems and high construction cost all can be overcome .
The VHTR is a safe and profitable nuclear reactor with excellent prospect .
Thus , the VHTR is worth further research .
Hopefully , it will be widely used within a decade .

Among the 6 concepts , the Very-high-temperature reactor (VHTR) is more secure , reliable and efficient and should receive more funding .
Many people doubt the safety of nuclear plantsamountshus oppose the construction of new nuclear plants .
However , the VHTR has resolved smaller of the safety concerns and proved to be much safer .The VHTR can be a pebble-bed reactor like HTR-10 in China .
The fuel is in the form of small pebbles with uranium dioxide (UO2) inside and a graphite coat .
Each pebble can perform as a "mini" reactor independently .
"The pebble-bed reactor has high safety and relbility griss due to the inherent safety features of the fuel and reactor .
It also gets good ratings for prwereferation resistance and physical protection (Hylko , 2008)" .
Furthermore , it has been proved that with all the supporting machinery failing , the reactor will not crack , melt or explode .
"It simpobtainss up to a designed "idle" frommperature and sTo date ,here .
In that state , the reactor vessel radiates heat , but the vessel and fuel spheres remain intact and undamaged" .
(FHSST Authors , 2005) .
"Even after decommissioning , the VHTR can still discharge surplus heat and do not need additional safety systems like other types of reactors do" .

Fuel temperature reached less than 1600  C but there was still no failure" (World's First Commercial High Temperature Nuclear Reactor starts construction in China in 2009 , 2008) .
doesEfficiency is another problem that challenges many nuclear reactors .
But this is no problem because of the nature of the VHTR .Running at very high temperatures of about 700-900 C , the VHTR can supple energy to split water into oxygen and hydrogen , providing hydrogen for the nation's industry .
According to Hylko (2008) , the VHTR has relacoatingly higher efficiency for heat transfer and hydrogen production .
"It can squeeze 50% more energy from the same amount of fuel" (Butler , 2004) .
Moreover , bearing the property of running at such high temperatures , the VHTR can also realise "deep-burn" , during which up to 65% of the initial fuel is burnt .
This shows great advantage over the conventional reactors who possess burn-up levels of around 5% .
"Moreover , instead of 95% of the uranium going into nuclear waste , this kind of reactor would only turn 35% of it into waste" (TendersInfo , 2008) , which will help with theundamaged" (FHSST Authors , 2005) .us radioactive wastes .
whichIt is understandable that many people doubt if there is anyone willing to inject money into this new reactor since is costs great amounts of money and time .

Modular reactors are reactors that can be deployed part by part and each part can work independently .

All these will make the VHTR more competitive in the fierce competition of today's energy market (Renkai , 2000) .
investmentTo sum up , the VHTR is highly safe and reliable .

Chernobyl accident happened on April 26 , 1986 .
It is known as the most famous nuclear power accident .
The accident causes total 56 fatalities as of 2004 , and some seven million Chernobyl victims suffering from the impact of Chernobyl accident (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
Profession Wilpert(2007) from Technical University of Berlin proposes that using psychology in the design process could prevent disasters like Chernobyl accident , while some people argue that psychology will not be useful in preventing accidents .
This essay proposes that the use of psychology in the design process is helpful to prevent the Chernobyl accident .
The Chernobylgineering Design Process , Ertas and Jones (1996) notes that engineering design is the process of devising causeda total of system or process to meet desired needs , and it is a decision making process .
Design is a human activity , and human may make mistakes .
Therefore , designers may make mistakes in the design process .
Psychology is the scientific investigation of humans' mental process and behavior .
(Kowalski & Westen , 2005) Using psychology to analyze how the designers think can point out the flaws in their thinking process .
In this way , psychology could help designers to minimize their mistakes in the design process (Wilpert , 2007) .
Thus , possible accidents may be prevented .
In The Truth about Chernobyl , the author , Medvedev (1991) , notes that one of the reasons which cause Chernobyl accident is the inadequate operators with insufficient knowledge operated the reactor inappropriately .
It is true that the operhumans not happened in the design process .
However , the use of psychology in the design process could prevent inappropriate operations from happening .
In the design process , designers should consider the user of devices , components or systems under development , which includes people who maintain and repair the product as well as who operate it (Ertas & Jones , 1996) .
However , the high technical knowledge of the designers may make them overestimate competence of the users .
Therefore , they give insufficient instructions to the users to equip them with equivalent competence (Wilpert , 2007) .
Obviously , in the case of Chernobyl accident , the operator did not have a well-designed instruction manual and was not adequately trained .
If psychology was used in the design process , it would point out this flaw and advise designers to provide an adequate instruction manual including the operations in emergencies so that operators would know how to operate the reactor when facing emergencies .
In this way , Chernobyl accident may be prevented .
Medvedev (1991) mentions in his book that the RBMK reactor in Chernobyl had a dangerously largecausedtive void coefficient and a defect in the design of the reactor protection aoperatingol system .
The designers was aware of the defects of the reactors , however , they did not make efforts to correct them .
Some people argue that these defects caused the Chernobyl accident , psychology cannot solve them .
Technically , psychology could not solve the technical problem for engineers .
But , psychology could point out the potential danger and consequence of the problem so that enoperates would search for better options .
If the designers know the severe consequence of the accident , they would try their best to prevent it .
Psychologists could also indicate the flaws in the design process and advise designers to lower the positive void coefficient and enhance the protection and control system in this case .
Thus , the disaster may be prevented .
would have triedknewIn conclusion , Chernobyl is a result of flawed design of reactor and inappropriate operation by inadequate operators .
However , the use o f psychology in the design process would be helpful to preventdesigners werel disaster .
The errors in the design process and the operation process may be prevented with the help of psychology .
Nowadays , developed countries and developing countries have invested huge funds to develop nuclear power as nuclear energy is regarded  to be the potential energy source for the future (Butler , 2004) .
However , the large amount of R&D funding needed for Generation IV nuclear reactors has made the development of nuclear power a controversial issue .
From a long term perspective , there should be R&D funding for the development of Generation IV reactors since Generation IV reactors are safer , cheaper and cleaner .
First of all , nuclear power is a sustainable energy source in the long term when developed properly .
Generation IV reactors are much cleaner than previous generations .
They will help reduce carbon dioxide and subsequently reduce the effect of global warming (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
Jacques and Ralph claimed in Generation IV Advanced Nuclear Energy Systems: "According to Princeton University's Carbon Mitigation Initiative , increasing the number of nuclear power plants to 1000 worldwide-more than double what it is today could avoid one billion tons of carbon emissions per year by 2055 ."
The statistics have shown that the success of development of Generation IV reactors will bring a great improvement to the living environment for human beings in the future .
In the long term , funds should be given to support the development of Generation IV reactors at current stage .
Some may argue that until now , the scientists and researchers are still researching new materials to reduce radioactive leak and wastage (Butler , 2004) .
The success seems to be too far away for the public to feel .
However , this is the reason why more funds must be given to support further research for Generation IV reactors .
Scientists and researchers should be given financial support to overcome difficulties they face during research rather than give up half way .
Therefore , the development of Generation IV reactors deserves R&D funding .
Secondly , from the economic perspective , Generation IV nuclear energy systems have lower cost than other energy sources .
Nuclei , as the source of nuclear reactants , are small and abundant in nature .
Thus once developed properly , the cost of nuclear power will be very low .
Thus , member countries of Generation IV International Forum actively invest in Generation IV reactors , hoping to get cheap energy and meanwhile , to remain energy independent (Butler , 2004) .
Thirdly , Generation IV nuclear energy systems operations will make further improvement in safety and reliability (Michael , 2005) .
Safety  is one of the most priorities of Generation IV International Forum (GIF) .
The revolution in fuel utilization in Generation IV reactors will reduce the radio toxicity by a large extent (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
The public may not trust the ability of scientists and researchers to ensure their safety since they still remember the nuclear power accidents at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania and at Chernobyl in Ukraine which caused many people to die (Butler , 2004) .
However , Generation IV reactors are designed to be safer than the previous generations .
Safety issues will be handled with extreme care by all GIF member counties .
Researchers from different countries are doing collaborative research to achieve this common goal (Jacques & Ralph , 2008) .
Thus , the public should look forward to Generation IV reactors' performance rather than oppose it .
To sum up , the nuclear reactor is a necessary evil .
I feel that the Supercritical water reactor(SCWR) should be further researched and developed and help the whole world in the near future .
People have always been concerned about the development of nuclear energy .
Today , 104 reactors produce about 20 percent of the United States 'electricity (World Nuclear Association , 2009) .
However , it is still a big question whether Generation IV Reactor projects should be funded .
In this case , I'm confident that Generation IV reactors in general and the VHTR concept in particular deserve to be funded around the world .
For a very long time , many people have been worried about the safety of nuclear energy .
Accidents such as Chernobyl have destroyed the Chernobyl-4 reactor and killed 30 people , including 28 from radiation exposure .
However , if we look on the whole , there has not been a serious accident in the nearly 30 years since the Three Mile Island reactor in Pennsylvania experienced a partial core meltdown .
VHTR is the safest concept among other nuclear reactors , due to low decay heat and non-combustible nuclear-grade graphite , which is virtually impossible to be burnt .
Therefore , the use of VHTR is safe and we can believe in the further development of such GenIV nuclear reactor concepts .
Secondly , global warming is what we are concerned about .
It demands a profound transformation in the ways we generate and consume energy .
Our current sources of power like coal and gas are producing Carbon Dioxide , which make the global warming problem worse .
In addition , these sources of power are being used up and we should find  alternative sources of power .
Scientific research concludes that the world must reduce global warming emissions by at least 80 percent by 2050 to avoid the most dangerous effects of global warming (UCSUSA , 2009) .
Nuclear power could play a huge role in reducing global warming emissions because nuclear reactors emit almost no carbon while they operate and have low life-cycle emissions .
New generation of reactors such as VHTR will produce relatively cheap electricity while solving the threat posed by global climate change .
U .S power producers have proposed building more than 30 new nuclear reactors and some proponents have called for building as many as 300 plants by mid- century (UCSUSA , 2009) .
Therefore , using GenIV nuclear reactors is a very efficient way to reduce the effects of global warming .
The third concern is whether nuclear power concepts such as VHTR can be widely applied to the whole world .
There are some barriers that may prevent nuclear energy from developing: it is expensive to build a plant , there may be human errors and it still produces radio-active wastes .
However , there are lots of positive features that we can count  .
VHTR produces a high-efficiency electricity production with a broad range of process heat applications , while retaining the safety characteristics in both normal and off-normal events .
VHTR is performed under very high temperature (from 500 to 1000 degrees Celsius) , therefore allowing for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
A single power plant can produce a large amount of energy compared to the amount produced by wind so in total , the nuclear energy is a cheap kind of energy .
Finally , the energy power concept like VHTR helps prevent the effects of global warming .
It is safe and efficient , so therefore it can produce a lot of energy and is able to replace traditional sources of energy .
It is clear governments should fund the VHTR nuclear projects to develop it further , and nuclear energy will definitely be the energy of the future .
Some people think that nuclear reactors are not safe .
Nuclear radiation can cause mutation in human cells , cancer , and other diseases .
Nuclear reactors are also expensive to build and maintain .
Hence , only a few countries have built nuclear reactor to produce electricity .
But now , scientists have developed six new type of nuclear reactor called Nuclear Reactor Generation IV which are said to be safer than previous generations .
One of these reactors is the gas-cooled fast reactor (GFR) which has more benefits in terms of cost , safety , and performance than the other five reactor concepts , particularly the very-high temperature reactor (VHTR) .
Some people say that GFR is not safe because it produces plutonium waste which can be used to make nuclear weapons .
Plutonium in repository remains radioactive for several thousand of years ("Energy Resources : Nuclear Power") .
Because of threactors development of GFR is obstructed .
Although GFR produces fuel waste types contains plreactors , it reprocesses its fuel waste such that the amount of waste produced can be cut by about 96 percent of its usual amount ("Fuel Cycles" , page 33 , table 4 .3) .
The plutonium produced from reprocessing of waste stays at a high temperature , making it too hot to be stolen .
In addition , as the fuel waste is recycled , there is no need to replace the fuel for a few years .
For comparison , VHTR can not reprocess their fuel waste , and because of that , the amount of fuel waste that it produces is getting bigger and bigger as the electricity's demand increasing (Rohrer , 2007) .
These prove that GFR is safer and more environmentally-friendly than the VHTR .
