Many major engineering accidents have occurred around the world such as the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accidents .
Some feel that  incorporating psychology into the design process can help to avoid such accidents from happening .
This could be one of the reasons why Psychology is now being taught in the design graduate programs of many institutes , such as Chicago's Institute of Design ; it is also used in some design firms (Psychology by design , n .d) .
Psychology is , in short , the scientific study of human mind and its functions , especially those affecting behaviour .
By understanding psychology one would be able to enhance his or her thinking style and creativity , therefore would be able to come up with  better solutions during the design process .
Therefore , the use of psychology in the design process would help to prevent major engineering accidents from happening again .
There are a group of people who might strongly feel that if proper research has been done , the engineers at Eschede would have come up with a better design such that any fault in the wheels would have been detected and hence prevented the train from moving .
High technology research on this aspect of design would have been possible and hence would have prevented the accident .
However , the study of psychology focusing on  Human Computer Interaction (HCI) helps one to use the rapidly advancing telecommunication and research facilities to their advantage .
As mentioned , "modern information and communication technologies drastically change the nature of the design process" (Wilpert , 2007 p .297) .
Therefore , the study of HCI would better enable the engineers to analyse  information they gather and would hence  to be able to come up with innovative designs which look into the safety of the design .
Therefore , the use of  psychology would have helped  prevent the accident .
The world's population is predicted to expand from about 6 billion people to 10 billion people by the year 2050 CITATION ATe02 \l 1033 (A Technology Roadmap for Generation IV Nuclear , 2002) .
And global energy demand is expected to double at that time CITATION Nuc04 \l 1033 (Nuclear Power's New Dawn , 2004) .
Today's energy use has caused adverse environmental problems so the energy supply will be far from sufficient for future demand .
Now the whole world has the same goals of sustainable development .
Then should we concern over environmental pollution , climate change , and energy availability so the use of energy supplies which clean , safe and economically effective is necessary .
Currently , a general recognition suggests that nuclear power is a good sustainable energy .
However , the public is very concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors , economic costs , technical risks , waste disposal of the nuclear energy systems .
To solve these problems , six generation IV reactor concepts are planned .
Compared with the other five concepts , the Molten Salt Reactor (MSR) advances in safety , reliability , performance and economics .
In my point of view , people should support the farther research on MSR technology to fulfill human's energy consumption in the future .

In recent years , oil has become very important to many people by providing fuel for cars and most importantly , generating electricity .
We are using more tools that require electricity with technological advancement .
This means that we need more oil to meet our rising energy demands , causing the oil price to increase due to depleting oil reserves .
At the same time , burning oil to generate electricity also releases a large amount of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere .
This has caused many environmental problems like global warming .
Thus , there is a need for us to find other ways of generating electricity .
One alternative we have is nuclear power .
However , there are many who oppose  this idea because they feel that this choice is expensive , unsafe and cannot perform as well as others like renewable energy .
Thus , scientists have come out with the idea of Generation IV Reactors , which will be safer , cheaper and better in terms of performance .
The Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) is one of these reactors .
Since  the Generation IV Reactor that is expected to have one of the earliest deliveries with the highest power output (Butler , 2004) ,  research on it should be supported and continued .
Firstly , many people oppose the use of nuclear power as a form of energy because it is expensive to research and build  .
However , they do not realise that nuclear power is expensive only at the early stage .
In the long run , nuclear power is still a cheaper alternative fuel as VHTR can generate fifty percent more electricity from the same amount of fuel in the current coal-powered power plants (Butler , 2004) .
Besides this , the rising price of oil will eventually become much more expensive than the radioactive materials used .
In the long run , the cost of setting up the plant and researching can be offset .
Thus , nuclear power is not expensive compared to other sources .
Secondly , people may argue that nuclear power is not safe  because of the radiation that radioactive materials give out .
The Three Mile Island accident and Chernobyl accident are evidence of their claims .
In the Chernobyl accident alone , there were fifty-six deaths (World Nuclear Association , 2004) .
Hence , they feel that nuclear power is dangerous .
Yet , according to the World Nuclear Association (2008) , the most serious case of nuclear reactor accident was the Chernobyl accident with fifty-six deaths while a recent coal mine methane explosion in China has caused seventy-eight deaths .
Thus , nuclear power is not as dangerous as we thought .
Furthermore , in the new concept of VHTR , it will be "meltdown proof" so it will  still be safe if accidents happen (Butler , 2004) .
Thus , nuclear power is not as dangerous compared to other sources of energy and  VHTR can be made safer with modern technology .
Lastly , people claimed that it cannot perform as well as other sources of energy since it is not sustainable (Langwith , 2009) .
The radioactive materials will run out one day like oil and coal , giving us the problems that coal and oil are giving us today .
Thus , they feel that we should use renewable resources like solar and wind for power .
However , nuclear power is actually a better choice over other sources of energy because it has the best output for its cost and land area occupied .
Many renewable resources like solar and wind require a lot more land mass to generate sufficient energy (Mckenna , 2007) .
Thus , the amount of electricity generated per land area is not as much as nuclear power .
So , if we use renewable resources , we will have to clear more land , which is harmful to the environment .
Furthermore , nuclear power is one of the cheapest powers to generate now (The Royal Academy of Engineering , 2004) .
Thus , even though nuclear power cannot perform for a long time like other renewable powers ,  it is the best performing power that we can rely on now for its efficiency per land area and cost .
In conclusion , coal and oil are no longer sources of energy that we should rely on because of their rising costs and environmental impact .
Thus , there is a need for other sources of power .
Currently , generating power using the nuclear reactor , VHTR , will be our best choice since it has zero emission , cheap , safe and efficient .
Thus ,  research on VHTR should be continued and funded to get ourselves ready before the demand for energy increases much more in 2050 as predicted (Butler , 2004) .
Fund the development of Generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV Nuclear Reactors
As noted in "Nuclear power's new dawn" , Butler said that the public is concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Public opposition was one reason why few nuclear reactors have been built in the past few decades in many countries .
However , nuclear energy is more efficient and gives a new future for  energy consumption , especially after the use of generation  IV nuclear reactors (Hill , 2008) .
In my perspective , it is a good choice to support and fund the development of generation  IV nuclear reactors for future energy consumption .
A country can also benefit a lot from nuclear energynot because it is a kind of future energy but also because it can enhance the speed of economic development (Hill , 2008) .
People always say that economic development will depend on  comprehensive national strength or  national power , not  nuclear energy .
However , they may not see the importance of nuclear energy in improving  .
According to a report made by OPEC , in 2009 , China consumed 8 .27 million barrels of oil a day , which is 0 .29 million barrels more per day than 2008 .
And China will rely almost 50% of its whole energy consumption on oil .
The money for oil import is a huge number and that money can do many other infrastructure constructions .
As mentioned before , the material for nuclear energy can produce much more energy per kilogram .
Hence , China will reduce a lot of its oil import if nuclear energy is widely used and accepted by the public .
The generation  IV reactors will perform very well in this aspect .
If we can support and fund the nuclear energy for future development , it will enhance the speed of economic development .
As we advance into the age of technology , we witness many breakthroughs .
It is significant that nuclear power has marked a new era of science and technology .
However , some people have lost their confidence in nuclear power development after the occurrence of nuclear disasters in Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
But the generation IV reactors that are currently under research and development have been greatly improved and hence they are much safer than conventional plants .
Of the six generation IV reactors ,  the Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) has the most potential to be selected for further R&D funding .
Specifically , compared with the Molten Salt Reactor (MSR) , the VHTR is saferand incurs low operation and maintenance costs and modular construction costs .
The MSR operates at the temperature of 700-800  C and low pressurs .
On the other hand , the VHTR requires a very high pressure since inert helium is used to keep the reactor cool .
Thus , the VHTR would incura higherr cost of installing since it needs thicker pipes to sustain the high pressure .
However , the VHTR which operates at a higher temperature is highly efficientin then conversion of heat to electricity compared to the MSR .
For instance , the VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared to conventional plants (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , with economy of scale , the cost of installing and maintaining the VHTR increaese less than proportionately with the plants' generating capacity due to its high efficiency .
Moreover , additionalR & D technologiesD for the VHTR includings high temperature alloy , fiber reinforced ceramics and composite materials can further improve the efficiency and cut down the costs (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
For instance , an optimized approachtor dealing with graphite is currently under research .
Thus , the VHTR is much cheaper than the MSR in overallcosts .
Some people might have a wrong assumption that the MSR has higher performance than the VHTR since it is a fast reactor that relies on fast neutrons while the latter is a thermal reactor that relies on moderators to slow neutrons first .
However , this is not true because the reactors' performances  also depend on  temperature and pressure .
In fact , the overall plant efficiency of the VHTR is more than 50%  compared to MSR's  44-50% .
This is because the VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , thus its thermal power output is up to 600 MW .
In addition , the VHTR is operating in a midsized plant as compared to the MSR which is  large in size .
Thus , it is true that the VHTR has higher performance .
Research shows that the MSR is safe to operate and maintain as the molten fluoride salts used are mechanically and chemically stable at sea-level pressures (DestinationScience .com) .
However , the MSR is operating with closed fuel cycle while the VHTR is operating with an open fuel cycle system .
Thus , the VHTR is neutral in sustainability which means that VHTR spent fuel that could be disposed of in a geological repository or conditioned for optimum waste disposal .
Therefore , the VHTR is definitely safe to be used because the encapsulation for the spent fuel fission products has been further improved so it is extremely resistant to leaching in a final repository (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
Furthermore , the MSR discards a larger amount of waste compared to the VHTR .
Even though  waste from the MSR undergoes recycling ,  this process is unsecure as this bypasses the stage where plutonium , an active ingredient for nuclear weapons , is produced .
Hence ,  plants might become  targets of terrorist .
In addition , the cost of recycling is very expensive and a lot of fuel still ends up as waste .
On the other hand , the VHTR enhances minimization through fuel recycling .
From the analysis , the VHTR will spend fuel in a symbiotic fuel cycle that can achieve significant reductions in waste quantity and radio toxicity because of its ability to accommodate a wide variety of mixtures of fissile and fertile materials without significantly modifying the core design (U .S . Department of Energy Nuclear , 2002) .
Thus , in terms of safety and security , the VHTR is actually much safer than the MSR .
In conclusion , the VHTR provides an economically competitive nuclear heat source and hydrogen production capability (Idaho National Laboratory Idaho Falls , 2006) .
Therefore , unremitting efforts and funding should be put into its research and development so that it would give a fresh impetus to enhance the development of nuclear power .
Should funding be given to  Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor over the other Generation IV reactors ?
There has been much debate on whether to develop Generation IV reactors , or to continue using Generation III reactors , which are much safer (Butler , 2004) .
However , with the rising need for energy , going ahead to develop the Generation IV concepts is a logical choice .
Among the six chosen concepts for Generation IV reactors , the Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor (SCWR) is one of the more popular choices (Butler , 2004) .
The SCWR has a much simpler design compared to the other chosen reactors , and would be cheaper to build and operate (Cogeneration Technologies , 2002) .
This will fulfill the nuclear reactors' main purpose of generating affordable and reliable electricity (Buongiorno , 2003) .
In addition , the SCWR is developed from existing technologies that work , which will result in a reduction in the cost of building it and also an increase in its reliability (Buongiorno , 2002) .
Therefore , the SCWR is the most feasible choice among all the other generation IV reactors .
The main reason for choosing the SCWR over the other reactors is the low cost of development (Buongiorno , 2003) .
The SCWR requires the least to develop , compared with the other reactors .
This is due to the SCWR being developed from existing technologies , and some of its core components can be recycled .
In addition , the coolant , water , used by the SCWR is the cheapest among the chosen Generation IV reactors .
The SCWR also creates hydrogen , which can be sold to the hydrogen economy , resulting in the reduction of operating costs (Buongiorno , 2003) .
Opponents of the SCWR would argue that water is a precious resource , and the amount of clean water available is decreasing .
This problem can be solved by using other methods to generate the water needed for the coolant .
One of the methods available to date is the distillation of sea water .
As the Earth is mostly made up of  water , there will be enough water to be used for the coolant of the SCWR .
Therefore , with the low cost needed to develop and run the SCWR , it will be an apt choice for more funding and development .
People who favor other reactors may argue that the SCWR's performance may not match with other reactors .
However , in terms of performance , the SCWR can match the thermal efficiency of the other reactors (Idano National Library , 2009) .
The thermal efficiency of the SCWR is 45% , an improvement from the 33% of the light water reactors (LWR) , which the SCWR is developed from .
This thermal efficiency can match up to that of the Very-High-Temperature Reactor (VHTR) , which has an estimated thermal efficiency of 50% .
The VHTR has the highest thermal efficiency among the generation IV concepts (Idano National Library , 2009) .
The VHTR runs at a temperature of 1000 degree Celsius , which is twice the temperature of the SCWR , which meant higher risks of a reactor meltdown (Butler , 2004) .
Therefore , with lower risks and a thermal efficiency that can match the other reactors , the SCWR is clearly a more superior choice , compared with the other Generation IV reactors .
Research and development has to be done before any of the Generation IV reactors can be implemented (Butler , 2004) .
In terms of the research needed , the SCWR has the least amount of research needed .
The only areas that require more research are mainly security and safety (Buongiorno , 2003) , which mainly require new materials that can withstand high temperature and also radiation at the same time .
Materials that can withstand corrosion at high temperatures are also required (Buongiorno , 2003) .
To date , several suitable materials have been identified .
Materials such as ferritic-martensitic steels and lowswelling austenitic steels for parts exposed to high neutron doses , high-strength austenitic steels and nickel-based alloys parts exposed to low neutron doses were some of the materials indentified .
These materials are currently being tested for their suitability (Buongiorno , 2003) .
As for security , all reactors have to address the same problem of preventing terrorist attacks and sabotages .
Therefore , without any other major problems , the SCWR is the more logical choice to place more emphasis on .
The SCWR is clearly the reactor to receive more funding , as it requires the least cost and research to be developed .
In addition , the SCWR is one of the two reactors that does not reprocess plutonium waste (Butler , 2004) .
This further supports the case of more funding for the SCWR .
In conclusion , the SCWR should receive more funding , as it is the most promising concept out of the six chosen concepts .
Generation IV nuclear reactor Very high Temperature Reactor versus Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor
The rapid decrease in the amount of fossil fuels is leading to development of alternative energy sources .
Nuclear power is one of the frontier alternative power technologies that people have huge interest in .
However , converting nuclear power into usable energy is not a simple process .
Unfortunately , the development is not aided by nuclear disasters , such as the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 and  the Three Mile Island disaster in 1979 , which are two of the most serious accidents which happened in nuclear power plants .

The current nuclear power plants use generation II reactors , for example , Pressurized Water Reactors and boiling water reactors .
However , the efficiency , security , economics and sustainability of generation II nuclear reactors are not up to the mark .
New nuclear technology is definitely needed to be developed to achieve a broader application in the power industry .
As a result , generation IV international forum (GIF) , initiated in 2000 , is currently developing six new nuclear technologies for deployment between 2020 and 2030 .
We will discuss two out of the six new nuclear technologies---Very High Temperature Reactor (VHTR) and Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor (SFR) .
Then we will decide which one will better meet the energy deman of the future .
VHPR is a good reactor for utilization in the future .
It offers the potential for the cogeneration of electricity and hydrogen , alongside process heat .
Moreover , VHPR is expected to achieve an even higher efficiency than SFR due to its higher operating temperature .
However , after considering sustainability and practicality factors , SFR is better .
It is proven scientifically that hydrogen could be generated in the VHPR system .
However , it is not important , as no research has proven that the method of generating hydrogen can achieve a higher efficiency compared with generating electricity .
Besides , from a practical point of view , electricity is more widely used than hydrogen .
Most of the devices and appliances we are using today use electricity as a source of energy .
There is a rather mature and secure electricity transit and selling system in the world , while hydrogen transit is still a problem waiting to be solved .
Nuclear power is a good substitution for fossil fuel .
The utilization of nuclear power is going to change the world and people's way of living  in the future .
At present , it is necessary for people to decide which one of the six new nuclear technologies is most valuable to our power needs .
It is reasonable to choose Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor instead of Very High Temperature Reactor since SFR has a narrower technology gap , safer and more environmentally friendly , can achieve a high efficiency rate and has the potential to be developed to reach a higher efficiency level beyond the hypothesis .
Work cited:
* "Nuclear power's new dawn" .
Nature .
20 May 2004: VOL429 .
The first nuclear reactor was invented by Dr Fermi in 1934  .It produced plutonium for the world's first atomic bomb ("World first nuclear reactor , " 2008) .
The bomb , dropped in Japan during the World War II , killed more than 200 ,000 people .
In 1986 , the worst nuclear accident in history broke out in Chernobyl .
The meltdown of the nuclear plant caused 30 immediate deaths along with 100 ,000 cases of fatal cancers in the years that followed (Greenpeace UK , 2006) .
Seventy years into the nuclear age , we are being constantly reminded of its power and danger .
However , the world today has come to a crossroad where we might have to reconsider the role of nuclear power .
In many instances , nuclear power could be a solution to problems we are facing now .
For example , fossil fuel combustion which emits greenhouse gases can be substituted with nuclear power to produce electricity .
Nevertheless , with the high cost and the inadequately safe nuclear technology that we have now , convincing people to embrace nuclear power will not be possible without safer and cheaper technology .
Out of the various fourth generation nuclear reactors currently being researched , the Very High Temperature Reactor , also known as the VHTR , is one of the most promising ones .
Conventional nuclear reactors utilize heat produced from nuclear fission to boil water .
This water becomes steam and drives a turbine which produces electricity .
The VHTR , on the other hand , utilizes the heat to boil helium , an inert gas , which drives the turbine directly .
This brings up the efficiency of the reactor by as much as 50 percent (Hecht , 2008) .
Besides efficiency , VHTR also shows its potential in two other aspects .
The first aspect is in its inherent safety design .
In conventional nuclear reactors , the radioactive fission products remain in the reactor's core .
In the event of an explosion , these products will dissipate into the surrounding .
The VHTR , however , is designed such that the fission products are trapped inside the fuel particles .
These fuel particles , coated with layers of uranium oxycarbide , have the ability to absorb the radioactivity and withstand a temperature of 2000c , way above the working temperature of 1600c (Hecht , 2008) .
People may be concerned that the high temperature of VHTR can trigger an explosion .
However , the worry is unnecessary because the VHTR is able to shut down itself in a situation of abnormal high temperature .
When above normal working temperature is reached , the VHTR reactor is able to catch the highly accelerated neutrons and stop the chain fission reactions completely , thereby shutting down the whole system .
This is evidenced by the test carried out on one of the VHTR prototypes , HTR-10 in 2004 .
The helium coolant was cut off from the system and the reactor was able to shut down automatically without leakage of any radioactive particles (Hecht , 2008) .
The second aspect lies in its economics .
Most people are aware that building a nuclear plant is expensive .
According to a report by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2009) on the cost of nuclear power , the overnight cost (cost without interest incurred) of building a nuclear plant is US$4000 / kwh (kilowatt hour of electricity produced) .
A coal-fuelled plant of the same scale only cost US$1300/ kwh .
While its initial cost is high , VHTR makes up for its efficiency and versatility .
Besides electricity , VHTR also produces heat and hydrogen which can be harnessed for other industrial applications .
For example , heat can be used for petrochemical reprocessing while hydrogen can be used as fuel in fuel cell plants to produce even more electricity .
Hence , VHTR is actually more profitable to operate as electricity , heat and hydrogen can be obtained altogether .
Besides , non-monetary economics should be considered at the same time .
Traditional coal-fuelled power plants produce 20% of the world's emissions of greenhouse gases ("Coal and climate change fact" , n .d .) while VHTR does not produce any of such gases .
The environmental damage done , though not measurable in dollars and cents , should also be taken into account as  cost .
In this context , VHTR is much cheaper than coal-fuelled plants .
To conclude , VHTR is not only safe , but it is also more efficient than existing reactors .
With further research , it is possible that the cost of VHTR can be lowered further and will appeal as a better alternative to existing nuclear systems .
Nuclear energy was once regarded as a major future energy source which would provide cheap and clean energy .
Even though it gained popularity in the 1970s , the partial meltdown of the nuclear power plant's core on Three Mile Island in 1979 and Chernobyl explosion in 1986 had a serious taint on the popularity of the use of Nuclear energy as an energy source .
Chernobyl explosion caused less than 60 radiation-related death and required resettlement of over 336 ,000 people .
Although more serious incident is yet to occur , people are increasingly concerned about the potential hazardous threat posed by the nuclear plants .
Nuclear reactors produce harmful or even deadly radiation while radioactive nuclear wastes are extremely difficult to handle and may even explode with no warning .
Nuclear reactors also produce plutonium as a by-product which can be used in the nuThe Clear weapons .
It raises a global concern that terrorists or aggressive countrnuclear have easier access to the nuclear weapons and may threaten the world peace .

s .However , with increasing demands for energy due to industrialization and the rising price of oil and fossil fuels , nuclear energy remains as an important source of energy despite all the controversies .
Currently , there are mainly six differ types of reactors .
Among them , very-high- temperature reactor (VHTR) and sodium-cooled fast reactor (SFR) are sidered the two most advanced and iable systems .
The VHTR has an open fuel cycle and can supply electricity , hydrogen and heat at a highly efficient level .
Tfuelre reactor is connected to an intermediate heat exchanger to process heat and is able to output the temperature up to 1000 degree Celsius with more than 50% efficiency ("Very- High-Temperature Reactor" , 2003) .
On the other hand , the SFR has a closed loop fuel cycle and is designed to reduce wastes .
It demands less space of repositories as it recovers and recycles 99 .9% of the actinides and has the thermal efficiency of about 40% ("GEN-4: Technology: Systems") .
With regards to safety , the VHTR has certain desirable safety measures under both normal and extreme conditions .
However , the need to operate the VHTR above 1000 degree Celsius puts the limitations on the effectiveness of the safety measurement .
For the SFR system , safety measures consist of a long thermal response time , a huge margin to coolant boiling and a main mechanism that works near atmospheric pressre .
However , sodium reacts chemically with air or water and is a major safety drawback .
Nevertheless , with some innovations , a buffer can be introduced to prevent water vapor from reaching the radioactive sodium in the primary system .
Also , the SFR offers other safety measures such as automatic shutdown function and cooling function in case of accidents ("Jordi , Todd , Lineberry" , 2002) .
The cost ofa reactor varies with various factors .
For the VHTR , the cost is mainly associated with the heat exchanger size and the installation expenses which usually total to about US$781 .5 millions .
For the SFR , the cost can be reduced considerably by using some innovative methods to make a modular design or to remove a primary loop or to integrate the pump and the heat exchanger .
Although the cost of building a nuclear reactor is great and there are concerns about safety , there are several advantages of using nuclear energy as an energy source .
The small size of the nuclear pwer plants allows them to be integrated in the already developed regions and makes the long- distance power transfer unnecessary .
Also , the nuclear energy does not produce pollution directly into the atmosphere in the form of greenhouse gases .
Moreover , a large amount of energy can be produced in the nuclear power plants within a relatively short period of time .
The use of nuclear energy is also advantageous in a sense that it will never run out while oils reserves and fossil fuels are likely to be used up at some time .
With more research and investments in the nuclear technology , the SFR can become a viable energy source in the future .
The infety measures can be improved and the hazardous by-products can be reduced with the advancement of technology .
With the rising demand for energy and the increasinlong-distancermful effects of the use of oil andssil fuels to the environment , the nuclear energy offers an alternative and is regaining some of its popularity and early successes of 1970s .

6 November 2003
The collapse of  Nicoll Highway was a controversial issue where everyone had his or her own views .
Could the use of psychology have prevented the accident ?
There were views from engineers as well as the parties involved , saying that the collapse was not due to a mistake in design as they followed the code of practice in their design and the safest bottom-up construction method was used .
There were no occupational hazards influenced by the decisiveness and attitude of the project managers .
The parties involved took pride in their work .
In my opinion , I felt that the collapse was due to a mistake in the design , the lack of integrity as portrayed by the parties involved and the management team's indecisiveness about the situation .
Indecisiveness and negligence of the management team , design mistake and lack of integrity are three factors of psychology which I felt were lacking in the design process which had resulted in the engineering accident .
The reason for the collapse of Nicoll Highway was not solely due to a mistake in the design .
Safety factors were taken into consideration in the design of the loads according to the Code of Practice (LTA , Sep1 , 2004) .
Furthermore , the common and safest bottom-up method was used , said a civil engineer working in LTA .
It was definitely a mistake in design as the investigation revealed that there was an error in the design of the strut support system and that it was under-designed(MOM , 2009) .
Also , it was under-designed by a safety factor of 2 (SCOSS , SC/06/102) .
There were omission and misintepretation of the code of practice (SCOSS , SC/06/102) .Therefore , the use of phsychology could have prevented the accident if the parties involved had not made any errors in the design .
The parties involved in the construction of  Nicoll Highway were carefully selected and one of them was the Land Transport Authority (LTA) .
Since it is under severe guidance by the government , there should have been  no problems with integrity or dishonesty .
However , there was evidence showing that there was dishonesty and lack of integrity among the parties involved .
From the book on Nicoll Highway Collapse , extracted from New Civil Engineer (2005) , Nishimatsu-Lum Chang (NLC) , being a party involved in the project , was negligent , reckless and dishonest during the design and construction of the retaining wall .
He cut costs by using scrap material as a replacement of stiffener plates as stated by Shanmugan (New Civil Engineer , 2005) .
If the parties involved had integrity and knew that  cutting costs would result in many casualties , the engineering accident would have been prevented .
It was due to the parties' lack of integrity , which was one of the psychological factors that they failed to demonstrate , that resulted in the collapse .
In conclusion , the use of psychology could have prevented the accident if the parties involved were careful about the design and made sure that it was not under-designed as in the case of  Nicoll Highway .
The carelessness and negligence of the management team  caused the accident .
If there were no cutting of costs in this case , the structure wouldn't have collapsed .
In many cases , structures failed due to the dishonesty of the parties involved in the construction process , not just Nicoll Highway but also the collapse of the Hotel New World .
Therefore , I felt that the use of psychology could have prevented the accident .
Nuclear energy generally refers to electrical power from controlled nuclear reactions .
Some people think nuclear energy is good but there are still people whothink we should not develop nuclear energy .
Two sides support their  views on pro and cons to nuclear energy .
In my opinion , we should further develop nuclear energy .
In Butler's (2004) article , there are 6 types of generation IV reactor .
If we look at Supercritical-water-cooled reactors , it is cheap and requires low temperature to generate electricity .
This means it is safer to use this kind of reactor .
